The main objective of the project is to improve the professional competence of teachers in particular in the use of modern techniques of learning and teaching in the field (e-learning ) , virtual whiteboard  and improving the quality of school work . The project participants internalize knowledge about educational standards in Italy , become familiar with the structure and organization of work and educational institutions will be introduced to the educational system of the host country while raising the level of competence in English and Italian . Improving the professional competence will strengthen , create and develop pedagogical innovation and education by providing adequate skills, knowledge and new experiences . Important and basic need in creating innovative attitudes among teachers is based on the assumption that the development of professional competence , language and computer teachers , resulting in higher scores on the job and increase self-esteem.    
The significant need in the case of creating innovative attitudes will increase the attractiveness and quality of education by teachers participating in the project , through the implementation of development programs in the field of school education , vocational training and foreign languages according to the needs of the labor market , strengthening the existing partnership of schools and educational institutions through the European exchange and creation of new areas of cooperation. Various actions will be taken aimed at attractive learning process, to increase the activity of participants in education : pupils, students , prospective students and people who will improve their skills on courses and vocational training.   
During the program , the participants become familiar with the web e-learning platform and gain some skills in the use of interactive virtual table . The combination of traditional learning with modern education would be an effective and attractive way of learning for young people and a modern tool for the implementation in the curriculum and the project. On the online platform , you can create and maintain e - lessons and tasks for students, information for teachers and auxiliary teaching materials . Built-in tools allow for individual selection and implementation pace of learning, content according to the progression of software . Virtual interactive whiteboard Onfinity replaces the fixed interactive whiteboards , it is a landmark achievement in the learning process , thanks to it, a teacher and a student receive an unique tool to teach classes and perform tasks at the blackboard.   
Participation in the trip will allow teachers to check their existing skills on the basis of a different culture and communities , at the same time developing a sense of European identity. The beneficiaries will be able to learn about the culture of Italy, language, customs prevailing there and the tourist attractions and breake stereotypes about both countries. The observation of teachers working with a similar age group , a similar type of school , will allow the transfer of experience on the ground of the given institution and at the same time improve the prospects of teachers participating in the project on the European labor market. The training will take place on the form of lectures , demonstrations and exercises in the field of innovative teaching methods .    
After returning from the training, the participants will share their experiences with other teachers and the local community , it will increase their personal and professional prestige , and prestige of the school in the local educational market . With the implementation of foreign training , the school will improve the quality of education and will be perceived as an institution impementing modern learning , it will assure graduates with a successful start in an adult life . As you can see the impact and the potential benefits will be long term and will have a European dimension, by broadening the international dimension of education and training , in particular through international cooperation of educational institutions of the countries participating in the project.

Autotronik v Polsku: Prakticky nejen anglicky

Context and project idea:

SŠ - COPT Kroměříž has three 4-year study programs – one with focus on electronics, second with focus on mechatronics and thirs focused on autotronics. Five previous LdV projects were focused only on electrotechnics and mechatronics. We would like to focus for the first time right on autotronics to also support this branch with international mobility in vocational training.



Project targets:

We would like to bring possibility to go through the vocational training in foreign country, in Polish Krakow to be specific, in English language for autotronic students. We want to focus on transparent certification based on ECVET principles or similar. 



Number and profile of trainees:

20 talented autotronic students in third grade and 4 accompanying persons divided into four runs on fall 2014, spring 2015, fall 2015 and spring 2016.



Activity description:

Vocational training for autotronic students at foreign work places with tasks corresponding to their school program for third grade. Activity is provided by our partner Tellus Ltd.



Methodology:

SŠ – COPT Kroměříž processes reports for NA, reports of accompanying persons, organizes transport, insurance, subsistence, mentoring and free time activities. Tellus Ltd. processes finale report for SŠ – COPT Kroměříž, APT certificates, organizes local transport, accommodation, boarding, monitoring, reporting and evaluation of vocational training. Both organizations process together contracts, agreements and Europasses Mobility.



Outputs, effects and benefits:

Increase of vocational skills and soft-skills. Improve of English language usage at work place across European Union. More qualified trainees for lifelong learning and employment. Czech-Polish-English technical dictionary will be compiled.

Campus Berufsbildung e.V. is a registered association which is located at Geneststraße. Our vocational school has an intercultural profile.  Among many other school activities, such as our annual event in the context of 'school without racism/school with courage', we enable our students a practical training of twenty weeks in the fifth semester to complete abroad. 

Students of geriatric care also have the possibility to do a six week practical training abroad.  Interested Students must have a good grade point average and acquire at least a B1 level in their language skills.  

Good foreign language competence makes it possible for nursery nurses to work in

bilingual kindergartens and assist children with their homework. We also fulfill the requirements of our cooperating partners for the practical training whose wish is to realize the increasing desire of parents for bilingual education.



Besides linguistic improvement, students gain more independence abroad during the practical training and achieve professional maturity.



We want to make the training in 'geriatric care training' more attractive for our students and show them that there are many job opportunities at home and abroad. Improved English knowledge in relation to further studies is a great advantage, since most research publications appear in English.

We prepare the participants for the practical training with additional language

courses, regional and cultural studies.



Our cooperating partner, TellusGroup, organizes internships and accommodations. Each

student has a personal practical instructor during their training. Their level of qualification

should be at least NVQ Level 3 in order to be comparable with the German trainers. TellusGroup provides an advisor who introduces the participants to their facilities and provides counseling when problems arise.  Moreover, there is a peer advisor for students. 



The participants receive practical training tasks from different class teachers that are planned, executed and evaluated on site. These tasks are also available in the national language. Their training experiences are to be reported in their final work experience report.

In order to assess the learning progress of the participants, it is mandatory for them to write

weekly reports and submit them promptly to the school. In addition, a visit to the host country is carried out by a class teacher. The aims of this visit are to promote contacts with practice facilities and to discuss the theses topic with the students.

Finally, the participants will receive a certificate from their institution and a euro mobility pass which is a certified document for the proof of stay abroad. The internship will be graded in the diploma.



We have developed questionnaires regarding the practical trainings, accommodations, preparation and general satisfaction for the evaluation of the stay. 

We publish our students’ experiences abroad on our website, Facebook and a blog.
Get ready for Europe - Learning in Vocational Training for Office Management and IT

The internationalization of vocational training has continually grown more relevant in the past few years. The improvement of interpersonal skills of “mobility trainees” and apprentices, who have worked abroad, seems to happen incidentally. The improvement of “soft skills” (analytical thinking, creativity, and sense of responsibility) as well as international competency are important for the apprentices and the employers alike; especially those in commercial business dealing with office management and IT.

The topic of language skills is becoming a greater factor. Due to increasing market internationalization, competency of technical English (or other world languages such as Spanish) has become requisite know-how of all applicants. Thus, strong knowledge of other languages increases individual chances on the labor market twofold. 
For apprentices who work in commercial businesses, the highest achievement is the successful completion of an apprenticeship abroad. For it entails a high quality vocational training, an increased dimensionality to their European identity, and the advancement of foreign language acquisition, as well as an increased knowledge of intercultural awareness.
 In the first year, fifteen apprentices will be given the opportunity to complete a 3-week apprenticeship in a partner country.  In the second year, a subsequent group of fifteen apprentices will be given the same opportunity. They will participate in a 3-week program that will entail  work in an administrative or IT related company as well as the participation in an intercultural seminar, intercultural activities and language course. 
The stay will be organized and supervised by the mobility team of H7. Clarification and establishment of  accommodations, job placement, the participation in an intercultural language course, and a mentorship with an on-site contact person will be aided by the foreign partners. The apprentices will be prepared for their foreign apprenticeship via an intercultural preparation seminar with Arbeit und Leben Hamburg.
 Expected results are:
The apprentices will get to know the culture, economic and political infrastructure of a foreign country, will experience the profession of an EU country and compare it with the German version, will communicate with schoolmates, colleagues and customers and will finally prepare a public presentation of their project.

Along with the German partners (H7 and Arbeit und Leben Hamburg) implementation of the study abroad program will concern the following groups and countries: UK (Foyle Language School and Tellus Group ), Ireland (Partnership Europe), Malta (Paragon Europe) as well as Spain (Tangente) will be included as well and will also concern themselves with the implementation of the study abroad program.

The program's aim is to guarantee both a good work experience and a good social integration into daily British, Irish, Maltese or Spanish life.
Ungdoms mulighet for kvalifisering og arbeid i et åpent og multikulturelt Europa.

This application is a result of experience based on placements abroad for second year pupils attending Healthcare, Childhood and Youth Development. Our pupils have before had their placements in Lithuania and England. This time we wish to apply for placement in Krakow, Poland for both groups of pupils. 



Our school want to motivate our pupils in order to prevent drop outs. This project will make it possible to facilitate improved quality of learning and placement, and increase the possibility for pupils to find work both in Norway as well as in other European countries.



The target group is second year pupils attending Child- and youth care studies and nursing assistants.  We wish to send 8 pupils and 2 teachers each year.



The pupils will have their placement in a kindergarten and at different health-institutions. During the period of placement we also intend to focus on Polish culture and religion. Our school wish to offer our pupils different cultural experiencies, like visits to museums, churches,  characteristic architecture, culinary traditions etc. We believe that this will make our pupils and teachers more tolerant regarding other cultures and respect for other norms and values. An experience that can be shared with collegues and other pupils at our school. Increased multicultural understanding will have a positive effect on the  environment at our school. Another competence aim that will be covered is increased knowledge of languages. They will also develop communication- and cooperation skills and increase their social competence. Our school also focus on the cooperation between our two vocational lines of studies and emphasize relevant goals in these two lines of studies.



We will  focus a lot on communication, cultural understanding, tolerance and respect for other people's values and differencies.  Before the placement pupils and teachers will  prepare themselves by learning about the Polish healthsystem, kindergartens, culture and language in Poland.



We wish to promote our school as a school offering Healthcare, Childhood and  Youth Development as a line of study . In the longer term we also wish to recruit well qualified and motivated applicants that are suited to work in an open and multicultural Europe.

Our cooperation with the English organization Tellus Group started a few months ago through very frequent e-mail and telephone correspondence. Shortly after the new Erasmus + program has been presented we thought it would be a perfect opportunity and possibility  for a project that could be of mutual interest. In this project our company FILIP M  will participate as a sending organization with 7 teachers and Tellus Group as a hosting partner.    
The name of our project is "Obtaining European experiences -improved language competencies
The possibility to be faced with greater and advanced countries provides opportunities each teacher, each individual who is involved in any kind of teaching, educating or involvement in language to widen, enhance and get better skills and knowledge .
The aims of this project would be: 
- increased foreign language competencies 
-enhanced employability and improved carrier prospects 
- increased motivation in participation in future formal and non formal teaching and training 
All participants who will be involved in the project will find ways to improve themselves as this is their second profession. They will share what they know, how they  perform their classes  and from their second activity that they have, they will  gain more experience better and improved ways of translation and interpretation.
Our  company together with the involved participants are hoping to gain the following competencies.
-improved language competencies
It means that after attending the training course  they can use all four language skills reading,writing speaking and listening better  and with great self confidence
-improved social and cultural competencies
The possibility to stay in a country as England can provide direct links to the social life, their habits, customs and culture which could influence  the teaching and could be presented better in front of the future students.
- greater ability for promotion of English language and culture
The fact that they will visit the country itself they will get closer image for  the language, people and their inheritance. In that way they can easily transfer to their students what they have actually seen
 -better teaching skills 
As our company is not very large but exists for 10 years now  this kind of experience would be excellent for future development and investment in better studying, training and giving chances that are rarely given  to the teacher. With improved working methodology  and practices, the participants would be actively involved and they will have unique possibility to hear, talk and communicate solely in English, but at the same time
-to present their knowledge
-how they teach
-what methods they  use in their teaching and translating activities
-what actions they take to make their attendants more interested
The mobility would take place from 20.04.2015 to 03.05.2015 with 7 participants at Plymouth, England

Fourty-six 3rd and 4th grade students will take part in the project and carry out their professional training in commercial enterprises and companies during 15 workdays in England, Hungary and the Czech Republic. They will be accompanied by seven teachers who will look after them and monitor their internship and solve problems if any. Mobilities shall start in September 2014. 
The main goals and outputs are the following:
• enhancing attractiveness of vocational education and training
• to support these young  people in their professional and language preparation so they can use, apply and improve their knowledge and skills which they gained during their studies at our school
• to support their personal development, employment ability and participation at European labor market
• to increase students' interest in foreign languages
• to enable students to test their flexibility and adaptability in a foreign country, their personal maturity, independence and responsibility
• to increase their own personal experience and become acquainted with different culture, mentality and traditions 
• provide students with new working methods and procedures
• to increase the school credit
• to keep and strengthen cooperation with the partners who has already cooperated with us within the Leonardo da Vinci Mobility project
The main activities of the sending organization:
- to inform studnets about the mobility project
- to select participants on the basis of clearly defined and transparent criteria
- appropriate target country, receiving partners, duration of the training and its content to reach targets in terms of their skills and competencies which the participant should  acquire or expand 
- in cooperation with the partners, preparation of the participants for practical, vocational and cultural life in the host country
- agreemets the content of which will be transparent for all parties involved and work internship programme will be their inseparable part  
- transport, accommodation, necessary work permits, welfare and insurance
- teachers´monitoring
- consistency among needs of the participants´ vocational training, School Educational Programme and the content of the training
- confirmation of skills, abilities and knowledge gained by the participant and evaluation of general outputs in specific area of vocational training
- dissemination activities
The main activities of the receiving organization:
- cooperation with the sending organization during the planning process and the project implementation
- full-board accommodation of the participants
- adequate placement of the participants in an enterprise
- supervision and monitoring of the participants
- local transport
- cultural programme, social events
- support in the understanding of the inhabitants´culture and menatlity 
- practical assistance if necessary
- the final report
- the certificate of vocational trainig completion, recognition of vocational training within ECVET
When the mobility is finished, all participants will receive Europass Mobility, Europass certificate supplement, a certificate of achieved qualifiction - all these documents will help participants to be successful at the labor market. The existing cooperation among involved organizations will strengthen  as well as the functional relationships and we can help each other with the implementation of ECVET which is increasingly becoming an important part of mobility projects. The cooperation within the ECVET partnerships for mobility will allow transfer of credits from the host environment to the home environment which is based on the  process of evaluation, validation and recognition. This will help us improve the educational process of students so that their success within further study options as well as possible job placement would be highly adapted to requirements of nowadays.
Europa hautnah - Auslandsaufenthalt für Auszubildende der Stadtverwaltung Ravensburg

The educational concept created by the city of Ravensburg "Future 2020 - training at the city council " provides that trainees can provide some of their practical training abroad to undergo further training abroad. The aim is to promote their own mobility and in addition to the recovery of its own professionals to promote the personal development of trainees . Hence, in addition to the improvement of international action skills and foreign language skills are intensified. Also the independence and personal flexibility should be encouraged.



Knowledge of foreign languages need now not only our budding event managers and merchants for tourism and leisure, but in particular the public administration clerks and skilled employees for office communication.



The exchange promotes international relations and broadens the view of our trainees . Ultimately, this increases the overall quality of education. Likewise, acquire the budding professionals intercultural skills , which are in the increasing number of citizens with a migration background an important qualification .



The four-week posting to Plymouth (England ) is to be with 4 adult apprentices who complete dual vocational training and are in the second year of training , conducted in August 2015. After a one-week intensive language course a three-week practical placement is on the programme. Accommodation is in host families and it is offered a cultural programme. In the host country , the stay is implemented by our partner organization Tellus Group Ltd. They have years of experience with the implementation of mobility experiences and we work together very well since 2011.



The course of the Tellus Group refreshes the existing English skills and deepens it . Participants can also receive voice and internship certificates that represent an advantage for further personal and professional life.



By staying with host families and the daily contact with colleagues in the placement operation, the theme of our project is automatically lived " Europe first hand ." The trainees will be assigned to each separate host families to allow no "hiding" behind other trainees. Mostly, the students share their room with an intern from another country , so that in a very tangible intercultural consideration can and must be practiced. About teaching and work in the placement companies , the participants come together with students from other countries . This promotes our goal to encourage our students to overcome barriers and overcome prejudices .



We as promoters promise us an increasing attractiveness as a training company in the increasingly competitive market for suitable trainees. The city of Ravensburg takes as a public employer a pioneering position , thus gaining additional training company as attractive. We also recruit the majority of our administrative staff from our trainees . Empirical evidence from the private sector and from already -made experience from assignments in the years 2011-2013 that trainees work after a stay abroad more independent, more flexible and are more motivated . Trainees see life of another country from a different perspective by getting there insight into the working world. In addition, the trainee has the opportunity to acquire country-specific skills as well as to meet operational processes and techniques they use in the city of Ravensburg and able to contribute . Accordingly, the acquired knowledge, experience and skills can be used directly for the city administration and its service quality to good .

Our school is located in in the environment which provides students and teachers with limited opportunities for personal and career development. Unfortunately, our region belongs to the least developed in Slovenia according to different indices. An enormous outflow of young people is a sad fact, which is due to poor variety of educational programs that are offered here and consequently fewer possibilities to find a job. We have been coping with the problem of reduced enrolment in our school and we believe that additional contents would be a good promotion of our school. Namely, this year a lot of younger students and their parents have showed a lot of interest in international mobility activities.
The participants of the project “Open your mind” will be students of Secondary School of Economics and Commerce Brežice attending programs of economic technician and logistics technician.  In both programs students of the 3rd year have to carry out a 2-week work placement. Therefore, the central activity of this mobility will be work placement of 20 students in companies abroad. All the students did their work placement in local companies in their 2nd year of school. It involved receiving and sending post, recording transactions in day books of a company /working with cash registers, manipulating databases and entering data, archiving documents, business correspondence and working with customers. An international experience means upgrading students’language, communication competences and work skills as well as personal qualities. The work placement of economic technician program students will refer to administration field.   Their work will consist of: sorting out the post, managing diaries, answering the phones, greeting clients, writing business letters, preparing presentations, using ICT in administration and using office devices (fax machine, copy machine, etc). The students of logistic technician program will fill in transport documentation and do logistic correspondence using ICT. 
As a part of Vocational matura exams students are obliged to make a project work, so the participants of this mobility will focus in their projects on comparison of Slovenian and English economy systems and on transposition of good business practices in the Slovenian environment. Through this experience students are expected to be additionally motivated to learn English for specific purposes, to develop their business sense and to become mobile within the European labour market. The objective to decrease early school leaving could be achieved through increased motivation of students, different teaching methods and actualisation of work and life, all of which is provided with this project. 
The “open your Mind” project is carried out by a coordinator cooperating with teachers of economics and logistics subjects and teachers of English. Tasks and responsibilities are assigned through the phase of application of candidates, choosing the participants and preparation for mobility as well as at mobility monitoring and post-mobility evaluation and dissemination. Results of the project will be presented by the students on “open door days”, on the information day, on “Festival of education” (“Festival izobraževanja”) and on technical days in primary schools. The model of cooperation with the Youth Centre Brežice (MC Brežice) and the Posavje Museum Brežice has proven as very successful in the context of presenting our work in international projects to the local community, so we intend to keep this model also for this project.
Aktuelle europäische Perspektiven in der beruflichen Bildung als Beitrag zur Schulentwicklung

The application for the project ‘mobility certificate’ – awarded ‘good practice’ – covers 51 IVT participants in their 2nd year of training (20 sixth form students focusing on business studies and modern languages preparation and additional qualification as bilingual secretary; 31 participants doing a three-year-course in Health and Social Care / Childcare training to be nursery nurses) who will do 4 or 8 week placements in the UK, ES, SE, NL, FR and MT. These placements are a mandatory part of their courses and will be assessed. In addition, 16 VET staff will be visiting international partners for 2-3 days to exchange project related issues.
The project stems from the European work of the participating departments, which contributes essentially to the school’s quality. Current discussions in vocational training in Health and Social Care as well as Business Administration (BA) give rise to the issues dealt within this project. Due to the two participating departments, the project focusing on current European perspectives in vocational training will be twofold.
In the BA department the issue of work-life-balance (WLB) is particularly gaining in importance in times of demographic change, internationalization and changing values. Being aware of the positive implications of WLB can decisively contribute to enhancing corporate competitiveness on the European labour market and to increasing a company’s attractiveness for highly skilled staff.
In their project task during their internship the students are not only asked to deal with the topic from the employers’ perspective, but also from the angle of employees, families and politics.
Prior to their internship they deal with human resources management including different working time models in their BA classes, develop questionnaires/observation sheets to analyze the existing framework in the target country, e.g. key economic data, the availability of childcare etc.
They work out the specific features in their designated countries through interviews and independently evaluate their observations (PPP, collages, internship report). After the internship their results are compared with those gained in Germany.
The new focus of the work experience of the social department results from current discussions about changing pedagogical attitudes in elementary education in Germany. This new pedagogical attitude requires a resource-orientated view from the child to promote children`s individual development according to their strengths and competences.
Working “inclusively” in every field of education and promoting children`s individual needs have become a chore issue of pedagogical work, in theory. However, transferring these concepts of “nobody stays behind” into reality is still problematic.
This project continues the previous European work of the social department at the RvW college of further education with the aim to resolve the issue of “inclusion” with the support of European partners. In addition, apprentices and teachers of the social department at the RvW college will closely work together on this project. Whereas apprentices will practice the new resource orientated view from children with the help of observation and documentation sheets, teachers will discuss this issue with teachers and tutors from European partner institutions to obtain fresh ideas for the tuition and training of their students in Germany (A1, A2). 
In the BA department activities include the exchange of experiences between two teams of VET staff and the students’ tutors in the host companies with the aim of benefitting from synergy (e.g. cross curricular European projects) in both main subjects of the BA department (English and BA), thus enhancing the specific profile of the department.
The close link between the students` and teachers` mobility serves to guarantee the project`s quality by the following aspects: the teachers` interchange of possible concepts as regards a child`s individual promoting or the concept of a WLB respectively is structured in the same way as are the students` internships, namely through specific tasks (called “Agenda”) and its results are meant to help improve class teaching and the didactic structure of the departments. Steady teacher teams, each being responsible for one country (consisting of one language and one subject teacher per team), have proven to be worthwhile. Apart from these teams, a supervising “EU team” officially recognized in the school`s curriculum is responsible for the evaluation and distribution of the results in the school`s yearbook, on its homepage and at meetings with tutors or international partners.  This strategy of internationalizing the project`s results carried out by RvW college provides a professionalization of the teachers and in this way a further development of teaching concepts in the different departments of RvW college.
Let's Go! Mobilità Trasnazionali e Formative per i Giovani

The project Let's Go inserts in the wide context of the objectives of Europe 2020 with the aim of integrating policies for education and training in the Strategy, the mandate that the European Union has given to all operators in the sector. Two key aspects of the Strategy: 1) the promotion of a "sustainable, smart and inclusive" economic growth; 2) the reduction of early dropout in charge of young people. The overlap between the current economic crisis and the data, that emerge from ISTAT surveys on training poverty of young people, give us a complete inescapable picture: in Italy there are more than 113.000 young people between 14 and 17 years old out of the school–training channels and they represent 5% of the resident population in the same age group; there are more than 2 million young people who do not work and do not study, representing 22% of the population, the incidence is significantly higher than in other European countries; the proportion of NEET is prevalent in the South, where the incidence of the phenomenon reaches 30,9%, although in recent years is also growing in the Central-North, especially the Northeast, where the crisis has intensified the phenomenon of non-employment. Let's Go is coherent with the objectives set by the Europe 2020 Strategy and taken back by the Italian government document "Italia 2020: piano di azione per l’occupabilità dei giovani attraverso l’integrazione tra apprendimento e lavoro"; the project would promote the development of techniques skills (compared to the demand of enterprises) through the creation of an internship period, carried out during the course of the studies - as advocated by the Italian document - to develop the culture of work and enterprise, of language skills and citizenship skills and entrepreneurial spirit. Let's Go promotes 300 mobilities for the realization of internship in enterprises, pointed towards young people of the circuit of Education and Vocational Training. These young people come from the network CONFAP (National Entities for Vocational Training) and Professional Technical Institutes of the Province of Padua. The beneficiaries are: - the second and third annual paths of regional qualification (in some cases fourth annual path where required under regional regulation); - neo-qualified of qualification paths of not more than one year; - young of the4th and 5th class of technical professional institutes; - the graduates of not more than one year from the education pathways and technical professional. The young beneficiaries come from 17 Italian regions (from North to South Italy). Let's Go is a "multi- sectorial" project because it involves young people from different professional backgrounds (33% catering, 20 % mechanical, 17% agro-alimentary transformation, 7% of electricity, 10% of thermo-plumbing, 10 % well-being, 3% graphics). The correspondence between the type of beneficiaries, professional profiles and countries of destination is designed on the specific professional sectors in relation to the offer of the labour market of the European territorial contexts involved. The profiles of mechanics, electricity, thermo-plumbing will go in Germany, UK, Spain and Sweden. The profiles of the catering will travel to France, Germany, Spain and Malta. The profiles of agro-alimentary transformation will go to Spain. The profiles of well-being will travel to UK. The graphic profiles will go to Germany. The pedagogical approach of the project is intercultural because the internship activities foreseen are designed in function, on the one hand, of the reinforcement of learning already established by the beneficiary in Italy (strengthening of the starting situation), from another hand, in function of the learning to be acquired in the country of destination (differences-comparative learning; product/typical processes of the country of destination, the various laws of hygiene and safety in the workplace; different measurement techniques; different types of raw materials used for processing). Lets'Go project also provides for the use of ECVET tools (learning Agreement and Memorandum of Understanding) for the personalized design of transnational mobility, in view of the enhancement of learning outcomes, acquired in the individual experiences of mobility. The mobilities include the realization of internships in enterprise, being this a true learning context (Work-based Learning). The expected impacts are of long-term and  they are related to the design of mobility as an active investment of the promoter in social and employment integration policies. Let's Go intends to pursue: the integration of training and transnational mobility in the life project of the beneficiary (in recognition of the mobility in the formal learning pathway, awareness of enterprise’s stakeholders to the value of learning mobility).

For several years our institution Janos Csere Apaczai Professional Secondary School has been seeking international partners who can give us a chance to join practical work in an English-speaking country. The situation has been particularly difficult since September 2013 because the professional curriculum requires completing a professional summer practice  on each course/year. The opportunities  of our small town with a population of 20,000 are especially limited in the field of the fast-improving Information Technology. So since September 2013 we have been looking for international partners on that particular area consciously. Beyond expanding professional vocabulary our aim is to learn about new ICT tools, softwares and hardwares.
 
 
In the frames of the project with the purpose mentioned above we are going to organize three trips for 16 students with 3 teacher escorts altogether. Since so far we have not had enough experience with any of the partners, the management of the project decided on short, 14-day mobility for the small groups.  Our  students are taking part in after-matura education, studying on the informatics branch and have their final examinations in English as a foreign language.
 
 
According to the expectations the trips will take place from 1 August 2014 to 31 July 2015. We are planning two trips for August (Malta and Italy) and one  for June (England).
 
 
As the result of the project we expect to get acquainted with  and  spread new technologies and ICT tools within our institution. We expect our students to improve their English, to extend their professional vocabulary. We expect the international practice to improve teaching Information Technology for both our students and our teachers. The independence and confidence of our students will grow, they will be able to apply their acquired knowledge on the home and international labour market. We wish to form a long-term relationship with at least one of our partners, which would expectedly raise the teaching standards of our school and at the same time it would improve the chances in both further education and finding a job.

The mobility project "AZUBI Plus" starts on 01.07.2013 and ends on 31.05.2016.



The aim of the project is to offer its participants internships abroad in all EU program countries in order to improve their international, professional and foreign language competence and to expend their knowledge of the work processes of the target country. The project leader supports its participants through an intensive intercultural and language preparation and guidance throughout the whole internship duration. 



AZUBI Plus aims to provide internships and studies abroad for pupils in vocational training, graduates of vocational training (up to 12 months after training), teachers/ trainers of vocational institutions, school leaders and people in companies who are responsible for training.



The learners should benefit by fostering the development of international vocational, intercultural and language skills, new cultures, experience on the international labor market during an internship lasting from 3 to 6 weeks.

The teaching staff should benefit from 2 to 5 days job shadowing and study visit by exchanging working methods with their European colleagues within the education system as well as in the workplace. Furthermore, the target group should serve as promoter and disseminator on local as well as regional level by boosting mobility and free movement of the European Union.



AZUBI Plus is open to all vocational areas and offers tailored internships abroad to suit the needs of every participant. All participants can chose the host organization (relevant to their profession), as well as the duration, the period of the internship, and the destination country (within the program countries) according to their individual professional needs. Every participant receives an Europass mobility after successfully finishing the internship as a tool for recognition of skills and competencies acquired abroad.



Further information and application documents will be available on the website:

http://www.bic-nordthueringen.de/projekte/azubiplus/
Go Abroad and Complete Your Skills II

The Agency "School in Europe" of the District Government of Soest is offering 20 vocational students of the districts vocational schools a four week internship in Plymouth, UK within the project "Go Abroad and Complete Your Skills II". Main focuses of the project are  competences in foreign languages (Englisch) and the internship in a foreign company. 
Partner of the District Government of Soest is the Tellus Group in Plymouth, UK which is responsible for organizing housing, internships and overseeing the students during their internship period. 

The use of foreign languages is vital especially in the educational fields of business management and administration. That is why, the vocational training in business and administration "Höhere Handelsschule" has an emphasis on language training in two different foreign languages, one of them beeing Englisch. To promote  learning of foreign languages, an internship in an Englisch company is considered to be very helpful and motivating. After the internship, the new aquired competences are validated by a third party with a certificate, which can be used to help with future work applications.

Because of the work placement in a foreign company in a foreign country, social an language competences are improved, especially because of the new cultural insights. Thus, intercultural learning will also be a great part of the internship experience.
Experience and skills in the field of tourism and gastronomy

Experience and skills in the field of tourism and gastronomy

The length of the project is a year. It begins on 1st December, 2014 and finishes on 30th November, 2015. Within the project we are organizing a 4-week long vocational training and practice at work in the field of catering and tourism. The program is organized for 1 flow from 30th June, 2015 to 28th July, 2015. This practice will be recognized for the students as their compulsory 4-week internship at school. The students will be put up with families, which makes studying even more intensive.

The participants of the program are 12 students. 8 of them study catering and tourism in the 10th year of a vocational school. 4 of the participants are students in the 13th year- 2 of them in the field of tourism organizer and marketing, the other 2 ones in the field of catering manager and restaurateur.

The Year 9 VET students –aged 16-17 – ending the school year have to fulfil a compulsory 13-day long summer practice related to the area of catering. During Year 9 and 10 students gain the necessary basic knowledge and competencies of the restaurant and kitchen area on theoretical lessons, practical sessions and during their internship, Students continue learning English after the primary school education in Year 9 and 10, and they reach level A2, which is the prerequisite for this program. For them, the new professional working environment, foreign language environment and cultural experiences will develop their personality, and deepen their knowledge and competencies.

For students participating in vocational training the required language level is B1. They have more theoretical knowledge and students in the fields of restaurateur and catering manager gain work experience during their compulsory practice. For them a different working environment with outlook on other expectations increases the opportunities for future employment. While students in the fields of tourism organizer and marketing acquire their first work experience in this mobility. For them it is especially important to develop their foreign language / professional foreign language competency since the basic criterion of obtaining the technical certificate is a successful language exam.

The purpose of the mobility is to develop professional and social skills, and competencies in the fields of hospitality tourism and the English language; and to increase the students' further education or employment opportunities.

The internship will be recognised as their compulsory traineeship, the students will receive a certificate from the partner institution verifying their development and results. We provide them with the Europass Mobility Certificate as well.
Pregatirea tehnica la standarde europene a elevilor din licee tehnice pentru o cariera de succes

This project is targeted at 80 students in the 10th, 11th and 12th grades, enrolled in VET initial formation, in the following domains: Electronics and Automation and in Natural Resources and Environmental Quality Protection, with the following qualifications: Technician in Telecommunication, and Technician in Ecology and Environmental Quality Protection, both ensuring romanian level 3 of qualification. The students will undergo practical training with the duration of 2 weeks, in 8 flows of 10 students, in Plymouth, Great Britain and in Rome, Italy, at VET institutions of Tellus College  and at the companies with which Tellus collaborates. 

The project is set within the frame of the Easmus+  priorities: developing basic and transversal abilities: digital, entrepreneurial, multilingual and promoting of coherence between European countries and national transparency in the recognition of the abilities and qualifications acquired through this project. 

The purpose of this project is that its beneficiaries form professional competences in their domain of qualification, acquire new knowledge, develop skills and qualifications at European standards, all which will facilitate personal and professional development and will increase the chances of integration within national and international labour market. 

The project was designed to meet the needs of the students in initial VET training, from the Telecommunication and Environmental Protection specialties and its main objectives for the 80 students who benefit from the work-based learning are:

-forming specific professional competences for the two specialties in real work conditions and at European companies professional exigency standards 

-obtaining practical European experiences by working with modern equipment and latest technology in the specific domains

-developing linguistic competences in English and Italian languages, focusing especially on technical and professional terms

-increasing social and personal abilities (teamwork, self-esteem, personal and professional motivation)

-raising employment perspectives in the domain of qualification at graduation

-forming an active attitude towards the environment, the entrepreneurship abilities and work place responsibility 

-promoting intercultural awareness and consolidating European values

During the mobility period abroad, the students will work in groups of 2-3 students, for 6 hours daily and will perform practical activities specific for their school level and specialty. This way they will develop those competences, knowledge and abilities agreed upon by the two partners in the Memorandum of Understanding. The students will write daily in a work notebook about the observation charts, the activities carried out, the operating parameters, the verification methods and means, the tools and instruments used to assembly/verify/monitor.

At the end of the mobility abroad carried out in real work environment and at professional exigency standards specific for VET institutions and European companies, students will improve professional competences specific for the  qualifications mentioned. Thus they will be able to analyse, use and mount different modules and equipment used in Electronics and Telecommunication and also will poses the necessary skills to carry out relevant measurements in environmental protection, becoming more responsible towards the work place. At the same time they will develop skills to use modern equipment and latest generation technologies in their domains of qualification and will improve fluency and understanding of messages and technical instructions in English and Italian languages. Increasing  social and personal abilities (team work, self-esteem, personal and professional motivation) will enlarge chances of employment at graduation in the domains of qualification at Romanian and European companies and will also enable them to set up their own business in the targeted domain.

The Europass and Tellus 'Preparation for working life' certificates awarded with credits and acknowledged at European level as a result of evaluation and monitoring of the students within the work- based learning during the mobility period abroad will be accompanied by each student’s portfolio. These will illustrate and function as an instrument to measure the impact of the acquired competences, improved linguistic, intercultural, social and personal abilities.

The project will also have an impact on the school in terms of raising the quality of technical training, as well as the local, regional and national prestige of the school. Accordingly, more gymnasium graduates will choose our highschool and these domains of qualifications, thus raising the number of students enrolled in initial technical training who will have the chance to participate to European mobilities for future collaboration with European institutions to create new European projects.
Agir na Europa, promovendo a mobilidade dos cidadãos autónomos e solidários. Um instrumento para a qualificação numa nova realidade de emprego.

This project lies contextualized in our vast experience that comes from participation in previous applications under the Leonardo Da Vinci Programme - Mobility and Partnerships. We are, therefore, holders of a wide network of partnerships that have been expanded and consolidated, developing a cooperation work with other training institutions and companies who host our interns. 

There are already several countries and institutions involved in this project with us, some of them already for several years. They are countries like Spain, France, Belgium, Slovakia, Estonia, Poland and England. Thus, we intend to strengthen cooperation with schools and other foreign companies, considering crucial the development of a partnership between both parties in order to conciliate the pedagogical organization of schools and  technical training, which must be in accordance with the needs expressed by companies, not just local, regional or national but also at an international level.

As main objectives of this project, we would like to highlight the decrease of youth unemployment and the increase of qualifications for the participants, as well as the learning of foreign languages and skills enhancement. We believe, therefore, that the mobility of these young professionals may promote future job offerings more diverse or a developing professional career with increased and differentiated responsibilities. With these mobility experiences, we believe that we are contributing to the formation of autonomous, supportive and active individuals, aware of their rights as European citizens.

The group of participants embraced in this project consists of twenty-two young people who are developing their initial training in the technical areas of Civil Construction, Commerce, Hotel Industry, Gas and Environmental Management (initial formation of level 4) and also young people attending Vocational Courses (training initial level 2). We also intend to cover for the first time, two graduate students who have recently completed their initial training level 4, in our school, and six staff elements.

The proposed activities are the placements / mobilities, lasting four weeks, for the young beneficiaries to undertake their initial training, internships / mobilities, with the duration of three months, for beneficiaries who are graduated students and internships / mobilities, for five days, for the staff members who, mainly, intend to share experiences and enhance their professional skills.

The process of guiding and monitoring the beneficiaries trainings and their technical / personal progress, according to the objectives previously defined, will be provided by the Office of Planning and International Cooperation, in close collaboration with those responsible for each school / company, tutors and teachers from each institution and the Course Coordinators. This monitoring process is achieved punctually and exceptionally through visits and / or meetings in local internship and partner / host schools, but also through contacts (by phone and email) more frequent among the actors involved in this process

We would like to mention the possibility of making a weekly monitoring of beneficiaries through Skype, enjoying thus the benefits in terms of new technologies. Visits and meetings are, essentially, responsibilities of the tutor / tutors from the different technical training areas which later come into contact with the project promoters, transmitting all important information concerning the trainings' development.

This project seeks the professional training of beneficiaries who are developing their initial training and those who have recently completed their training with the purpose of entering the labor market consciously. Currently, it is impossible not to think of extending employment opportunities to the European dimension, so that this project aims participants to be active, responsible and independent citizens. In addition to this idea, it is important to emphasize that this project contributes to the reduction of youth unemployment and the  increase of the European citizens' skills.

Regarding the staff beneficiaries, the impact of this project lies in the fact that this is an opportunity to observe and compare different methods of working, and a way to enhance their professional curriculum, adapting their knowledge to innovative training practices inside a new European working context.

 In conclusion, we emphasize the need, in a long term, to achieve more skills and more jobs, building up a more cohesive and stronger Europe.

Our 2014 Erasmus + mobility project is part of our development strategy to give our school a genuine European image. Our objective is to improve the quality of our trainings. Since 1998, our ambition, modestly, is to awaken a European consciousness in young people in order to get them ready for their future professional life. We know that today young people in vocational training have to adapt themselves to the new requirements of mobility and flexibility of the European job market. 



The public targeted will reflect the diversity of the students' families' background as well as the trainings proposed by our vocational school. The participants will be young people in Vocational Training Qualification in cooking and waiters, Higher Vocational Catering Diploma in cooking and restaurant plus Vocational High School Diploma in Hotel Business. 24 participants from 16 to 19.



Participants’ objectives: train the participants to use new technologies as a working tool, acquire a linguistic autonomy as to be at ease in daily life and able to work in an international working team. Acquire new professional skills to improve their chances of getting a job. 



For our high school

- Enrich the professional skills and educational practices of the teachers, be more in contact with the companies

- Develop a coherent network of partners in Europe. Promote the understanding and the spirit of cooperation between European young people.

- Comply our trainings and curriculums with the new requirements of mobility and adaptability in the sector of the hotel and catering business



The activities before the placement 

- professional, cultural and linguistic preparation: multidisciplinary works in small groups

- Write a CV and a letter of presentation which will be sent to the companies

- Create the blog: research work on the partner high school, the host company but also on countries and regions the students will be going to. 

- Meetings with people who had a work experience abroad and former participants. 

- Participate to the open days to promote the European programs 

- Preparation of the documents needed for the placement

- Skype meeting with the internship tutors and school contact persons



During the placement

- A five-week internship which will be taken into account for the student’s final exam.

- Visit of the partners’ high schools, meeting with the partner students and the internship supervisors

- Participation in cooking, restaurant and hotel front desk practice, language courses, PE

- Participation in a discovery race in the receiving city, cultural and professional visits all along the placement (on days off) 

- Blog weekly writing (the students will have to write about their internship, the things done at work, skills acquired and cultural visits)



After the placement

- Write the 2e2f  internship report, the Jehanne of France report and the Europro report. The trainees will present their work to a jury composed of professionals and teachers in order to have the Europro Certificate from the Region Rhône-Alpes. 

Share the benefits of their experience: 

- Update the blog, contact the local press

- Organization of video and photo exhibitions during the school open days or “Salon de l’Etudiant”  in order to promote the European programs, organization of a European dinner at the school restaurant, powerpoint presentation to the other classes of the school



We decided our students will have to act rather than just participate. They will have to think and develop a personalized professional project (objectives of their internship), be able to manage the budget given to them and organize their local transports and visits. 

We have created two groups to control the project and be sure that everything will run smoothly (Groupe Technique and Groupe Qualité). They will insure a good financial management and a good progress of the project. We’ll use modern means of cooperation and communication to insure an effective follow-up of the trainees



Results and impacts for the sending organization: 

Perpetuate the European image of our school with partner institutions, student’s families, Carry on developing our partnerships abroad,  promote the European Programs among teachers in order to get them involved



For the participants: 

The skills acquired by the participants will be given an official value by obtaining the Europass which certifies the acquired skills and will bring a new professional asset to the future professionals. The diploma "Passport Professionnel Européen" (Award we created in 2003 accredited by all the partners). The Certificate Europro from the Regional educational authority aims at recognizing the European dimension of the students’ scolarship. These documents are essential elements for the future studies or job applications of the students. 

Develop the students’ professional skills in cooking, restaurant and hotel reception, in languages and in the organization and management of a personal and professional project.

"To Europe for education" it  is a project focused to  category of young people, students in  their initial education. They prepare  in the area of automotive technology, automotive industry and information technology. Due to the fact,  that the automotive industry is one of the preferred and rapidly developing sector, we consider the following project focused sufficiently well founded.
Internship participating the third-grade students a  three-year course apprenticeship  and fourth –grade  a four -year  graduation study. These students   have already acquired enough knowledge and professional skills and are ready to take advantage of mobility to build the superstructure in areas of their profession, which they aren`t able to obtain in our school.
Professional internship will focus on the repair and maintenance of cars of various  brands,  in the fields of mechanics, electronics, bodywork and bodypaint or  to diagnose those areas directly in production. The project also responds to the Bruges Communiqué in 2010, which updated the Copenhagen process and in which emphasizes on "enhancing the attractiveness, quality and performance of vocational education and training ..." These intentions are considered the main targets in our project. 
Within mobility  cooperation with partners we  provide for our  participants so  attractive  working conditions which  we aren`t able to provide in our country.  In addition to professional skills our students become  familiar with the complex system works in real workshops, verify their ability to integrate into the work team in a different language seting, the ability to communicate with superiors, as well as with customers.
The project is implemented from  July 2014 to June 2015 in six countries: Czech Republic, Austria, Portugal, Turkey, Italy and the United Kingdom. We expect the participation of 7 groups , which will form 5 trainees and  accompanying teacher. Preparation of mobility participants will be ongoing and include: the intercultural, technical, linguistic and organizational preparation.
The project is also justified  because of the support the possibility of success on the international labor market. We consider this as an important contribution of the project and thanks Europass - Mobility to each participant, the internship will not be  only registered but also applicable to  find future employment.
 There are the expected outcomes  as to improve the professional skills of individual profession, acquired language skills and also social competencies in communication and assimilation into different language environment. All participants of the project will be integrated into the process of lifelong learning and we hope that in their young age they  begin to realize its importance to their professional development throughout their entire career. We consider this factor the long-term impact of the project.

Mobility activities of „Stiftung Bildung & Handwerk“ (SBH- Education and Crafts Foundation) are realized in the EU Programme „Erasmus+“ (2014 – 2020) in the framework of mobility for learners in vocational education and training, key activity 1 (KA1). 



SBH promotes mobility of learners within three different types of activities:

1. SBH provides opportunities for apprentices from companies throughout Germany to realize work placements abroad 

2. SBH continues colaboration on regional level with „Carl-Severing-Berufskolleg für Handwerk und Technik, Bielefeld“ and organizes work placements for 10 students as assistent in food technology to gain work experiences as well as to develop intercultural, social, personal and social competences. 

3. SBH promotes mobility for staff of vocational education and training centres belonging to SBH and working in the field of VET for disadvantaged young people.  SBH and partners organize within one – week study visits exchanges of experiences and discussions on pedagogical issues with regard to daily work. 

 

SBH act as promotor of individual mobility for apprentices, so as done within „Leonardo da Vinci“ with mobility certificate.  

We support apprentices from the sectors of administration, commerce, hotellry and gastronomy throughout Germany. 

Based on the wide range of vocational programmes in many different professional fields in our vocational training centres SBH has numerous contacts to companies throughout Germany. By the grant of ERASMUS + we promote 25 apprentices (in the second year of VET- process) to realize a four week work placement in one of our European partner countries: Bulgaria, Finland, Ireland, Italy, Spain, Hungary and the United Kingdom.  If apprentices or their companies have contacts in other European countries that can be used to realize the internship, too. 

SBH publishes the offer at the companies website, corresponding the standard of quality for so called „Poolprojekte“. 

Interested apprentices SBH are choosed within an interview via phone and on the basis of corresponding documentation (CV and letter of motivation).  

SBH offers pedagogical and intercultural preparation, if necessary language preparation, too. Therefor we decide depending on the place of domicile of the apprentice either to participate in a workshop at SBH Paderborn or to realize preparation via e-learning.    

SBH supports aprentices and their company during the whole process: starting with application for funding, planification,organization, preparation, realization and post evaluation. If wished by the company or the apprentices we coordinate a task to study during the work placement.

Requirements and aims of the work placement are established individually with every participant corresponding to his VET process.  The final programme for the stay abroad is coordinated among apprentice, company or vocational school and the partner institution abroad.  In situ abroad process is supervised by the partner organization in cooperation with a mentor for internship at the company abroad. Learning agreement will be established between all three parties to assure quality and as base for work. 

The aim is to promote flexibility and independece, to offer technical, intercultural and individual experiences. In contact with people, culture and language of hosting country apprentices develope knowledge and competences. 

Essential part of every work placement is post preparation: after the return from abroad participants present their impressions and experiences: either at SBH or at their company or at vocational school to develop sustainability about mobility. 



All partners and participants play an active role in the public to disseminate experiences within European mobility. 



To document activities, experiences, skills and competences, all aprticipants within all activities will get the Europass Mobility document.
Съвременни информационни и комуникационни технологии в сферата на професионалното образование и преподаването на английски език за специфични цели

The project aims at organising a mobility of 7 teachers of Vocational education centre Millennium for the purpose of professional qualification with methodology training and sharing of experience in Tellus Group, the UK. The main aim of the project is for the teachers to learn about the latest and most modern tendencies and methods in vocational education, to develop their professional teaching skills and competences in accordance with the European standards and latest trends in vocational education in Europe.
The group consists of specialists in vocational education with experience in teaching special subjects as well as foreign languages for specific purposes. The teachers are highly motivated in their professional development for acquiring practical skills which could be implemented immediately and directly in their everyday practice for improving the quality of teaching and vocational training in our institution. In this way the mobility will have a direct effect on the educational process and will correspond to the needs of our students for quality training and their broad interests and ambitions for professional qualification at European level and opportunities for further realization in multinational environment with the profession they are learning. Our students have chosen Information technologies as their speciality, which is one of the fastest developing specialities with main priority and a lot of potential necessitating highly specialised skills and training. That is why we would like to introduce in their training the latest European achievement in the field.
Tellus Group has long experience in training teachers, with numerous successful projects, seminars and  teacher-training events and we believe that they will be very useful with their expertise by organising for the group of teachers a wide range of activities, included in the programme of the training: lectures and  fruitful discussions, high quality presentations, observations and demonstrations of the most modern methodology of teaching and learning as well as modern systems for school management and course design for various subjects and specialities, implementing the IT and all sorts of new online resourses for teaching, testing and evaluation, suitable for vocational training and leading to reliability and validity of professional qualifiaction in Europe.
Placements in Environmental and Traditional Skills

The Placements for Environmental and Traditional Skills project (PETS) brings together a consortium of UK VET colleges providing vocational training in environmental skills and traditional skills and crafts. The project will offer vocational students in these subjects inspiring and educational 4-week work placements with our experienced European host partners. The project also offers VET tutors the opportunity to undertake 7-day staff training visits to European host partners, to learn from their training methods, share experience and form lasting mutually benefical partneships. The project will fund 4-week placements for 47 environmental students and 55 craft students. PETS will also fund 7-day staff training placements for 18 teachers from environmental courses and 26 craft tutors (all from VET courses level 1-3).

This application benefits from over 10 years of Grampus promoting environmental and traditional skills and craft placements through the Leonardo da Vinci programme. This application and consortium combines the experience of delivering two certified IVT projects ‘Training in Contemporary Applications of Traditional European Crafts’ (TICATEC) and ‘Developing Environmental Skills In Rural Europe’ (DESIRE) within the Lifelong Learning Programme. (mobility certificate UK/09/LLP-LdV/MC/Z007) 

Host countries represented in the consortium are Czech Republic, Slovakia, Cyprus, Germany, Romania, Iceland, Slovenia ,Bulgaria Ireland and Turkey.

Participant students and recent graduates will develop a higher degree of self confidence, put theory into practice, gain new skills, improve existing skills and competences, inspire a renewed interest in their chosen subject, gain new language skills and complete a CV enhancing placement which will improve employment prospects and/or enable an informed progression to higher level study.

Participating staff will benefit from placing their own training in a wider European context. Travelling tutors will not only explore new skills, methods, approaches and techniques but will also share their own experiences with host organisations. This experience will give staff access to new ideas and approaches to training which will have a positive impact on their own training delivery. This will ultimately benefit vocational students of the tutor and enable the tutor to pass on new skills and information with a broader European scope.

The objectives of the project are to: 1 Provide a period of ‘real work’ experience for beneficiaries studying environmental and craft courses in the UK at VET level. 2. To ensure that this period of European experience is of relevance to the participant’s course of study and can be accredited as such. 3. To increase the appreciation in beneficiaries of the benefits of European cooperation and the fact that we are facing similar challenges across Europe. 4. To provide beneficiaries with sufficient time and support to increase competencies in key environmental and craft skills being used on the placement. These include:

Environmental Skills: planting, coppicing, footpath design and construction, countryside furniture construction (bridges, steps benches etc), biodiversity assessments and species identification, basic surveying, habitat management, organic sustainable food production.

Craft Skills: weaving, embroidery, silversmithing, blacksmithing, ceramics, wood carving, green wood construction, traditional building techniques (natural materials), 

 5. To develop a sustainable European VET partnership (hosts, UK colleges and Grampus) which can share experience and develop future cooperation projects. 6. To increase the employment prospects of participating students through gaining real-work experience and laying the foundation for language skills 7. To enhance UK VET training provision in environmental and traditional skills by providing 7-day staff placements for tutors with relevant European hosts.

The project management methodology for the PETS consortium is consistent with the 2001 Recommendation on mobility for students, persons undergoing training, volunteers, teachers and trainers and the ten principles set out in in the European Quality Charter for Mobility.

Students are accredited as part of their UK course of study for the mobilities. All participant mobilities are recognised through the Europass certificate as well as the Europass CV and language passport. Host partners provide a minimum of four language lessons with professional tuition. All staff mobilities are recognised within an agreed CPD plan with their own organisations. Host partners also provide certification and a record of achievement in their own format as additional evidence of achievement.

Detailed learning agreements are drawn up prior to placement through discussion between participants, hosts and UK colleges. These provide a realistic benchmark against which the success of the project and placements will be evaluated.

Context/background: Our two first Leonardo projects ”Expanding Horizons” 2006 and ”Exploring horizons” 2008 included one school. “Experiencing Horizons” 2010 – 2014 (LLP-LdV-MC-10/S/689) covered three schools which merged into two. Now we apply for one more school in order to benefit from our joint experiences and strengths and to help each other.

We are three consortium members: The applying Allvar Gullstrand together with Selma Lagerlöf and Svalöfs gymnasium.  Selma and Svalöf keep the contact with the two municipalities Landskrona and Svalöv for a joint and collected dissemination of our results. Svalöf also has a long experience from ECVET knowledges.

Objectives and impacts, organization level: We want to establish a placement network for the upper secondary schools in Landskrona and Svalöv. This is our main objective. Furthermore as a sidetrack we want to give our teachers an extended international school- and professional perspective that the students may benefit from.

Landskrona and its vicinity is a region with high youth employment and many of our students are second/third generation immigrants so the project is a possible way to reduce the employment through enhanced European mobility and thereby increase the knowledge about EU/what EU can offer young people in our region. For the municipalities of Landskrona/Svalöv it is importantant that we keep the education on a high level, fight the segregation between natives and immigrants, offer our students a future without unemployment and counter the student migration from us to the big school cities in south: Lund, Malmö and Helsingborg.

Objectives and impacts, students: It is important for the students to see more of the outside world to create user friendly, ergonomically correct and competitive products and services and moreover to attune their professional skills and experiences to European demands and values. We want to increase their innovation abilities, strengthen their vocational qualifications and their employability in a mobile world where competition no longer has any geographical, cultural and language borders.

Results and longer term benefits: The students should feel that the whole of Europe is their future labour market and that their products and services should have an international imprint to be able to match different needs in different countries. Instead of practicing for the third time at a local company we give the students the possibility to “Extend their Horizons”. To encounter this students will enhance their language skills. Young people who have been practicing abroad bring back more experience and a broad, international perspective that together with increased quality awareness, level of creativity and entrepreneurship are welcome contributions for future employments in companies in Landskrona and elsewhere, which adds to the Swedish initiative.

The placement experiences of the students form the basis for future education and placements at a local level.

Context/Background, students: All the students come from the third year vocational programs. They have during their first two years been practicing at local companies as a complement to their theoretical studies in their vocational subjects. Abroad they use the skills they have acquired during their upper secondary school years and learn new curricular skills. 

Methodology: We intend to use ECVET, which means a written Memorandum of Understanding and a Learning Agreement.
