-The main steps: I. completing the application for the tender, II. the continuous realization of the mobilities: 1. Making contact with the host institution (via phone calls, emails, reaching an agreement about the programs and schedules) 2. Inviting applications for the mobilities, collecting the letters of motivation, selecting the participating students, 3. Preparation of the students (professionally, psychologically, culturally, language) ,4. Conducting the mobility project, 5. Evaluating the experiences, 6. Disseminating the experiences,, III. Final project evaluation, IV. Making final report

-Expected outcomes: students ’ individual account about their experiences; photographs and videos made during the time of practicum; minutes, work diaries and an account made by the group of project participants; Development of the students’ skills and abilities, strengthening of  their professional motivation. Improvement of the quality of BEKSZI’s vocational training, increase in the number of  students participating in vocational training abroad.

-Short-term effect: gaining experiences during a practicum placement to fulfill the requirements described in the central program of the vocational training program. As a proof of the successful completion of the training participating student will receive a Europass Mobility Certificate.

-Long-term effects: We will inform the public about the completed training through the channels of dissemination: the media and the press. As a result, the school can expect an increase in enrollment. The project will help increase the participants’ chance of employment and give them an advantage in the job market through the experiences gained in an international work environment; through application of acquired modern knowledge, everyday and professional language skills and communication.

We are a medium-sized enterprise that supplies the automotive industry all over the world. Currently, we employ 600 people, including 40 trainees. In our offices it is necessary to be able to speak English. We have to prepare our trainees perfectly for the business life – therefore we would like to give three trainees the chance, to take part in a stay abroad to prepare for their later worklife at hago. We would like to give this chance to Jessica Scarpa, second year trainee, Timo Kohler and Sandra Zoller, first year  trainees, to go to England. All three have advanced college qualifications and have currently 2 lessons of English per week. The trainees will take in an one-week English course and two-weeks internship in an English enterprise. These stays abroad will take place from 13.07.14 - 02.08.14 in Plymouth.  It is very important for us to have motivated junior employees, that are able to speak English well  after finishing their training. They should not be afraid of speaking English on a daily basis. Many automotive coperations have their production facilities in foreign countries. So, most of their data sheets are in English. Also meetings or phone calls are held in English. In order to prepare our future workforce for these challenges a stay abroad is essential. Generally, we would like to fully integrate a stay abroad into our trainings in the future. We have currently contact to the IHK Hochrhein-Bodensee and the organisation Tellus Group. These organisations have already organised three internships in an English enterprise from 13.07. – 02.08.14 in Plymouth. They also organise the airport transfer as well as the one-week English course. Our trainees should also learn about the English  culture – we therefore booked a cultural programme at Tellus Group.  During the preparation phase, our trainees receive a presentation assignment to familiarise themeselves with the town Plymouth and the English economy. For the stay abroad, they get several assignments and questions, which they have to answer and return within one week after their return to Germany. During their stay abroad they will permanently in touch with Anja Gutknecht via email or phone. Immediately upon their return, they will individually talk to their trainer Anja Gutknecht and after that there will be a group discussion with all participants. After that, the trainees will work in departments where they can use their English skills, for examplelogistics or disposition. In doing so,  we can monitor if the stay abroad has the desired effect.

As our industrial clerks increasingly work in companies, which subsidiaries and customers are located abroad, it is very important for our school to offer the apprentices the possibililty to handle their customers due to the mobility and flexibility that they have shown by participating in such a programme. While participating the students shall get used to the culture, speach and of course business situations in a foreign country. Furthermore they should deepen their skills and abilities. What is more is that they have got the possibility to enhance thier listening and speaking skills in concern of the KMK-Examination. It has always been a topic of utmost concern for the ETS to make such a programme part of the apprenticeship for the industrial clerks. The whole programme should take place in Plymouth, UK in the periode of September to October 2015 and 2016. As the apprentices will be in the third year of their apprenticeship at that time they should be able to deal with all the situations (host family, office, TellUs) they might encounter. 
Responsible for the organisation on our part is Mr. Frederik Georg as for our partner organisation in Plymouth,UK is Ms Karolina Blicharz (employee of TellUs Group). We got supported by the Go.for.europe-Servicestelle of the IHK Hochrhein-Bodensee in Konstanz. Furthermore Go.for.europe recommended TellUs Group three years ago. For our first flow we are planning to send 12 students abroad.


Departure and arrival:
The participants will be leaving from the airport in Stuttgart. It is a matter of their own responsibility to get to the airport. They will be fetched by our partner at Heathrow Airport and transfered to Plymouth. At Plymouth the host families will fetch them. 

Accomodation and environment:
The particpants will be informed by employees of TellUs where they will be staying as they will get a short tour of the city.

Adaption phase:
The first day in Plymouth will be opened with a welcoming ceremony at TellUs. There they are going to meet their contacts. That is important because their contacts are responsible to deal with any problems. Next they' ll get their bus tickets and maps of Plymouth for a better orientation. After that they will take part in a short language evaluation test. The test will sort out the language level each person will be taught. During the first week they can get to know Plymouth a little better so that they can find their way to their internships.

Internship:
The interns will works in their work placements in the area of office administration.

A day of work:
They will be working 37.5 hours a week, not to forget that hours could vary due to the work of the company. Of course the 37.5 hours won't be exceeded.

Cultural programme:
Our partner will book a cultural programme for three weekends which is optinal for our apprentices.

All of our students should get the Europass Mobilität at the end of the project which they could use for their future applications. Furthermore they gain an insight into a foreign culture which will be something that they will never forget in their lives.
Zahraničné skúsenosti v odbornej praxi zdravotníckych asistentov

The main aim of the mobility project named Experience in Professional Practice of Healthcare Assistants Acquired Abroad is to provide a selected group of students attending the Secondary Nursing School in Lučenec with an opportunity to take part in professional practice in facilities providing healthcare and social services of developed EU member states, thus, allowing them to acquire new skills, experiences and knowledge. The project lasts a year and 22 students are going to visit Denmark, Germany, United Kingdom and the Czech Republic throughout it. The participants are the 3rd and 4th grade students of the full-time four-year study programme Healthcare assistant at the Secondary Nursing School in Lučenec – the students who have achieved the best study results not only in vocational but also in general subjects and the foreign language course. The selection criteria included study results, very good Average Grade and a polite, outgoing and trouble free attitude during the whole study period. Divided into 7 groups, the participants will perform their practice in the cities/towns of Plymouth (UK), Horb am Neckar (DE), in the region of Funen (DK) and Prague (CZ). All the work placements will last 21 days except for the one in Prague which will take 2 weeks. The first three visits are going to start in October 2014, the others start at the end of May 2015. Regarding mobility projects, we have had good experience in cooperating with most of the organisations involved herein; however, this project involves a new partner – the College of Nursing and Secondary Nursing School in Prague. The receiving organisations will ensure the participants are provided with  board and lodging, useful information and help while dealing with problems that arise throughout their stay. During the visits their performance will be assessed by a supervisor of the receiving organisation who will be monitoring and looking after them. They will also be in touch with the Coordinator of the sending organisation, and they will keep a journal, filling it with results, experiences and performance data. At the end of the visit the participants will get the Europass – Mobility documents and certificates of the sending organisation signed by the receiving organisation. The receiving organisation shall also produce an evaluation of the completed practice. Those who performed their practice in Plymouth will also take an educational course in English; after successfully completing it, they will obtain transferrable credits. The aim of the project is to enable the participants to gain new experience and competence in using modern, innovative methods, techniques and aids (e.g. positioning and self-care aids) or in the field of culture, social traditions and language. The participants will get familiar with the healthcare systems and vocational education of the receiving countries; they will be able to compare them, and their knowledge will be of help not only for them but also for other students. One of the objectives is to strengthen and maintain the partnerships in Denmark and Germany, the educational organisation in the United Kingdom, and establish a new partnership in the Czech Republic. Apart from professional and personal development of the participating students, we find the exchange of information, knowledge and experience between our partner organisations and us, and the healthcare system we represent, to be very advantageous as well. Concerning the national and regional level, these mobility activities will stabilize our position in the system of Slovak secondary schools, they will enhance the quality of education provided, which might encourage the young people´s interest in this type of education. We hope that by engaging in this project activities we will take part in the process of increasing the number of qualified healthcare assistants, which is the job that is becoming highly needed in the states of the European Union nowadays.
Europäisch Lernen für Auszubildende und Bildungspersonal

The Akademie Überlingen is an education provider with close links to the economy and a strong local, regional as well as European network. The project 'EULE - European Learning' (EULE) supports stays in other European countries during vocational training. Through an internship abroad trainees can gain professional competences and new vocational skills. They learn new working techniques and can improve their language skills!



It is our aim to increase personal capacities by gaining vocational qualifications abroad and improving language skills. The Akademie Überlingen organises the stays and prepares the trainees in attunement with the training company and the vocational school. Our transnational partners look after the trainees in the destination country.

Strategically we aim for an internationalisation that ensures training, recruitment and long-term employment of skilled people for the economy. Our development concept targets: the individuum, real-life personal and cultural diversity, a culture of welcoming and appreciation. The EULE project encourages everyone involved to trust in European cooperation and equal opportunities, moreover we support sustainability and economic success for businesses (SME's).    



The EULE project is organised as a pool project for trainees from the whole of Germany by the Akademie Überlingen in partnership with the national consortium partners (the 3 vocational schools of the Harz county) and the transnational partners. Building on the success of the currently running EuBeLe project (we have been a LLP project coordinator for the last 8 years) we are planning 60 'pool' places for trainees from all of Germany and 20 places for trainees from our consortium partners with a minimum stay abroad of 3 weeks (several fixed flows, free selection of dates with individual stays, preparation in day or weekend seminars). Furthermore, tutors and training staff are able to gain praxis-related professional experience with European training providers or companies and can improve their language skills.  We organise internships in the following areas: Tourism, Office and Administration, Technical professions, Crafts, Service, IT, Health. Accommodation is organised in host families or in shared accommodation. Preferred host countries are England, France, Italy, Spain and Malta.



Our precise aims are:

- improving the adaptability at the requirements of the European labour market

- increasing awareness for mobility and break existing barriers of mobility

- improving and using of language skills in a real working and living environment

- improving the quality, attraction and performance capacity in initial vocational training

- recognising of competences and qualifications

- enhancing of competency levels of groups at risk (disadvantaged youth, early school leavers, immigrants, disabled persons)

- improving the attraction for vocational training through work related skills improvement to attract enough young persons to get training in our region despite the demografic problem



Our transnational partners are already partners of the Akademie Überlingen in the currently running Leonardo Da Vinci mobility project 'EuBeLe' and in the IdA project (IdA - Integration through Exchange is an ESF project by the Federal Department of Labour and Social Affairs). Building onto the positive experience from these projects the partners will be responsible for the welfare of the participants, the accommodation and the placement companies. They have highly experienced personnell dedicated especially for these tasks. In addition participants may take language classes during their stay. Selection of participants will be done in tiered stages and in close collaboration with the partners and companies.

A training agreement between trainee, vocational school and placement company ensures a binding committment to the contents of the stay. Continuing monitoring including evaluation questionnaires, weekly reports, feedback meetings with the participants and the receiving organisation are part of the quality assurance system. After successfull completion of the internship the participants will receive the Europass Mobility, the Europass Languages (if applicable) and the Certificate of Participation by the Akademie Überlingen.
Zagraniczny staż w Wielkiej Brytanii kluczem do europejskiej mobilności -2015

This project is going to be realized in a form of three – week foreign technical training, in companies dealing with IT, production, trading and service branches. The realization of this practice is going to take place from the 21 June till 12 July 2014. The participants of this project will be 33 students from Zespol Szkol No 3 in Wyszkow who educate in IT and economical areas. The offer will be directed to the students of the 2nd and 3rd grade (17-19 year-old). 

The main aim of this project is to improve practical skills of 33 students from technical classes (IT and economical specializations) form Zespol Szkol No 3 in Wyszkow so as to make  their later professional and personal development easier.

Detailed aims (hard):
• Gaining additional qualifications, the expansion of 33 students’ knowledge in IT and economical professions.
- the number of students whose qualifications grew  in the professions of  IT and  Economy
- the number of issued Europass Mobility
• Getting to know the requirements which are put on students/ employees in a partner’s country by 33 students.
- the number of certificates of completed training in the UK
• The improvement of 33 students’ English language skills
- the number of students whose English language competence and skills improved

Detailed aims (soft):
• the development of social and public skills (endurance, precision, dutifulness,  cooperation in groups)
• an increase in motivation towards learning, higher professional and personal aspirations
• the alignment of educational chances, especially for students coming from villages or with special educational needs
• enabling students to gain extra skills and knowledge  which will make further education easier and/or the choice of a professional path
• the improvement of  the quality of provided educational services at school
• an increase in key competence
• a growth in students’ self-esteem
• a better preparation  of school graduates in labor market
• the establishment of cooperation: between labor market institutions and school, in terms of  two-directional information flow and the accuracy of  offered educational services
• transnational cooperation ( the introduction of innovatory system solutions in technical training, an increase in vocational students’ mobility, an increase in the number of graduates who are open towards other cultures and posses language skills  at an extended level)

The sources of verification: 
- attendment list
- training register (every day)
- evaluation forms (two during the project)
- final reports
- diagnostic vocational tests (two during the project)

Products:
90 hours of foreign training per student
33 Europass Mobility
33 certificates of completed foreign training
6 multimedial presentations prepared by the participants of the foreign training
1 film showing the ZS No 3 stay in the UK
a www subpage concerning the ZS No 3 stay in the UK
two articles in a local newspaper
2 open lessons with the participants of the training concerning their stay in the UK which  are aimed to promote their professional mobility
33 final reports from the foreign training 

Needs:
• students’ needs ( the usage of theoretical knowlege in practice, vocational mobility, expanding language skills inc. technical language, the willingness to check onself in a stressful situation, becoming independent, making contacts with future employers)
• school needs (the improvement of educational quality, a growth in educational competitivness, gaining prestige, recruitment improvement, giving the assurence of a good professional start to students)
• Polish and foreign employers’ needs (raising demand for IT specialists with an international experience)
• District, province and country needs (promotion, hiring skilled workers, the development of IT branch)

Since 2009, the Public Vocational School 2 in Passau conducts a 4-week stay abroad for the foreign language industrial business management assistants. In 2011, our school received a Leonardo da Vinci mobility certificate for this project. The mobility measure is a mainstay of our dual education and training model in the form of a double qualification as an industrial business management assistant and foreign language correspondent (English). This model is carried out in cooperation with the Chamber of Industry and Commerce of Passau and the regional training companies.

In accordance with the internationalisation strategy of the Public Vocational School 2, a four-member EU-Team consisting of teachers, who among other things organise the international project, was established in 2010.

The target group for this formal training and education are trainees with secondary school qualifications as well as high school graduates. By now, 30-40 participants take part in this foreign measure, each year.

We organise the stay in England as a combination of 2 weeks occupational project work at the European College of Business and Management in London, and 2 weeks work placement in small and medium-sized companies, organised by Tellus Group Ltd in Plymouth (South England). In a precisely designed training programme at the ECBM the aim is to especially promote the professional and linguistic skills of the trainees. During their work placement, the trainees work in international teams and correspond with foreign business partners, which in return, should encourage their intercultural occupational competence. Accommodating the trainees with guest families leads to improvement of their linguistic skills and a better understanding of the English way of life.

Due to a genuine encounter with a different culture, the entire stay leads to an awareness-raising and cultural openness of the participants. The relativity of values, perceptions as well as mentality and manners are sharpened. They have the ability to act appropriately in both professional as well as private intercultural situations.

At the end of each stay abroad, we have found that our trainees have become independent and self-confident and have reduced their fear of the new/unknown. The skills acquired through the project and certificates (e.g. Europass Mobility) improve the employment opportunities especially in international companies. Since 2008, in the course of this project, the offered training places for our education and training model have increased from 16 to 34 places. The success of this project was certainly one of the reasons why another vocational school in Lower Bavaria, the vocational school in Landshut, has decided to adopt this double qualification.
Auszubildende in England: Leben, Arbeiten und Lernen

The project ‛Auszubildende in England: Leben, Arbeiten und Lernen’ (Trainees in England: Life, work and education) is conducted by Carl Helbing School, Emmendingen in co-operation with Tellus Group Ltd. in Plymouth. It is open to commercial apprentices in the vocational fields of wholesale and foreign trade, industry, office management, banking and health, who are enrolled in Carl Helbing School. They attend compulsory English classes in school and aim for the ‛KMK’ certificate. They are predominantly placed with local businesses with international connections. Therefore, proficiency in English is indispensable for their success in their apprenticeships as well as in school.

Attaining or consolidating, as the case may be, proficiency in a foreign language is a self-evident reason for going abroad. Nowhere can a language be learned with greater efficiency than where it is actually spoken. For this reason, we enable our apprentices to participate in the Erasmus+ programme. They apply for the available places handing in their ‛Europass’ cv, as well as a motivational letter in German and English, respectively. Following the selection of participants by the school, they attend an intercultural preparatory workshop, during which they have a chance to get to know each other and receive all relevant information on their stay in England. Organizational matters, such as transfer arrangements to and from the airports, necessary insurances and means of payment are settled and the requirements of the learning contracts are explained.

The participants fly to London together and are then transferred to Plymouth and their host families by our local partner organization. They are quartered half-board in twin rooms. They spend four weeks in Plymouth. First, they attend an intensive one-week language training in order to prepare them for the subsequent three-week placement. There, following a brief familiarization, they are involved in the daily routines and may perform duties such as telephoning, e-mail correspondence, customer support or sales, thereby getting to know different departments, like purchasing and sales, bookkeeping, marketing and logistics as they are organized in foreign companies, and gain new insights into alternative methods and procedures, while at the same time increasing their language proficiency.

Week-end excursions in and around Plymouth, organized and conducted by Tellus Group, complement the programme and give the participants the opportunity to further their knowledge and appreciation of life in England.

After a successful completion of the project, the apprentices receive the ‛Europass Mobility’. This will increase their chances in the national, as well as international labour markets. Through Erasmus+ projects, we also aim to improve the quality of our education and hope to facilitate excellent results in our pupils’ final examinations. From the evaluation and propagation of their experiences in the project, we hope to gain prestige for our school. The preparation of a well-qualified skilled work force is essential for the success of the local, and by implication the international economy, particularly in view of global future demands in the labour market. For this reason, we are eager to continue offering voluntary placements abroad in the future.

The project is called People Around Us. Our aim is a two-week placement for 10 students.
8 students of Social Pedagogy and 2 students of Pre-school and out-of-school pedagogy. The host organisation will be the English partner school Tellus, Ltd. Work Experience UK. The students of Social Pedagogy will work in workplaces of the partner school - charity centres of social care for the socially excluded people - the homeless and drug addicted people in the area of the city of Plymouth.
The students of Pre-school and out-of-school pedagogy will take their teaching practice in kindergartens.
The programme will be made up by the special vocational preparation before departure and by the placement itself.
Our aim is special and language experience, casual differences in approach to the target clients in the social sphere, gaining the fundamental skills for eventual getting a job in the EU in the given field of practice, problems of employment of social workers and kindergarten teachers, challenges and inspiration for creating new types of jobs for social workers and kindergarten teachers, learning to be tolerant to the mental, social, cultural and civilisation differences and general enrichment of knowledge concerning other countries of the EU. 
The results of the project are focused on practical knowledge and skills in the field of
1. social work with the homeless and drug addicted
2. pre-school pedagogy and care for the 3 and 4 years old children
The participants will observe the model of social care, they will learn the new skills and practical experience and will keep their documentation.
The project will start in September 2014 with the selection of students, professional preparation, the placement itself will take place in February/March 2015 and after the return of the participants the dissemination of the results will take place, both on the regional and district level. This dissemination and final report will round up the project by the first of September 2015.
At the end of the placement the participants will receive the Europass Mobility and the Certificate of Work Experience. The project is to contribute to the quality of vocational education of our school and to the attractivity of Pre-school and out-of-school pedagogy and Social Pedagogy.

The project is directed to students of ZSZiO Technical School in Żukowo of the following specialties: economic technician, IT technician, logistics technician, advertising technician. Month-long internships will take place in modern companies in Plymouth in Great Britain. Participants will develop the practical skills connected with their profession and will be given opportunities to confront theory with practice. At the same time, student will acquire key skills, such as second language communication, workplace communication, social skills and  cultural sensitivity skills, in particular those connected with accepting workplace diversity and preventing prejudice and racism. They will undergo basic law orientation; they will become familiarized with workers’ rights and responsibilities; they will learn how to pursue their rights abroad. Thanks to the project, the students will become more active professionally and will enjoy greater mobility with respect to their workplaces, jobs and even place of living. The abovementioned skills will be certified with proper documentation recognized in Great Britain and other EU countries (Europass Mobility, APT Awards).
Gender in Kindertagesstätten - starke Mädchen, starke Jungen für Europa

The school Marianum Hegne is a private school in patronage of the catholic church which offers different educations. The vocational training offers the possibility to become state-approved nursery teacher. One class includes 60 pupils. For one third of the each class the mobility project provides a chance to collect working experience abroad. 16 of our students absolve a three week traineeship in Plymouth (GB) while 4 students work in Linz (Austria).

The mobility project runs under the heading of 'Gender in nursery schools – strong girls and strong boys for Europe'. This topic is central to the project because it arouses the students' awareness for various approaches to gender pedagogics in the different European countries.

One aim is to foster professional competence and social skills in reference to gender pedagogics. All students prepare themselves for their stay in concern to language and culture in meetings over a six-month period. In these meetings students grapple with the project topic and reflect upon methodical and didactical transfer in their future facilities.

Students also have to rely on themselves while preparing and organizing the whole stay, so this offers the possibility of personal growth in organizational skills, communication and team competence.

The Tellusgroup is our partner in Plymouth and is responsible for the organization of guest families and traineeships. The Bakip (Bildungsanstalt für Kindergartenpädagogik) provides for the housing and the traineeships in Linz. We also welcome students from Linz and offer them accommodation and traineeships.

In the end we evaluate the whole exchange by requesting feedback from our partners, from the individual facilities and from each single student and use is as a basis for improvements in future years.

 As a final step students present their experiences in front of the whole school after their return. This way the project is presented to a broad public.
Dzisiaj uczeń ZSP w Bytowie - Jutro europejski pracownik

The promoter of the project is Zespół Szkół Ponadgimnazjalnych (Complex of Secondary Schools) in Bytow and a partner institution is Tellus Ltd in Plymouth in Great Britain.

The most important reason to create the project was low motivation of young people to learn and improve their skills and also a significant unemployment among graduates technicians in our region, and hence, the increasing migration of young people abroad who take a job not related to an educated profession, because they do not believe in their abilities and skills in an international group.

Therefore, the main objectives of the project are:

1. Taking effective actions to make graduates of schools attractive, mobile and well-prepared employees, who will perform their educated profession; 2. The awakening of the need to improve qualifications continuously by students; 3 Improving the qualifications and skills sought by present businesses; 4. The increase of the self-esteem, motivation and activity of students; 5. Improvement of practical language skills especially in the field of information technology and automotive branch; 6. Gaining practical experience and professional knowledge that fulfill the standards applicable to the examinations of professional competence; 7. Improving the quality of vocational education by allowing students to work in real conditions with equipment using modern technologies; 8. Acquainting with the equipment, with the applicable procedures, organization and quality of work abroad; 9. Enriching the curriculum vitae of the beneficiaries of a new experience, cultural and moral aspects; 10. The increase of communication skills and adaptability.

The project will be attended by 32 third grade students: 16 - the profession techniques vehicles and 16 - in the profession IT technician.

Four groups will take part in 2 - weeks trainings, 1 group - 8 students; the first group will start in the autumn 2014, the second group will go in March 2015, the third in the autumn and the fourth in March 2016.

The Group of IT technician will practice in Tellus Institute Ltd.

Their task will be the implementation of a project to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a certificate. Their specific preparation will be competence in the field of professional exam: 

Designing of local area networks and network administration, which pupils take at the end of the second semester of the third class. 

The group of professional automotive technician will carry out trainings in professional workshops of English local entrepreneurs according to the schedule of classes. 

The course takes into account the content of examination in the profession and it relates to the diagnose and repair electrical and electronic systems of motor vehicles. Pupils obtain these qualifications at the end of the second semester of the third class.

The most important form of achieving the desired effect will be learning through work, real experience, place in a problematic situation.

Beneficiaries will acquire competences calculated in accordance with the credit system APT Award.

The expected result of participation in the project will be new experience gained by students in the Informatics and automotive fields. This aspect can find recipients in the local market.

Certificates, including Europass - Mobility make beneficiaries more reliable and attractive employees. This knowledge will provide better results on examinations confirming vocational qualifications.

Students’ entrepreneurship and their organizational skills will increase.

Better knowledge of vocational English will appear in the students’ communication skills and will give them more confidence.

Realization of the project will allow to use the potential of young people efficiently , it will have a positive impact on the development of corporate social responsibility, a better opinion about vocational education. It will encourage future students to benefit from this form of personal development and training. It will foster pro-European attitudes.

The BBZ Bautzen has been introduced to the program through similar projects conducted by the BSZ Löbau. The positiv results for the participants and teachers as well as the long lasting experience of the project manager have produced the wish to be able to offer these internships to our own aprentices. 

We train students in building professions such as decorating or building, our young people come from disadvantaged backrounds. They need special support in managing every day live as well as work live. The project is aimed to involve them right form the start.

They are in a rehabilitating training program, they havent been able to succesfully apply for aprenticeships on the free market. The project will help them to establish basics such as punctuality, responsibility and activly taking part at lessons.

The mobility itself will furthermore teach them how to deal with a new culture and new situations and will strenghten their selfimage. Our young people rarely have a chance to go abroad. With such a project they can experience work practise in a different country in a safe way - being looked after by highly trained, caring and experienced staff.

20 years of experience with exchange projects have proofed the strong positiv impact that these placemnets have on the trainees. 

8 young people will work for three weeks in Devon UK and be accomanied by two teachers/staff and the project manager.

The two groups of builders and decoraters will each tackle one project, the first lot wil be construting a car park and the other will be creativly refurbish hallways and walls. 

CMS Devon Ltd has succesfully and with mutual profit worked with Teignmouth Community College who ultimatly will be hosting the work program. The studenst will work together with the local maintenance team.

CMS Devon Ltd as the receiving partner is responsible for the organistion of the whole mobility including preperations seminar, accomodation, flights, transport, food, insurance and free time activities. For which the company director has ample qualification by managing such projects since 2010.

We believe that our students will grow in their personal and vocational strenghts and that it will enable them to succesfully apply for work in the free labour market when they have finished their aprenticeships.

The project is aimed at three specializations of our school: economics, information technology and tourism. The project will be implemented in cooperation with the partner organisation Tellus (Group) Ltd - Work Experience UK. There are 32 participants of the program (aged 17- 19): 6 in economics and 20 in information technology and 6 in tourism sector. The participants' selection criteria are clearly stated. During their stay in the UK the students will be accompanied by 2 teachers:  Mrs Ducka and Mrs Gurowiec/ Mrs Musiałek

The main objective of the project is placement implementation  in small and medium enterprises in Plymouth (the UK). The participants will be divided into two groups. The first group will consist of 16 students  ( 10 in IT,  6 in economics) and will stay in the UK from 1 March  2015 to 28 March 2015. In the second group there will also be 16 students (10 in IT , 6 in tourism) and they will  stay in the UK from 18 October 2015 to 14 November 2015.

Other priority objectives of the project are the following:

a. to acquire new qualifications and improve existing ones,

b. to acquaint participants with requirements imposed by European employers on employees,

c. to acquaint students with ways of functioning and management of small and medium enterprises. It would be helpful in supporting graduates in setting up and running their own companies and counteracting unemployment,

d. to develop students' skills and thus improve their situation in the labor market and increase their employability,

e. to match curriculum requirements and the needs of employers in the European markets,

f. to promote the idea of mobility in working life,

The project is based on the analysis of job markets needs and conclusions drawn from cooperation with local employers. It also takes into account current changes taking place in European job markets. We want to meet  requirements imposed by local and European employers on our graduates. Potential employer looks for enterprising, mobile people with good knowledge of foreign languages. Professional training and  skills are also essential here. Student will be able to receive employers' references and international certificates.

The placement will be mainly implemented in small and medium companies in Plymouth.

One of the priorities of our placement program is supporting graduates in setting up and running their own companies. The aim is going to be reached by the knowledge of companies organizational structures, their functioning and management.

 The process of education will be greatly accompanied by experience gained in companies. International placement allows not only to make observations, improve professional skills and gain professional experience but also to communicate  in English freely and to gain ability to move on the European job market as well.  Teachers will benefit in this field as well.

As a result the participants will increase professional and language skills. They will also acquaint themselves with part of the British job market. The participants of the project will receive the Europass Mobility certificate, employers' references and the certificate of attendance in the project . Each of the institutions participating in the project has the tasks assigned to. In addition, the project schedule has been created. The project will be evaluated  and monitored at its every stage and its results will be disseminated.

At local level, our project is in agreement with the needs of development strategy for the Silesian District (2000- 2020), where increasing mobility on job market and professional qualifications improvement are emphasized. At present, the Silesian District is developing dynamically as far as its economics is concerned; and foreign investment is essential here.

On national scale, our project supports actions promoting the spirit of enterprise among the young, whose careers might be the result of experience gained on the European job market.

For European perspective, the project supports and  complements EU member countries actions in the field of education and vocational training.

Our Erasmus+ proposal has the aim to enable our students to spend four weeks in England for a language course and an internship. All of our students are currently enrolled in a program for a dual vocational education and training. They are in their second year or at the end of their first year of studies at our school and are about 18 to 22 years old.

All of them are working in publishing companies, advertisement companies or in film and television companies. Typically they are working in small and medium sized companies that are not able to send their students abroad. Nevertheless their field of employment is characterized by an increasing internationalization. In order to prepare our students for the job market and increase their employability, we want to offer them the chance to spend one part of their vocational training abroad. We want to give them the opportunity to broaden their horizon and increase their understanding for a different culture by spending time in an English company as well as by interacting with their host families in England. Furthermore we want to enable them to use the language skills they have acquired in school. We believe that the students will not only be able to enrich their own lives with this experience but that they will also gain a higher employability for their current or future companies.

They will obtain the Europass Mobility as well as a diploma supplement confirming their internship, language skills as well as the additional professional skills they have obtained during this internship abroad. With these measures we want to increase their chances both on the national and international job market.
Zagraniczne staże dla uczniów wchodzących na rynek pracy

The goal of this project is a four-week apprenticeship in the UK for  students from Zespół Szkół nr 1 in Sanok.  Seven students from each of the following profiles : economic technician, logistical technician, hotel technician and nourishment and household technician will take part in the apprenticeship. That will total 28 students and 2 counsellors. The hosting organisation is Tellus Ltd., which is an organisation experienced in organising apprenticeships for students. The training course will take place in Plymouth in the UK. The project meets school needs (increasing the attractiveness and quality of teaching), students’s needs (increasing  personal, professional and linguistic competence, increasing job opportunities, providing equal chances), local employers’s needs (better workers in the local job market) and the local community’s needs (parents, local authorities).

The appretice will learn about the nature of a British company, management and work methods, occupational and safety hygiene regulations, vocational foreign language and governance typical for the UK. They will also develop the following qualities in real work conditions: propriety and dealing with customers, independence, industriousness, respecting work discipline, ability to work in a team, ability to plan one’s work and time managment, ability to organise one’s work place and ability to use a foreign language. The above skills will be characteristic of the profession, as they will be shaped in a specific work environment characteristic to the trade.

The theoretical knowledge acquired at school will be deepened by practical skills, and  the skills and certificates attained by students will make it easier for the future graduates to function in the job market. The project will help them  to find a job or run their own business. During the apprenticeship students should learn about the functioning of a company in the European labour market, understand the occupational requirements, resulting in  the satisfaction of customer needs. Taking part in this project will make the graduates  more confident in their relations with employers and customers.

Thanks to living with  host families, the apprentices will get to know the lifestyle of average British people, their culture, customs and leisure time activities. The apprentices will learn how to cope in new, sometimes extreme situations. The proper recruitment system will motivate students to improve their academic results and attendence. The apprentice will also attain points in the APT Awards system. It is a system developed to offer the participant job experience recognised in the EU. The general idea makes it a clear system to assess student’s skills, which supports the current pursuit of EU countries to standardise the marking scheme of  the practical skills of vocational school students. Using APT Awards will result in an easier and fairer job application procedure or the ability to continue education in EU countries. They will also increase their competence in the following fields: professional, linguistic, computer skills, organisational , social and personal.

The project will definitely:

- improve the quality of vocational training offered by Zespół Szkół nr 1 in Sanok,

- improve knowledge and professional skills of the participants,

- decrease the differences between academic knowledge and skills and competence expected by employers,

- teach about methods and techniques used in the UK,

- increase the employment prospects of the apprentices,

- increase the apprentices’ enterprising spirit and initiative,

- increase the apprentices’ mobility in the job market,

- improve English language skills,

- encourage the apprentices to take part in various forms of job training (also abroad),

- increase apprentices’ multicultural competence and show them how to live and work in a mulicultural environment,

- positively influence self-esteem,

- show the apprentices how to appreciate European Union membership.

WinE - Workplacement in European Enterprises



The objective of the proposed project is to significantly improve the starting conditions of young adults for later possible occupations in foreign countries through the placement abroad . The placement also improves the employment opportunities in the native country as local and regional companies can benefit from young adults offering excellent foreign language skills and international experience.



The project particularly focuses on two groups of participants :



1)

14 participants come from the traditional field of vocational education within the dual system . The courses Industrial Business Management Assistant and Management Assistant in Wholesale and Foreign Trade train future employees in industrial and trading enterprises (training according to the Vocational Training Act / BBIG ) 

Due to the Europeanization of the economy, increasing globalization and the high export share of the German economy, these young adults will certainly have to deal with export and import transactions in their future working life.

The placement supports the trainees of the courses " Industrial Business Management Assistant " and " Management Assistant in Wholesale and Foreign Trade " in the acquisition and the use of knowledge , skills and  qualifications to be well prepared for this internationalization of companies . It promotes their personal development, employability and their willingness to participate in the European labor market.

2)

16 participants are students from the educational course Commercial Foreign Language Assistant. This is a full- time school-based educational course of vocational training by state law. The language assistants have fundamental , mainly theoretical knowledge that is complemented by professional practice. In this context, the placement serves the purpose of applying , consolidating and deepening the knowledge acquired . The aim of the placement is to apply the business and commercial knowledge and skills acquired in the full -time vocational course in practical operation. Therefore the development and promotion of economic linguistic competence is of special significance.

The foreign language assistants should gain first professional experiences abroad with a view to their future career in the framework of the placement.
Lernaufenthalte für Lernende und Lehrende in Landschaftsgartenbau

As the Umbrella Organization for Landscape Gardening in North Rhine-Westphalia we see ourselfs compelled to provide our member with all possible instruments to establish and maintain high quality education. ERASMUS+ is a good tool to send Learners and Trainers to receive practical and technical training in a foreign country.

The goal is to send trainees for work experience to English Gardens which have influenced Garden Design historically and continue to do so. Such knowledge is relevant for the vocational education as well as on the labour market. That is why we also aim to train our trainers in this field to give them an edge over competion.

Additionaly a work experience abroad always strengenths personal and intercultural skills of the participant. It also raises their mobility. It helps to grow together in Europe and will counter the lack of skilled personell through offering atractive and high quality vocational training.

The trainees will travel in two flows consiting of each members each to South-West England where our partner CMS Devon Ltd is going to receive and look after them. CMS Devon will deploy our interns to work with the National Trust, who is the largest employer in this field. CMS Devon Ltd is responsible for organizing the flows and looking after the participants during their stay - this includes flights, accomodation, transport, insurance, board and leisure time offers. This is the same for our training personell, in addition CMS Devon Ltd will provide planing and execution of the training curriculum including historical and current gardens and institutions as well as a practical day to reinforce what has been learnd.

Being a hugh umbrella organisation this will enable us to infuse that knowledge and those skills back into our vocational schools and  our companies. This will ensure them an advantage over their competitors.

On top of that it brings added value to all participants through strengthening their personality and their practical skills and proffesional knowledge. We agree that every trainee should spent time abroad during their training period because it does open up new hoizons and gives new perspektives in work and private life.

Having said this it is our goal to send out more trainees and trainers each year to educate both groups and thus continue to offer relevant and highly qualfied vocatinal training in order to win mor young people for this profession.

The promotor of the project is Bytów ZSE-R school. The realization is planned for 2015-2016.Our intermediate partners are the Centre of Vocational Training in Schmalkalden,Germany and Tellus Group in Plymouth,England.The receiving organizations will be enterprises dealing with services and trade,and hotels and tourist centres,in which 50 students will have a 4-week internship in May 2015 and in May 2016.The participants will be third-grade students who are now being trained in: trade, economics, hotel and tourism industry and food and catering services.The students will have work placements in specialised enterprises in Thuringia in Germany and in exclusive hotels and tourist centres in Hampshire County in England. Moreover, 20 of our graduates will take part in this project;ten of them will have two-month work experience, the other half will have a 5-monthinternship from July to November 2015 and 2016. The graduates will have their apprenticeship in the same places. This project meets the needs for modern vocational training,aimed at preparing students effectively for their future life and work by educational system. The direct results are the needs of the school students and the local job market which is suffering from high unemployment(24%).Young people, especially those who come from socially and materially neglected rural beckgrounds,have limited opportunities for development,further education and realisation of interesting business plans.Their participation in this project will be an important stage in their real-life process of personal and professional development as it will permanently integrate them with domestic and European job market and will raise their self-esteem.

The objectives of this project are:

1. Fighting with unemployment and social exclusion among graduates from vocational schools

2. Promotion of employees' mobility on a European job market 

3.Enhancement of students' and graduates' competences, both personal and social ones through teaching resourcefulness and creativity, mobility and universal personal and cultural development

4. Reduction of unemployment among young people, especially women, in Bytów County 

5.Gaining practical experience and professional knowledge by the students according to the highest standards of business know-how in providing services in trade,catering, tourism, hotel industry in countries of western Europe

6. Improvement of quality and position of professional training through developing real competences of students

7. Adjusting professional qualifications of the trainees to the needs of job market

8. Stimulation of connection between professional training and employment

9. Implementing innovative educational solutions to upgrade students' professional qualifications

10. Training and improving students' practical language skills which leads the young people to become multilingual

The school has appropriate staff resources as well as vast experience gained through doing numerous exchange projects, what gives a full guarantee to fulfill the above objectives and predicted results,i.e.70 work placements,certificates and Europass documents confirming formal qualifications.The domestic qualification will be unified with the European ones.Rational actions at the stage of planning,realisation and evaluation of the project give a quarantee that all Erasmus+ partners will contribute in expected results.Knowledge, experience and practical skills will make it easier for the trainees to realise their interest and professional plans. Taking part in the project will lead to increase participants' key competences and practical skills, which are so welcome on a job market in our County.There will be implementation of good examples from countries with the best governance and efficiency to local businesses in fields of commerce, tourism, catering and hotels. 

The participants will gain skills of using knowledge in new situations, integrating technology with training and self-development,what is an optimal way of creative actions in professional and social life of young people.Thanks to gained language skills, both general and professional, the internship will empower the position of beneficiaries on a real job market. Participating in another edition of work placements abroad will bring long-term effects by consolidating the position of the school as a successful school,which takes chalenges because it takes care of the level of education and professional preparation of its students. The scope of cooperation between the vocational school and foreign enterprises will increase,which will influence the development of the school. Vocational education both at school and on a local level will gain new quality and will become trendy among middle school students. The project will be an impulse to economic development. It is  important for local eemployers to take part in elaboration of the programme of the work experience and now they are looking forward to the effects of the project
European Mobility Network und TTASTE- Teachers and Trainers are sent to Europe

During the project timeframe the „Berufsbildungswerk Neckargemünd “(BBWN) sends a total of 27 trainees and apprentices abroad for internships or practical stays who all have very specific special education needs and come from various apprenticeships and training programs within the Dual Training System.  At the BBW young people are trained outside of a company i.e. the practical part takes place in well-equipped training companies res. on shop floors.  In these internship programs Trainees gain valuable experiences at cooperation companies.

One of the most important objectives is the strengthening and acquisition of self-reliance and more self-confidence. After finishing their training program or apprenticeships our trainees have to face the first job market and compete with people without handicaps. Showing mobility and intercultural competence and having gained experience abroad increases our trainees’ chances dramatically and helps compensating for disadvantages resulting from their handicaps. At the moment we are offering internships in Switzerland, Spain, Estonia, France and Italy. The Coordinator for Internships Abroad at our vocational school plans, books and organizes the entire internship programs. Typically, the trainees are accompanied during the first days of their internship by a teacher/trainer. Leonardo-da-Vinci and the BBWN fund the program and bear all expenses, such as traveling expenses, board and lodging and insurance.



Apart from the trainees in their initial training, 15 trainers and teachers of the BBWN visit our partners in connection with VETPRO Projects.  These are facilities that offer vocational training for young people with special education needs. Our goal is to learn from our partners, gain insights and deepen our collaboration.  e.g. within Peer Review Projects or ECEVET.  We are striving for a regular exchange of colleagues within VETPRO projects in order to also promote the internationalization of our facility.
Zdobywamy doświadczenie w Europie –praktyki zawodowe przymiarką do współczesnego rynku pracy.

The group of participants of the Project „We gain experience in Europe – work practice as an approach to modern job market” consists of 32 students of technical college Zespół Szkół Zawodowych im. Stanisława Staszica w Barlewiczkach. The students attend classes with the following specialities: motor vehicle technician, computer technician, feeding and gastronomic services technician, hotel technician, auto mechanic technician. Also, a group of 25 graduate students will join the Project. In May and October 2015 two group of 16 students are going to go on traineeship to Plymouth, Great Britain. Between March and June 2015, a group of 10 graduates is going to go on 3-months probation, and between September and November next group of 15 graduates is going to set off for the work practice. The partner of the project is Tellus Group Ltd from Plymouth, Great Britain – vocational course centre. 3rd grade students and graduates from our school will undergo the traineeship and practical training in Great Britain. The traineeship and probation will be connected with a practical training „Preparation for working life”, due to which students will be prepared to enter the job market. The course gives them an opportunity to obtain qualifications at APT Level 2 Award, a respectable European award. This eligibility is fitted to participant’s needs and capabilities. 

The participants choose the number and topics of credits that they want to obtain. The trainees, due to the prolonged stay in Plymouth, will have the opportunity to gain higher qualifications by choosing additional modules to pass. The youth from our school requires support, as the students come from rural areas and often from dysfunctional families or threatened by social exclusion. Many of them live in poverty. In January this year the unemployment rate in our county has reached 28,4%, while the unemployment rate in Poland totals 14%. Because of the tough family situation and places of residence, our students often are not able to face up to the requirements of modern job market.  Sztum county offers little possibilities for hiring graduates, that is why it can be observed than more and more young people migrate to other polish cities or countries for financial reasons. The lack of fluency in speaking English language and low level of professional and social competence limits occupational mobility of our students. For this reason, taking part in the proposed project is a great chance to leave the poverty and lack of education behind. The objectives of the project are compatible with European objectives Europa Strategy 2020. The objectives of the project represent preventing youngsters from precocious deserting educational system by the way of raising the level of crucial competence and abilities, including language and professional competence, which would raise the level of employment among 20-years-old graduates. The project will also help to minimize the number of people threatened by poverty and social exclusion, strengthen the international educational dimension, certification on the basis of learning effects, increasing youngster’s mobility, promoting European values, promoting awareness of foreign cultures and traditions, shaping attitudes towards openness and tolerance, learning about aspects of working in a culturally and socially different environment, pointing out the need of continuous enhancing qualifications. 



Expected results of the project: 

100% of trainees will undergo work practice in Plymouth (certificates)

100% of graduates will undergo probation in Great Britain (certificates)

100% of trainees and graduates will receive Europass Mobility documents

100% of trainees and graduates will receive a confirmation of obtained qualifications due to competence APT Level 2 Award

100% of trainees and graduates will take part in cultural and pedagogical preparation workshops

100% of trainees and graduates will enhance their qualifications. 

100% of trainees and graduates will enhance their language skills. 

100% of participants will be better prepared for beginning working life and entering job market.  

- developing the sill of team work, creativity, adjusting to a new situation, comprehensibility,

- a rise in the sense of affiliation to European Union owing to breaking through language barriers and enhancing self-esteem. 

-participating in the project will significantly increase the school’s prestige, as well as let it gain new experience in work education and organizing work practice. 



In order to support self professional development, students will gain new qualifications and work experience. Experiences obtained during the external practices and trainings are more and more important as a criterion for applying for a job. Traineeship in English companies and work practice provide perspectives for professional development and possibility to present education and compare it with other, European educational systems. Project  entitled " Foreign professional practice develops skills and improves competitiveness on the national and European labour market " is addressed to  male and female students of the  third grade of the technical college of  the Complex of Vocational and Grammar Schools in Sułkowice in the following professions : nutrition and food service technician, hotel management technician, mechatronics technician.
The training will take place in foreign companies, as the  part of a 4-week professional practice based on the curricula of the particular professions. The place  of training: restaurants, hotels and industrial plants in the UK in Plymouth.
Tellus Group in Plymouth is the intermediary institution in organizing the training.
The term of the training: 24 May 2015–20 June 2015
Project objectives:
• gaining  the experience in an international, multicultural environment by Project participants
• acquisition of skills , enhancing the competitiveness of the participants at the national and European labour market
• improvement of language skills in English
• developing students' creativity and mobility , allowing them to move freely in the modern labour market
• developing interpersonal communication skills and teamwork
• broadening  the knowledge about the culture and customs of the UK
Nutrition and food service technician and hotel management technician are occupations closely cooperating and the contents of their curricula  are complementary . Students have already got the basic theoretical knowledge in the field of vocational subjects , that is strengthened and verified during the practical classes . The project will re- verify and expand their knowledge and skills in a new environment .
Mechatronics technician is a profession of the interdisciplinary characteristic of knowledge related to mechatronics .
Realization of the training will allow mechatronics group to expand the ability to use an advanced knowledge of mechatronics , used in machines and vehicles , equipment and systems , in the design , manufacture and operation of machines and manufacturing systems , management and expansion of production in industrial enterprises and technological processes .
There will be 30 students  taking part in practice and 2 teachers.
The project will include the following activities :
- recruitment of participants
- preparation of pedagogical and cultural- linguistic side
- organization of travel and insurance (civil liability , accident , EHIC)
- finding  the  training places for participants according to their field of study ,
- organization of accommodation,  meals and local transport in Plymouth,
- support and professional assistance in the course of practice
- evaluation and popularization  of project results
Students selected on the basis of " Recruitment Rules" before the departure from Poland will take advantage from the obligatory language support in the form of the assessment of the level of language skills and the implementation of language courses online . Participation in the preparation in the field of educational , cultural and linguistic  aspects will be mandatory of about 50 hours per person , carried out by experienced trainers . British Council Institute in Cracow will be our supporting partner in the activities .
The school will provide the organization of classes,  travel to and from the airport in Poland , travel and training insurance .
Tellus Group will prepare a training place, accommodation and board at the host families . It will also be responsible for monitoring students at  the workplace, and passing modules needed to gain qualifications APT Award.
The documents Europass Mobility will be prepared together.  Evaluation of the project  will be carried out during and after completion of the project, and the school will organize activities promoting the results.
Expected results assume the acquisition of work experience in an international, multicultural work environment , skills that increase the mobility of participants , improvement  of language skills in English, interpersonal communication and teamwork , broadening  knowledge of the culture and customs of the partner country (England ), obtaining certificates confirming qualifications ( Europass Mobility, APT Award ) .
Experience  in the implementation of previous projects indicates that these effects influence   our younger students in a direct way , increasing their motivation to study  vocational subjects and a foreign language , interest in practical classes . It also makes our school interesting and attractive for middle school students , their parents and local employers .
Potential long-term benefits :
professional and personal development, improvement of language skills of participants will increase their competitiveness in the  labour  market ,  their mobility which will result in lower unemployment problem
the attractiveness of vocational education will increase
the prestige of the school in the local community will increase

SINDBAD and TRANSDUAL are mobility programme for trainees. The programmes are being conducted by sequa and commenced operation in September 2008. SINDBAD is an European Mobility Programme for trainees; TRANSDUAL is a Mobility Programmes for trainees who intend to untertake practical and theoretical learning either in Madrid, Paris or London. Soft skills like mobility, flexibility, tolerance and capacity for teamwork become increasingly important in the labour markets. The programmes' targets are to supporting the development of these soft skills. SINDBAD and TRANDUAL targets are to gain professional experience on international level. SINDBAD and TRANSDUAL are being funded by the LEONARDO DA VINCI programme. LEONARDO DA VINCI, itself, is the non-academic mobility programme within the LIFE LONG LEARNING Programme (LLP) of the European Commission. sequa´s  role is to file the application and to administrate the funds. 

484 mobility flows shall be implemented in the project period 2014 - 2016.



Mobility of Vocational & Educational Institutions and Trainers (move-it) is sequa’s mobility programme dedicated to the vocational education and training professionals. Since June 2012 the programme is conducted by sequa in cooperaton with partner organisations. move-it is financed by "VETPRO - Vocational Education and Training Professionals", a sub-programme of the European Commission’s Leonardo-da-Vinci programme. 

108 mobility flows shall be implemented in the project period 2014- 2016.



Both mobility programmes are “pool projects” and the respective flows for participants are published nationwide and accessible for anyone who fulfills the application criteria. Thereby individuals whose trade training institution has not applied for mobility projects do also have the possibility to participate in the EU Erasmus+ programme

Facing the evolution of the economic Community, it is prevailing for young people today to be aware of its changes. They have to be prepared to mobility and adaptability developing linguistic and vocational skills in order to fit to tomorrow’s society.

We want our pupils to be play an active part in their training, while favouring their autonomy, and developing their adaptation and integration abilities in another professional environment. Our aims are the professional and personal enrichment 
Pigier vocational high school is a private institute with a state association agreement. It has the label: Lycée des metiers (vocational high school), specialized in the tertiary se ctor : office work, sales representative and managing assistant. It is located in the city of Toulouse, and welcomes pupils from numerous cultural and social origins. These students, often with a chaotic background have , for many of them a lack of motivation and confidence. Their training will lead them to the jobs of salesman, commercial or assistant. Few of them will go on with higher studies.

We want to develop mobilities for them in order to :
- Give or restore confidence in themselves through experiences outside their personal environment
- Develop an interest in meeting each other, learningabout other cultures and lifestyles
- Deepen their professional field internationally
- Develop adaptation abilities, the sense of personal and collective responsibility while encouraging initiatives, autonomy and integration.
- Increase the knowledge in the everyday language and in the professional one in a concrete way.
- Enable them to speak easily and correctly with a motivating project and thus improving their oral and written expressions in their mother tongue (for those issued from immigration) or foreign language or language of their place of living.

We want to integrate those mobilities into their curriculum with a progression : work placements in France for their first year of studies and then abroad (for volunteers and motivated students) in their 2nd year, promoting the mobility of a teacher on site. Starting with 10 mobilities in Spain (near Toulouse) and in England, we believe that it will develop the idea and lack of mobility for the others by the evidence and impact on the development of language and professional skills of the students who did a mobility.

Mobilities for our teachers contribute to increase their level of qualification, and participate in the development of our European department. The knowledge of other educational or professional systems is a bonus for our school. These mobilities will establish a strong link between education and companies , pointing out skills to be developed in education in order to fit to the needs of current professional life . These mobilities and exchanges allow us to develop a network of partners (schools , companies) across Europe.

Life Long Skills Training Project aims to contribute to the improvement of related vocational education fields and to empower skills and abilities according to the sector’s needs, after observing the implementations in the EU countries through improving the teachers’ ability and skills. This Project is being proposed within the view of updating the recent vocational education in our country, in other words to contribute to studies directed to create new employment fields.



Project owner is MoNE General Directorate for Vocational and Technical Education (DG of VET). Foreign stakeholders of the project are  TUV - Rheinland, Dehoga, OSZKIM, İRİS, Telus educational institutions and Mittelhof e.V.,  Kindertagesstätten, Berlin Süd West, IFB, Marie e.V.  Zeitschrift and HM Media companies. In addition, 22 Provincial Directorates for National Education (Ankara, Aydın, Adana, Antalya, Bursa, Balıkesir, Diyarbakır, Eskişehir, Erzurum, Gaziantep, İstanbul, İzmir, Kayseri, Konya, Kocaeli, Manisa, Mersin,  Samsun,  Sakarya ,Trabzon, Tekirdağ, Hatay) and by signing a protocol with these institutions chambers of industry of related provinces that will provide support to the trainings of the participants  will be involved as local partners. 



The abroad stay duration for participants is 4 weeks. 1 week is for theoretical education in the hosting country and 3 weeks will be dispatched to the skills training. Mobility activity will be realized through one week for school experience and 3 weeks for hands on training experience in a company. The mobility activities aim at increasing the competencies of the teachers serving in the fields of Child Development, Food-Beverage, Accommodation-Travel, Radio-TV and Journalism, Marketing- Retail, Regular Nursing, Nursing of old people, Beauty-Hair Care, Furniture-Wooden Technology, Motor Vehicles, Photographing and Metal Technology in the identified provinces of VET schools affiliated to DG of VET. 



The Project is proposed to enable VET teachers; to observe how to transfer vocational skills to the students through implementations based on the EU standards, creating an opportunity via school experience to make an observation on the subjects, such as; school management, functioning and sectorial cooperation of VET Schools in EU countries, and following school practice to gain experience within the sector through observing and experiencing the improvements and innovations. The Project will also enable VETteachers to observe the communication and balance between demand and supply in terms of providing adequate human resources through analyzing the sector’s HR need. In the vocational environment, sectorial experience, thought and point of view, which are special for the field, will certainly redound a new perspective to the education.  The aim of this point of view is to contribute to the gaining of the knowledge skills and gains that demanded by the sector primarily to the teachers which then to be transferred to the students. Increasing the vocational knowledge, cultivation and the competencies of the VET teachers is to contribute to the improvement of all the actors in the VET system. Hence, the skills training of trainers will provide a positive contribution to the improvement of the quality of VET, to provide a closer link between labor market and educational institutions, to the integration with the EU and to the creation of a balance between demand and supply in the labor market will also enable the participants to provide appropriate competencies for these priorities. Another aim is to create an opportunity for stopping the statis in terms of teachers’ knowledge, skills, competency, manner and behavior and to create a movement. In VET, handcraft skills and according to the sector’s specialty behaviors and attitude is such an important issue. Therefore, gaining these competencies one by one through doing and living has a positive effect on the participants. Theorotical education is definitely not enough for education. The most important thing for the participants is that they know how to transfer information and they interiorize the information by seeing and applying. Without application, no information is persistent. Hence the Project expects participants to do and learn and interiorize the information they learn. The project's goal will contribute to the integration process with the EU in the field of VET. Besides, participants will obtain information about living in abroad and in a foreign culture, foreign behaviors and attitudes and vocational foreign language and in their respective fields. Before mobility activities , all partners and participants will take place in the pedagogic, cultural and language preparation process as well as the dissemination activities that will take place after the mobility. It is predicted that 500 VET teachers from 13 different branches will be mobilized within the scope of the Project..
