A Project Has been created with  view to helping graduates in tourism to seek opportunities for up skilling in finding employment.
The aim of the project is to increase the mobility of graduates, participation in vocational training with an international dimension and increase chances for employment of people involved in the project.
The project will be attended by 20 Participants graduates from the county of Ostróda to one year after graduation courses in hospitality, catering and tourism ((waiting staaf, cooks, food service). Partner organizations in the project are Tellus Group in the UK, Europroyectos LDV from Spain, Sistema Turismo in Italy. The project involves the exchange of experiences and information related to gastronomy , broadening knowledge and skills within the scope of the project.

Ostroda is the city of tourist innovation and also of sports and recreation, called the Pearl of Masuria , which consistently focuses on enriching ambitious infrastructure natural advantages of it`s location. Sport, active tourism, effective cooperation, public-private partnership and unconventional mass events locating Ostroda as the most attractive resort in Poland . Ostroda is the fourth  in terms of population (34,300people) Warmia and Mazury, situated near the capital of the province – Olsztyn. A major role plays a hotel base of Ostroda. As a first have been built a four –star Hotel Platinum, located in the city center and hotel Villa Port situated on the waterfront of Lake Drwęckie. Today the city boasts a modern facility of five-star Hotel Villa Port Resort & Spa Conference. Ostroda District is a region with great potential for tourism and hospitality (a modern hotel accommodation: Hotel Spa  Dr Irena Eris 5*. Hotel Platinum 4*, Villa Port 4*) but also with large unemployment. The existing hotel base is continually being expanded. An exclusive 5*  hotel currently is being built, in which there will be over 150 luxury rooms and suites. The hotel will have restaurants, café, nightclub,  indoor and outdoor pools, a bowling alley, spa & wellness complex and conference rooms with a total capacity of about 1,000 people. There is the largest in eastern Poland an exhibition center in Ostroda too.

Participants in the project will take 5 -week internships in the following areas : group I ( 5 participans) - Plymouth, UK , group II ( 5 participans ) - Granada, Spain (both groups:  05.10-09.11 . 2014) group III ( 5 participants) - Rimini, Italygroup IV (5 participants) - Cordoba, Spain (both groups : 26.04 - 31.05 . 2015. ) .
The curriculum isuses various forms of knowledge transfer that will enable the effective implementation assumed in the project objectives and results. An enrichment program with elements of cultural preparation will help improve personal competence and intercultural project's Participants  and classes of business will contribute to the professional activation and increase the sense of their own value and self-esteem.
Participants will be training in catering and hotel management positions as waiters, cooks , hoteliers  so that to gain the widest possible knowledge of the specifics of work , methods of organization , information flow , principles of personnel management . Internships will take place from Monday to Friday, 8 hours a day .The planned replacement time is optimal and will implement a wide range of internship programs and also allow them to learn the cultures of other countries of the EU in a framework of cultural preparation .
The major aim of the project is not only to increase mobility of the European labour market and skills through practical learning, but also gaining a new experience in the field of catering and hospitality and enabling personal  development to make people more employable.
Results of the project: project participants will gain a unique experience, expand their knowledge and professional skills necessary for employees working in their specialties in modern hotels and restaurants. This knowledge will be confirmed by granting participants the Europass Mobility documents.
Staying and working in another country with different cultural specificity, different customs and mentality of the local population, participants will take a great lesson in tolerance and understanding for representatives of other cultures not always for us comprehensible and often difficult to accept.
OUVERTUR PROFESSIONNELLE EN ANGLETERRE POUR LES ELEVES DU LYCEE PROFESSIONNEL A FOSSES

Who is concerned ?
When they are on their last diploma year, Charles Baudelaire Secondary School – which is located in Fosses in the Gonesse area (95) – gives ten Sales and Receptionist students the opportunity to go on a trainee period in Plymouth. The group of students consists of 8 girls and 2 boys, all living in or near Fosses.
These young men and women are really motivated to experiment life abroad, to open their minds and be confronted with the Anglosaxon culture. Thus we want them to be part of a European project so as to be efficient on the labour market. Thanks to this project, they could become autonomous, open their minds and learn how to adapt to the working situations. These qualities are essential for future Salesmen / Saleswomen and future Receptionists.

What does this project consist in ?
It is a four-week internship under agreement preceded by an integration week in a language school. Our students will live in host families and they will be followed through twice by the School and the Service Provider.

Where will it happen ?
In Plymouth – a big, economical, cultural, cosmopolitan European City which highly attracts young people and which is near France.

When will it happen ? On November 2014.

With who ?
1/ A united teaching staff : the English teachers, the Sale and Reception teachers and the Headmaster. Their roles consist in preparing, accompanying and assessing the students. They also run the project : its organisation and its funds.
2/ The Sales and Reception companies which accommodate our pupils. We are in constant contact during the trainee period. Our students are trained and assessed by reliable professional tutors.
3/ The Service Provider : we work with CEI and its French representatives. CEI has many qualities : they are in touch with us, they rapidly react to solve our problems and their work  philosophy corresponds to our prerogatives.


Our aims.
The goals of this project consist in giving our students a European professional experience, in developping their abilities and in enriching their cultural and social environment.

The aims of the project :
1/ We want our students to be aware of the European dimension and to create a link between their job and the English language.
2/ We want them to be proud of this project as they are its main actors. It is essential to pass knowledge on through a work experience on a foreign country.
3/ Through the trainee periods, we want to create a link between the British teaching staff and our trainee program.

The assessment:
1/ an assessment of the trainee period : we must assess our students for the BTEC National Diploma, following the previously English translated examination grid. They must write a trainee report in order to succeed in the European test on the 2015 BTEC National Diploma. Finally the trainee assessment appears on the students' final school reports.
2/ An assessment of the students' interest for their foreign experience. They must fill a grid in before and after their internship.
3/ An assessment of the Service provider.
4/ An assessment of the project : we create a log (the different steps of the project, the contributors, the goals and the adjustments).
5/ Indicators: an assessment grid, a log, the bugget, the Diploma and European test rates, the rate of students integrating a BTEC Higher National Diploma and the improvements in English.
6/ The assessment of the trainee tutors in order to improve and adapt our reports to the professional fields.

A spread project:
A Europass ceremony.
An experience shared on the School Open Day and on the Area Schools.
An Internet newspaper.
A “European Class” blog.

The Context:
A united and mobilized school : the headmasters, the teaching staff, the students and their families.
The European Ressource Center and Mrs Moquin (for her pieces of advice).
Sale and Reception companies and our Service Provider – Tellus group.
The European Commission which allows us to propose this project to our students.
Développement des compétences professionnelles des jeunes des missions locales du Nord Pas de Calais par le biais d'une expérience de mobilité

The network of “Mission Locales Nord Pas de Calais”, was organized with two main financial partners, the state and the regional council to establish an organization for young people. The objective is to professionalize the social workers, exchange and harmonize practices, help the various Missions Locales to build projects. The Regional Animation Team ensures the operational implementation of this program with the support of managers and technicians of various “missions’ locales”. This network includes 27 “Missions locales” and assisted in 2013, more than 150 000 young people. This service has enabled the implementation of actions related to the mobility of young people and gave them access to intercultural discovery of 20 European countries and the Mediterranean area.

These actions were performed thanks to the European Voluntary Service, under funding from the youth Action program and thanks to our previous projects LEONARDO MOBILITE entitled VISA JOB, EURO PRO and EURO TIME PRO with these experiments, the “Mission Locale Douaisis” wishes to continue to implement actions to help with the mobility of young people by mean of the Regional Animation Team.

With the success of our previous projects LEONARDO MOBILITE, we propose to organize new mobility actions for young people in the framework of new mobility programs: ERASMUS+.

Our previous projects have mobilized 10 “missions’ locales” of ARML network, by sending 95 young people.The success of this project in terms of results and satisfaction of young people facing to this experience, entrance the drive the go even further.Other local missions of our network also want to get involved in the project. In this context, the Mission locale of Douaisis becomes the mainframe and the organizer of the network.

The Mission locale of Douaisis is a nonprofit association law 1901 who has for mission is to welcome, inform, accompany and support young people between 16 to 25, out of the school system with or without diploma .

In our area the lack of mobility prevent young people to find a job is the main goals. The objective is always to unite the 27 “missions locales” of Nord pas de Calais network around a European mobility project enabling young people with integration difficulties , having a defined career plan , acquire professional, personal and language skills through a training in one of the European partner countries.

We wish to offer to 50 young people of the territory the benefit from this experience: The young people who already have a professional qualification or professional experience in the field of his or her professional project. 

Duration of the mobility : 4 months or/ and 6 months for Spain.

5 partners for this project:

• CEI center international exchange in Dublin, Ireland

• Tempo LIBERO in Brescia, Italy

• Intervista E.V in Berlin, Germany

• Tellus Groups to Plymouth, England

• INTRAS foundation to Valladolid, Spain.

If our project is accepted, these periods of mobility with our various partners in host countries will take place over period of 24 months between September,2014 and March 2016 in order to have a global overview and a better perspective. 

Several objectives for this project:

For young people:

• Acquire the necessary experience

• Develop a culture of European mobility

• Develop their adaptability and autonomy

• Develop self-confidence

• Develop language skills



For the partners:

• Develop the European dimension in the integration process

• Promote European mobility of job-seekers

• Extend the partnership to develop new projects

• Involve and convince the companies of the real and direct benefits of this experience

So mobility must be linked to their work integration .We will organize an accompaniment for these young people as soon as they come back .We tested in the past these accompaniment and the result hare very positive.

In the next 6 months, 78% of these people had found a job. This project already supported by the Regional Council of Nord Pas de Calais
Staż z rybnickim "Mechanikiem" - twoja droga do zawodu

The project is aimed at the second grade students of Technical High School No. 2 of the Complex of Schools of Mechanics and Electricity named after Tadeusz Kosciuszko in Rybnik. They study the following profiles: an electrician, a mechanic, an energeticist, an electronics engineer, an information technology engineer. Unfortunately the fact that companies move their headquarters to different cities, it has become difficult to provide the students with appropriate training. Erasmus also emphasises investing in the improvement of educational background and the development of cooperation between educational institutions and employers in the region, country and Europe. In the school year 2014/2015 34 students of the profiles named above will serve a 4 weeks’ internship in companies in order to prepare for their future jobs.
Unemployment now is groving in every profession and in Feb 2014 it has increased to 14,4%. It has been the highest rate since March 2007. In order to prepare our students for the requirements of the labour market, regional and European, it is necessary to enhance their key competences: technological, ICT, social and citizeship skills, language skills, the ability to learn in mobility conditions and to cooperate with organisations creating possibilities of their employment in Europe. To make our students’ abilities more valuable and attractive for potential employers we plan to realize this project.
Vocational needs of the students diagnosed by the teachers and potential employers (eg. The knowledge of modern technology, the acquisition of experience, skilled use of English and the basis of Spanish) shall be met through organising a month’ vocational training by our intermediary partner Tellus Group seated in Plymouth and Europroyectos Leonardo da Vinci S. L from Granada. The companies are experienced organisers of IVT mobilities, who are able to place our students with adequate British employers with whom the students will be able to meet innovative technologies connected with optical fibre data transmission, mobile telephony and others they would not hav the Chance to meet during home trainings.
On the preparation of the students will be working a project team consisting of a coordinator, carers, 2-3 vocational teachers and people from accounting and administrative matters.
The recruitment will be carried out according to terms and conditions of the project that enable all third grade students to take part in it. The main conditio will be handing in an application form which will show the willingness to take part in the project. Those who will not be qualified, will be drawn into a waiting list.
The school  will provide all necessary preparation for the students and their parents for the internship through language, culture and pedagogical preparation (lessons with a native speaker and  an educator), the purchase of adequate insurance, agreements, certificates, the organisation of the trip, the flight and the meetings with their parents. The school will also meet its obligations and deadlines of the relevant documentation and accounts receivable financing to the National Agency, the Board of Education, the Host Authority and intermediary organizations.
Along with the intermediary organization it will plan the course of the internship, accommodation, meals, airport pickup, organize free time, weekends, establish operating rules and try to predict risks and lead to their elimination. Organizations will work together to ensure the smooth and safe conduct of the placement and support of the participants.
Internship (planned for March  2015) will provide the opportunity to learn about another professional culture, which will be equipped to their unique experience for the future. The trainees will live with a family in England or in the centers.
The aim of the project is to increase mobility and competence of young people in initial vocational training, including the selection of competent partners to ensure high quality.
Professional experience will be documented by  Europass Mobility, certificates of completion of the intermediate organization and linguistic preparation to enhance their CV and a chance to find work.
Multi-stage evaluation will be carried out in Poland by the applicant and the intermediary partners in the following forms: observation, questionnaires, reports, reports.
The internship will be monitored by the applicant and intermediary organizations.
Dissemination of the results of the project will take place in the country and abroad mainly on web pages.
The internship will provide students the chance to learn about the culture, habits, develop interpersonal skills, ability to work in a group in the new environment, coping with stress in new circumstances and unfamiliar conditions, and prepare them for eventual possibility of a change of residence in search of work.

The project " Praktycznie w Europie + " will be implemented by Zespół Szkół Ponadgimnazjalnych Nr 1 w Łęczycy for 56 participants ( including 33 girls and 23 boys) learning in the following professions :
1. nutrition and food service organizations - 22 people ( 19 girls and 3boys )
2 hotel services - 16 people ( 13girls and 3 boys )
3 car repair and maintenance - 12 boys
4. builders - 6 people ( 1girls , 5boys)

The main aims, based on the needs of the participants and the participants, schools and employers , are as follows:
1. to improve the quality of practical training at school
2. to enable  the acquisition of practical skills, which would turn attractive on the labour market ,
3. enhancing growth in language and social skills of participating students ,
4. students' personal development,
5. to enable the participants to get acquainted with the requirements of the European labour market, as well as its operating rules.
The students will take part in: a 20 -hour course of English and German, reminding the vocabulary and phrases gained in the course of school , a 8-hour cultural preparation and guidance.
Students will take part in a 4-week vocational training in Berlin ( Germany) and Plymouth (United Kingdom). Foreign partners, chosen by the school, participating  in the project, will provide all the participants with an attractive place for the training , mentoring and interesting cultural preparation .

All the activities mentioned above are thought to enable the project to achieve  the following results:
1. the school (the applicant) will improve the quality of vocational training,
2. 56 participating students will raise their professional skills ,
3. 56 participating students will  raise their language and social skills, 
4. at least 80 % of the participants will notice their personal development ( self-esteem, self-confidence , self-reliance , etc. )
5.at least 80 % of the participants will raise their consciousness to  freely choose their place of work.
The project will have an impact on its participants, school , employers, local community , local authorities and other subjects  in the country and the European Union.

The project " Technical college students' apprenticeship abroad – a chance of success” is aimed at the students of the Secondary  Economic School in Słupsk, studying in third grades in the field of economy and trade. The project will enable the students to undergo a mandatory training period  in the dimension of three weeks, which results from the curriculum. The students whose command of English and German is on advanced level  will be directed to British and German companies respectively. The apprenticeship is going to have an innovative character as the students will have the opportunity not only to practice and be exposed to the foreign language of trade  but also familiarize with  other, more modern working technologies and new developments in contemporary British companies. The places of the training periods  were carefully selected according to the students' needs.  

 The students are going to work as trainees  in groups of two to several people. 30 students, who are going to take part in the project, will be admitted on the basis of the conditions detailed in the plan of recruitment, which was described in the appropriate table. The schedule included in the project was developed jointly with local employers and the organization Tellus Group of Plymouth and Berlink ETN GmbH in Berlin. The students will undergo the training  in the training centre and in the companies of different branches, compatible with the fields of education in our school. These companies have been cooperating with partner organisations enrolling trainees and apprentice. The applicant has been cooperating with Tellus Group for 6 years. Cooperation between the applicant and Berlink organisation was established 2 years ago. At present, the project of mobility is in progress.  The partner has already carried out  the  projects  with Polish schools, and has a broad experience if it comes to LdV and Erasmus programmes.

 To meet the demands of modern market economy, the task of the school is to educate young people and prepare them to do their job. Responding to these needs, the following objectives were specified in the project: improving the quality and effectiveness of vocational training, making  vocational education more attractive, acquiring practical vocational skills, improving foreign vocational language, increasing mobility of students and learning  British and German culture.

  The students will achieve their objectives by gaining new experiences and skills in modern British and German companies of  economically  developed countries , expand theoretical and practical knowledge in the field of vocational subjects, foreign language and culture of another European country. Thanks to the training  abroad and confirmation of qualifications in the Europass Mobility, students become competitive in the local labour market, as well in the country as in  Europe. An important result will be a new and courageous attitude of the students to the world and new ideas taken from another country. The school will make  its educational offer more attractive, which will contribute to improving the quality of vocational training and increasing the quality of recruitment.
Pour une approche professionnelle européenne des services à la personne et vente en Allemagne ou Royaume-Uni, au service de l'insertion des lycéens issus de Bac Pro SAPAT et CAP SMR

The Lycée Schattenmann situated in Bouxwiller (Alsace 67) is a vocational high School in the area of services to people and territory under contract with the Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Forestry.

The school wants to give the opportunity to students enrolled in Bac pro "Services aux Personnes et aux Territoires" (SAPAT) equivalent to BTEC National and CAPA "Services en Milieu Rural" (SMR) equivalent to NQC, to have a work placement abroad (respectively 3 and 2 weeks). Most of Bac pro students plan to pass a competitive examination in health and social assistance, or pursue short studies as HND Animation and Development of Rural Territories for example 

As students of CAPA, with a double dominant sales and service people, the primary objective is the integration in the professional world (nursing homes, hospitals, small shops, supermarkets, etc..). A number of students, however, are designed to carry out studies in first year Bac Pro. The knowledge of a foreign language is therefore one of the success factors. 



The school has chosen to send all students abroad. However, the frames of references plan to learn only one foreign language in professional training.

Through our close location to the German border, we offer our students a choice of two foreign languages, either English or German (2 hours per week). Therefore, in each class, students will do their work placement either in northern Germany or in the United Kingdom.

As the majority of students are underage a teacher will be present there during the whole stay to do the work placement monitoring of the students.



I. Use of English in Britain: 

Our 34 Bac Pro SAPAT students and 15 CAP students will travel to Plymouth to discover the business world there: some will be active in Charity Shops, others in clothing stores and also some will work in small food shops.

After the work placement, they will not only visit the city of Plymouth and the Barbican but also the surroundings with the Dartmoor National Park or Exeter...

The accommodation will be in host families to improve the language and immerse themselves in the daily life of an English family.

The workplacement and the accommodation are chosen after proposal from the partner Tellus.



II. The services sector in Northern Germany



A) The 33 students enrolled in Bac Pro SAPAT will do their work placement in Osterholz-Scharmbeck north of Bremen. They will work either in kindergartens, hospitals or even childcare for disabled children. 

They will also visit Hamburg, Bremen, Bremerhaven, and Cuxhaven during their free time. They will be accommodated in a youth hostel in the city of Worpswede.

A partnership with the “Berufsbildende Schule” 

BBS is a school with 2,200 students in initial training and learning, it has the label Europaschule (European school) and Unesco Schule. The school is responsible for finding work placements depending on the wishes of the Alsatian students.



B) The 15 CAPA SMR students will go to Schwerin in the Land of Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania to work for two weeks in the hotel, catering, personal services or sales industry. They can visit Hamburg and Rostock on the Baltic coast, Lübeck... Their accommodation will be self-catering in the house belonging to the partner institution.

A partnership with the Schweriner Bildungswerkstatt 

It is a centre for vocational education and training which is aimed at a diverse audience: businesses, job seekers, dropouts, and people with specific needs. Their jurisdiction encompasses many crafts and especially on the hotel industry, catering and home economics. Their extensive knowledge of the field will help find suitable work placement for the CAPA SMR students.



III. Get an opening to Europe 



These work placements are made possible thanks to funding from the European Union through the Erasmus + project. There are also regional financing, actions made by students and the involvement of the families.

Beyond the language courses a specific preparation is provided in the courses by teachers.

The objectives of these courses abroad are multiple: the trainees do not only use a foreign language in immersion, but they can also understand the customs of the region or even approach the reality of the professional world of another country. 

No doubt this experience will be a capital gain on their resume when seeking future employment, and encourage them, perhaps, to work one day in another European country. 

This experience also allows the school to establish its reputation among regional or national partners.

The project is promoted by the Institute of Vocational Education Giacomo Perlasca of Idro (Brescia, IT) in partnership with  Tellus Group Ltd of Portsmouth (UK) and involves 20 students of the V° class (school year 2014/2015) of the course for social operator specialised in services for early childhood and disability.
The opportunity for an internship abroad responds to the need to continue and insist on a path of personal, professional, and cultural growth for the students, resident in an alpine valley (Valle Sabbia) suffering from geographical isolation and economic downturn.
The project has a total duration of 12 months (from 1st October 2014 to 30th September 2015) including intercultural and pedagogical pre-departure preparation, final evaluation and exploitation of the outcomes. The duration of the mobility period is 3 weeks: from January the 11th to January 31st, 2015.
The internships consist in the placement of students in early childhood services and in services for the disabled in the town of Portsmouth, enabling rapid development of personal skills and professional attitudes. Intercultural exchange will also serve as a key element in enhancing the spirit of autonomy and initiative of the students.
Mobility Of VET Forward Automotive Sector Traineeships

TThe project "De Gustibus" will last 24 months and is addressed to 50 students in Initial Vocational Training (3rd and 4th year) who are attending the Istituto Alberghiero IPSSAR "G.  Marchitelli" (Technical Secondary School for Catering,Tourism and Hospitality)  located in Villa Santa Maria (CH).  “De Gustibus” project  meets the need to further qualify the young human resources that are studying at  this Institute through an internship lasting 1 month in foreign companies operating in the food and wine tourism field (including hotels, restaurants, and accommodation facilities). The project aims at upgrading the students’ skills within the food and wine tourism industry which is sharply rising at national and regional level and is subject to offer new and qualified employment opportunities (Reform of the National Tourism Legislation- Law n. 135/2001; Code of Tourism - Legislative Decree No. 79/2011; Regional Support measures to companies operating in the tourism sector - L. R. n.77 / 2000).

Thanks to the work placements abroad, it will be offered an opportunity for a learning "on the job" experience in foreign companies, in order to integrate the students’ formal training and ensure the improvement of their entrepreneurial and professional abilities especially regarding: technical and professional abilities in the specific field of food and wine tourism; the ability to move in an increasingly open market and to assess the opportunities arising from such growing openness; the ability to meet the needs of reception of new wine and food tourists ; the ability to boost the reception performance of companies in the tourism industry .      

In order to ensure a successful project it has been formed a consortium of regional and transnational partner organisations which are constantly committed  to professional development and training of young human resources and the area’s qualitative growth  within the wine and food  tourism sector. The partners organisations are institutions, employer associations, companies and social partners that work together to promote a cooperation of quality and enhance  knowledge/skills of young people. It is underlined that the project’s activities have been planned in line with the principles and criteria set up by European Quality Charter for Mobility regarding: selection methods, learning plans, personalisation, linguistic aspects, logistic support and  learning outcome recognition.
REthinking Sport to Enhance Talents: lifelong sporting

The project was born from the desire to create a link between the world of education and the labor market, with reference to the professional categories working in the organization of sporting events.

In the education ,in particular, the latest provisions of the Council of Ministers expect that the school will give more space to the topic of Sports. In fact, with the Presidential Decree No. 1 of 09/01/2014 the Government has  (introduced an educational enhancement in sports) enhanced sports  training institutionalizing its educational and social value and setting up, for the first time,  a strongly vocational course. 

In recent years  many agencies specialized in the  conception and organization of sporting events were born in Italy and in the international scene; public sport organizations, Olympic Committees, Federations, sponsoring companies, in fact, outsource the production of events to private companies dealing with all phases of implementation:

- Conception and planning; 

- Fundraising, budgeting, reporting; 

- Marketing and public relations; 

- Logistics and security management.

The project aims to integrate students’ education  through the learning of skills that are not covered in the school curriculum but which are highly required by companies working in the field.

The agencies / companies organizing sports events infact are in need of a qualified staff able to respond to a twofold requirement: on one side a cross specialization in the field of sport (including different disciplines and their target audiences) and on the other, technical skills and ability to coordinate the individuals who make up the work team  and who contribute to  the success of a sporting event consisting either of a single or multiple races or events.

Following  the thrust from the market demand, , through this project, the participating schools aim to develop the new professional profile of  SPORTS EVENTS PLANNER. This professional figure, present for many years in the U.S. market and increasingly in demand in Europe, in fact, has not yet found a corresponding educational offer  in the Italian schools.

Building a sporting event implies the involvement of various professionals who are required to work together in an integrated process. For this reason, the type of training required by the project (VET learners in companies) is structured according to two criteria:

1) the involvement of institutions organizing events in different sporting areas (eg, sailing, football, water polo, swimming, scuba diving, volleyball, bowling, athletics sports, gymnastics, cycling, ice hockey, handball, rowing) so that  students can take part in a wide range of activities;

2) the involvement of students in learning skills and abilities related to all phases and activities of a sporting event.

At the end  of the mobility, students will organize a real public sporting event in the former athletic field of CONI in Latina with the participation of a selection of athletes from  all the Schools of the DEURE  Lazio involved in the project. Students will be divided into sports planners teams and will work in a coordinated manner for the successful implementation of the sporting event which is the main output of the project. The overall assessment of the students' participation in the project will take into account the results of the ongoing monitoring based on 4 sheets focused on the learning levels of technical and professional skills, as well as the active contribution to the event. Evaluation, validation, transfer and recognition of credits for learning into school and extra school credits will be made by the teachers assisted by the Coordination Group of the project.

One hundred fifty students aged 17/18, attending the fourth and fifth classes and coming from  a Sport High School, a Tecnhnical a Vocational, a Commercial and Scientific School will be selected to participate in the project. The  selection, which is  preceded by a notice published by the Sending Partners, will be made according to the criteria of merit and personal motivation. Fifteen  teachers, one out of every ten students, given the prevalence of underage students, will accompany the students.



Total number of Sending Partners: 8

Total number of Participating Organisations: 20

Total number of beneficiary students: 150

Total number of accompanying teachers: 15

Length of mobility: 3 weeks

Partner countries: Italy, Germany, Malta, Slovenia, Spain
Students at Work in European Enterprises through Training PLUS
ESTANCIAS INTERNACIONALES PARA ALUMNADO Y PERSONAL DEL PROGRAMA SEFED

Inform Foundation manages since 1987 the SEFED Programme (Simulation for Business Educational Purposes - The Practice Firm concept) which offers training to around 5.000 students delivered by 800 teachers in vocational training institutions and training for the unemployed in Spain. All these students are being trained in professional and social skills in the business and managing of companies field.



This professional and practical training aimed at finding jobs is well know and acknowledged by the Ministry of Labour from the Generalitat of Catalonia issuing a professional certificate with level 2 or by the corresponding Ministry of Education issuing a medium level of vocational training in the administration or comercial field.



Inform has always considered working experiences abroad as part of and an added value to the training delivered in the SEFED Programme. Thus, Erasmus + K1 Programme allows us to support our students and teachers in training activities to achieve and use knowledge, skills and qualifications for their personal development, ocupability and participation in the European labour market. 



The participants of this project are:



- Unemployed students or VET students (mainly young people and women over 25 years old) who are being trained in the SEFED Programme and who would like to improve not only their knowledge and skills in the business field, undertaking working experience stays in Ireland or Great Britain, but their language skills as well. Thus, the project is about to undertake 70 working stays in Irish or UK companies and undertake business and management tasks during one, two or three months as a maximum as participants cannot have longer stays because of personal reasons and the need they have to look for jobs.



- Teachers and professional staff working for the SEFED Programme: the project allows us to offer a unique opportunity for teachers and professional staff working for the SEFED Programme to be able to share and improve their knwoledge and experiences in a different country and in different organizations, including the transfer of skills and/or methods and innovative ways of doing things in the training field. The transfer of know-how is meant to improve the quality and access to continuous training, to update and adapt the european educational and training systems. When improving knowledge, attitudes and individual skills from all professional staff involved in the SEFED Programme, we will improve in the development of the european labour market and social economy.

The project is based on professional stays in 4 countries, 3 of them already have practice firm networks and are members of Europen-Pen International, from which Inform Foundation is a founding member. Specifically, the professional/pedagogical team will undertake training stays for 5/6 days in different training organizations which have practice firms in Italy, Austria and Germany, in which teachers and professional staff will share experiences and best practices regarding the practice firm concept, the organization and management of practice firms as active learning tools.

The stay in Germany has a double objective, first to visit the practice firms and second there will be some visits to different vocational training organizations which apply the dual vocational training system in the administration field with a similar method than the business simulation.

There will also be some stays in Ireland in which there will be a combination of know-how transfer, innovative learning ways of doing things and application of IT in training. There will also be visits to Irish companies so as to undertake job-shadowing.

The participants will be teachers in language skills, foreign trade skills and counselors and training professional staff. There will also be professional staff from Inform Foundation with the aim to set up links with the Central Offices for Practice Firms from the 3 members of Europen-Pen International (Italy, Austria and Germany)



The project is meant to improve the quality of the SEFED Programme, the ocupability and competitivity of students and professional staff in training participating in the project.



To prove the success there has been some success indicators set up as the level of labour ocupability of students, the improvement degree of language skills, or the increase of foreign trade orders.
Domo-meccanica come nuova frontiera della conoscenza

The project aims to develop professional figures with highly specialized skills able to run control systems highly concerned into building automation, particularly in the field of home automation assistance, a discipline that designs and manufactures systems whose purpose is the improvement of the living environments for the old people and people with special needs.

The transnational training completes the education plan and technical preparation through an experience which will mark students’ consciousness of European dimension and technology diffusion to knock down  geographic and cultural differences.

The social and the economic context has strong consistency with the project objectives, in fact it denounces a negative population growth, 30 thousand residents less than in 2008 (1.640.379 in 2013, 1.671.001 in 2008). It is an alarming data if we analyze the resident population by age groups: most of the Sardinians are aged between 40 and 64 years (614 642), the birth rate has decreased from 8,07% in 2008 to 7, 59% in 2012, the death rate has increased from 8,68% to 9.53%, the working age population rate is 67.2%, less than the previous years, the elderly people rate (aged more than 65) is 169,2%.

The project will be directed to 105 students attending the Vocational Institutes of Macomer, Nuoro and Sassari. The stages will take place in Spain and England for a period of three weeks, and students will alternate classroom teaching with work-based learning in enterprises.

Participants will have the opportunity to experience vocationally related learning in the field of home automation and home automation assistance in order to enforcing their professional competencies on electrics, electronics and computing systems whose aim is to create more flexible electrical plants in living units, monitored by web, smartphone and tablet, useful for people with disabilities and older people.

Students will be able to intervene in the installing, programming and testing of the security systems and building control systems.

At the end of the mobility period the students will take part in further non-formal and informal learning activities in the enterprises which are involved in this project.

In the longer term, the project aims to encourage the employment rate of the young people involved in the project through the cooperation among all partners in order to raise awareness of the business community and the institutions to the benefits of validating/certificating the skills acquired in non-formal and informal learning.
IES MONTE NARANCO & EUROPA: CRECIENDO JUNTOS

IES Monte Naranco is a school located in Asturias with a broad educational offering spanning compulsory secondary education, baccalaureate studies and vocational training. Vocational cycles centre mainly on IT and communications.

As one of its overarching priorities, our Centre's educational project seeks to improve foreign language proficiency while fomenting  student mobility via internships in European companies. This all falls in line with the new EU strategy, which looks to see that, by 2020, 6% of young vocational training students aged 18 to 34 spend a training period abroad, one that includes internships at companies.

At the same time, the Centre is currently in the midst of introducing a new language project that entails the reinforcement of language skills. Included among this project's actions is the delivery of one/two module(s) in English in each of the training cycles' courses.

Within this project, the Centre has detected a need to continue training teachers so that they remain fully proficient in their skills, improve their language skills and observe educational methods at other European centres that have similar projects.

The activities proposed are as follows: 

a) Student mobility for internships in the UK (10 students)

-a.1. Recently graduated students aged between 19 and 35 who already have work experience at industry-specific companies for at least three months, language skills and motivation and interest in the European experience. 

-a.2.Students aged between 17 and 30 who are to carry out training in work centres at European  companies, with scant industry-specific professional experience, substantial motivation, language training and training courses.



b) Mobility for teachers for an observation period at companies in the UK (6 teachers) 

Teachers will visit companies as shadows to observe working methods while learning about the companies at which students will subsequently work, thus creating networks of collaboration with businesses. 

Carrying out these activities will require the aid of the host partner in the UK -the Tellus Group- to actively assist in the assignment to companies and practical aspects such as accommodation, travel, etc. At the same time, the partner will assist in the monitoring, dissemination and final evaluation of the project.

Following the planned schedule, recently graduated students would be selected in June for the internships so that teachers use the summer period to conduct the observation period at companies and hold meetings with the host partner to define the participant's profile. Students would perform internships at companies for three months and would receive a certificate at the end of their stay. Students enrolled on the practical work experience course (FCT) would carry out their internship from April to June, and would also earn a certificate at the end, apart from recognising their time as counting towards credits in the Spanish educational system.



The desired results are to: 

-improve student employability as a result of the new language skills acquired and new professional experience. 

-bring the educational system into the business world as a result of networks of collaboration and teacher observation periods. 

-improve teachers' skills and thus improve the level of teaching.

-create a benchmark linguistic project in the region. 



The project is to be disseminated through the press, workshops, informational sessions and a blog developed jointly by the host partner and Centre. 

The expected long-term benefits are an improvement in students' employment on the job market, a decrease in youth unemployment and the creation of a benchmark bilingual programme in Spanish vocational training.

We consider our project to be very important, in the city of Erzincan, in helping young people to find jobs in the field of computer based fashion design. By participating in this project students will have the opportunity to train in a European vocational centre. At the end of the training they will have the necessary certification to obtain a job in their chosen field. The aim of the project is for students to learn design techniques, marketing strategies, brand management and how to use the necessary computer programmes. We also aim to encourage students to use their initiative and creativity to come up with new techniques and ideas. Another aim is for students to learn how to choose the correct materials for their designs, and most importantly to learn the right marketing skills to distribute their products. The textile industry is very important in Turkey and due to the cheap labour in countries such as China many leading companies outsource their business to such countries. The fashion sector in Turkey are now realising the importance in having qualified designers working for Turkish companies so that we may retain business in the fashion industry. By taking part in our projects young people will become more cultured and disciplined and will improve their knowledge of the language and vocabulary in this sector.We will collaborate with our partner continuously.Study design, market analysis, product development, development of technical drawings, computer aided manufacturing design, brand management, konspt development, will include topics such as preparation of designs.
  Unfortunately, in Turkey, the vocational education in this sector is of a lesser standard than in Europe and the computer programmes are not up to date. Students therefore do not have the appropriate resources available to them to become sufficiently qualified in the field. We offer this project in the hopes that the students taking part can gain the necessary skills and qualifications so that they may return to Turkey fully efficient in the design industry. Our project will take place in April 2015 and will partner with an English vocational school.Consists of 15 students, 3 teachers companion.12.class  students in the field of graphics and the field of technology which produces clothing will take place as participants in our project.Participants consist of underprivileged girls.

Tellus Group will send 24 VET staff and mentors from business incubators on a one week training assignment to 012 Factory in Caserta, Italy. The participants will be professionals experienced in entrepreneurial education and training.  During the mobility they will mentor and provide workshops to young Italian entrepreneurs, who are learners at 012 Factory. The objectives are to improve the participants' competences, develop more effective training methods and help close the gap between vocational training and entrepreneurship. It is expected that the project will positively contribute to the fight against youth unemployment by encouraging the young people to engage in entrepreneurial activities and improving their skills in that field.

As an overriding objective, the project is seeking to address the issue of youth unemployment.  Currently, Italy is facing one of the highest rates of youth unemployment in the EU. Promotion of entrepreneurship is one of the solutions to fight unemployment among the young. Entrepreneurial education can strengthen problem solving skills, improve the ability to analyse and develop business ideas and  increase confidence in starting a new business. Effective entrepreneurship promotion and teaching is very important in attaining these results and can be achieved by improving knowledge and competences of VET school teachers and business incubator mentors.

This staff mobility project aims to support professional development of its participants by improving their competences and knowledge in the field of entrepreneurship and in a new environment. Through the exchange of best practices, it intends to develop more effective training methods of VET teachers and business incubator mentors. The project also aims to address the existing gap between vocational training, employment and entrepreneurship by promotion and improvement of entrepreneurial education in VET centres. Finally, it will strengthen cooperation between VET centers and business incubators in different countries and contribute to the internationalisation and modernisation of their missions.
 
Tellus Group intends to recruit 24 UK based VET centres’ teachers and business incubators’ mentors that are experienced in promoting and teaching entrepreneurship. They will have expertise in providing support and guidance for young entrepreneurs. The participants will be divided into 12 groups of 2 teachers/mentors that have knowledge and skills for the particular mobility week’s topic.
 
The participants will take part in a preparation course that will introduce them to the project’s partner - 012 Factory. It will provide linguistic support with cultural elements, as well as help them prepare workshops that will be performed during the weeks of mobility. During their training assignment, the participants will work alongside the 012 Factory employees. The main  activities will be providing workshops covering the main aspects of entrepreneurship according to the week's topic and mentoring young Italian entreprenuers attending 012 Factory Academy. The modules will include, among others: market needs analysis, production process, marketing, legal aspects and business planning. Participants will apply their techniques and teaching methodologies to train young people and observe 012 Factory methods in order to exchange the best practices in entrepreneurial education.

The project’s activities are expected to improve the participants’ knowledge and skills in entrepreneurial education and promotion by exposing them to a different environment. 012 Factory, on the other hand, will have an opportunity to familiarise with and adopt methodologies used by VET schools in the UK and will offer new services, provided by UK participants, to their learners. The learners and future learners of 012 Factory will benefit from a better and broader understanding of entrepreneurship due to the increased quality of training.

At the end of the project a set of entrepreneurial training guidelines will be created by the participants. These guidelines will be shared with other VET centres and will impact entrepreneurial teaching methods across Europe as well as promote entrepreneurship in vocational training. In the long run, the project is expected to create efficient connections between VET centres and business incubators in different countries. It is also expected that due to more effective training,  young entrepreneurs will be better prepared to launch and run successful businesses and, as a result, positively affect local economies and employment rates.
