BBA Oldenburg (an initial vocational school in Germany) wants to convey new inspirations and experiences to its students and lecturers.
Students and lecturers shall be able to establish ties with European colleagues and participate in European networks.
Necessities for the planned experiences are generated by changes in society (Europe 2020 strategy) and health systems (Health 2020 strategy) all over Europe.
The participants are to improve important skills (job-related and soft skills) through mobility. They shall communicate and interact with colleagues in Europe and deal cross-border with current professional and societal themes. The participants acknowledge lifelong learning and mobility as job-relevant themes in the EU.
The expectance in dealing with European themes is that the participants identify themselves with the EU and act as active EU-Citizens.
To achieve the mentioned goals, 19 participants of the BBA Oldenburg will undertake a mobility activity abroad.
16 students in their first year of training will take part in a fieldwork placement in a European country. Three lecturers of the BBA will participate in a Meeting of the "European Network of Occupational Therapy in Higher Education" (ENOTHE) in Bulgaria and Ireland.
The Experiences of the participants are evaluated afterwards. Gained knowledge and competences are integrated in the further vocational training.

With the “Nell-Breuning school project in UK III”, the school offers trainees the possibility to attend a four-week internship in an English company in the south of Britain. The parties involved are the Nell-Breuning school Rottweil as sending organisation, Tellus Group and Twin Group as receiving organisations, the beneficiaries, their training companies and their companies providing internships in the sending country.

The apprentices are at the end of the first and/or second year within their three-year or two-year training course. The training focuses, on the one hand, on conveying specialist knowledge in the areas of business administration and economy, and the acquisition and/or consolidation of English as a  business language on the other. The project aims at helping apprentices to improve  their foreign language skills as well as their intercultural and professional competence, benefitting the companies with their labour.
  
Companies in Baden-Wurttemberg traditionally place a strong focus on international markets. The situation in the district of Rottweil, where the training companies of the potential participants in the project are located, is similar. Small and medium-sized enterprises predominate here. Since the internationalisation of small and medium-sized enterprises will increase in the near future, the demands on employees will also increase. Language skills and intercultural competence are increasingly required. The aim of the project is to apply and deepen the specialist knowledge acquired in the vocational training school and in the training company, to become familiar with business operations in English companies, to get to know the English way of life and culture and to further develop oral and written English language skills. 

We pursue the following objectives, in particular:

-  Promoting the internationalisation of vocational training in Baden-Wurttemberg
-  Making the stay abroad an integral part of the training (especially in small and medium-sized enterprises)
-  Raising awareness among companies about investing in internationally well-trained professionals at an early stage, which is important to us as a school
-  Increasing the attractiveness of the dual training system 
- Promoting professional, intercultural, social and language skills (mobility, flexibility, independence, self-confidence, etc.)
-  Expanding the establishment of long-term contacts with foreign companies and suppliers.
Stärkung beruflicher, sprachlicher und interkultureller Kompetenzen durch Mobilität in Europa

The Hans-Böckler-Berufskolleg provides a wide range of vocational education and, moreover, it has the responsibility to encourage openness, tolerance and interest in cultural diversity. This project prepares students for the European labor market. First of all, about 80 students studying business and commerce, media, natural or educational sciences gain work experiences in countries such as Poland, Great Britain, Spain, Malta, Norway or Turkey. The students are integrated into international teams to work together in projects and on assignments in order to foster technical and linguistic, but also social and cultural skills. The students encounter work techniques and job routines in other European countries. They are getting an insight into European companies and their networks, so that they will have a competitive advantage on the international job market.
In addition, six teachers receive educational as well as language training in the UK to establish bilingualism in school life. In addition, it will help the teachers to obtain new ideas for their own teaching and to further the school’s projects at European level. Benefits result from teacher training but also through networking in Europe. Personal contacts are the foundation of a future European cooperation.

Mobility activities of „Stiftung Bildung & Handwerk“ (SBH- Education and Crafts Foundation) are realized in the EU Program for Youth, Sports and Education „Erasmus+“ (2014 – 2020) in the framework of mobility for learners in vocational education and training, key activity 1 (KA1).

From October 2015 until May 2017 SBH promotes mobility of learners (IVT and VETPRO) within five different types of activities:
1. SBH provides opportunities for 20 apprentices with special needs learning at SBH in vocational training programs promoting target group.  We offer them 2 or 3 – weeks - learning experiences abroad in European countries from the “Easy Mobil”- Network like in Finland, Poland, Bulgaria and Hungary. 
2. 10 apprentices from Vocational Institutes in Paderborn get the chance to learn and work for 3 weeks in the Mantua Province, partner province of Paderborn District, at companies or at work shopes of For.Ma., Regional Vocational Institute. We offer that to apprentices from gastronomy / backery // car mechanics or painters and varnishers / brick layers.   
3. SBH continues collaboration from 2008 on regional level with „Carl-Severing-Berufskolleg für Handwerk und Technik, Bielefeld“ and organizes work placements for 10 students as assistant in food technology to gain work experiences as well as to develop foreign language and intercultural, social and personal competences in Finland, Spain, Ireland, Hungary and Italy. 


4. SBH act as promotor of individual mobility for apprentices, so as done within „Leonardo da Vinci“ with mobility certificate. We support apprentices from administration and technical professions learning in the “dual system of VET” throughout Germany. Based on the work as promoter of the last few years SBH has numerous contacts to companies and chambers throughout Germany. By the grant of ERASMUS + we promote 25 apprentices (in the second year of VET- process) to realize a four week work placement in one of our European partner countries: Bulgaria, Finland, Ireland, Italy, Spain, Hungary and the United Kingdom.
If apprentices or their companies have contacts in other European countries that can be
used to realize the internship, too.
SBH publishes the offer at the companies website, corresponding the standard of quality for so called „Poolprojekte“.
Interested apprentices SBH are choosed within an interview via phone and on the basis of corresponding documentation (CV and letter of motivation).

For all participants (IVT and VETPRO) from all activities SBH offers pedagogical and intercultural preparation, if necessary language preparation, too. Therefor we decide depending on the
place of domicile of the apprentice either to participate in a workshop at SBH Paderborn or to realize preparation via e-learning. 
SBH supports all participants during the whole process: starting with application for funding, planning, organization, preparation, realization and post evaluation. 

SBH promotes mobility for staff (VETPRO) of vocational education and training centers belonging to SBH (12 teachers, foremen – instructors, social pedagogues) and 4 teachers and managers from Vocational Institutes of Paderborn. In the Partner´s countries from Easy Mobil Network we organize within one – week study visits exchanges of experiences and discussions on pedagogical issues with regard to daily work, working in the field of VET for disadvantaged young people. The teachers from Vocational Institutes will learn about the Italian system of VET at For.Ma., partner – school in Mantova, partner province of district of Paderborn.  

The final work - programme for the stay abroad is coordinated among partner and SBH / Voactional Institute (VETPRO) and apprentice, company or vocational school and the partner institution
Abroad (IVT). In situ abroad process is supervised by the partner organization in cooperation with a mentor for internship at the company. Learning agreement will be established between all three parties to assure quality and as a base for work. For all participants we coordinate a task to study during the work placement.

The aim is to promote flexibility and independece, to offer technical, intercultural and individual experiences. In contact with people, culture and language of hosting country participants develope knowledge and competences. VETPRO –participants get new impulses from their stay for daily work. 
Essential part of every work placement is post preparation: after the return from abroad participants present their impressions and experiences: either at SBH or at their company or at vocational school to develop sustainability about mobility. 
All partners and participants play an active role in the public to disseminate experiences within European mobility.
To document activities, experiences, skills and competences, all participants within all activities will get the Europass Mobility document.

WinE - Workplacement in European Enterprises

The objective of the proposed project is to significantly improve the starting conditions of young adults for later possible occupations in foreign countries through the placement abroad . The placement also improves the employment opportunities in the native country as local and regional companies can benefit from young adults offering excellent foreign language skills and international experience.

The project particularly focuses on two groups of participants :

1)
10 participants come from the traditional field of vocational education within the dual system . The courses Industrial Business Management Assistant and Management Assistant in Wholesale and Foreign Trade train future employees in industrial and trading enterprises (training according to the Vocational Training Act / BBIG ) 
Due to the Europeanization of the economy, increasing globalization and the high export share of the German economy, these young adults will certainly have to deal with export and import transactions in their future working life.
The placement supports the trainees of the courses " Industrial Business Management Assistant " and " Management Assistant in Wholesale and Foreign Trade " in the acquisition and the use of knowledge , skills and  qualifications to be well prepared for this internationalization of companies . It promotes their personal development, employability and their willingness to participate in the European labor market.
2)
10 participants are students from the educational course Commercial Foreign Language Assistant. This is a full- time school-based educational course of vocational training by state law. The language assistants have fundamental , mainly theoretical knowledge that is complemented by professional practice. In this context, the placement serves the purpose of applying , consolidating and deepening the knowledge acquired . The aim of the placement is to apply the business and commercial knowledge and skills acquired in the full -time vocational course in practical operation. Therefore the development and promotion of economic linguistic competence is of special significance.
The foreign language assistants should gain first professional experiences abroad with a view to their future career in the framework of the placement.
Go Abroad and Complete Your Skills III

The Europe-Agency of the District Government of Soest is offering 50 vocational students of the districts vocational schools a four week internship in Plymouth, UK within the project "Go Abroad and Complete Your Skills iII". Main focuses of the project are  competences in foreign languages (Englisch) and the internship in a foreign company. 
Partner of the District Government of Soest is the Tellus Group in Plymouth, UK which is responsible for organizing housing, internships and overseeing the students during their internship period. 

The use of foreign languages is vital especially in the educational fields of business management and administration. That is why, the vocational training in business and administration has an emphasis on language training in two different foreign languages, one of them beeing Englisch. To promote  learning of foreign languages, an internship in an Englisch company is considered to be very helpful and motivating. After the internship, the new aquired competences are validated by a third party with a certificate, which can be used to help with future work applications.

Because of the work placement in a foreign company in a foreign country, social an language competences are improved, especially because of the new cultural insights. Thus, intercultural learning will also be a great part of the internship experience.

The 'Award of Garden Merit', which is this years project title is given to a plant which has proven very well in many areas and has undergone strcit tests. Remembering this we want the very best training for our trainees and staff.This is why we as the Umbrella Organization for Landscape Gardening in North Rhine-Westphalia we see ourselfs compelled to provide our members with all possible instruments to establish and maintain high quality education. ERASMUS+ is a brillaint tool to send Learners and Trainers to receive practical and technical training in a foreign country.The goal is to send trainees for work experience to British Gardens which have influenced Garden Design historically and continue to do so. Such knowledge is relevant for the vocational education as well as on the labour market. That is why we also aim to train our trainers in this field to give them an edge over their competion.Additionaly a work experience abroad always strengenths the personal and intercultural skills of the participant. It also raises their mobility. It helps to grow together in Europe and will counter the lack of skilled personell through offering atractive and high quality vocational training.The trainees will travel in two flows consiting of 8 members each to South-West England where our partner CMS Devon Ltd has already sorted the work placement and accommodation. Two experienced ladies, who are our members also, will accompany one for each flow to safeguard any minors in each group. CMS Devon Ltd will deploy our interns to work with Mt Edgecombe. CMS Devon Ltd is responsible for organizing the flows and looking after the participants during their stay - this includes flights, accomodation, transport, insurance, board and leisure time offers. This is the same for our training personell, in addition CMS Devon Ltd will provide planing and execution of the training curriculum including historical and current gardens and institutions as well as a practical day to reinforce what has been learnd.In Norther Ireland our host organisation represented by Ms Koschemann will personally look after our remaining 12 trainees who will work in one of the Top Ten gardens in th world; Mt Stewart of the National Trust.Being a hugh umbrella organisation this will enable us to infuse that knowledge and those skills back into our vocational schools and  our companies. This will ensure them an advantage over their competitors.On top of that it brings added value to all participants through strengthening their personality and their practical skills and proffesional knowledge. We promote that every trainee should spent time abroad during their training period because it does open up new hoizons and gives new perspektives in work and private life.Having said this; it is our goal to send out more trainees and trainers each year to educate both groups and thus continue to offer relevant and highly qualfied vocatinal training in order to win more young people for this profession.
Entrepreneurship: a gateway to a growing education

The ENGAGED (Entrepreneurship: a gateway to a growing education) project involves the collaboration among IIS Scalcerle, other schools  in the area, Xena  for competence monitoring, City Hall and the Province of Padova, Fòrema from Confindustria.
The partners are in 9 European countries.With some there is a situation of reciprocity, both in the Mobility and other LLP programs; the foreign network includes business companies, chemistry labs, public administrations, educational institutions, universities, museums, hotels and other partners in the fields of tourism, culture, commerce.
We aim at consolidating and developing the mobility to keep offering many students the possibility to have temporary work placements abroad (Obj.ve 1 of the strategic framework for European cooperation in education and training (ET 2020).
The work placements abroad will be organized, monitored and evaluated according to ECVET criteria and they will be planned with the aim of acquiring increasing skills that can be acknowledged in several national and international contexts.
The skills acquired in non-formal contexts can enhance a young person’s professional assets and they will be useful in a labour market that is evolving fast (Europe 2020 on increasing the employment rate). The new professions will require updated digital skills, initiative and entrepreneurship;thanks to pre-placement training, work placement activities and the availability of technological equipment in the classrooms and labs and free internet access, ENGAGED multiplies these learning opportunities in Italy and abroad (Digital competences, Europe 2020, Strategic Obj.ve 4 of ET 2020).
The selection of the partners was based on the skills acquired by the trainees in preceding work placement experiences. With some partners of the Chemistry sector we share ECVET, which is now applied also in other educational environments.
IIS Scalcerleis a member of the European CREDCHEM network for scientific occupation.
With the hosting partners the learning goals in non-formal contexts, defined in LOUs (Learning Outcome Units), and the conditions for the work placements (objectives, duration, responsibilities of each institution) are agreed upon.
The content and the quality of the LOUs are determined using tools such as the MoU and the LA.
WithXenathe preparation, the monitoring and the certification of competences are elaborated.
The beneficiaries of the ENGAGED project are 108 students, 91 from IIS Scalcerle and 17 from other schools who have already completed the 4th class and who are selected according to shared criteria. 30 of them are students from the Chemistry course and 78 are from the Foreign Language course.
Among the “8 key competences”, here is a list of the ones who are more suitable for our beneficiaries:
Knowing the world of international labour; 
Getting to know different cultures, increasing one’s social and civil competences;
Acquiring language skills in more than one language;
Increasing self-realization as equal opportunity citizens for female beneficiaries; promoting integration and self-esteem in young immigrants (Obj.ve 3 ET 2020);
Transferring theoretical knowledge to the working environment;
Life-long learning.
The crisis of the labour market dictates the partners to offer more opportunities to their students to train them for life-long learning and the enhancement of their basic skills (writing, calculation, science, technology) and communication skills in a foreign language (strategic obj.ve 2 ET 2020).
The activities will be:
Information on the Erasmus+ program
Preparation about the LOUs
The work placements abroad
Monitoring of the work placements
Evaluation of the work placements and ECVET-directed certification.
Dissemination of the results among peers and institutions.
The methodology used is group work, the sharing of intentions among the partners and the debate among the work placement tutors on the contents and the objectives to be reached.
A supervision group, formed by the headmasters and the person in charge of GATEWAY+,monitors the observance of deadlines, the regular execution of the activities, the observance of the agreements among partners and the use of the budget.
The final qualitative evaluation will be determined among the participants, the tutors and the whole work group after certificates, final reports and the reports of the hosting companies.
The feed back for the beneficiaries is the acquisition of the planned skills, for the educational community the transfer of the same to schoolmates through guided debates. The trainers/tutors group increases its competences on mobility and the use of foreign languages. The tested LOUs are transferred into the curricula of the sending schools and integrated in the educational plan of discipline departments. The consolidation of the partners’ network and mutual trust is the basic ground for collaboration and the development of future relationships.
Duration: 01/12/2015 –1/12/2016
Sector Skills for emerging labour market

The project SSELMA- “Sector Skills for emerging labor market” is enrolled -through placement of five weeks (June-July 2016) in Companies located in Slovakia, Romania, Germany, UK, Spain, Portugal, Bulgaria, Poland – It pursues the aim to specialize 30 training students (selected from 140 attending the IV the year 2015 -2016) in the "Information and Communication", "Technologies of plastics-Mechanical /Mechatronics", "Electronics and electrical engineering", "Chemistry, Materials and Biotechnology" of the ' ITST "John F. Kennedy" based in  Pordenone and at the same time to introduce them in an European work context, , with its own rules, procedures and dynamics, thereby widening their adaptability, in view of new employment opportunities and entrepreneurial creativity. The target is represented by young people aged 17-18 years, in possession of FCE (Liv.B2),Certification CLIL,  approaching in curriculum planning, input, in integrated actions of school-work, enhancement of the axes cross-cultural, relational, launched in years with the different actors at  local and regional level (project partners), in formal and non-formal Education The 4 profiles chosen for mobility SSELMA, reflecting the new legislation that redefines the Technical Education and the most recent developments of Science and technology in the development of knowledge aims to give its students the knowledge, skills and abilities and new personalizing, that characterize today, an Industrial Expert (Liv. 4 EQF), It enables  to be integrated into the work world as well as to access to university faculties, especially to  technical-scientific (CEDEFOP, New Skills for New Jobs' flagship initiative of Europe 2020). In addition, in line with the priorities of the MISE (Budget 2014-16), the telecommunications sector has to play a key role in the economic recovery, according to Smart Specialisation strategies tailored to the specific characteristics of the territories. According to forecasts of Confindustria on Excelsior data January.2015, the  55% of companies would like to choose Industrial Experts. Despite the recession, the gap between demand and supply of technical professionals  remains of 75 thousand units (De Rita, Feb. 2015) .In addition, a recent study by Eurostat points out that  the creative ability of a company is inversely correlated to the  age of its employees- The under-40 produce about the 70 percent of innovations. In line with the demands of the market and the reform of the educational system that imposes a growing bond between schools and businesses, the I.T.S.T. "John F. Kennedy" always develops close cooperation and strict relations with the world of work and in particular with the companies of reference of its based  students, many of which have foreign branches. The participation of entrepreneurs in defining and planning of training promotes the desired continuous modernization of the offered profiles. Businesses often complain of young people, their lack of flexibility and adaptability, entrepreneurship and personal autonomy. The project SSELMA therefore assumes great importance since it allows beneficiaries to a direct comparison with situations linguistically, culturally and technologically different from their local context stimulating their curiosity and self-study, in an international dimension. The opportunity to experience completely new experiences even in terms of personal commitment, is a unique opportunity for the 30 students: it will substantially affect on their future professional life, given their location in an area (particulary FVG Region, subject to strong pressures for change and in need of new ideas and initiatives which are geared to sustainable development model. Today, the young must be Industrial, capable of fitting in different realities, very productive and characterized by a rapid evolution, both from a technological point of view and of the organization of work. "L’intelligenza delle mani: così la chiamava Don Bosco.. Is what the companies really  need". In the course of the mobility experience abroad, the beneficiaries may acquire those concrete knowledge, basic skills (cross and professional), which can develop only with practical experience, and integrate into the school curriculum. They will experience, such as contact with different cultures. Will initiate synergies and cooperation processes, will acquire experience in innovative organization and social content, in order to recreate in the operational context of reference. Learning outcomes, in terms of skills acquired will be validated by the University of Udine with the release of up to 12 ECVET.

CERTIFICATE OF COMPETENCE, CERTIFICATE OF PARTICIPATION of  the PREPARATION Linguistics, CV EUROPASS, Learning Agreement, MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING.

The project Fashion in VET (FiVET) stems from City of Casapulla, Ass. IFM Europe, local companies QUAREDO, STELLA WHITE, Confindustria Caserta, high school ISISS "Righi-NERVI" and A.Volta to transform innovations brought by the European projects in the daily practice of the functioning of public and private entities that compose it, in order to increase their operational capacity and their degree of internationalization. The subjects that make up the consortium have all the common goal of opening up to the European dimension to connote innovation and improve the quality of their usual activities and intend to do this, in the short term, to get the European Charter of quality in mobility. In the era of globalization, public and private body are required to develop complex skills. These include the ability to relate with the world and with the great challenges that mark our time. The production of textiles and clothing in the province of Caserta boast a secular tradition that has its roots in silk production introduced by the Bourbons at the end of '700. The business in this sector, which consists mainly of SMEs, managed, albeit with significant reduction of firms and workers, to resist over the years, also facing difficult challenges such as the economic crisis and the emergence of the so-called 'Fast fashion'. From fine silks of San Leucio, to small studios and workshops tailored to the pole shoe Aversa, the textile and clothing sector in the province of Caserta continues to have an important role in the production system of Campania, where the concentration of industries is organized mainly in small and medium-sized companies, highly specialized and often operating in niche markets. FiVET project will last 2 years (September 2015-September 2017) .It will be made up of two mobility: one from the last week of June 2016 with 20 students with destinations Seville and Valencia and the other from the second week of July with 40 students with destinations Prague, Lisbon and Plymounth. IVF aims to respond to the training needs of 60 students of vocational schools who intend to work in the textile industry and the production of garments, of which:
-40 From the institute I.S.I.S.S. "Righi-NERVI" St. Maria CV- address (address studio clothing and fashion), classes 3 and 4th;
-20 From the institute INSTITUTE OF SECONDARY EDUCATION A.Volta.
The schools involved in the consortium, opening internationalization, can more easily improve the quality of training, structuring academic skills with those required by the world of technologically advanced.
The comparison and exchange of experiences with companies and European entities involved in vocational training, are considered able to bring real benefits to the faculty and staff, students and their families. For participants is expected to be a path of strengthening of key skills, both acquisition of soft skills, and sector address. Will be released the following documentation: CERTIFICATE OF COMPETENCE, CERTIFICATE OF PARTICIPATION IN THE PREPARATION Linguistics, CV EUROPASS, Learning Agreement, MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING. The composition of the partnership, both national and transnational, was based on the evaluation of the contributions and capacities that everyone is able to put in place to achieve the goals of FiVET. 
The countries were chosen for good practice in the field indicated; foreign intermediaries to previous experiences in mobility projects for VET and quality hosting partner indicated, schools because they work daily with students who aspire to work in this sector, the local partners for the experiences in European projects, to the degree of involvement in activities related to VET, for knowledge of the sector and the needs of SMEs. The decision to form a consortium is due to the desire to share the territory a training model characterized by an effective and efficient public-private partnership; between agencies, schools and NGOs working on EU programs, including companies and associations who know the characteristics of social and productive land.
Mobility Experience for Learners in Technical Education Paths - 2015

The MELTEP Project 2015 (Mobility Experience for Learners in Technical  Education Paths 2015) brings together in partnership six Technical  Education High Schools, one VET Center in the Province of Bologna and  nine host organizations abroad.
 MELTEP 2015 aims at giving an answer to the strong need for  internationalisation of the productive area of Bologna, offering 160
 young people (16-25 years) resident in Italy and attending Technical  Education or VET-Courses the opportunity to experience an internship  abroad for 3 weeks at companies and / or vocational schools in the  European Union (Austria, France, Germany, Spain, Malta and the United  Kingdom).
 The mobility experience in a company or in professional courses  (always work-based and accompanied by seminars, workshops and company  visits) will be related to the specialisation areas of the schools  involved, namely: Administration, Finance and Marketing, Tourism,  Commercial Services and Advertising, Construction and Environment,  Electronics and Electrical engineering, Business information systems,  Administrative Assistant and Sales Personnel.  The first and foremost goal of the project is the improvement of the chances  of  employability of young students, improving their transversal,  language, citizenship, and technical skills.
In addition, what makes MELTEP project 2015 particularly innovative is  that it will reinforce the exchange of best practices in the field of  validation of competences. In fact, it will provide an opportunity for  pilot testing of ECVET procedures for the evaluation, recognition and  transfer of learning outcomes, with a focus on a group of about 20  trainees, trying to improve the international mobility of Technical  High Schools Students.
Global Rivers for an Environmental and Energetical Education Network II

The labour market becomes increasingly international, Europe, and thus also our Country, needs VET systems that fully respond to the requests coming from the labor market. One of the central ideas underlying European Lifelong Learning policies is that international mobility should become a natural part of education and training schemes. This helps learners to achieve higher qualification levels which are crucial for a successful first step into the labour market or for career improvements. The EU Member States are fully committed to helping young people take advantage of the opportunities open to them in terms of learning mobility. Young people participating in VET schemes are a particular focus of this commitment, and the Member States recently set a target of enabling 6% of all learners in initial VET to have completed a period of VET study abroad by 2020. 

In line with these objectives and European policies, through GREEEN II, I.I.S (Institute of Higher Education) MERLONI MILIANI of Fabriano aims to improve the quality of education and vocational training, giving a European dimension to the learning paths and thus providing the young participants the opportunity to test and improve their skills: professionalism in the specific areas of vocational education (renewable energy and environment), cultural knowledge and linguistic preparation. This general objective is pursued through a mobility experience that consists of a learning mobility internship abroad of 3 weeks for 80 students of fourth year of technical and vocational secondary school with fields of study related to the renewable energy and other 8 newly graduated.
The training programme includes an internship in selected companies in the renewable energy and environment to acquire knowledge and skills within the sectors and activities aimed at the inclusion and integration in the context and for the improvement of language skills and to better know the culture of the hosting country. The main expected results from the project include: the rise of the personal and professional skills of the participants, and the promotion of key competencies related to the real exercise of active citizenship; increasing the employment potential of the participants, the introduction of innovative training methods as a complement to existing practices and pathways and the improvement of the educational level of technical and vocational schools, the development of relations between the transnational partners and the promotion of processes of cooperation and exchange of good practices between the partners involved, with a significant impact in improving the educational and vocational guidance.

The project is, besides, implemented in an European context considering the European priority and thematic such as "ECVET for transparency and recognition of learning outcomes and qualifications". GREEEN II is a project based on the concrete responses to the questions of developing ECVET in the European member States and corresponding to the EU Recommendations on the establishment of the European Credit system for VET. The project works in particular to realise an European area for Lifelong Learning in the field of environment and renewable energy .
The whole activities are implemented by regarding a strong European perspective which are reflected in all project activities and results.

IGEA was the goddess of health and cleanliness in ancient Greece, where the relationship between man and nature ranged from those who theorized the supremacy of the first on the second, like Aristotle, and those who, like Pythagoras later, pushed for an approach with empirical spirit so to understand the ecological mechanisms that act within an ecosystem, and precisely the links between human health and the state of the environment.
As we know the modern world stands on the first perspective, producing a planetary ecological imbalance evoked by many people, now.

Within this context, economists and politicians invite us to look to the green economy as the only viable way to:
-get out of the economic crisis that hit world markets in the last two years;
-stop the dissipation of resources;
-create new jobs and entrepreneurship.

The development of opportunities arising from the green economy is indeed central to the Europe 2020 strategy, indicating in a smart, sustainable and inclusive growth priorities towards which to address the future of the Union.

The Report of Unioncamere "GreenItaly 2014, feeding the future" shows that the "green" sector is growing. Even the ILO, the International Labour Organization of the United Nations, has placed its focus on green industry, in particular the link between environmental sustainability and decent work, as highlighted in the report "Green Jobs becoming a reality - Progress and outlook 2013 ".
Also, the report edited by the Energy Observatory IRES-CGIL arrives to interesting conclusions 
according to which only in South Italy, by 2020, green jobs will increase to 9,000 units, while at the national level 12,000 net permanent units will be reached. These figures can not be ignored considering that Sicily and Sardinia, present in this consortium, are among the poorest regions of Europe as well as Veneto, the other region represented in the project, where the crisis has torn the local productive area.

Environmental jobs not necessarily generate new professions, in fact, most of the strictly environmental professions concern traditional figures "renewed", needing for a widening and / or upgrading of skills of the profiles in the green key.

The employment potential of new green approaches have relapsed also the VET offer, and within this context the meaning of the IGEA project can be read, offering a postgraduate education that strengthens the skills of young graduates of the project partner institutions, enhancing their employability in green jobs.

IGEA addressed to 90 recent graduates in Sicily, Sardinia and Veneto who have concluded a VET study course within one year, in the area of mechanics, mechatronics and energy, electronics and electrical engineering, chemistry, materials and biotechnology, computer science. Specific project objectives are: 
-Increase of the employability of young VET graduates from the project partners schools, offering an opportunity for on-the-job training abroad to expand their technical and professional skills in step with the skills required by the new trends of green economy.
-Promoting the access of VET recent graduates from project partner schools in the European labor market, offering a first opportunity of comparison with a cultural, social and economic environment different from their one, and strengthening the knowledge of a foreign language.
-Reinforce, through an internship of 13 weeks, soft skills as required by the green labor market: team work ability, problem solving, organizational and interpersonal skills. 

The job profiles to which the internships will be directed are: photovoltaic and photo thermoelectric, heat pumps system installer, low enthalpy geothermal systems installer installer, heat solar systems installer, micro controllers programming technician, environmental detection systems qualified technician, technician for the management of collection, reutilization and recycling of waste, energy producing biomass systems installer, mechatronic technician, waste disposal lab technician, green chemist, environment computer technician.

The mobility activities will be preceded by a linguistic preparation, through the European Commission portal, work-and-live-abroad pedagogical preparation and information about logistical and training aspects of the specific activity of mobility. 

The project is presented by a consortium of organizations built on a multisectoral basis and including diverse geographical origins. 

Coordinator of the project is the Technical School Vittorio Emanuele III, leader of Rete Sicilia per l'Europa (Sicily Network For Europe), which has involved two other Sicilian institutions in the project:“I.T.I.S. Galileo Ferraris” Technical Institute in San Giovanni La Punta (CT) and “Enzo Ferrari” Institute in Barcelona P.G. (ME).To ensure a wider territorial benefits, a Sardinian school and a VET center from Veneto Region were then involved:“IISS Primo Levi” Technical School Quartu St. Helena (CA)“Associazione Lepido Rocco” in Motta di Livenza (TV). 

The foreign partnership is broad and spread over seven European countries. The project has been joined by host organizations which, thanks to their experience and their business strongly bounded with the geographical area, will ensure a high quality demand-supply trainships matching and an excellent range of logistics services. In the partnership there are also 18 European companies that have already indicated their willingness to accept IGEA trainees in the planning phase.
By destination 90 grants will be distributed as follows:
Seville - Lisbon - Berlin - Lund (SE) – Prague - Plymouth (GB) - Cork 

The internships abroad will have a duration of 13 weeks.

In order to enhance the employment impact of the project, "SEND" a job agency authorized by the Italian Ministry of Labour was involved, specialized in transnational projects of guidance and placement.
In addition, actors such as the Department of productive activities of the City of Palermo, Confindustria Sicilia (Sicilia Chamber of Industry), Assoprovider and the Regional Agency for the environment were involved so to ensure the systemically diffusion of the project actions, on the ground of political decisions and economic choices.

Legambiente Sicilia is also present as an important partner to spread the culture of economic growth n which respect for the environment is a common value. 

There are several activities of follow-up and dissemination: post mobility guidance and job placement paths, conferences on green economy and its impact on employment in Europe, videos filmed by the youngs on their work experience abroad.

The impact of the project is expected especially on two dimensions: employability and "culture of international mobility". 

The project is, in fact, designed to make young people's CV, who graduate in VET school or centres more attractive, offering additional education in terms of technical and professional skills, but also soft and key ones, and propagate among young people the European citizenship culture, which leads them to think of their future personal and professional development beyond their national borders.
BETOE - Bridging Education and Training to Employment

Project AbstractCONTEXT/BACKGROUND.The idea of the BETOE Project rises out of the analysis of the daily challenges European high schools teachers have to face nowadays. From our teaching experiences, it emerges that the most widespread deficiencies among students aged 15 to 19 are the loss of enthusiasm about their future and the lack of connection of their studies to the needs of the labour market. In a society where the youth (aged 15-24) unemployment rate rose from 10,0 % in 2012 to 43,2.% in 2014 (ISTAT), students consider the learning experience too far from real life and not linked to the world of work . In this changing and complex context , teachers have multiple roles to perform : they are expected to be not only knowledge transmitters but also coaches, facilitators, learning mentors, guidance counselors. To fulfil all these roles professionally, teachers need to be competent in their responsibility towards their students both inside and ouside the classroom  at all levels: local, national and international level.OBJECTIVES It is our project priority to create a  group of highly motivated, well-prepared school professionals, closely linked to the world of enterprises and business and able to meet the challenge of bridging education and training to employment in a European perspective at the same time helping students increase  their  self-esteem, employability  and entrepreneurship.We want to offer a multi-level/inter-institutional training to a group of our talented professionals : they will spend one week abroad  job shadowing VET teaching techniques, exploring models of apprenticeship /Internship and experiencing job placement techniques at VET schools and organisations, enterprises and training centers in Plymouth, Devon, United Kingdom.Upon their return they will be able to transmit their improved/acquired skills to create a quality “Career Guidance and Counseling Service” and a quality "Internship Service"at school in order to reduce the GAP between Education, Training and Employment.Experience and expertise of grant holders will lead to a higher degree of innovation in teaching and research, as well as an increase of international cooperation capacity at both personal and institutional level.NUMBER OF PARTICIPANTS : 15 in 3 different fluxes of departurePROFILE OF PARTICIPANTS : Participants are all VET schools teachers DESCRIPTION OF ACTIVITIESThe Project planned activities are the following:- Job shadowing ( consisting in  peer coaching, peer learning and peer review activities ) /observation activities at VET schools on VET school subjects of the teachers' Sectors;- Workshops of self-reflection activities on teaching- learning practices in the field of Career Guidance and Counseling ;- Job shadowing/observation activities  at Enterprises and Hotels hosting learners on their apprenticeship;- Job shadowing/observation activities at Training centers/Job centers.TITLE OF THE TRAINING ACTIVITY IN THE LANGUAGE OF TUITION : BETOE - Bridging Education and Training to EmploymentTYPE AND ORIGIN OF THE TRAINING ACTIVITIES: JOB SHADOWING/OBSERVATION PERIOD aimed at VET StaffTHEMATIC FIELDS OF THE TRAINING: Career guidance and counseling ; Combating failure in education;Fight against school failure & link school and wor; Employment support.LANGUAGE USED FOR THE TRAINING: English LANGUAGE VERSION(S) IN WHICH MATERIALS WILL BE PRODUCED: English- ItalianMETHODOLOGY The project will make use of  Peer Learning Activities ( PLAs), related to Peer Coaching and Peer Reviewing Activities  in a variety of higly motivating European contexts both formal and non- formal , offering ful immersion into a European socio-economic environment.RESULTS AND IMPACT Remarkable impacts and results are expected on teachers partcipating/ beneficiaries, on the participanting organisations , on the Community and the Territory. A strong  impact on the teachers' motivation, involvement and competences expressed in terms of KSA is expected followed by a consequent effect on the learners' outcomes and sense of entrepreneurship as well as a "cascade" effect on the School Learning community/Professional Community in terms of sharing of "good practices" , innovative tools and methodologies regarding Career Guidance and Internship Organisation coming from an international training environment.POTENTIAL LONGER TERM BENEFITS The potential longer benefits will derive from dramatic changes : an Educational  Change  in the School Curricula design, in the sense of an  the alignment of the Curricula to the labour market requirements , on the Guidance and Counseling and Internship  activities and on the promotion of  teachers'continuing education ; a change in the Institutional Commitment  and in the Educational Policies  as to the promotion of an active  liasing process between Education and Training and the world of work, enterprises and business in order to create successful synergies in favour of youth employment.
European Citizenship Best Business Practice for HAK Innsbruck

Our project consists of a 14-day stay in Italy or France, depending on the choosen second language, with work placements in various enterprises. This project will be carried out for the first time next school year but has already been very successfully carried out for ten times in Brighton in the UK, thus helping us a lot in our new project.  Our students can choose among the sectors office, retail, and different offices , with a large focus on customer contact and communication. The highest principle is immersion, the complete integration into the world of our target language, with as little chance as possible to use our native languages. Aim and result are improved Italian or French skills, a better understanding of the world of work, a synergy between learning and work, social and intercultural competence, the ability to survive in a foreign-language environment, advertising Austria abroad and the perception of a united Europe worth working at.
Turiec do Európy, Európa do Turca 2015

This project is a follow up of a successful implementation of Turiec to Europe, Europe to Turiec 2014 (Erasmus+ KA1 project), currently implemented in cooperation within consortium. The connection of VET formal education covered by schools and non-formal education provided by K.A.B.A. Slovensko (career guidance, adult education, bilan de compétences) as experienced coordinator was a great choice with significant added value for all interested. The schools became more active in the mobilities, students gained vocational experience they brought back home. To prepare this project as consortium was a challenge, since the members (including new member) had to think about strategy of development in upcoming years and also because for 2015 we included several innovations. 
Among most important is inclusion of elements of ECVET. We are going to implement them in electronically (online) for on our portal www.ucetzrucnosti.sk (transl.: "skillsaccount"), where the participants of current project are already filling their daily reports under supervision of VET teachers. 
To raise the number of involved participants within the set budget according the availability of schools we want to create a twin or "buddy" for each participant. These would be students of the same field that before and during mobility communicate with participant abroad and hopefully observing the gaining of competencies by participant they would be motivated to work on their own personal development. 
As the last innovation we are planning to do a pilot combined-mobility from two schools that have partially overlapping fields. We will create miniproject teams that will get a task. For successful dealing with the task the students of both schools within the team have to cooperate before and during mobility, in foreign environment and foreign language. We expect bigger impact compared to two single mobilities with lower costs. 
The main goal of the project is within vocational practice to place 18 students of Obchodna Akademia Martin in the field business academy and 28 students of Stredná priemyslená škola Martin in the fields electronics, mechatronics, logistics and technical lyceum to VET schools and training institutes in UK and Czech republic, then 34 students of SOŠ of trade and services in Martin in the gastronomy and hotel services, cosmetics and hairdresser into companies in Italy, Spain and at VET school and it's local partners in Poland and 14 students SOŠ Turany of agricultural entrepreneurship - breeding and horse riding in Italian companies. In three rounds we are planning to send 6 members of schools' management and 7 VET teachers for vocational education to schools in Greece, Czech republic and Italy. 
Among other goals belongs successful implementation of ECVET elements, to know how to evaluate and validate gained skills and competencies, identify key competencies of participants, using bilan de compétences, involvement of management and VET teachers in participating on mobilities and so prepare field for broader cooperation in further years not only by sending but also hosting teachers and students, allow the participants to improve their language skills and bring new techniques and proposals for improvement of study programs. 
In total there will be in involved 94 students, out of which 46 in VET institutes and 48 in companies, 6 members of management and 7 VET teachers and 13 more teachers in role of accompanying person. Among main activities (A1) belong 3 rounds of staff mobilities to Italy, Greece and Czech Republic, (A2) 4 rounds of students for 2 weeks to companies abroad to Italy, Poland and Spain and (A3) 4 rounds of students to VET institutes for 2 weeks in UK and Czech republic. 
The aim of the project is on practical education and during preparation we will use tools of bilan de competénces that we imported via Leonardo TOI in 2012. In maximum available measure we will use online tools for monitoring and communication (Skype, email). All participants, foreign partners and consortium members with local media partners will join the dissemination activities using social media and company websites. 
94 students that will gain practical experience abroad will have - when entering labour market experience and competencies that will help them to find work in their field. 13 teachers/managers will gain knowledge in the area of school management and various VET fields. The participants will obtain certificate from partners and bilan du compétences evaluation. Consortium members will gain through mobilities of students and staff new international experience and new partners for further projects. 
With implementing of this project we will raise the number of mobilities in Erasmus+ and thanks to many partners we will spread good name of the program. The consortium will compete to gain Mobility Charter in VET, since we want long term cooperation and promote our region Turiec in EU and bring the best from EU to Turiec.
Technisch en beroepsonderwijs op Emmaus gaat Europees met Erasmus+

Technical and vocational education in Flanders is in a downward spiral. Student and their parents look for other forms of education because they have a wrong picture of the prospects of "the engineer." Therefore, the offer of an internship abroad a way to show that with technical and vocational education are many possibilities for grabs. Within the European market already are many opportunities that are easily accessible with a technical or professional qualifications.

With this project we want to do a first tentative start to integrate foreign internships for our students in the curriculum.  For now fully voluntary, but nevertheless part of the GIP / practice scores on the assessments. Students from the 5th and 6th year (16 till 18) can apply to do an internship in one of the internship companies in Germany or Finland. Students from the departments Machine Tools, Garage, Metal processing techniques, Electrical installation techniques, Electromechanics and Trade can candidate.

In the second part of this application, we focus on the teachers who are going to look at the European neighbors how they approach things. Teachers should then come up with creative ideas that will contribute to both the technical and vocational education in our traditional Flanders more attractive to students. Both teachers of general subjects and teachers technical or practical subjects will study the educational ingenuity in Finnish, German, Italian and English education. It must be the intention to bring best practices and implement them in our own school.

Consortium of secondary schools in the Posavje region and Kindergarten Mavrica Brežice are submitting a project titled "Stopimo skupaj".  We would like to organize a work placement mobility for 30 students of three secondary vocational schools and four staff mobilities to improve organizational and didactic approaches in organizations. The priority is to implement examples of good practice in the local area. 
The idea of consortium has developed as a result of decline in number of students in the last four years. It seems that we need to develop new strategies to solve the problem. In our opinion work experience abroad, different methods of work and actual work experience as well as real life experience can help us to increase the number of students. Project activities are going to improve students' language, social and professional skills as well as their awareness of finding their own way in entrepreneurship.  Students will write business plans and try to bring foreign practice in local area. One of the aims is to improve their confidence, also in the reference of work mobility in the European labour market.  
The project will provide the employees with theoretical and practical knowledge of management in educational institutions. Furthermore, they will gain experience from taking part in international projects, co-working with parents and local community, carrying out “matura” exams and coping with decreasing number of students. Teachers are also interested in the extent of incorporation of economy in general curriculum. The kindergarten employees are keen to acquire modern pedagogical approaches and learn about examples of good practice, team management within an institution, organization of work experience and get an overview of a curriculum. 
Schools are going to plan the activities together, set unified standards for selection of candidates and gain team work experience within the consortium. Results of our work are planned to be published on our own web site. What is more, all the employees involved will be obliged to implement their new experience in their work environment. This way the results should become more sustainable and we hope to motivate the employees and students to take part in mobility over the next years.
Get Professional Skills in Europe - III

The project Work and Learn in Europe is going to involve 3rd-year-students of Tomas Bata Business Academy Zlin. We are going to include 18 students of all study fields, which are: business economics, tourism, international trade and public administration. The students are going to spend four weeks working in Plymouth - Great Britain, and Leipzig - Germany during May 2016, each of them doing job connected with their branch of study. 
The trainees will gain work experience and they will learn about the organization, strategies and work habits in the European environment. The main aims of the project are obtaining practical skills specific for the particular jobs, improving in English/German communication, learning about European culture and behaviour, and becoming more self-confident. The trainees will learn to solve problems and be independent in the English or German speaking environment. This work experience will be also motivating for the trainees and their schoolmates as well as for future vocational students. 
The outcomes: work experience recorded in Europass Mobility, which students will use when looking for a job both in the Czech Republic and in the whole European Union. Other outcomes will be better communication skills in English or German  considering everyday conversation at home and work, and better knowledge of special terminology in foreign laguages.
Our aim is also testing and impementation of ECVET as one of a series of European instruments that target improvements in recognition and transparency.
The long-term objective is to strenghten the employability of our students and facilitate their transition to the labour market.
Activities expected in the project Work and Learn in Europe support developing the European dimension of our insitution.

This year Josef Sousedík Secondary School at Vsetín is again participating in the Erasmus+ European programme with the focus on several main aims. The Mobility Project “With professional skills around Europe towards ECVET” develops our current international activities and involves our cooperation with two foreign partners: the tried-and-tested company of F+U Sachsen gGmbH from Germany and a new well-considered partner of Tellus Group from the UK. 
There are 14 students of The Applied Technology Programme (Autotronics), 3 apprentices of Pastry Cook vocational training and 3 student of Business Studies (Pastry Cooks) to go to Chemnitz in Germany.
During the single run of the study stay the participants will adopt new procedures, gain new competencies and experience. The students of The Applied Technology Programme will learn to find faults and diagnose automotive electronic problems by means of automotive diagnostic devices.
The mobility added value will be the Forklift Training designed (in compliance with the Article 134b of the Czech Labour Code, CSN 26 88 05 – Forklift driver) for the students of The Applied Technology Programme (Autotronics). 
The apprentices of the Pastry Cook vocational training will learn new technological procedures of Saxon pastry production. They will use varied kinds of materials, pastries and fillings. The students of business studies (Pastry Cooks) will focus on the modern technologies and their combination with traditional procedures. In addition, they will get new ideas for their business and explore marketing strategies which are used in the private sector of confectionaries to be able to stand up to the tough competition in our region.
12 students of the plumber specialization will travel to English Plymouth together. These trainees will focus on procedures of laying floor heating – from design to assembly, they will learn to use the pressed joints of different materials, they will get acquainted with concealed mounting Battery Modules, including their connections. The Josef Sousedík Secondary School Vsetín has already concluded a memorandum of understanding with two foreign countries. They have recognized each other as partners and have agreed on common criteria and procedures for quality assurance, evaluation and recognition of the results of the ECVET course obtained during the study period abroad.

Trainees of the mentioned Crafts will be the second and the third - year pupils and the fourth – year graduation students. The main aim of the project is to prevent unemployment, improvement to assert them on the European work market thanks to ECVET and support student´s motivation to study of craft branches. The operational target of the applicant is to keep interest in craft, to promote and attract handcrafted branches.

Our trainees will respect and observe safety at work, they will get acquainted with the organization of work of German and British experts, apply technical terminology and improve the language skills and professional communication. They will be led to active approach, flexibility and cooperation.
The project is based on educational documents. It has been created in accordance with the framework educational programmes and school educational plans and in relation to the development of the participants´ competencies.

It accepts the graduate profile and approves their competences gained through ECVET.
Foreign traineeships are recognized as part of the assessment of vocational training. During their stay, the trainees will be assessed by our German and English colleague teachers and by the teachers accompanying the students.

Added value is that the trainees will obtain The Europass Mobility, where ECVET elements will be incorporated. It can help them succeed on the labour market not only in the Czech Republic, but also in the whole European Union. 

They will also get certificates of completing the traineeship abroad – at our partners, F + U Sachsen gGmbH and Tellus Group.

If the project is approved, it will be realized in the following layout:  the first run F + U Sachsen gGmbH in Chemnitz (Germany) in autumn 2015; the second run Plymouth (Great Britain) in spring 2016.
Za novými zkušenostmi na reálná pracoviště do Velké Británie

The mobility in Europe offers next development of professional skills of pupils, obtaining practice of graduates in prospering hotels and restaurant in Great Britain. Because of these mobilities, the participants improve their position on the labour market. Tourism undergoes the dynamic development and changes on many levels. The success of our students depends on the ability to react flexibly on these changes in business and also to obtain experience in tourism business in the EU. The practice provides our students with further vocational and personal training. Their self-confidence and communication skills grow. We await deeper interest in the profession, rising cultural and general awareness. It encourages the students to learn during the whole life. The project reacts on the situation on the labour market. The purpose is to balance  the requirements of employer and the skills of our students, which would  prevent lifelong unemployment. The main aim is to apply the skills in the real environment - prosperous hotels and restaurants of the  EU. Moreover, the intention is to decrease the number of students who do not finish their studies. Language proficiency is also an integral part of the project because we want to enable students to take part in EVS or voluntary service after finishing studies at our school.
We are going to support 24 students in the following professions: cook, waiter, hairdresser, beautician in their effort to get professional qualification. We want to improve our students´ ability to speak and practice foreign languages in real environment, to help them to get  international experience and understand what European citizenship is about. The participant will be chosen according to their professional and communication skills and it will be put the emphasis on their socil background. We want to enable the students who are coming from the low social background in their effort to get prestigious practice abroad and contribute  to lifelong learning.
Before this practice we are going to sign contracts and prepare unit of learning on which students are going to work . Every internship will ensure one unit of learning. An accompanied person will check the students at their workplace. Mentoring will be provided.
The pupils are going to undergo the practice in the real workplace and do the course focused on communication and solving the problematical situation at the workplace.
The partner abroad is the warranty of the study visit - it was  the best provider of practice in 2012 and it was among the final competitors in 2013. It contributes to everyday working culture of the country and provides the participants an improved CV.
From the lifelong point of view we can see the main contribution in learning English and getting self-confidence. Thanks to  this cooperation, we want to increase the connection among formal, nonformal, professional training and labour market. The important part is also recognition of ECVET standards.
Ungdoms mulighet for kvalifisering og arbeid  i et åpent og multikulturelt Europa.

This application is a result of experience based on placements abroad for second year pupils attending Healthcare, Childhood and Youth Development. Our pupils have before had their placements in Lithuania (since 2007) and England (since 2013). In March 2015, 6 of our pupils (3 from each line of study), will go to Krakow, Poland. We wish to apply for placement in Krakow, Poland for both groups of pupils. 

We hope that a placement abroad will give our pupils both professional and personal development. The subject "Prosjekt til fordypning" gives the pupils the opportunity to gain experience in content, working methods and work in the profession. An international practice will give the pupils many opportunities for specialisation in one or more topics.

Our school also wants to motivate our pupils in order to prevent drop outs. This project will also make it possible to facilitate improved quality of learning and practise, and increase the possibility for pupils to find work both in Norway as well as in other European countries.

The target group is second year pupils attending Child- and youth care studies (BUA) and nursing assistants (HFA).  We wish to send 8 pupils and 2 accompanying teachers each year.

The pupils will have their placement in kindergartens and at different health-institutions. During the period of placement we also intend to focus on Polish culture and religion. Our school wish to offer our pupils different cultural experiencies, such as visits to museums, churches,  characteristic architecture, culinary traditions etc. We believe that this will make our pupils and teachers more tolerant regarding other cultures and respect for other norms and values. An experience that can be shared with collegues and other pupils at our school. Increased multicultural understanding will have a positive effect on the  social environment at our school. A competence aim that will be covered is increased knowledge of languages. They will also develop communication- and cooperation skills and increase their social competence. We hope a placement abroad will give our pupils professional insight and understanding regarding possibilities and challenges in a multicultural society. This is a competence that is important when working with people in different ages.

 Our school also focuses on the cooperation between our two vocational lines of studies and emphasizes relevant goals in these two lines of studies.

We will  focus a lot on communication, cultural understanding, tolerance and respect for other people's values and differencies.  Before the placement pupils and teachers will  prepare themselves by learning about the Polish healthsystem, kindergartens, culture and language in Poland. This is further described in the application.

We wish to promote our school as a school offering Healthcare, Childhood and Youth Development as lines of studies. In the longer term we also wish to recruit well qualified and motivated applicants that are suited to work in an open and multicultural Europe.
Les futurs boulangers, pâtissiers, cuisiniers, serveurs et professionnels des soins et service à la personne en marche vers une découverte professionnelle à travers l’Europe.

The professional school, recognized as a school for artistic and culinary specialities, as well as for services to the individual, intends thanks to this project to send 36 students in year twelve abroad for five weeks (as an integral part of their 22 weeks examination preparation programme).  They will go to: Plymouth (England), Valencia (Spain) and Leuze en Hainaut (Belgium).  After a rigorous selection process our students will be preparing for their professional diploma in the following specialities:  restaurant sales and service; cooking; bakery and pastry making; support, care and service to individuals.  The possibility of such a period of study abroad has attracted new students and families to our school.  For them, the possibility of a period of study abroad adds value to their professional training, allows them access to a European training programme, encourages them to consider themselves European citizens, and increases their employability. The piloting team intends to help them, both by creating a group dynamic and by offering  the logistical and practical help.  In conformity with the programme for the Professional Diploma (baccalauréat) over three years, with our aims and objectives and our school’s mission statement (point 2: recognize the student’s achievement in his/her studies, school and professional environment; point 3: strengthen the students’ interest in arts, culture and citizenship; objective 3.3: promote the mobility of students in Europe and internationally).  The objectives of our Académie (wider school district) also stipulate that we are to encourage success among all our students  and prevent drop-out by offering personalized training programmes, and also to develop the European citizenship of our students.The countries targeted (Belgium, Spain, England) are suited to the needs of the students concerned since it is necessary to know the dishes and working methods,the procedures used in service to the individual in Europe, as well as competence in English and Spanish at level B1+ to succeed in the continuous assessment part of their final year examination. Throughout their period of training,they can improve their linguistic competence, acquire professional skills, discover cultural differences, develop their autonomy, their ability to travel abroad, learning about the constraints of working in another country, compare methods, working times, technics, materials and procedures. They also have the possibility of gaining extra credits for their diploma thanks to this mobility programme which is an integral part of the examination.The student can also show his certificate of work placement,the Europass mobility,a language passport to a future employer.  An active piloting committee is at work in our school, made up of : the coordinating teacher, the Head Teacher, the resources manager, all the teachers principally involved in the project (teachers of Spanish, bakery and pastry-making, cookery, restaurant service and the coordinator of the department of services to the individual).The tools we use for all the members of the project : table of educational objectives, project specification, establishment charter, assessment and validation tools.Meetings with all the partners have been held during preparatory visits and the following elements have been decided: educational objectives and obligatory assessment proformas based on the defined programmes, modalities of the new mobility option in the Baccalauréat diploma, professional and everyday needs of the students, the appropriateness of the workplaces, living accommodation of the students, the costs, the accompaniment of the students by those permanently present  in partnership with and continuous liaison with the project leader, the students and their parents.For the participants the initial impact will be to obtain a good mark in the mobility option of the Baccalauréat , to succeed in the professional assessment of this period of work experience and finally to obtain the diploma.  Their capacity to communicate about their experience will also be very important: by sending the report to the partner school, by explaining their experience on the school’s website, the overseas work-experience blog, at the school’s open day by talking to future students, at the European work-experience day by motivating future candidates in the year below, at the moment of the award of the Mobility Europass,  by talking to the press ,parents and partners.  The teaching team will also help the students to pursue their studies and find suitable professional openings.  Thus this experience will be profitable to the students because they will be able to prove  to an employer, or at an interview for admission to another institution, that they are motivated by European opportunities in their chosen field and that they have acquired the professional skills and autonomy which will allow them to move ahead
Zabraňme tepelným ztrátám: Využití termografie II

The project Stop Heat Loss: Thermography in Use II follows the implemented project that is based on reducing the amount of energy required for heating and ventilation inside buildings and uses thermography for that. The new project is focused on how to lower unwanted heat losses through buildings and thus reduce heating demands. This can be achieved by a good-quality building envelope with a high-quality external thermal insulation system.
The mobility of students will be divided into two parts. In the first part, participants will study factors that affect microclimate inside a building, they will design an insulation system for the building, will develop the energy label of the building envelope. To achieve this, they will use thermography. Students will use ICT equipment with software that performs the calculation and assessment under applicable national legislation.
In the second part, participants will practise installation of thermal insulation systems. They will work with the latest insulation systems and practically acquire skills that will contribute to reducing energy consumption in building operations.
The mobility deals with these aspects:
- The technical design of the building
- The use of thermography to find points of heat loss and air leaks in existing buildings
- Practical installation methods of thermal insulation
The project follows the content of the educational programs of builder, construction and building maintenance. Its goal is to extend competencies of participants. The participants will gain practical skills, will get to know building insulation systems and materials used abroad, will use ICT technologies, will improve their skills in the field of thermography.
18 students will work in Germany, the UK and Lithuania. The organisations there guarantee high-quality cooperation in vocational education and training of future Czech craftsmen and technicians in construction sector. 
The applicant aims to maintain and increase interest in natural science and technical fields.

The project is focused on the initial professional training of the third-grade students of the secondary health medical school majoring in nursing and the second-grade students of the medical college– branches Diploma general nurse and
Diploma nutrition therapist. Within the project, two or three-week specialized practical trainings in Great Britain, Spain, Germany and Slovakia  will be implemented. 40 students from our school will participate during the project period.
The main goal of the project is to extend and innovate professional training at our school through such experience abroad. By
putting the project into practise, students should be able to compare nursing and nutrition care in Great Britain, Spain, Germany and Slovakia with the Czech one.
No less substantial aim is the support of foreign language qualification, possibility to check the ability to communicate in a foreign
language and broadening the vocabulary in the field of professional medical English and German. Thanks to the multicultural enviroment, students will also gain knowledge in the sphere of cultural and mental differences of foreign citizens and the development of their personal qualities (like independence, responsibility, tolerance) will also be supported.
Professional experience is the part of educational programmes of the above mentioned branches. ECVET is implemented at this project.  Professional educational stays abroad are to be planned for the very same period when the other students will take part in such working experience in the Czech Republic. After successful finishing of the practical training, students will be given a Europass Mobility and the training will be acknowledged as part of the compulsory practical training.
The output of the project will be a specialist courses for students from the other grades focused on the comparison of experiences
gained in the work places in foreign coutries and in the Czech Republic, or, more precisely, oddities and differences in nursing and
