ESTANCIAS INTERNACIONALES PARA ALUMNADO Y PERSONAL DEL PROGRAMA SEFED

Inform Foundation manages since 1987 the SEFED Programme (Simulation for Business Educational Purposes - The Practice Firm concept) which offers training to around 5.000 students delivered by 800 teachers in vocational training institutions and training for the unemployed in Spain. All these students are being trained in professional and social skills in the business and managing of companies field.

This professional and practical training aimed at finding jobs is well know and acknowledged by the Ministry of Labour from the Generalitat of Catalonia issuing a professional certificate with level 2 or by the corresponding Ministry of Education issuing a medium level of vocational training in the administration or comercial field.

Inform has always considered working experiences abroad as part of and an added value to the training delivered in the SEFED Programme. Thus, Erasmus + K1 Programme allows us to support our students and teachers in training activities to achieve and use knowledge, skills and qualifications for their personal development, ocupability and participation in the European labour market. 

The participants of this project are:

- Unemployed students or VET students (mainly young people and women over 25 years old) who are being trained in the SEFED Programme and who would like to improve not only their knowledge and skills in the business field, undertaking working experience stays in Ireland or Great Britain, but their language skills as well. Thus, the project is about to undertake 70 working stays in Irish or UK companies and undertake business and management tasks during one, two or three months as a maximum as participants cannot have longer stays because of personal reasons and the need they have to look for jobs.

- Teachers and professional staff working for the SEFED Programme: the project allows us to offer a unique opportunity for teachers and professional staff working for the SEFED Programme to be able to share and improve their knwoledge and experiences in a different country and in different organizations, including the transfer of skills and/or methods and innovative ways of doing things in the training field. The transfer of know-how is meant to improve the quality and access to continuous training, to update and adapt the european educational and training systems. When improving knowledge, attitudes and individual skills from all professional staff involved in the SEFED Programme, we will improve in the development of the european labour market and social economy.
The project is based on professional stays in 3 countries, 2 of them already have practice firm networks and are members of Europen-Pen International, from which Inform Foundation is a founding member. Specifically, the professional/pedagogical team will undertake training stays for 5 days in different training organizations which have practice firms in Italy and Austria in which teachers and professional staff will share experiences and best practices regarding the practice firm concept, the organization and management of practice firms as active learning tools.
There will also be some stays in Ireland in which there will be a combination of know-how transfer, innovative learning ways of doing things and application of IT in training. There will also be visits to Irish companies so as to undertake job-shadowing.
The participants will be teachers in language skills, foreign trade skills and counselors and training professional staff. There will also be professional staff from Inform Foundation with the aim to set up links with the Central Offices for Practice Firms from the 2 members of Europen-Pen International (Italy and Austria)

The project is meant to improve the quality of the SEFED Programme, the ocupability and competitivity of students and professional staff in training participating in the project.

To prove the success there has been some success indicators set up as the level of labour ocupability of students, the improvement degree of language skills, or the increase of foreign trade orders.
Mobilité et découverte des pratiques professionnelles pour des élèves de filière professionnelle

We are a secondary school located in Saint Ouen (93400). We propose several trainings : general, technological and professional. We propose a 3-years professional training which prepares a vocational high school diploma specialized in management and administration. In this training, we have opened a european section for the second and the third level. After this professionnal training, we also propose a complementary distinction (1 year) with specialization in "commercial assistant job".This aditional training will open in september 2015. 
We propose mobilities to our participants who are pupils from these professional trainings and often come from unprivileged  background. They start the training courses with an handicap, it is not like pupils coming from general classes. They do not have an european culture and opening. The families can not pay intensive courses of language or journeys for their children. 
We have decided to propose mobilities to 25 pupils studying in our vocational diploma training and also pupils preparing the complementary distinction training. This complementary mention completes our vocational diploma training and will allow our participants to realize another mobility. 
This project is for 25 participants studying in our european section and in our complementary distinction. For this project, we have chosen Tellus Group. Tellus Group is a VET training provider and proposes a training alternating professional training and mobilities. 
The objectives or our project are : work experience, english level improvement, enrichment of our professional trainings thanks to european mobilities, several certifications and national/european tools (Europass document, passport of languages, APTed certification, skills portfolio, more chances to integrate the labor market and more things in the CV. 
The impact of our project is local : valuation of our professionnal training with the european section and the complementary distinction, improving results, motivation of our participants, improving the english level, european culture and citizenship. The impact is also regional and national : results for the vocational diploma (a-level), results for the complementary training, attractiveness of our school and our professional section in Seine-Saint-Denis, partnership with  a european company like Tellus Group. 
We hope to launch our project with success and to offer the most completed professional training to our participants in order to offer them all the work experiences and skills to integrate the labor market or to continue their studies. 
We know that our project will allow our participants to have a european culture, to improve their english level and to get skills. Some of them will be able to realize other mobilities, to study abroad, to validate other skills during their life training thanks to the skills porfolio, to continue their studies or to work.
"Ouvrez le champ des possibles : Oz a Zot !"

Reunion Island, a French overseas department located in Indian Ocean, off Madagascar, presents a very specific situation with alarming statistics concerning employment. For four years, the unemployment rate has been at 29%, which represents 59% of the young people aged between 18 and 25 years old. The geographic isolation of the island imposes a certain degree of mobility the young people from Reunion.
Our professional training center is aimed at opening the range of opportunities for this target group. Most of young people are under skilled which means that we must be innovative in providing alternative training solutions, through non-formal education, based on experience and hands-on learning. But here on the island, mobility is not easy to organize.

The aims of the project are :
- to provide to young people from the island an opportunity of mobility to discover new horizons
- to nurture an open-mind and curiosity which are needed for the job market, here or elsewhere
- to improve their linguistic skills, which are vital for the tourism industry on the island
- to gain experience in the sector as part of a vocational validation project to strengthen their skills.

The project called "Ouvrir le champ des possibles, Oz a Zot !", offers to 30 unemployed young people from Reunion, aged between 18 and 25 years old, the opportunity to be trained via an internship in a European firm (Spanish, Italian, Irish or British) for 3 months. The project caters for a linguistic preparation, intercultural workshops and vocational issues before departure. The project also caters for a follow up after the mobility to increase the value of this experience.

The expected impacts, in addition to the advantages for the participants, are to promote the European mobility as a tool for integration and to foster our organisation in the field of mobility and to thus develop new projects.

The "Proval: passport to Europa" project requested by the IES Escolas Proval is contextualized within the Erasmus + Training Action Programme "Mobility of persons based learning (KA1)". The project aims to provide students of intermediate Vocational Training in Electronics and Administration the possibility of their On the Job Training (FCT) in European companies. The project also aims to facilitate to the center staff the possibility of job-shadowing practices in European institutions.

The project arises primarily due to the interest shown by students in perform vocational training practices abroad, and the growing difficulty for teachers of vocational training to find suitable companies to perform FCT practices.

The project offers 12 mobilities for internships in companies in Germany, Italy, Portugal and the UK for 12 weeks to cover 410 hours of practical training in two annual periods project: from September to December and from March to June. The main objectives pursued with these VET mobilities are:
a) Help students adjust to the needs of the European labor market and to have more and better employment opportunities
b) Allow students to develop specific skills, including language, and expand their knowledge on the economic and social culture of the host country while gaining work experience.
c) Promote cooperation between the school and companies.
d) Contribute to the development of a highly skilled group of young, open-minded and internationally experienced as professionals
e) Acquisition of knowledge and skills with a view to personal and professional development
f) Encourage the learning of foreign languages

It is intended with this mobility that students achieve the above objectives and be better prepared to enter the European or Spanish labor market. In short, obtaining a first work experience in an international environment.


The project offers 3 mobilities for center staff to Germany, Italy and the UK. The main objectives pursued are:
a) Expand the possibilities for personal and professional development of teachers
b) Promote the multiplier effect which will hold the international experience of teachers
c) Promote the exchange of technical methods and experiences on pedagogical methods
d) Strengthen links between the center and the entities with whom training arrangements are made

IES Escolas Proval center ( Issuing Center and organizer of Mobility )  is responsible for:
- Request to the SEPIE the Erasmus grant for key 1 + Action program
-Make an agreement with the host companies (Annex I translated into English)
- Request authorization to the administration to carry out the placement of the student abroad
-Make a report (by the secretary of the Centre) in accordance with the student is covered by school insurance
-Conduct an individualized plan of FCT and translate it into English.
- Define the objectives of stay
- Select the participants
- Prepare the participants
-Establish a contract including a training agreement
- Help participants manage the transport, accommodation and insurance
- Negotiate an individual program
- Agree on monitoring and mentoring arrangements
- Implement agreed validation procedures
- Establish appropriate communication channels
- Evaluate the progress of the project so continues
- Generate the Europass Mobility Certificate for the Student
-Make the final project report and sendit to SEPIE through the Movility Tool

Intermediary companies commit to :
-Find accommodation for students
- Manage and look for host companies in Italy and the UK
- Keepa continous  track of the students
-Promote cultural understanding and mentality of the host country 
- Provide practical support if required 

The desired impact of the project on participants is to help achieving a technical degree through On the Job Training in European businesses, an improved employment opportunities , knowledge of new cultures and new languages that can help them to consolidate a European entity and to support their future employability .

The desired impact on our organization is to acquire new competencies and skills in relation to foreign companies that can help us to improve the training of future students.

The consortium "Mobility Picardie 2015" (MOPIC 15) will boost European mobility in Company abroad for the benefit of 114 young people and 10 educational staff people in the field of initial vocational training.

Picardy is a “young” French region: under 20 years old people represent 26.5% of the population (2 points higher than the national average). But young people from Picardie must face difficulties to achieve vocational training: in 2010, people aged 15 to 29 are 25% without any degree, (5% more than the national average). Picardy is thus the second region of France with the most "dropouts" studies.

The MOPIC 15 project's main objective is to promote the mobility of learners in the field of vocational training to secure their curricula and to promote their employability.

114 young people of Picardy enrolled in vocational school or apprenticeship, from various sectors, will live a rich human and professional experience in receiving a training period in a company abroad. While 10 educational staff people will also have the opportunity to discover new educational experiences abroad.

A steering committee will oversee the implementation of the project and will include various committees / working groups, one in charge of monitoring and animation. Each consortium member institution will implement its mobility project with the support of the Steering Committee.

Expected impact on young beneficiaries of mobility projects from MOPIC 15 :
 - Improving the propensity for mobility,
 - Improvement of openness to the world and Europe,
 - Improving professional skills
 - Improved recovery rates or further study.
 Expected impact on educational staff beneficiaries of mobility projects:
 - Improving teaching skills,
 - Improved knowledge of European devices
 - Strengthening the motivation for the organization of mobility projects.
 Impact on participating organizations (educational / training institutions institutions)
 - Development of the European and international openness
 - Developing the attractiveness (selected orientation and active young people to those institutions / organizations) and awareness,
 - Improving the skills of administrative teams in terms of monitoring and project management.

MOPIC 15 project aims to answers to Picardy territory’s issue (encourage professional mobility, resumption of study and minimum access level degrees 5, further studies in higher education, equal access to vocational training, rise level formation). MOPIC 15 will help reviving interest of institutions and training organizations for European and international mobility. It will disseminate good practice to give rise to other European projects.
"Mobilność przede wszystkim, czyli jak uczniowie ZSP nr 1 w Słupsku zdobywają  doświadczenie zawodowe w Europie"

The project concerns mobility of third grade students of Technical School no 1 in Slupsk.    The students are trained in professions of Technician of Hospitality Industry  and Catering. The students are devided into two 15- person groups for April and October in 2016 in Porstmouth in England. The project concerns the students` training period in English hotels and restaurants based on signed with a partner so called “Agreement about training period programme” and  participants` needs, curriculum for professions of Hospitality Industry and Catering Industry and additionally it is based on features of the English employers. The project arose as a consequence of the school policy associated with the increase of the internationalization in the school functioning It is done by endeavouring to enlarge the  effectiveness and quality of teaching process. Additionally, the project is aiming into balanced and intelligent developement that supports social inclusion. 

The project will be fulfilled in a partnership with an experienced company called  Tellus Group in the UK that is based in Plymouth. The company is an organization that has participated in a lot of similar projects and it ensures satisfaction with an organized training period for students. The advantage of the project is an opportunity to gain additional skills   by students that will help them to enter the European and Polish labor market - APT.

The aim of the project is to develop for students the opportunities to gain work experience in actual working conditions of the European environment in a tourist place, but not in isolation from the school knowledge, to prepare students for professional performing their job tasks and the formation of a sense of initiative and entrepreneurship. An important goal of the project is to pursuit for the growth of language and social competence.

The project will have significant influence on the professional as well as social development of the  project participants including the development of qualities such as independence,    self-discipline, responsibility, dealing with difficult situations, teamwork, creativity, assertiveness,   communication ability, building relationships with the surrounding, time management. The training period in England will  improve the linguistic competence of the students in the field of conscious, effective and free communication at the professional level, cultural as well as in everyday life and increase the chances of passing the professional examinations. Thanks to this, the students will have bigger chances to be employed after finishing the school. The project will have a positive impact on increasing the mobility          of graduates in seeking employment in a situation of high unemployment in our region.

Fulfilling the project by the school will improve the quality of education process, it will make more attractive our educational offer, strengthen the international dimension of our school, will affect the development of international cooperation and the promotion of European and intercultural awareness among young people and the whole school environment. The school will gain experience that will be used to enlarge international element in the curriculum for these professions. Moreover, fulfilling the project will have a positive effect on a local environment- it will affect in reduction social exclusion and provide young people with a good start in the labor market.
Mam wiedzę mam umiejętności nie boję się przyszłości!!!

I have knowledge , I have skills and  I am not afraid of using it.

It's a big project  many challenges both for the organizer and for three foreign partners. The partners are organizations from Germany, Spain and the UK.
It proposes increasing international mobility of 68 students and 10 teachers from PZS nr 1 in Pszczyna.
The target groups of the project are students enrolled in the following professions:
car vehicles technician
hairdressing services technician
car mechanic
barber
locksmith
electrician
seller
confectioner
baker
fitter of networks, devices and sanitary - plumber
vehicle electrician
cook

as well as teachers of: mechanical, hairdressing, engineering, construction, catering, commercial; entrepreneurship teachers, foreign language training fields and managing staff.

The number of participants in a given occupation, the teaching staff will be determined in the course of recruitment, and after consultation with the host partners . The main objectives of the project is:  for students to raise their professional, social, linguistic competence, to form the ability to work in a team and strive to achieve the desired objectives.
Also important is the fact that we aim at the acquisition of new skills and new knowledge by students in their profession and to strengthen the knowledge and skills they have  already possessed. In the case of teachers we want them to learn new training methods, new techniques used in their sectors and also, in the case of this project, the Spanish system of vocational training. We believe that new methods learned during this enterprise will be applied in their teaching. We also want them to compare the issues they teach our students to what is taught outside Poland.

Planned activities include (following the approval and signing the financial agreement):
Refinement with the project partners all aspects of ECVET
Refinement of issues related to internship program so that it will be fully coherent with the objectives
Signing of the relevant agreements with the host organization as well as with participants of the project,
Recruiting participants
Appointing guardians for trainees,
Conducting language, pedagogical, cultural, health and safety training
Ensuring transport, accommodation, insurance and all necessary materials to carry out an internship for all participants
The purchase of equipment and materials,
Organization of the document – EKUZ
Safe conducting internships
Conducting ongoing monitoring of the implementation of the internship,
Ensuring systematic reporting of participants,
Organization of the Europass Mobility document and documents related to ECVET
Running a campaign promoting the project,
organization of pre-journey meetings and evaluation of the project with participants,
Promoting effects and outcomes related to the project in local environment,
Publication of materials in the local media, on the school website,
Timely submission of the report of the beneficiary,
Correct and timely financial settlement of the project,
Ensuring the sustainability of results.

We expect that the results of the project will be:
- Raising the students' knowledge in the field of professions in which they are trained,
- Learning new techniques related to their profession by students ,
- Understanding  the Spanish vocational training system by teachers
- Learning by teachers new forms and methods of work in vocational training in their industries,
- Improving language, professional and social competence of participants
- Increasing the international mobility of Polish citizens ,
- Involving more teachers in matters related to the implementation of EU projects
- Making employers aware of how important it is for their students acquire the skills and experience in foreign companies,
- Increasing the importance of our school in the local community,
- Enhancing methods of education,
- Increasing the effectiveness of education,
- Demonstrating the correlation between theory and practice,
- Implementation of the European path of institution development .

The project implementation will positively influence participants in the project, the school and the local environment, employers and institutions connected with education. In the context of the long-term impact, not without significance is the fact that our students have taken part in  the implementation of foreign internships for many years. We hope that thanks to the project, another group of our students will realize the awaited internship and in the nearest future thanks to their experience, knowledge and skills gained and developed during the internship will be motivator for students to participate in future internships.

In the case of the teachers- learned new techniques combined with those already used in both professional  and related to teaching methodology issues will be reflected in the development of  methods of  teaching our students. We strive to ensure that our graduates will be  well repared prepared for life.
Staże zagraniczne jako inwestycja w sukces zawodowy

The applicant for the Erasmus+  project is the cluster of Secondary Schools (ZSP Nr 1) in Lowicz named after 10 Infantry Regiment. The partner is Tellus (Group) Ltd, based  in Plymouth.
The participants of the project will be a group of 16 students being educated in the professions such as: automotive technicans, mechanics, mechatronics and IT technicians. The duration of the training/ practice is two weeks (10 days).
The main objective of the project is to improve the quality and novelty in vocational education in given Secondary School No. 1 in Łowicz by gaining new skills, linguistic and cultural competence. The project will let the students to  achieve specific objectives, namely familiarazing with the English working standards, with technological and quality standards.  Familirazing with working conditions, typical equipment and procedures in a workplace are the following specific objectives. The project participants will get professional training in mechanics, mechatronics, IT and automotive enterprises. The expected effect of the project is the project partisipants' aquisition of  a practical knowledge and gaining professional experience which is aimed to lead to the increase of the participants'  professional potential on a labor market and to improve their linguistic competence (mainly professional vocabulary and its practical application).  The place of exchange is Plymouth where our project partner is bared. The place, because of its versatility, excellent hardware and competent staff , will allow the students to willtake full advantage of the training and archive objectives.  The partner will also  provide us with the projects carers, the accommodation and meals and the adequate cultural programmes. The participation in the project is free of charge. The declaration of participation (after going through the recruitment process successfuly)  obliges the student to the full implementation into the intended action. 
The placements are intended for February 2016.

Łowickie Centrum Kształcenia Ustawicznego(Continuing Education Centre) in Łowicz is the applicant for the Erasmus + Project together with the English partner - Tellus Group based in Plymouth. 
The participants of the project will be a group of students being educated in the professions such as: massage therapists and pharmacy technicians. The duration of the the training / practice is designed for two weeks (10 day).
The improvement of the quality of education and the introduction of novelty into that sector by gaining new skills, linguistic and cultural competence are the main objectives behind the project.   The project will let the students to achieve specific objectives, namely  familiarizing them with the  working standards in England as well as  with the technological and quality standards. Familiarizing with working conditions, the professional equipment and the procedures in a workplace are the following specific objectives. The project participants will get professional training in national health service organisations and pharmasists. The expected effect of the project is the participants' acquisition of the practical knowledge and gaining professional experience. Those two effects  are aimed to lead to the increase of the students' professional   potential  on the labour market and to improve their linguistic competence (mainly English professional vocabulary and its practical application). The place of exchange  is Plymouth where our project partner is located. The place, owing to its excellent hardware and competent staff will allow the participants to benefit from  the training and to achieve the objectives. The project carers / councellors will also provide the students with the accommodation and meals as well as adequate cultural programmes. The participation in the project is free of charge. The declaration of participation (after successful  recruitment process) obliges the students to full implementation in the intended action.  The placemants   are designed for February 2016.

This mobility project will be developed by the IES Fermín Bouza Brey, of Vilagarcia de Arousa (Galicia), a secondary school that offers: ESO, Vocational Education (short cycles, Higher education and Vocational Basic), Secondary and Sport Education in Basketball Sport Technician. Born from the need of increasing internationalization of companies and their staff need to incorporate availability of international mobility, commitment to improving the skills of management and organization of the center and its faculty, improving the skills of students facing a employability more and better career prospects, increased language skills, etc.
The principal aims of mobilities will be:
- Increasing skills and general abilities related to market work and contribute for a cohesionated society which builds bridges between the labour market and the education world.
- Developing training, more recent innovation and internationalization at all levels
- Promote the need for a European conscience, encouraging reformers principles at national level to modernize the education and training system, giving an example of good practice and recognizing EU tools. 
- Increasing international dimension of education and training through cooperation between institutions and partners
- To encourage the teaching and learning of languages and promoting an intercultural awareness and spread the linguistic diversity of the EU. 
The project shows 4 mobilities: 2 for students and 2 for teachers. The profile of students, by which is meant the activity, are students of first courses of FP (IMA) and the teaching staff would be  who are involved at that level. That is, the first two levels of Vocational training course of Electromechanical Maintenance. These students are prepared to exercise electromechanical maintenance technicians in companies. The main employment destiny of students is a company, so both partners comply with this premise . The type of cycle is usually faced to:
- In the areas of execution of maintenance and repair of machinery and industrial equipment.
- A production areas in automated processes as responsible of lines, integrating the production and maintenance functions.
- A production areas making machinery manufacturing assembly, installation and technical assistance plan.
The mobilities of students will last for 2 months in order to complete the module of Job Training (FCT) defined in the curriculum of the training cycle
The mobilities of teachers will be for job shadowing in a company of the industrial sector and a Vocational Training Centre in order to identify different teaching methodologies.
The methodology used to conduct the project will be working with the intermediary company Tellus Group, which is committed to accommodating students with families, provide language training, provide a suitable company profile for pupils to practice, and safety training health, cultural visits, etc that gives us everything raised as bases of mobility. The communication between the partners will be fluent, including the intermediary partner, the sending institution and the company chosen, using CIT tools that will maintain high cohesion between the objectives and the development of mobility.
As a project which contains mobility of students and staff of educational institutions we are going to try to get:
- Contribute to the training of young people as qualified, open and experienced professionals abroad.
- Promoting language learning and culture of the countries of the European Union and promote integration between different cultures.
- Encourage the update and recycling of teachers involved in teaching of the cycle. This training will also cover personal cultural, linguistic and educational areas.
The benefits of participating in a European program of this nature is mainly focused on:
- The training cycle has much more publicity, which will mean that more students are interested in making it.
- Through this program the students were expanded the range of possibilities to find work when they obtain the title of Technician, as companies valued pleasantly availability to the mobility of workers.
- This project will build the first steps for future more students and technicians to benefit from these agreements and going to work or train to different regions of the European Union.
- Improve cooperation between companies and institutions
- Promote European integration and promote the acceptance of the partners involved in other countries.
- Motivate to teachers to increase their knowledge and skills in the face of better training for their students.
Praktyka zawodowa w Anglii, Niemczech i na Malcie szansą lepszego startu zawodowego dla uczniów Zespołu Szkół nr 2 w Sanoku

The project is a continuation and is complementary to the assumptions of the mobility project being currently done in the Erasmus+ programme, and just completed  mobility project in Leonardo da Vinci programme. The project participants will be 72 students from  technical and vocational school of ZS No. 2 in Sanok, studying to become  telecommunications technican, mechanic technician, automotive technician,, environmental protection technician and a car mechanic and 3 teachers of vocational education. Students will take an apprenticeship in workplaces and companies corresponding to their field of study in Malta and vocational training centers in Germany and the UK. There will be four groups of students going abroad. In February 2016 20 pupils of technical and vocational classes will go on a 2-week course of AutoCAD, in September 2016 16 students- mechanic technicians and automotive technicians will go on a 4-wee- training to a training center in the UK and 16 pupils- telecommunications technicians and environmental protection technicians will leave for vocational training in companies in Malta. In January 2017, another group of 20 students of technical and vocational classes will go on a 2-week course of AutoCAD. Apprenticeship programs have been developed in close connection with the guidelines of apprenticeship programs based on the curriculum of particular professions, but are to be implemented on the basis of modern facilities and equipment, and focus on learning new technologies and to develop skills particularly desired by the local labor market. Within the project  3 ZS2 vocational teachers will participate in the training of staff of job-shadowing type in March 2016 in a partner school in Germany. 
Before leaving for an internship, students and teachers will receive support in the form of  linguistic, cultural and pedagogical preparation .
 The project is a response to a problem which occurred in our school: poor recruitment to school, poor school performance, and consequently poor performance in professional examinations and Matura examinations. As a result, fewer students continue their education after secondary school, and not even all of them take the exams. After examining the problem we tried  to solve it on many levels, but in-depth analysis in the form of interviews and surveys showed that the primary cause of failure is lack of motivation for learning, lack of faith in students' own abilities and lack of prospects for the future. An additional problem is a nationwide trend, which is  the popularity of general education over vocational training among junior high school students. To change this situation, we have developed a project whose main goal is to increase students' motivation to develop knowledge and improve skills, gain new skills, improve language skills: English and German, increase the mobility of participants, increase their chances on European and national labor market, increase self-esteem, increse intercultural competences, improve the quality and attractiveness of vocational education in the school and in the region, prevent early school leaving and reduce failure in education. Thanks to the cooperation with a partner school in Germany and the training of job-shadowing, our employees will expand their professional competence and language. They will  develop their skills in the diagnosis of pupils' needs and learn more attractive teaching meathods. The cooperation will contribute to the exchange of best practices, gaining experience through practical activities and ability to cooperate at the international level. On the basis of the experience of the German school we will develop a system that will contribute to diagnosing and assisting students with educational problems more professionally. The project is also  a preparation for the planned strategic partnership in the field of education, training and youth, which we intend to participate in the partner institution. 
The most important results of the project will include obtaining Europass Mobility certificate , obtaining ECVET points, acquiring new skills, improving language skills and filling in the European Language Passport, increasing the mobility of participants, increasing students' chances on European and national labor market, increasing self-esteem and motivation to learn, which will help to reduce the number of early school leavers, learn intercultural competences among students and teachers, improve the quality and attractiveness of vocational education in the school and in the region, as well as the preparation to the strategic partnership in the future.
Młodzież z pasją - kształcenie zawodowe na południu Europy

The Participants of the Project will be 30 students of Zespol Szkol Gastronomiczno-Hotelarskich in Bytom: a technician of hotel industry, a technician of nutrition and household. Bytom, where our school is located, is characterized with the high rate of unemployment – 21, 5%. Vocational education based on work practice in our country and abroad is the possibility for young people to find  work more easily and to experience mobility regarding their professional skills  - they can work in different places and they are experts in their area. The possibility to work in a real company will enable  the Beneficiaries group to work as a team and to take responsibility for the quality of their work.
The host organization , Tellus Limited which is a training center, will provide the Beneficiaries  with both – cultural and language training and possibility of practical training at workplaces.It is a dynamic organization, which we cooperate with fine results. The four-week traineeship will take place in Rome and Salamanca in two turns in years 2016 and 2017, Each time a group of 15 carefully chosen benericiaries will go with one chaperon . The period of language-cultural preparation and the  places of practical training - Spanish and Italian hotels and restaurants -are carefully chosen to meet the beneficiaries' needs and make the education effective to further  improve the skills at foreign workplaces, in particular those connected with the Mediterrenean and Spanish cuisine.ZSGH will provide all the logistics for the beneficiaries: insurance and care, workplaces according to their needs, accommodation, transport and food.
The aim of the Project is to improve the vocational competence of our students at a workplace - facing real life situations  experiencing  work at places with European standards, gaining experience different from the one they can get in Poland.  As a result the youth taking part in the Project  will be able to assess their preparation, vocational competence and practical skills enriched with vocational foreign language practice in the Southern European job market.  The aim of the Project is also to encourage the students to learn foreign languages and increase language competence by the Beneficiaries, mainly within the professional  vocational linguistic area. A foreign language becomes a tool used in their professional work.Another result will be an increase of their self-esteem.
One of the long term benefits of the project will also enabling our students, especially those at risk from social ills and social exclusion, to find employment after graduation,  raise their mobility in job searching and to find out the labour market orientation needs- experience exchange and cooperation with workplaces.
The partners of the Project will be able to assess the level of Beneficiaries' practical knowledge, verify their skills and specify their usefulness on the European labour market after their traineeship and education process. It will be the base to prepare the feedback and evaluation of the participants vocational skills. The results of the project will be visible in the school and local environment.

The aim of the project is to boost the quality of vocational education, as well as to increase occupational and language competence of 40 students, which then will be certified. The project is directed to 3rd grade students of the Private Vocational College of the Vocational Education Centre in Kielce from the faculties of: logistics technician, IT technician, cooking technician. Our partner in the project is Tellus Group from Plymouth in the UK, which has long standing experience in realizing mobility projects.
International traineeship in Plymouth will be provided for 2 groups of 20 students and 2 tutors in the following dates: the first group – 04.04.2016 - 29.04.2016; the second group – 07.11. 2016 - 02.12.2016. The number of representatives from particular vocational courses will be proportional to the number of such students at school, that is: logistics technician – 10 students, IT technician – 5 students, cooking technician – 5 students. Before the traineeship, logistic and organizational support will be provided to the students. They will also be trained in the aspects of culture, language and pedagogy. Apart from organizing work placements Tellus Group will provide the participants of the training with the complex programme of vocational training including the following: APT training, vocational language activities “Communication in a work place”. Language activities will be a form of support and improvement of students’ communication in the practical work place settings. The programme of vocational training in British work places will be consistent with the educational plan and programme of the school. The students are going to gain work experience in work places working 8 hours a day five days a week. The traineeship programme will suit the needs of Polish and British employers and will be prepared in cooperation with the Partner. In their spare time, the participants of the project will learn the culture, history and tradition of Great Britain.
Participation in international traineeship will result in the increase of language competition of the students and their mobile and enterprising attitude, which will increase their chances of employment in local and European market. The project will also allow students to get to know professional environment, organization and culture of work in foreign country.
International professional contacts, established in the project may allow the participants to take up a job in the partner's country. On the other hand, by hiring our graduates, Polish employers may count on introducing modern techniques and technologies into their companies. The final product of the project will be a popularizing material about modern techniques, methods, technology and quality systems used in British firms generated and completed by the participants and their tutors. This will also contribute significantly to the improvement of the quality of education and modernization of the educational system through the exchange of good practice in other schools in Kielce and Świętokrzyskie Voivodeship.  
Obtaining Europass – Mobile certificate in Polish and English will guarantee the acknowledgement of participants' qualifications and vocational abilities in all countries of the European Union. It will also enable them to access employees. The certificate with a grade obtained according to ECVET will be an additional asset.  The APT Certificate will be an authentication of transparent skills and equalized modules that are  recognizable in all European countries. It can be used by the participants while continuing education in EU countries or when applying for a job in the local environment as well as abroad.
Formare europeana in turism și alimentație publică

The present project intends to address the need of trainees of developing personal and professional abilities for a better integration on the European labour market that becomes more and more competitive. Other objectives of the project are improving linguistic competence of the participants and also facilitating the transition between formal education and professional training. Last but not least the validation of competence gained during their training abroad through transferable credits is addressed.The direct beneficiaries are 14 trainees from the 10th grade (16, 17 years old) who study Services and specialise in Tourism and Gastronomy. They will be organized into 2 flows of 7 and will be accompanied by a teacher.The training they will have in Great Britain contains activities designed to acquire abilities necessary for a chef  and an employee in an accommodation unit: making dishes of low complexity, mis-en place for breakfast and dinner, greeting clients, cleaning in an accomodation unit.This particular group age has been chosen as it has been considered that acquiring abilities necessary on the labour market has to be made gradually and at this age, students are in the middle of their training.The training will be done in Great Britain, the host organization being Tellus Group, a well-known provider of vocational training programmes which  has successfully provided and placed trainees in a wide variety of internships, vocational training placements and work-based learning since 2002. The host organization is going to provide a member responsible for monitoring students'progress using evaluation forms, questionnaires, interviews. The project is going to have an intermediary as well as a final evaluation. (final and intermediary evaluations).The abilities and skills acquired by students will be certified by Europass doscuments as well as by transferable credit ECVET. Students are also going to get a mark for the competence acquired.As a result of the project, trainees will have at the end of their training a portofolio and also a presentation of one of the themes of the training. (for example making a dish  they have learned during the training). The presentation can take the form of a power-point material, culinary exhibition) We consider that by developing the professional competence of the trainees, by increasing the opportunities trainees have on the real labour market, the indirect beneficiary of the project is the local community and by extension, society and the European labour market.
Dezvoltarea competenţelor de marketing ale elevilor,  prin activităţi de practică în U.K.,  pentru o piaţă a muncii europeană

The project ”Developing marketing skills of students through practical activities in the UK for a European labor market” is a product of the vision of Technological High School ”Nicolae Balcescu” Oltenita by which our school wants to promote a change adjusted to the requirements of European integration, based on the  personal and social development of the pupils. In this context, the needs analysis at the level of our school has indicated a major problem: at the end of the professional training students have difficulties of integration and professional development on the labour market. Our projects sets to contribute to the removal of one cause that can also be approached by the educational system: the insufficient number of practical training hours at economic agents that lead to the impossibility of students to develop a number of practical and professional competences sufficiently and also to adapt to a real economic environment.The purpose of our project is to facilitate the efficient passing from school to the professional life through work experience at economic agents from different social and economic environments. In this way, we intend to increase the  competitivity and capacity to integrate on  the labour market of our  students graduating as technicians in economic activities. Having this purpose in mind we have chosen as a partner the organization TELLUS, specialised in professional training and language classes, aknowledged in all Europe for the quality of their mobility projects.Our objectives are:• The consolidation of  professional practical-applicative training by carrying out practical activities during work experience in the domain of  marketing in a company or VET institutions  with specific profile in the United Kingdom of Great Britain And Northern Ireland by students training to become technicians in economic activities.• Development of specific competences for the qualification of technician in economic activities- business marketing through practical activities done in the same context;• Increasing the capacity of adjusting to professional, social and cultural environments through sessions of linguistic training (applied on the economic domain) and cultural activities in Great BritainThe participants are students in initial training, in the domain of qualification of economic technicians. 20  students(over 60% from rural areas) will be selected to directly participate in the project, but the results, the impact and the dissemination are adressed to all students training in this qualification, to all teachers of this speciality, to all public institutions and economic agents.The project will start on  the 20th of  July  2014, and will last for a year. In the training activities of the project we have taken into consideration not only the linguistic and cultural aspect, but also the training in the domain of speciality by two intensive classes: ”Business English” and Business Administration-British particularities”. The mobility in UK will last for 21 days, in two flows (November and December), with the same types of activities(e.g.: marketing, stock analysis, processing documents, data bases updates, Business English Activities and cultural-touristic activities). The dissemination will be done constantly, throughout the project, by conferences, seminars, exhibitions in public institutions and economic agents, press articles, by using at maximum products such as: the site of the project, the mobility diary, good practice guide, optional class syllabi, posters, fliers. The impact on the direct participants will materialize in the   increasing by 40% of the speciality and communication in English competences in general and in specific terms. We estimate a better capacity of adapting and integration in different socio-cultural environments, a development of the feeling of European citizenship, an increase of the degree of self-confidence regarding the challenges of the European market, after getting the Europass and ECVET certificates. An increase of 25% of the number of partnerships and collaboration with economic agents for work experience, as a result of the activities of dissemination of good practices from the mobility will take place for the Technological High School ”Nicolae Balcescu” Oltenita. An improvement of the curricular offer with two optional school curricula, two teaching auxiliaries ( a guide of good practices and  a mobilty diary) can also be added to the above.  On the long term the oportunities of the local and regional labour market will be better valorized for training the pupils in a real economic environment. We estimate that in the first year after the project we will witness an increase (25%) of the number of students that will perform  work experience for economic agents; thereafter most of the students will  be interested in doing this too.
"Competente practice de nivel european - profesionalism si competitivitate in formarea initiala a elevilor"

The project "Practical Skills at European Level - Professionalism and Competitiveness in Students' Initial Training" (COMPETENT-EU) has as main objective the fact that the students involved will achieve practical professional skills in the qualifications of agricultural mechanic and transportation technician, so that they become competitive on the European labor market. At the same time, their personal development through cultural and language skills, and their preparation for the transition between school and work are notable.It is intended that students acquire specific objectives for their professional development, taking into consideration their knowledge, but at the same time we want them to achieve specific objectives, general for all qualifications: developing their specific language skills and communication in English; developing IT skills;  developing intercultural skills;  developing entrepreneurial skills.Reaching all these objectives that students will acquire through this mobility will prepare them for lifelong learning, for the transition to an active life and for their integration at their workplaces.The project is designed for 76 students, out of which 40 for the level 2 auto mechanic professional qualification and 36 of them for level 3, with the qualification of transportation technician.Those students come from three technological high schools - Technological High School Costesti, Arges, "Dinu Bratianu" Technological High School Stefanesti, Arges and "Capitan Nicolae Plesoianu" Tecnological High School Ramnicu Valcea, Valcea. The first two high schools are from South Muntenia region and the third is from South - West Oltenia region. The three high schools formed a consortium, due to the successful collaboration within several educational partnerships and school competitions, but especially, having the same qualifications, we identified the same training needs accomplished through training stages in an EU country. These training stages fulfill their need for initial training and help them to develop the skills for their professional and personal development and enable their socio-professional insertion.For a good development of the project, the management team will provide a pedagogical, cultural and linguistic training to the target students. They will follow all the stages of the project: information and selection, training, monitoring, assessing, dissemination and usage of the project outcomes, so that the project becomes a success and a motivation for students and for teachers, for future projects.The students will pursue their mobility with a training contractor VET, attending the training program/ECVET qualification "preparation for working life", learning by doing periods in proper places.Participating to this mobility, their added value will be enormous. They will develop themselves:-personally: by participating to a training program in an European country - developing practical, technical, special abilities; by relating with students from other European countries and with professional employees; by using TIC; by identifying their strengths, which they can develop and use for their needs; by assuming roles and places in a team;- culturally: by enriching their knowledge regarding the values of other countries and European cultures, by knowing the cultural treasures of mankind;- in terms of language: by enriching their English skills; their dialogues with the workout tutor, with the other students and people in different contexts (details about the training field, about the cultural and historical points they are to visit). The added value obtained after the participation in this mobility will be seen in students'  enriched portfolio, with the certificates that they will receive.The skills achieved after this training stage will be stated in the Europass Mobility document, in the employment certificate and they also can obtain ECTS certificate (ECVET), all these being a step forward for their successful enrolment on a continuous changing modern labor market, and a recognition of their training in any other EU country.
Boosting Employability: VET Traineeships in Europe

Centre d'Estudis Sant Francesc is a VET school willing to improve the implementation of processes for better internationalizing its students. Currently CESF is offering Intermediate Vocational Programmes for Commerce (Retail), Carers, Auxiliary Nursing Assistants and Computer Technicians. Also, for those students who could not finish the compulsory secondary education, a course in the field of Computing is offered. Short-degree cycles are also taught in different areas such as business, computers or community services (Early Childhood Education and Social Integration).

What the school needs is the following: 1) students need more foreign language skills (especially English) and some type of added value (internships abroad) in order to increase their employability, and 2) we need better prepared teachers in foreign languages and CLIL methodology to provide more content in English and make students have more contact with the language in the classes, epecially in the field of VET and the courses described above.

Activities:
A1) for students, 6 flows to UK, Ireland and Malta in different periods (March / April and June / July) are proposed for traineeships in companies. It is strongly recommended to go to Cork to students whose area of expertise is Health and Care. In total 35 students will be travelling to do their internships abroad in groups of 5, and in some cases, in the summer, 10.
A2) for teachers, a five-day course related to CLIL is suggested. Maximum 5 teachers.

To carry out the project, we wilk talk to students who are likely to take part in it to make them aware of the importance of these traineeship periods. As for the training activity for teachers, the idea that it is a unique opportunity will be emphasized. The selection process is meant to be very objective and, once selected, participants will be monitored by the sending institution as well as by the host organization. At the end of the project, students' results  will be analyzed from the point of view of employability and language learning. As for the staff, the implementation of the CLIL methodology in their classes will be evaluated.

CESF is aiming at increasing the number of well-prepared students in the VET sector who can afterwards enrol in any course in the field of Higher Vocational Training, and actually grow their employability. As for teachers, they will be encouraged to use in their lessons the techniques learned in the course.

In the long term, CESF will innovate in methodology and may offer modules in English as it happens in many other schools where CLIL is the norm. As for students, we understand that the traineeships will help them get into Higher Vocational Training, gain greater experience and achieve a better future job.

The project „International- we gain the experience” is realized by Powiat Malborski/ Starostwo Powiatowe in Malbork (including three subordinate units: ZSP 4 in Malbork, CEZ in Malbork and Powiatowy Urząd Pracy in Malbork) as well as two foreign partners: Work Experience-Tellus Limited (the UK), Stowarzyszenie na Rzecz Wsparcia Zatrudnienia I Kwalifikacji Zawodowych Bad Freienwalde e.v (Germany)

The project is addressed to current pupils and former pupils ( who will complete their apprenticeship  as part of the project no later than one year after their graduation) ZSP4 and CEZ in Malbork trained in followed professions:
a) Mechanic Technician ( 2x5 pupils)- four weeks of apprenticeship in the UK
b) Car mechanic, cook, hairdresser, electronics installer ( vocational school)- for pupils with knowledge of german language  on the level A2 ( 2x16 pupils)- two weeks of apprenticeship in Germany

Countries in which the apprenticeship takes place are in accordance with the languages taught in  the schools mentioned above and with the experience, leading branch of vocational education in foreign partners. The duration of the apprenticeship is adapted to the curriculum for the particular fields of study in the schools as well as the abilities of the schools to incorporate the apprenticeship within their curriculum.

The length of the project is scheduled for 24 months. Each year the  apprenticeship will be organized abroad in both our British and German  partners.

The intention of the project is to:
1. enable students to increase both their qualifications and their awareness of the value of the acquired experiences  during the apprenticeship within the project.
2. create the opportunity to put up pupils’ position in EU labour market by granting them with certificates
3. strengthen pupils’ personality traits such as: entrepreneurship and initiative.
4. strengthen pupils’ confidence in new situations
5. increase the knowledge of foreign languages by staying with foreigners
6. recognize by the pupils their professional environment- principles of the organization of work, culture of the work in foreign countries, encourage pupils to frankness, cooperation as well as support their adaptive abilities 
7. strengthen pupils’ motivation for studying
8. improve the system of vocational education in ZSP4 and CEZ in Malbork by adapting it to the needs and requirements of the European labour market.

The participants of the project will take part in special courses in their schools about the culture of the foreign country, language course etc. During the apprenticeship abroad pupils will take part in courses concerning their labour qualifications and social skills. The paricipants will gain  the unique opportunity to conform their abilities with needs of European labour market. They will take part in trips during which they will meet with culture and history of the foreign country. They will also meet with their peers, families and workers of foreign companies, which will increase their language and cross-cultural abilities. The principles of the organization of the apprenticeship allow the participants of the project to increase their social skills. The qualifications they will gain during the apprenticeship will be legitimized with Europass Mobility document which will increase our pupils’ position on international labour market.

The  beneficiary of the project are:

1. pupils- by increase of their motivations, social skills and qualifications, strengthen pupils’ personality traits such as: entrepreneurship and initiative, strengthen pupils’ confidence in new situations
2. our foreign partners and their workers- by  introducing methods of cooperation on the international level, strengthen the cooperation between schools and employees  as well as adaptation of the education system to the needs of the local labour market
3. other students in ZSP4 and CEZ- by adapting system of vocational education in our region to meet the requirements of the European labour market, which will uprate the quality of vocational education in CEZ and will make way for the access to apprenticeship in foreign countries.

4. local labour market-  by introducing to the market workers with higher skills and with experience gained in foreign companies, which may significantly improve  employees position on the local market.

The main aim of the Practices Consortium coordinated by Fundació BCN Formació Professional is to improve the competitiveness and employability of recent graduates of initial vocational training of the vocational schools of Barcelona across a period of practices in different European countries. The project also aims to generate a positive impact increasing and diversifying the professional experience of Initial VET graduates. Al same time the project aims to foster the European identity of the youngster to improve the professional mobility. Also, the project pretends to enforce the skills and knowledge of the Chemistry and Audiovisuals. 

The present consortium focuses his activity in mobility for graduates in individual vocational training but wants to maximize the participation of more schools and VET students in the next future. Both, Fundación BCN Formación Profesional wants to continuous being the reference institution of Barcelona in relation with the coordination and execution of European education programs. 

With the project development, the consortium pretends that a total among of 20 graduates in initial vocational training acquire more professional experience related with the finished studies and, at same time, that this background helps them increasing their employability and strengthening they entry into the labor market. The project will allow that the youngsters develop 2 months of practices in different companies. At same time, the projects pretends that Barcelona has VET professionals with more and more diverse knowledge around their professional field across Job Shadowing stages in reference countries of their professional field.
Zagraniczne praktyki zawodowe uczniów ZSEiT - projekt 2015-2017

The project 'Technical college students' of ZSEiT apprenticeship abroad – project 2015 – 2017' is aimed at the students of the Secondary Economic  and Technical School in Słupsk, studying in third and second grades in the field of economy, trade as well as digital and graphic processes. The project will enable students to undergo a mandatory training period in the dimension of three weeks which results from the curriculum.
80 students, who are going to take part in the project, will be admitted on the basis of the conditions detailed in the plan of recruitment. These are people aged 17 to 18. In every year given students will be  involved in the project: technician in the field of economy,  technician in the field of digital and graphic processes  and technician in the field of trade.  Altogether,  40 students will take part in the training in 2016 and 40 in the year 2017. Students will do a three-week-training  at March - April 2016 and 2017. 
The main purpose of this training is to improve the quality of vocational education, acquire  key competences and vocational skills of students taking part in vocational training abroad, confirm the results with certificates and the Europass Mobility document. The purpose was issued due to priority union activities concerning developing basic skills and reducing premature school leaving. Training is going to reflect an innovative character   since  students will not only have a chance to be exposed to and practise a foreign language of the trade but also familiarize with different, more up-to-date technologies of work and new solutions in newly established English and German companies.
In order to be equal to the requirements of  temporary market economy, the school's task is to educate a young man as best as they can and equip them with the knowledge to do the job. Given purposes were laid down in the project in response to these needs: improving the quality and effectiveness of vocational training , improving skills of foreign vocational language, icreasing mobility of students, learning a new culture, developing the enterprising spirit.
Students will achieve their objectives through gaining new experience and vocational skills  in training centres and companies of different branches in accordance with fields of education in our school, in economically developed countries. Young people will also broaden their theoretical and practical knowledge in the range of vocational subjects, foreign languages and culture of different European countries. Due to abroad training and confirmation of qualifications in the Europass Mobility students become competitive in the local labour market,  in their native country as well as in Europe. An important result of building networks of international contacts, which enables active participation in society, will be a new and courageous attitude of the students to the world and new ideas drawn from another country.
The school will make its educational offer more attractive which will contribute to improving the quality of vocational training  as well as increasing the quality of recruitment.
There will be some long-term benefits of this project: better recognision of competences gained through  learning periods abroad, reinforcing the effect of links between formal and informal education, vocational training, employment and enterpreneurship. Project operations should continue the process of broadening the international dimension of education due to cooperation with Partner Countries.
Współczesne aranżacje terenów zieleni w obrębie obiektów historycznych

The project provides four weeks of  the vocational training  In Rome as well as the preliminary courses including the language course, the pedagogical training as well as the cross-cultural training. The project  is prepared for 10 students attending the Technical School of Landscape Architecture Design.  The project will take place in July 2016. The students will be supervised by the teacher from Poland.
Currently there are plenty of obstacles preventing us from creating vocational opportunities for the students of this particular specialization in our local area, especially when it comes to parks and waterfronts surrounding world famous historical sites.  Therefore, the vocational training in Rome would definitely meet the beneficiaries’ occupational expectations, ensuring them obtaining valuable vocational qualifications 
at the actual source.
The sites will be selected by our co-partner and later those selected parks, community gardens as well as historical sites will be approved by the school board.

The principal objectives of the project:
- becoming familiar with the international policy of conservation and maintenance of historical sites
- studying the landscape development , public realm and urban ecology in various historic periods
- gaining site planning and  design process skills required for maintaining  public areas within historical sites
- learning solving-problem strategies associated with landscape architecture design while holding various positions and responsibilities
- using modern information sources in order to prepare students to become autonomous in gaining knowledge
- improving language skills (Latin, Italian, English)

After completing the vocational training, students will develop skills in:
- prioritizing and organizing work at public realm
- planting annual summer flowering bulbs for historical sites
- cultivating flower-beds
- describing and creating  flower and outdoor plants compositions for selected public areas
- cultivating community gardens
- trimming trees and shrubs, pruning hedges
- managing garden and landscaping tools
- cultivating formal gardens, alleys, pathways
- maintaining pavements with polishing techniques and weeding pathways
- providing stocktaking services
- managing building materials used for maintaining historical gardens
- composing garden flowers and plants, wreaths, shrubs for historical sites along with local styles and trends
- learning methods of adorning community gardens and public spaces surrounding historical sites
- comparing the historical background of landscape design in Italy and Poland
- Recognizing garden styles, themes and landscaping networks according to historical periods
- Designing plants and flowers when taking into consideration the area’s potential and  Italian styles of decorating
- Managing modern  irrigation systems and maintaining watering tools
- Speaking English fluently and using basic Italian

The vocational training will bring several benefits. The primary benefit is enhancing occupational qualifications, improving students’ mobility and  competitiveness on the  job market.
Taking part in the project will help students to broaden their horizons and understand the ongoing process of improving their qualifications.
It will open the opportunities to interact with everyday English. It will be crucial to lay the foundations for learning Italian. The work experience students will obtain there will definitely contribute to improving the quality of education in our school by implementing new methods and approaches to effective learning, encouraging teachers to enhancing their teaching qualifications. In this way the effectiveness of education in landscape architecture design will increase.
Staż zagraniczny - pewny start w życiu zawodowym.

On the competitive job market young people need practical knowledge and skills which will enable them to readjust to employers’ demands. Thus, it is necessary for students to undergo vocational trainings abroad which will provide them with a whole new set of professional skills and competences.
The main aim of this project is to develop the key competences concerning the job market and to place a strong emphasis on entrepreneurship involving a practical communication in the English language. The project is aimed at juniors, sophomores and seniors of a technical school for students of economy. A core group of 15 students will be chosen. They will participate in a two week training in a vocational training centre in Great Britain.  The students will develop practical, professionals skills tailored to the current needs of the job market, build up self-confidence, increase the mobility of students and improve their Curriculum Vitae to further their future employment prospects. During the vocational training placement students will broaden the knowledge and hone their skills in running the office, self-presentation, bookkeeping and other aspects of business such as marketing and promotions. Students will have the opportunity to apply prior and new knowledge in practical situations, develop proficiencies in independent thinking and collaborative problem solving. Teachers will serve as advisors. Participating in extra-curricular English classes and living in host families will give trainees additional opportunity to develop the English language competence. Additionally, the teachers, also acting as guardians, will prepare a professional English e-learning course which will be shared among all interested and the course will be used during regular classes as well.
The participants will receive Europass Mobility certificates in Polish and English which are recognised in all European Union countries.
Europejskie praktyki szansą na lepszą przyszłość

The Applicant of the project "European traineeships a chance for a better future" is Vocational School Complex in Giżycko.Thepartner institutions are: Tellus Group Limited – WORK EXPERIENCE UK and ESMOVIA – Sistema Practices s.l. The participant of the project will be group of 32 students of Vocational School Complex in Giżycko who are being taught in following professions: hotel industry technician, nutrition and food servicetechnician and cook. The participants will be divided in to two groups  The curriculum of the traineeship will be fulfilled in modern hotels and restaurants. 
The most important aims of the project are: raising professional skills of the participants, broadening their competences and knowledge based on European standards of hotel and catering industry. 
The implementation of the project enables  the students to achieve the following specific goals: broadening the knowledge and skills acquired at school classes and applying them into practice (in reputable hotels and restaurants), raising the English language competences, including professional English, shaping creativity, openness and mobile attitudes, increasing the faith of students in their possibilities and chances of finding work and obtaining the independent living, enhancement of inter-cultural sensitivity through knowledge of different history , culture and traditions, confrontation of solution used in hotels and restaurants in Poland, Great Britain and Spain. 
The aims of the project are focused on the supporting the participants in vocational training and as well as the use of knowledge, skills and qualification to facilitate their personal development and employment possibilities. The participants will be able to learn  new valuable work experience and thus improve their professional competence and attractiveness to potential employers.
The project envisages two trips to foreign traineeship. 
The first group is going to go to the traineeship in May 2016  to Plymouth in Great Britain, and the second  one in October 2016 to Valencia in Spain. There are two attendants (tutors) for each group. 
The students will make 2 weeks traineeships in 3-4 stars hotels and restaurants hostvisitorsall year round, offering ahigh standard of service ( swimming pools, SPA, saunas, restaurants , pubs) at the position corresponding to their profession. 
The students will be developing their skills of preparation of the residential units for guests , preparation and serving breakfasts in the facility providing hotel services, preparation of different meals and beverages, learning the secrets of working in reception. The traineeship curriculum will be fitted to each group and included individual needs of the students. 
In order to prepare the student properly for the traineeship , before the leave, they will be covered by language , cultural and pedagogical preparation. 
The workers of the partners institutions will monitor and evaluate the course of traineeship, issue the certificate confirming the pursue the traineeship with a list of acquired skills.The Vocational School Complex will apply for issuing the Europass Mobility Certificate in consultation with partner institutions. The participants of the project will familiarize with ECVET system ( European credit System for Vocational Education and Training) system, which will be very important for the development of the school. During the project will be created the professional dictionary and culinary guide, which will be used to work with other students in the classroom at school. The culinary guide will be also given to the cooperating with school chefs of restaurant and hotels. 
In Vocational School Complex there  will be organised  “The Day of English and Spanish Culture and Cuisine”, where our students are going to prepare the dishes from English and Spanish cuisine and share the information about culture and traditions in these countries. 
The project will affect the professional and  personal development of the participants. They will be taught team work. By learning  rules and necessary skills the students will increase their chances of finding work. They will more active look for work and become more mobile.
Our school will have the chance to adjust the teaching program to the labour market expectations. Observed rules will be included in the program of traineeship.
