The project will also improve the essential qualifications of teachers who will transfer the positive experience from the project to the school work, taking into account the results of the project  in the lessons draft which will  also bring benefits to the other students who not participate into the project. 
This project will increase the prestige of Vocational School Complex. The gained experience will allow to include the foreign traineeship into the school offer, which will raise the attractiveness of education in our school. The experience and acquired skills of employees will be used to plan the school work.
Staż zagraniczny szansą na rozwój kompetencji zawodowych

The grantees of the project are 48 pupils from 2-nd and 3-rd classes of Technical College, who are educating as future general builders, electricians, IT-technicians and surveyors and pupils from basic vocational school in profession drywall installer. Most of the students come from poor families living in agricultural areas, with social benefits as the only source of income. Participation in the Project is for them the only occasion to gain vocational experience abroad.
  The main target of the Project is to develop and broaden the knowledge and practical skills of students within the framework of practice. The school as a promoter of the Project would like to improve the quality of education, especially practical one, and adapt the vocational education to the needs and requirements of the job market. Our institution aspire to create new methods and implement pedagogical and technological innovations as well as offer the holistic attitude towards vocational education. As a part of the Project the student will undergo four week training, two weeks in Polish companies and two weeks in foreign training center. Along with the resourcefulness training our beneficiaries would have an opportunity to compare the functioning of the enterprises both in the country and abroad. This kind of training will be prepared together with the Employment Agency and Association “Przedsiębiorcy Skarżyska”. 
  Our Partners are: the Portugal company – EPD with its headquarters in Portugal, the Italian company - INFOL and the  British company- Tellus, which are firmly experienced in working with students due to the fact of their long-lasting participating in Leonardo da Vinci and Erasmus+ projects. The main targets of our Partners are sharing experience and knowledge, support of the educational institutions abroad and development of cultural awareness along with the improvement of language skills of those young people entering the job market. 
  The technical collage curriculum envisages vocational training in companies and institutions which operate in the same areas as the scope of education. This function is fulfilled by the abroad traineeship. After the end of the training all the students will be given the certificates to prove the skills they acquired and their vocational qualifications. The measurement of the value added will be conducted in the form of an exam while the experience and skills gained will be disseminated among the school community.
The process of dissemination itself will take place though the establishment of the internet platform for the exchange of experience available not only for the beneficiaries but for employers and the young people in the whole country. 
  The project will be executed in cooperation with EPD located  in Lisbon in Portugal (X.2016 - 16 students), Infol in Rome in Italy (II.2017 - 16 students) and Tellus in Plymouth in Great Britain (III.2017 - 16 students).
  The execution of the Project will certainly have a positive impact on the functioning of the students on the European job market.

The project “Apprenticeship abroad is my opportunity” is aimed at students of the third form technical school of electronics and ICT profiles. Participating in the project gives the students a real chance to acquire knowledge, skills and professional qualifications, it increases the perspectives of finding employment in both domestic and European job markets and it enhances personal development.

Moreover, it supports the development of our school, especially in the field of vocational education and it aids the cooperation as well as the exchange of experiences on an international level. These kinds of contacts have an influence on the transference of different and often innovative educational solutions on the native ground in the form of learning content, services, training and the methods of lifetime learning.

The apprenticeship will take place in Plymouth in the centre of the vocational education Tellus Group. 20 students will take part, 10 from each class involved in the project. The recruitment will be based on clear rules. The students will be provided with international transport, insurance, accommodation, board and full mentoring from both the teachers of ZSEiO, who will be looking after the students during the apprenticeship and from the employers of the host organisation.

Before leaving the young apprentices will get organisational support, which will make their stay abroad easier. During the classes, they will boost their vocabulary and expressions needed for work and everyday life communication. They will also get basic information about the culture, traditions, customs and the economy of the country they are going to visit. They will be familiarised with the rules of the apprenticeship, the programme and regulations of their training, rights and obligations, safety rules during their journey and stay as well as cultural differences.

During their 2-week stay in Plymouth, the students will undergo vocational training called “Preparation for vocational life”. They will get to know the rules and regulations concerning health and safety at work in the UK, organisation of the workplace, personal and social competences, which are helpful in carrying out their work, methods of individual or group work organisation.
The ICT students will do tasks connected with designing and creating local computer networks as well as managing the data communication networks. The group of electronics students will do tasks connected with installing, maintenance and repair of electronic devices.

The apprenticeship will allow the opportunity to compare the European industry solutions with the ones used in Poland and to verify the theoretical knowledge in a practical aspect.
While taking part in the project, the students will develop their language competence, improve their communication skills and specific vocabulary. Staying with families and often participants of other courses who come from different countries, the students will learn the understanding of different cultures, openness and tolerance.
Each participant will receive the Europass Mobility document, which carefully describes the vocational and additional benefits the student acquired during the apprenticeship and a Certificate of completion issued by the host organisation.
The experience of the apprenticeship will definitely be of great significance for the students’ vocational and personal career.
Twoje doświadczenie - twoja przyszłość (Your experience - your future)

The participants of the „Your experience – your future” project will be 40 students from the 3rd grade of technical school: hoteliers, logisticians, sales specialists and economists. The students will go on a 4-week training to Portsmouth, England (20 students + 2 teachers), Leipzig, Germany (10 students  +1 teacher) and Salamanca, Spain (10 students + 1 teacher) from 17 January to 13 February 2016. In order to qualify for the Project, the students will have to meet the following conditions: at least good knowledge of English, high average grade in foreign languages (everyday and professional), good behaviour and be well-mannered.
The most important goals of the project are:
- improving vocational competence of our students
- enhancing self-reliance and self-confidence
- showing new dimension of practical education
- improving language skills
- enhancing intercultural and European awareness
- overcoming stereotypes concerning work market
- enhancing motivation for further education and self-education.
Apart from gaining practical knowledge, during their stay abroad, our students will have the possibility of getting familiar with the culture of the country that they will go to. This will happen not only at their work places (e.g. group going to England will stay at host families) but also during cultural trips.
As a part of preparation process there will be pedagogic, culture and language classes.
Main duties of the project partners are:
- the sending organization is obliged to recruit participants and prepare them to their training abroad
- the host organizations are obliged to provide work places and logistic support in their countries (accommodation, meals, local transport, etc.)
- both, sending and host organizations are obliged to cooperate on preparing detailed training programmes, to monitor and evaluate the project, and to disseminate project results in their countries.
The monitoring and evaluation of the project will happen systematically during the entire project and after it is finished. In order to monitor students’ progress their work diaries will be checked regularly and also the teacher will discuss with students their everyday work. Student and employer surveys, analysis of work diaries and certificates will be used during the process of project evaluation.
We assume that the most vital effects of the project will be increase in language competences, professional expertise, and higher self-confidence of the participants. Also, we assume that the cooperation between project partners will increase as a result of this project.
Staż zagraniczny uczniów Zespołu Szkół nr 1 w Sanoku drogą do osiągnięcia sukcesu zawodowego na wymagającym się rynku pracy.

The target of the project is a four-week internship in the UK and Italy  for students of Zespol Szkol no. 1 in Sanok. Seven students from each  school faculty will participate in the internship. There are four faculties learnt at the school: economy, logistics, hospitality, nutrition and food service. Together it gives a total of 28 students and two teachers to look after them. Tellus Ltd. is the host organization. It is an institution with many years of experience in organizing  internships for students. The internship will take place in Plymouth in the UK and in Caserta, Italy. The project is a response    to the needs of the school (increasing the attractiveness and quality of teaching), students (increasing personal, professional and linguistic competence, increasing employment opportunities, equalization of opportunities), local employers (better employee on the local labor market) and the local community (parents, local authorities). Its aims and objectives are a response to the school's development strategy, which involves professional development of teachers and students, using international potential. While participating in  the project an intern will study the characteristics of a British and Italian company, methods of management and labor, health and safety rules on individual workstations, professional terminology in a foreign language, the rules of organization and work culture characteristic to the UK and Italy, he/she will form the following personal characteristics under actual working conditions: manners and the culture of personal customer service, self-reliance, hard work, respect for labor discipline, teamwork, the ability to plan work and working time, the ability to organize their workplace, speak a foreign language. These skills will have the specifics of a particular profession, because they will be shaped in the work environment characteristic to a specific industry branch. Theoretical knowledge acquired in school will be deepened by practical skills, while gained skills and certifications will help future graduates in functioning on the labor market. The project will make it easier to find a job or running their own business. During the internship, the student should get familiar with the operation of the company on the European labor market, he/she should understand and realize the nature of the profession, which is to satisfy the diverse needs of the customer. Participation in the project will increase graduates’ sense of confidence while dealing with the employer and the client. The interns will be accommodated with British families which will help them in getting to know  the British daily life, their culture, customs, ways of spending free time. He/she will also explore the culture of Italy and the specificity of Italian cuisine, which is very popular in Poland and Europe. The trainee will learn to cope with new, perhaps sometimes even extreme, situations.  An adequate system of recruiting students to participate in the project will motivate them to improve their academic performance and attendance. Trainees will  increase their competence in the following fields : professional, linguistic, IT, organizational, social, personal. A trainee in the UK will implement the program "Preparation for life", and will also receive points in the APT Award system. It is a system designed to provide the participant with work experience recognized throughout the EU. General targets are based on the fact that it is a transparent system for assessing the student's ability, which supports and promotes modern aspirations  of the European countries to unify the scale of assessment of practical skills of vocational school students. Its use will result in an easier and equal process of applying for a job  or follow-up education in the European Union for all. In Italy, the intern will implement the program "Preparation for gaining employment" which has similar targets. The project will surely affect:
- Improvement of the quality of training offered by Zespol Szkol no. 1 in Sanok,
- Improvement of  the knowledge and skills of the internship participants ,
- Reduction of the gap between the knowledge acquired and the skills and competencies required by the employer,
- Increase of knowledge about the methods, practices, technologies used in the UK,
- Increase of trainees’ employability and creating better career prospects for them,
- Increase of trainees’  sense of initiative and entrepreneurship,
- Increase of the mobility of trainees in the labor market,
- Improvement of the English language skills of trainees,
- Increase of  motivation to participate in various forms of education and training (also abroad),
- Increase of  the intercultural competence of trainees, it will teach them to live and work in a multicultural environment,
-Self-esteem (positive),
- Appreciation of the fact of being a member of the European Union.
Innowacyjna praktyka w Europie - lepszy start w przyszłość zawodową

The project entitled ”Innovative training in Europe – better start in professional future” carried out by Zespol Szkol no3 in Wadowice  will last for 12 months, it intends to organize 4 mobilities:
1) in London for 16 students (8 trade technicians + 8 economic technicians) – 3 weeks
2) in Austria/ Carinthia for 20 students (10 food and gastronomy service technicians + 6 waiters + 4 hotel industry technicians) – 3 weeks
3) in Plymouth for 28 students ( 12 graphic design technicians ) – 4 weeks
4) in Lisbon for 20 students ( 12 graphic design technicians + 8 hotel industry technicians).
The main aim of this project is to improve the quality and vocational education innovation by gaining professional and language skills, and socio-cultural competence by 84 students from our school, the acquisition of valuable experience and professional skills and also language development of their trade, and thus improve their qualifications and competitiveness on the labour market. Our trainees will work in various positions in catering, hospitality, advertising, trade and business companies in English and German-speaking environment.
The new skills they will gain make them more attractive on the Polish and European job markets. They will also be effective and helpful for students while starting the first job or running and managing their new businesses. All these skills will let them easily deal with  various ingredients used in Austrian cuisine, modern technology used in trade or business, and also computer software used in advertising or hotels. The language and civilization skills will help them in  future business contacts with English, Austrian, Portuguese partners. The long-term benefits of their work experience are:  high self-esteem and awareness of gaining new skills.
The expected effect of the project is the acquisition of the new practical knowledge and professional experience, which directly increase the attractiveness of our future graduates in the job market, as well as the improvement of  communication skills by using professional vocabulary in the participants’ trades (catering, hotel, advertising, business and commerce).
The participants of the project will receive certificates of Europass Mobility and ECVET documents confirming the acquired knowledge and skills.
Zagraniczne praktyki zawodowe drogą do uznawania kwalifikacji w Europie

The project concerns the 4-week foreign vocational training in 2016 for 104 students of technical vocational school in 6 professions from Agricultural Complex of Schools in Namysłów. From 4/04/2016 to 29/04/2016 16 students will undertake a training in the profession of photo technician in the Great Britain. From 02/05/2016 to 27/05/2016 there are 4 groups of students which are going to be trained and these are: 30 students in the profession of an IT specialist in the training centre in Plymouth in the Great Britain, 10 students of the landscape architecture of technical vocational school in the gardens and ornamental enterprises of Rome, 19 students of technical vocational school of the tourist service together with 8 students of hotel industry in the hotels and restaurants of Rimini, Italy and 21 students of nutrition technology in the restaurants of southern Hesse. Hosting organizations are: Tellus of Plymouth with its branch in Rome, Sistema Tourismo of Rimini, Starkenburg Farmers Association in Darmstadt, Germany. The main goals of the project are: the development of skills and professional knowledge of students and their ability to communicate in foreign languages and their personal development: increase in their responsibility, self-reliance, self-confidence, tolerance for other cultures and the ability to deal with difficult situations. The project is crucial for the learning and development process of students of technical vocational schools due to the fact that it gives them new skills and professional knowledge and it increases their mobility on the labor market. Future graduates are better prepared for work. The projects is putting more emphasis on the European aspect of technical vocational education and encourages students in linking theory with practice, better understanding of foreign cultures and customs, together with the development of language skills, especially with using professional language. The project is contributing to the mobility and the personal development of its participants, allowing them to know foreign cultures more adequately, without the threat of being alone in an unknown environment, establishing new contacts and friendships, coping with difficult situations and their increase in pride and self-esteem. As a result of bonding the labor environment with the educational environment the project is enhancing the chances of employment for its future graduates on the European service market. The project is promoting the transparency and credibility of professional qualifications in Europe based on The European Credit Transfer System for Vocational Education and Training (ECVET).
Care of the students will be supervised by the teachers from Agricultural Schools Complex and representatives of partner organizations, as well as caregivers in individual enterprises. Phototechnicians internship program includes mastering the skills associated with registration, reproduction and processing of graphical images. IT students will be involved in the assembly and maintenance of personal computers and peripherals as well as the installation and administration of local area networks. Technician of the Hotel Trade and Tourism will occupy tourists in hotels and travel agencies organizing tourist events. In the practice of Architecture is to master technicians skills ornamental plant cultivation and maintenance of gardens and green areas. The Technicians of Nutrition will learn how to prepare dishes and service consumer. Another result of the project is to increase students' skills in communicating in English and German and Italian languages, knowledge of Italian culture, English and German, and the acquisition of independence and responsibility. Students will be prepared pedagogical, cultural and linguistic. The project participants will be provided with travel, insurance, accommodation and meals abroad, tickets for transport and pocket money. After completing the practice students will receive certificates confirming the acquisition of new competencies and Europass Mobility documents.
The project affects the students in the vocational education and contributes to the development of the industries in which future graduates will find employment. Also teachers - caregivers will benefit in terms of work experience and professional skills development. Long term benefits primarily the acquisition by the participants in a new experience,practice language and finding job easier, the development of cooperation between partner organizations and increase the attractiveness of the school.
Zagraniczny staż w Wielkiej Brytanii kluczem do europejskiej mobilności-2016

This project is going to be realized in a form of three – week foreign technical training, in companies dealing with IT, production, trading and service branches. The realization of this practice is going to take place from the 27 June till 15 July 2016. The participants of this project will be 33 students from Zespol Szkol No 3 in Wyszkow who educate in IT and economical areas. The offer will be directed to the students of the 2nd and 3rd grade (17-19 year-old). 

The main aim of this project is to improve practical skills of 33 students from technical classes (IT and economical specializations) form Zespol Szkol No 3 in Wyszkow so as to make  their later professional and personal development easier.

Detailed aims (hard):
• Gaining additional qualifications, the expansion of 33 students’ knowledge in IT and economical professions.
- the number of students whose qualifications grew  in the professions of  IT and  Economy
- the number of issued Europass Mobility
• Getting to know the requirements which are put on students/ employees in a partner’s country by 33 students.
- the number of certificates of completed training in the UK
• The improvement of 33 students’ English language skills
- the number of students whose English language competence and skills improved

Detailed aims (soft):
• the development of social and public skills (endurance, precision, dutifulness,  cooperation in groups)
• an increase in motivation towards learning, higher professional and personal aspirations
• the alignment of educational chances, especially for students coming from villages or with special educational needs
• enabling students to gain extra skills and knowledge  which will make further education easier and/or the choice of a professional path
• the improvement of  the quality of provided educational services at school
• an increase in key competence
• a growth in students’ self-esteem
• a better preparation  of school graduates in labor market
• the establishment of cooperation: between labor market institutions and school, in terms of  two-directional information flow and the accuracy of  offered educational services
• transnational cooperation ( the introduction of innovatory system solutions in technical training, an increase in vocational students’ mobility, an increase in the number of graduates who are open towards other cultures and posses language skills  at an extended level)

The sources of verification: 
- attendment list
- training register (every day)
- evaluation forms (two during the project)
- final reports
- diagnostic vocational tests (two during the project)

Products:
90 hours of foreign training per student
33 Europass Mobility
33 certificates of completed foreign training
3 multimedial presentations prepared by the participants of the foreign training
1 film showing the ZS No 3 stay in the UK
a www subpage concerning the ZS No 3 stay in the UK
two articles in a local newspaper
2 open lessons with the participants of the training concerning their stay in the UK which  are aimed to promote their professional mobility
33 final reports from the foreign training 

Needs:
• students’ needs ( the usage of theoretical knowlege in practice, vocational mobility, expanding language skills inc. technical language, the willingness to check onself in a stressful situation, becoming independent, making contacts with future employers)
• school needs (the improvement of educational quality, a growth in educational competitivness, gaining prestige, recruitment improvement, giving the assurence of a good professional start to students)
• Polish and foreign employers’ needs (raising demand for IT specialists with an international experience)
• District, province and country needs (promotion, hiring skilled workers, the development of IT branch)
Staż dla zawodowców - zagraniczna praktyka zawodowa dla uczniów ZSB

Learning in the classroom does not allow students to acquire skills good enough to fulfill expectations of future employers. Today’s employers expect from their employee some practical skills, the knowledge of new trends, a good level of a foreign language and a completed internship. As a result, the school wants to help its students undertake the training abroad in order to improve the quality, attractiveness and effectiveness of vocational training as well as meet the expectations raised by employers. 

The given project includes the participation of 72 students both of Technical Secondary School and Vocational School of the Building Schools Complex in Konin in four week work placement in the United Kingdom and the Federal Republic of Germany. The internship will be held in four groups of 18 people in the years 2015-2017. Training institutions are Tellus (Group) Ltd-work experience UK (Tellus) and Vitalis GMBH (Germany).

Training will take place in Plymouth and Leipzig best facilities offering the opportunity to develop professional skills of students. In every company, the internship will be organized in small groups of two or three people. Each group will have its own manager – the person working in the given place and training will be monitored by Tellus Group Ltd., Vitalis Gmbh manager and two other teachers - internship guardians of the Building Schools Complex. At the time of doing the internship, students will master English or German language and culture of the host country thanks to language courses, cultural activities, sightseeing tours or host families in the UK.


Students will take part in intense English or German language courses a few months before their departure to the UK or Germany. They will also participate in workshops about stress, conflict solutions, vocational counseling and safety regulations in the workplace, the ability of creating portfolio. 

The main aim of the project is to enable students of construction industry, surveying, logistics, catering and hotel industry to gain and improve vocational skills in attractive workplace conditions as well as to give them the opportunity to increase their chances on the job market. Moreover, students will be able to get to know needs of the European employers and European job market. At the same time, the school itself will gain experience in handling international projects.

Detailed goals of the project are improvement of vocational skills and foreign language (English and German) during the internship in the UK and Germany and cooperation with vocational training institutions in these countries.

Thanks to the project, all 72 participants will get new qualifications  and  vocational skills in
the UK and Germany confirmed by certificate and the Europass Mobility in Polish, English, German languages, they will be able to improve their English and German language (English and German language course certificates), will benefit from educational activities, learn how to deal with stressful situations, create their own EUROPASS CV and electronic Portfolio. All these things will significantly help students look for better job opportunities in the future. 


The internship will prepare students to a proper use of vocational English and German languages, it will also develop their own self esteem and motivation for future education and helps them gain experience as workers in a different culture and reality. What is more, students will expand their interpersonal skills, learn independence and responsibility in the new environment. 

The Building Schools Complex in Konin will present project results on school website, exhibitions, seminaries and will include vocational internship in the school curriculum. The project itself will contribute to the promotion of school and its students’ achievements (future graduates) in local environment.
Staże zagraniczne dla uczniów  Zespołu Szkół Zawodowych im. ks. Edmunda Domańskiego w Iłowie - Osadzie

The project includes support for twenty students from Zespół Szkół Zawodowych in Ilowo-Osada. It is aimed at people who are learning in such professions as forester and information scientist. The project responds to individual needs of the students. It helps the school to develop in many aspects. The main aims of the project are:
- to allow the students from Zespół Szkół Zawodowych in Ilowo –Osada to understand their professional environment better
- to get to know the organization and work culture in another country 
- to encourage the students to cooperate and be open-minded
- to develop their adaptability and sensitivity to cultural and mental differences.
The planned actions of the project will help the students to develop their self-confidence and personal abilities. Establishing international cooperation not only expands the international education but also contributes to permanent school development.

The project involves Vocational Food Service School in Rzeszów and TELLUS LIMITED company - a subsidiary in Greece. The project plans a trip to a foreign internship to Athens two groups of 14 students, who are learning in the profession technician of nutrition and food services with an attendant. The foreign internship will be performed for one month (30 days) on the following dates time: First group from 2nd April 2016 to 1st May 2016. Second group from 1st October 2016 to 30 th October 2016. The practice will be implemented in seven catering companies. In every company, there will work two students. Nutrition and food service technician is a very attractive field of study for young people. Each student is equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to work as a cook and a waiter. Gastronomical labor market is still open for good professionals. It is very easy to find a job in gastronomy. There are jobs in the country and abroad constantly available. The overall objective of the project is to increase the international mobility of young people, to improve professional, personal, intercultural (cross-cultural) and language competence, to acquire new theoretical knowledge and to increase the theoretical and practical experience in the profession nutrition and catering services technician. The basic objectives of the internship is to prepare participants to live in conditions of the modern world, to ease the  professional work and an active role in the changing labor market, to meet the expectations of employers in connection with the development of the foodservice industry, learn new techniques and technologies, learning the secrets of Greek cuisine drafting skills food and beverage, catering production organization, planning and implementation of catering services, learning a new culture, taking responsibility for one's own level of education and belief in their own abilities. The curriculum is an integral part of the training and is a continuation of the school curriculum in the profession nutrition and catering services technician. The project is designed to show participants how attractive can be vocational training, and also indicate the importance of mobility, through which young people can raise their professional skills, and thus its attractiveness in the labor market for potential employers. The project also aims to combine theory with practice, that is, learning in the Greek catering companies, to strengthen the links between the world of education and work, intercultural education, and encouraging learning throughout life. Internship in fact creates the opportunity to learn the real environment to work in another country and another culture. The strategic objectives of youth participation in the project are to increase their attractiveness as a potential employee profile adapted to the standards and requirements of the European labor market, develop practical arrangements for the implementation of the program in terms of the content of the training, a comparison of the skills acquired in the course of professional practice in the country with acquired during training abroad. Expected hard results are to get the Europass Mobility and certificates confirming the holding of practice, and thus obtain additional qualifications, enhance the attractiveness of the participants at the local, national and European labor market, improving communication skills in English and Greek language learning, the development of key competencies under the implementation of the core curriculum. Expected soft results are awakening students' curiosity, openness to others, to increase confidence in dealing with future employers and clients, skills development cooperation in multicultural and multinational teams, developing entrepreneurial attitudes. Participation in the internship will help students in shaping their European awareness and teach attitude of acceptance and tolerance towards people of other nationalities. The expected results of the implementation of international practice is to develop the students' specific learning outcomes in the form of new powers, new knowledge, new skills, linguistic, cultural, and interpersonal. The proposed plant implementation internship:1. Palmyra Beach Hotel -10 Possidonos Avenue, Glyfada, Athens 2. Mediterranean Palace - Salaminos 3& Karatasou, Athens 3. President Hotel 43 Kifisias Ave. 11523, Athens 4. Eratria Village Hotel - 5th Km Eretria – Aliveri 34008 Evia island Greece 5. Da Sotto café-restaurant  - Plateia Eleftherias, Korydallos, Athens 6. Plateia Eleftherias - Hanioti 63085, Athens 7. Metamorfoseos 21 Alimos Athens  or Anaxagora 26-28 , Tavros, Kalithea, Athens.

J. Horák Primary School represents the kind of  an institution  which is honestly open to internationalization and the school representatives together with the highly motivated  teaching staff have been  indicating their ambitions and potential  to upgrade and modernize the teaching process in accordance with current  educational trends  on the international levels.The school definitely realizes the fact that becoming the valuable and competitive educational institution within the European Union  needs to develop foreign languages competence skills  and abilities of  the teachers  to use a foreign language  fluently in theiprofession.Furthermore, we understand that achieving our needs  within  the European  Development Plan is possible to implement  through   highly qualified and motivated teachers  whose professional qualities,  motion and passion  will enable to upgrade their  professional  education  as well as improve their professional competences, although the teacher´s profession has not been  efficiently valued and is often  considered to be an extremely time - consuming profession.The main objective of the mobility project is teacher‘s  training.Secondary goals are following: Providing professional and career development based on the mediation of innovative content and teaching methods,Using  ICT in the teaching process,Improving language skills and competences, Learning  about the culture, history, customs and traditional backgrounds of the countries, Getting experience  from the international project organization, Increasing of self-confidence and satisfaction in a daily professional  life.Participants of the project are two employees of the J. Horák Primary School.The first participant is a deputy head teacher of the Primary Education who also teaches English language  at the primary level of education  and represents the coordinator of the presented project. In  a  previous  few years  she attended several training courses focused on English language communication skills and skills in Information and Communication Technologies. As a school representative, the applicant  is highly motivated to keep and develop the  progress and prosperity of the educational  institution on the international level.The experience obtained from this project will enable to improve her managment skills and internationalization strategies,  and finally,  will meet the needs of the European Development Plan.The second participant  is a teacher of German language and Russian language, and she can also speak  fluent  English language. She teaches students of the secondary level. This participant will be able to implement all the obtained project experience in her profession – teaching  German language and Russian language.  She is a graduate of  several  English language courses  as well as the ICT competences. Participation in the specialized structured courses will  enable to  increase participants‘ professional competences  in the field of innovation and creativity  of  a teaching process  as well  as  abilities to use ICT effectively  in teaching technologies. Thanks to the mobilities and project participation will both applicants  meet the opportunities to eliminate imperfections and shortcomings  especially in phonetics and also improve their knowledge of vocabulary, morphology and grammar sections of the language.Highly important is the fact that during their stay the participants will  obtain information and experience concerning the language of the country,  culture, traditions and customs of the population in the country of residence,  and will utilize obtained experience in a teaching process.Project participants  will take part in  two structured courses:1st course: innovation and creativity in teaching, 2nd course: teaching by using ICT technologies- Obtained language skills will be completely utilized by the deputy teacher of the school as they will help to establish new cooperation possibilities and through the improved English language communication skills with foreign partners  will also contribute to improve  the school  government more effectively,-Project experience, knowledge and skills will be shared and disseminated  with the colleagues in the form of presentations, didactic days  or  open class lessons, - New and innovative approaches and methods  will be implemented  in the educational process in order to increase the interest of students to communicate in a foreign language and  encourage their creativity in project work,-Special knowledge gained from using the ICT will be used in a teaching process which enables to increase the professionalism, modernization and innovation of the teaching process as well as the students‘motivation,- Based on project and organizational experience from this project the school will apply for the participation in international projects  and this will enable to participate in teachers or selected students‘ mobilies. Both participants will receive Europass mobility.

The submitter and co-ordinator of the project is Obchodná akadémia Dušana Metoda Janotu in Čadca, Slovakia, which is planning to involve 2 teachers of bilingual branch of study (Slovak - English) into international mobility activities that are intended to be realized in the courses - Teaching Skills for Teachers; CLIL course.The usage of the method CLIL within the teaching of vocational subjects (Economics, Commodity Science, Correspondence and Typing) at Obchodná akadémia DMJ v Čadci is focused to strengthen the teaching of English language which is inevitable for our graduates to succeed on European labour market.  Within the project we would like our 2 teachers undergo teaching training courses in the receiving organization Tellus Group in Plymouth in order to develop and reinforce their professional skills and competence, broaden their horizons. Teachers can improve their English language skills and learn how to use new innovative and creative methods in teaching with the aim to improve motivation of students. Experience of teachers is to be converted into methodical meterials, brochures which will be used by other teachers in international context. One of the main objectives of the project is to provide our teachers with an opportunity to enhance their professional knowledge and competence as well as their language and social skills in real environment by active training in the course of mobilities.Teachers have to improve and enhance their professional knowledge within the requirement to prepare students to handle school leaving exam according to Common European Framework of Reference - developing reading, writing, listening and speaking skills in the language level C1.Undertaking the courses teachers will be able to prepare students to succeed and to adapt to changes on European labour market. The mobility activities will take place in Tellus College in Plymouth during 2 weeks of July/August 2016.In the future the school is planning to keep on and enhance co-operation with partner organization Tellus Group.

Bras-Fusil vocational and technical high school is located in the East of Reunon Island and it welcomes a majority of pupils who come from an underprivileged social background. Currently, it attracts less and less pupils enrolled in the vocational classes and especially too in the European courses. That's why, one of the priority of the school policy is to help pupils succed their school education and prevent school drop-outs.In order to reach this goal, the school plans to organise work placement abroad and set up  partnerships with European schools. Those projects will also develop the European citizenship of our pupils in an overseas department.Participants are willing to participate to an European mobility to improve their language level and acquire the skills to handle international projects.Eventually, those participants will become ambassadors of the Erasmus Plus programme by promoting the benefits of the programme and the assets for Bras-Fusil high school.
ACtive Teaching In a Valued Education - AC.T.I.V.E.

INTEGRARE IL PRESENTE PARAGRAFO CON LE CORREZIONI/MODIFICHE APPORTATE SOPRA.The project idea ACtive Teaching In a Valued Education - AC.T.I.V.E. is based on a kind analyze of the context in which school staff is daily involved. The students of our Institution in the majority of case belong from family with a single-income  and medium or low level of instruction although there are students from families culturally higher. The situation  of first year students is mostly problematic:It remains a significant gap between their cultural heritage  and what is required in terms of knowledge, skills and competencies. Perhaps this gap is also more evident in the new generations than in the older one. This has been producing an increase of the percentage of dropout rate in the school. The problem particularly evident in our institute is also of national and European interst. The national average of early leaving school is around 15% while the European one is around 11%. The school,  in consideration of one of its ardresses that on hotellerie, also feels the need to spread in its educational plan the teaching of a healty style of eating that can be deal trasversally in specific ardress's subjects as for example cooking. This might be a good opportunity to deepeen the responsability restaurants might have in the spreading of an healty stile respectful of the results elaborated in the Milano's Charter. The issue of a corret way of eating should become of European interest especially in consideration  of the increase of obesity cases in Europe between children and young and on adolescents and the increase in adult age of the diseases linked to unhealthy diete as for example diabetes.On the base of these considerations, the project idea AC.T.I.V.E. proposes 30 mobilities divided as follow: 12 between the teachers of technical ardress; 12 between the teachers  of the hotel and 4 between  administrative staff. Participants will have their mobility experience in our partner schools in Spain and the United Kingdom.The mobility will be divided into two groups: Group I composed by the teachers arddress technical and technical staff; Group II composed by the professors of the hotel address.The whole consortium will benefit from the project. The institute Sereni, lead partner  of the project  will benefit of a staff more prepared and ready to face the challenges that the territory in which the it is located and the global market require to the school.The experience abroadf will henforce school staff motivation and it will pull to look for a change. Through the comparison with foreign colleagues the staff can improve specific skills: teachers from tecnical ardress the use of teaching methods and active participation as for example the use of role play; the administrative staff will improve management and administrative skills for reporting and creating synergies in fighting early school leaving ; teachers from jotellerie ardress will acquire knowledge on the nutritional value of foods and how to build laboratories that encourage students to specialize on the preparation of dishes not only tastly but also healthy. The whole partnership, thanks to the monitoring phase that includes between the different tasks also the evaluetion of the learning outcomes reached by the partecipants thought the use of ECVET system, will become familiar with the European instruments for the certification and validation of competences formal, informal and non- formal. All the partnership will experience the value of international cooperation, strengthen relations, and in this way, to plan new  mobility for the school staff as well as for the students.In the long period the project will bring to a general improvement of teaching quality, more in line with the needs of the labor market and more effective in combating early school leaving.
Formación en idiomas del profesorado CE Ave María San Cristóbal

The CE AVE MARIA SAN CRISTOBAL  is promoting teacher education in foreign languages in the second cycle of nursery, primary and secondary education with the aim of implementing bilingualism in English in 2017 - 2018 for the second cycle of Nursery and Primary and in the 2018-2019 for Secundary.According to the Andalusian Order of June 28, 2011 published in BOJA 135 of July 12, 2011, the center wants to provide, to the involved students, the acquisition of language skills in relation to the listening, speaking,  reading and writting skills through integrated content in the areas of natural and social sciences. As the project will consolidate in the center, new areas will be incorporated to bilingualism.To accomplish this task, the center is co-funded language training of all teachers involved in the project. Analyzing the progression thereof, and because of the need that teachers must achieve a minimum level of B2 on the Common European Framework for Languages, it has scheduled what areas may initially be  incorporated and what areas can go up itself in successive courses.However, to reach a point of excellence, it was considered that these teachers should supplement their training in an English speaking country.The project therefore will help to improve the skills of teachers, the teaching methods used, the School European dimension and, and finally the students language skills.The plans have been to prepare intensive summer English courses.It was decided to take courses during the summer to avoid interference with the normal running of the center during the course.Contact has been made with a center in UK, acting as a host partner, which will provide with language courses as well as finding accommodation and provide with logistical support.The training received by participants will help the number of teachers with levels B2 and C1 in English to increase.This will clearly and unequivocally impact on the quality of training provided by the KA101 project participants to students at the school .
Czas na kadrę - rozwój umiejętności językowych nauczycieli bielskiego Tuwima w celu podniesienia jakości pracy szkoły.

The applying organization in the project is Zespół Szkół im. Juliana Tuwima, which provides qualifications in the Hotel and Tourism vocational area. The project participants are teachers from the school.During the planning stage of the project, in order to investigate the needs of the school, but also for the project to meet the teachers’ needs, a questionnaire was distributed among the teachers to show the direction and type of planned courses. The legitimacy of such actions has been confirmed by the number of school staff, who have expressed a desire to join the project, making a group of participants up to 56% of all teaching staff. In addition, the project assumptions are dictated by the policies of the Ministry of Education and meet the horizontal and structural priorities.The main objective of this project is to prepare teachers to participate in foreign trainings through participation in courses which improve language skills or allow to learn new languages in striving of multilingualism. It is planned to organize four language courses: English (beginner and pre-intermediate level in the UK), Spanish (beginner level in Spain) and Italian (beginner level in Italy). In addition, an English teacher will take part in observation of the work of a foreign language school, called job shadowing. These courses and observations will help to improve the quality of teaching at Polish school, because on the basis of received information it is advisable to introduce elements of a foreign language during vocational subjects and humanities (elements of CLIL), as well as using the latest teaching methods and techniques of a foreign language observed abroad. The project will also contribute to broaden the horizons and worldview, to skill sharing with teachers from other European countries and promoting the concept of lifelong learning. Teachers will be able to familiarize themselves with various education systems in Europe. The next objective will be to establish new international contacts and increase teachers’ involvement in the development of new application forms of European Programme, as well as sharing their experience from a language course abroad with students going for training abroad.In order to prepare for departure, each participant will have the opportunity to take part in the cultural preparation and short language course in Poland. When it comes to language courses organized abroad, they will be prepared and carried out by an organization Tellus Education Group from the UK which has extensive experience on the international market in organizing language, methodical and professional courses, not only in England, but also in Italy, Spain and Poland. The project activities have been planned so as not to interfere with the work schedule at school, so the dates within which the courses will be organized include a period of winter and summer vacations. During the project essential tests will be carried out to assess the level of participants’ language skills (before and after the course), as well as other forms of assessing their progress in order to achieve the best results.For the purpose of the project,  European School Development Plan for 2016-2018 was developed and adopted by the teaching staff. It describes various stages of activities related to the preparation, implementation and dissemination of the project. All activities undertaken during the project implementation will be monitored by the project coordinators. There are several methods that will be used in order to obtain it: direct observation of the language courses, current interviews with project participants and an analysis of information posted on websites, facebook and publications connected with the dissemination process. In order to assess the activities and results of the project an analysis of the results of the survey conducted among the participants after the course completion will be interpreted. The project itself and its results will form the foundation for future projects offering further training for staff working in the school.Project activities will bring numerous additional benefits, not only for all participants, but also the whole teaching staff, such as increase in the teachers’ mobility, improving language skills, the development of tolerance and openness to other cultures, overcoming prejudice and stereotypes, familiarizing with work in different linguistic and cultural conditions, as well as the ability to work in an international environment. In addition, it will enrich the educational offer of the school. Finally, in the future a number of people participating in dissemination activities of project results will be able to use it indirectly.

The project will take place between the two project partners: Birk KG, Nuertingen and Tellus Group, Plymouth. The Birk KG is an international, owner-operated, wholesaler in building services with offices in Nuertingen, Rottweil, Heidenheim, Lindau, Memmingen, Schwarzach and St. Gallen.Our project partner Tellus Group is as educational partner an active partner of programs such as Erasmus Plus with many years of experience in arranging internships.Planned are two segments, one in October/November 2016 and one in October/November 2017. Each of them are for four weeks. Each time we will send eight trainees. Our trainees have a dual training: Businessman and –woman in wholesale and foreign trade and specialist for warehouse logistics. They are in their second and third year of training and in average 18 years old. The criteria for selection of trainees are good grades and corporate commitment. The cross-cultural and linguistic preparation will be carried out by our company.Our experiences with the project “Go for Europe” have been very positive. In the past few years Birk enabled 36 trainees under Leonardo Da Vinci an internship abroad and had good experiences with it, including increased, language skills, mobility, flexibility, independence and openness towards other cultures. Furthermore, the trainees gain valuable experiences in dealing with international interlocutors and business partners.As a result, the attractiveness of the dual training can be increased significantly for both the trainees and Birk KG, also providing an image boost in the competitive market.The duration of the stay will be four weeks in Plymouth or Portsmouth. The trainees will be accommodated in host families, which are selected by the Tellus Group. On the first day the trainees receive all the informations (map of the city, timetable of busses, language course and the companies).During the first week, the trainees conduct an intense language course. For the following three weeks they work in a selected internship company. Our company organizes the travel arrangements and insurances. The Tellus Group organizes the transfer from the airport, the accommodations in host families, language course and work placements.There is regular contact with our partner Tellus Group and to our trainees. The trainees have the opportunity to stay in contact with Tellus Group at any time.The evaluation of the project is assured by the participant reports, the confirmation of the project partners and the personal feedback from our trainees.
Work Placements in Europe - Kaufmännische AZUBIs im Auslandspraktikum

The internationalization of vocational training has continually grown more relevant in the past few years. The improvement of interpersonal skills of “mobility trainees” and apprentices, who have worked abroad, seems to happen incidentally. The improvement of “soft skills” (analytical thinking, creativity, and sense of responsibility) as well as international competency are important for the apprentices and the employers alike; especially those in commercial business dealing with office management and IT.The topic of language skills is becoming a greater factor. Due to increasing market internationalization, competency of technical English (or other world languages such as Spanish) has become requisite know-how of all applicants. Thus, strong knowledge of other languages increases individual chances on the labor market twofold.For apprentices who work in commercial businesses, the highest achievement is the successful completion of an apprenticeship abroad. For it entails a high quality vocational training, an increased dimensionality to their European identity, and the advancement of foreign language acquisition, as well as an increased knowledge of intercultural awareness.We gain to continually offer our highly motivated apprentices the opportunity to complete a 3- to 4-week apprenticeship/internship in a partner country. They will participate in a 3- to 4-week program that will entail  work in an profession-related company as well as the participation in an intercultural seminar, intercultural activities and language course.The stay will be organized and supervised by the mobility team of BS28. Clarification and establishment of  accommodations, job placement, the participation in an intercultural language course, and a mentorship with an on-site contact person will be aided by the foreign partners. The apprentices will be prepared for their foreign apprenticeship via an intercultural preparation seminar with Arbeit und Leben Hamburg.Expected results are:The apprentices will get to know the culture, economic and political infrastructure of a foreign country, will experience the profession of an EU country and compare it with the German version, will communicate with schoolmates, colleagues and customers and will finally prepare a public presentation of their project.Along with the German partners (BS28 and Arbeit und Leben Hamburg) implementation of the study abroad program will concern the following groups and countries: UK, Ireland as well as Spain will be included as well and will also concern themselves with the implementation of the study abroad program.The program's aim is to guarantee both a good work experience and a good social integration into daily British, Irish or Spanish life.

Our Erasmus+ proposal has the aim to enable our students to spend four weeks in England for a language course and an internship. All of our students are currently enrolled in a dual vocational education. This means that they spend three to four days a week working in the company that hired them and one to two days at our vocational school. When they are sent abroad they are at the end of their second year of studies at our school and are about 19 to 24 years old.All of them are working in publishing companies, advertisement companies or in the marketing department of their company. Typically they are working in small and medium sized companies that are not able to send their students abroad. Nevertheless their field of employment is characterized by an increasing internationalization. In order to prepare our students for the job market and increase their employability, we want to offer them the chance to spend one part of their vocational training abroad. We want to give them the opportunity to broaden their horizon and increase their understanding for a different culture by spending time in an English company as well as by interacting with their host families in England. Furthermore, we want to enable them to use the language skills they have acquired in school. We believe that the students will not only be able to enrich their own lives with this experience but that they will also gain a higher employability for their current or future companies and experience what it means to live in the European Union.They will obtain the Europass Mobility as well as a language course certificate confirming their internship, language skills as well as the additional professional skills they have obtained during their internship abroad. With these measures we want to increase their chances both on the national and international job market.
GoEurope - wir bringen Berliner in Bewegung: Mobilität für Auszubildende, Berufsschüler, Absolventen der beruflichen Bildung, Referendare und  Berufsbildungsverantwortliche

The city state of Berlin has a youth unemployment rate of roughly 9.5 % as of December 2015, the highest figure among all 16 German states. This problematic situation leads directly to the most important goal of the project – improving the employability of apprentices, students in full-time vocational training as well as those who have just completed their vocational training course. We want to reach this goal by offering the target group customized high-quality learning settings abroad. To achieve this we will continue cooperating with the vocational schools, the apprentices’ companies, the Chamber of Commerce as well as with the trade unions and professionals’ organisations. To flank the achievement of these goals we aim to strengthen the competences of the professionals working in schools (particularly at the management level), so they can better aid the young learners to enter the European employment more successfully.An overriding objective of the project is to increase the integration of participants with a migrational background, who are young parents or who are disadvantaged learners into the work force.The following are the main activities we will offer the youths mentioned above:- internships abroad for the youths in their fields- project work abroad for the youths on topics related to participants' vocational fields A majority of the participating youths will be from the following fields: clerical occupations, media, hotel, gastronomy, carpenters/joiners.These main activities will supported by the following flanking activities offered to professionals and student teachers in vocational training centers in Berlin: - Advanced and further training abroad with the topic “professionalizing the teacher’s acting in the classroom on the European level aiming to better prepare students for the European job market”.- Professional development training for school management staff regarding “students with special needs”.- Training for student teachers with the focus on „Learning from the Best in Europe – enhancing methodical expertise!”- Training for future school management staff: “How to successfully develop a vocational training school/institution”Our GoEurope mobility network encompasses 30 different partner organizations in 10 EU countries plus Turkey. All of our partners are specialized in the professional execution of Erasmus+ (formerly Leonardo-da-Vinci)-funded learning stays for youths and professionals in the field of vocational training. The majority of our partners can tap into a network of a several hundred or even a several thousand potential internship companies. They are well connected with the vocational training centers and political institutions in their respective regions. As soon as the decisive parameters of a mobility flow have been defined with our local training institutions the project is actively promoted to the target group and participants are selected from the applicants. As soon as the participants for a particular flow have been secured the partner organization in the host country is commissioned with carrying out the preparations for the flow. The quality of each flow is ensured by a number of measures, e. g. mid-term reports, evaluation meetings, accompanying visits and/or a preparatory visit. The most desired outcome of the stay abroad is always to improve the participants' employability (roughly 10 % of our participants even receive a job offer abroad), improved social integration of participants who are young parents, have a migrational background or learning disabilities, improved proficiency in foreign languages as well as personality development. Furthermore, we intend to create excitement for the European Union in general amongst satisfied participants! All of them can be instrumental in internationalizing their educational institutions. Particularly by helping to create a functional network including the body responsible for the project and local partner organizations.Our network has been growing for ten years now and the long-term effects of our steady growth in terms of quality and numbers of participants are becoming ever more evident. By now 20 Berlin vocational training centers have already appointed an EU-Affairs Representative to manage their collaboration with us. Two vocational training centers now even offer vocational training courses with integrated mobility stays abroad. For our EUROPASS mobility ceremonies we are often honored to have Undersecretaries of State personally handing over the certificates to our proud young participants.A development towards an innovation and internationalization cluster including our local, national and international partners is becoming ever more visible, gaining more and more capacity to establish internationalization.Last but not least around 500 youths come back home every year - excited about their mobility experience abroad. Their personality has developed, they have experience they will be able to dr
Europa hautnah - Auslandsaufenthalt für Auszubildende der Stadtverwaltung Ravensburg

The educational concept created by the city of Ravensburg "Future 2020 - training at the city council " provides that trainees can provide some of their practical training abroad to undergo further training abroad. The aim is to promote their own mobility and in addition to the recovery of its own professionals to promote the personal development of trainees . Hence, in addition to the improvement of international action skills and foreign language skills are intensified. Also the independence and personal flexibility should be encouraged.Knowledge of foreign languages need now not only our budding event managers and merchants for tourism and leisure, but in particular the public administration clerks and skilled employees for office communication.The exchange promotes international relations and broadens the view of our trainees . Ultimately, this increases the overall quality of education. Likewise, acquire the budding professionals intercultural skills , which are in the increasing number of citizens with a migration background an important qualification .The four-week posting to Plymouth (England ) is to be with 6 apprentices who complete dual vocational training and are in the second year of training , conducted in July/August 2016 and 2017. For the first time, it might be possible that there will be apprentices under 18 who apply for a participation 2017. Therefore we apply for aid for an accompanying person to provide for special needs in taking care of these apprentices.After a one-week intensive language course a three-week practical placement is on the programme. Accommodation is in host families and it is offered a cultural programme. In the host country , the stay is implemented by our partner organization Tellus Group Ltd. They have years of experience with the implementation of mobility experiences and we work together very well since 2011.The course of the Tellus Group refreshes the existing English skills and deepens it . Participants can also receive voice and internship certificates that represent an advantage for further personal and professional life.By staying with host families and the daily contact with colleagues in the placement operation, the theme of our project is automatically lived " Europe first hand ." The trainees will be assigned to each separate host families to allow no "hiding" behind other trainees. Mostly, the students share their room with an intern from another country , so that in a very tangible intercultural consideration can and must be practiced. About teaching and work in the placement companies , the participants come together with students from other countries . This promotes our goal to encourage our students to overcome barriers and overcome prejudices .We as promoters promise us an increasing attractiveness as a training company in the increasingly competitive market for suitable trainees. The city of Ravensburg takes as a public employer a pioneering position , thus gaining additional training company as attractive. We also recruit the majority of our administrative staff from our trainees. Empirical evidence from the private sector and from already -made experience from assignments in the years 2011-2015 show that trainees work after a stay abroad more independently, more flexible and are more motivated . Trainees see life of another country from a different perspective by getting there insight into the working world. In addition, the trainee has the opportunity to acquire country-specific skills as well as to meet operational processes and techniques they use in the city of Ravensburg and able to contribute . Accordingly, the acquired knowledge, experience and skills can be used directly for the city administration and its service quality to good .

Twelve years of experience of the Goldenberg Europakolleg (GEK) – both a college of further education and a vocational school- offer an established project background and a perfect basis for the new European programme ERASMUS+. Both of the school’s locations are situated in major economically important areas near Cologne. Our cooperation with many successful and internationally active companies in the fields of agricultural machinery, chemistry and the metalworking industry demands a vocational training which prepares trainees, and the teaching staff as well for the challenges of a growing European job market. The GEK is a European School which highly values on their European oriented education. One example is the variety of language courses on offer such as English, Dutch, French and Spanish. We consider it to be important that our students have the opportunity to use these languages in real-life professional situations. These take place during a three week internship work placement abroad.Here, our project background and our project objectives are closely linked. The VET mobilities of trainees as well as trainers lead to an increased cross-cultural understanding of a common Europe.The experiences of our students abroad lead to a higher self-confidence and encourage them to seek for job possibilities beyond their country borders. Another project objective is that “Europe” is part of the school’s curriculum. Lessons in various subjects deal with topics that are relevant for a European way of thinking. This is supported by the school’s annual European week which offers the students a variety of projects focusing on Europe.   With the start of ERASMUS+, the GEK is able to offer almost 100 mobility participants the chance to travel and work abroad in 2016/17. This is the largest number of participants so far and follows the plans of our district council in Cologne to raise the number of vocational mobilities to 10%.  These participants are for example technicians for illumination advertisements, electricians for automation engineering, chemical lab assistants, metal workers and technical assistants in the field of design.So far we have organized VETPRO-projects for trainers and teachers which took them to our partners abroad for one week. Last year they worked under the title “Teaching the European Way”. Our IVT-projects under the title “Different Places-Different Faces” enabled our students to work for three weeks in Finland, Rumania, Malta, Great Britain and on the island of La Palma.All those activities are now coming together with ERASMUS+ and the GEK is now offering future participants to work under the title “IVT quality+”. In addition to our student mobility under KA1, we also succesfully applied for a KA2 strategic partnership. But the GEK does not only send students abroad, we also welcome our partner school’s students from Finland here in the Rhineland area. The teachers and trainers of the GEK organize accommodation and internships with our cooperating companies in the field of electrical engineering, chemistry and design. These internships usually last from four to six weeks.Our project implementation has been consistently improved and is now divided into 3 main stages: The first stage is the application phase. In this stage students qualify by participating in cross-cultural preparation lessons. Here they also create a europass CV in English and pass a mobility interview, to show their motivation to work abroad. This stage ends in an intercultural evening which prepares all the participants for their upcoming departure day.The second stage is their actual stay abroad. During this time, the students are monitored, both by the local partners as well as the responsible teachers and trainers of the GEK. The participants document their linguistic, social, personal and professional impressions and experiences in a travel diary called “Travelog”. It is an important instrument of the third stage of the mobility project. This is where the evaluation of the experience abroad is going to take place. With the help of the Travelog their gained competence are documented and can be comprehended. Later on these competences are evaluated in our competence overview, which are used to fill out the europass Mobility certificate.The project results, their benefits as well as their impact are closely related. The Europass Mobility is one example. It is used for future applications by our trainees after the end of their vocational training, as well as by our teaching staff for better career chances. This document increases their career prospects on both the national and European job market. Our collaboration with regional companies that employ apprentices of our foreign project partners, often results in the decrease of language barriers and more cultural acceptance. By implementing our European mobilities we do not only spread the idea of Europe within the GEK but also increasingly on a regional level.
Lernen und arbeiten in England III

For its students, the Gewerbliche Schule Ehingen wants to create the opportunity of an internationally accepted practical training abroad. Similar to a former Leonardo-project, the school intends to offer three-week work placements in England in industry and trades and crafts (mechatronics technicians, car mechanics, industrial mechanics, industrial electronics technicians, plastics processing technicians, professional drivers, floorers and parquet layers). Details for the next two years: 2 flows to England with 10 participants each. All participants are at the end of their second or at the beginning of their third year of vocational training.Parents or companies rarely encourage the students to go abroad. However, it is evident, that they make valuable experiences which benefit them in their career and intercultural awareness. They learn about industrial production, maintenance and repair and customer service or customer orders in comparison with their home country. Apart from that they enlarge their professional vocabulary and learn to integrate into the workflow of a foreign company in a short period of time. This placement is accepted as part of their German apprenticeship and provides them with advantages for future job applications (certificates).The work placement has been positively evaluated by the previous project participants. Their training companies increasingly appreciate and support this possibility. Our present strategy has proven successful which is why we intend to establish this programme over a longer term.
Die EU-Bürgerschaft durch Auslandspraktikum aktiv gestalten

The diversity of people is to be considered by differentiated educational opportunities which is part of our school mission statement. It aims at a future-oriented training to the individual requirements of the trainees and to acquire comprehensive professional, social and personal skills which are necessary for a successful career. In order to  individually support students in their development they need attractive and motivating learning opportunities that to develop job related knowledge, skills and abilities.The international project of the Wilhelm-Schickard-Schule Tübingen is part of the lived mission statement, by taking into  the needs of students into account and offering them the chance to get involved into a project in which they can collect additional experience during their vocational training. It is the desire of many students to spend some time abroad and improve their language skills. The WSS Tübingen wants to support their trainees to acquire  English language skills and to achieve quality learning outcomes for a successful education by offering attractive learning opportunities. The trainees shall be motivated by the  experience of the stay abroad for a lifelong willingness to learn, being aware of common European values and incorporate them actively in society and working life.During to flows 10 vocational school students participate in a three-week international project in collaboration with the Tellus Group in Portsmouth. The trainees are in 2-3 year courses of the dual system in the commercial sector.In the first week 20 English lessons will be held that prepare them for the subsequent two-week internship. This content will be practiced in business standard situation and intercultural awareness at work will be further developed. In addition, country-specific social and cultural topics will be discuess.During the work experience job-related language skills can be applied and improved. Students will experience the professional life in the business environment foreign in a foreign country. They participate in meetings and get to know the operational processes. They compare the work processes and the kind of collegial collaboration with the experience from their previous company training.Participants acquire skills that can be transferred to future professional situations . This acquired skills increase the readiness to work in a company with international  business relations. These experiences prepare them for the changing requirements of a European labor market in terms of flexibility , mobility and intercultural competence .
