The responsable of the project and the financial responsable will asure the elaboration and the sending at national agency of final project report according to procedures in the quide Erasmus+ at the establshed data.The evoluation of the project will be realised by using specific assesment instruments such as quizz documents analysis.The sustenability is assured by the multiplication of the result, suport materials, new projects

By this project we would like to follow Leonardo da Vinci Programme because of the long term experience and because it has fulfilled our expectations and to join ERASMUS+ programme. The aim of the project is to support vocational and language education of our students with respect to continuity of the theoretical and practical knowledge. We respond to the factual and relevant needs of the students of vocational schools and we deal with questions how to responsibly prepare these students to their future jobs with respect to the work situation neither in our region but in all states of the European Union. The project has been planned for the second and the third grade students. Totally there will be supported 38 students of Tourism, Business and Economy, Graphic Design and Shop Assistant. Twelve students of Tourism will check their knowledge and skills during three weeks in the area of the Club Belcekiz Beach Hotel situated in the Turkish Fethyie. With the same aim eight students of Economy and Business will be sent for three weeks to the south-west England town Plymouth, where the company Tellus Group place them into the administration areas of the local companies. Four students of Economy and Busincess and six students of Graphics Designs and Shop Assistant will spend their placement in Slovakian Lučenec where they spend their training in the regional companies aimed to their field of studies. Eight students of Business and Economy, Graphic Design and Shop Assistant will be provided by the professional training in the French Epinal, by Lycée Viviani School, at the local companies. The activities react to the needs of the current vocational training while they respect School Educational Programmes and development of vocational qualifications. In the frame of a training the students are prepared for their future jobs, they verify their theoretical knowledge at the training, they improve a foreign language knowledge, they will learn how to respect different cultures and traditions, to be good oriented in the unknown place, they will learn how to be independent and accept work habits. The teacher will study different educational systems and will meet the rules and competences of the vocational training of the different school. The project has been founded on the co-operation betweeen sending organization and receiving organizations, which follows theirs proved co-operation from the previous years. The main aim of the project is to teach the students to use the obtain skills and knowledge not just in the frame of the secondary vocational training but at the higher education level, as well as at their further jobs.
Mobilité innovante dans la voie professionnelle 2016

The consortium « Innovative Mobility in the vocational field 2016 » (MOBinov 16) will boost European mobility in company abroad to the advantage of 255 learners from Nord Pas de Calais – Picardy: pupils from secondary schools for vocational training, apprentices and vocational trainees.   The region Nord-Pas-de-Calais – Picardy has nearly 6 million inhabitants, which represents 9.4% of the population of metropolitan France. It is thus the third most populated French area in the new territorial organisation. The new region is characterized by its youth with the highest proportion of under-25-year-olds and student attractiveness.Raising the level of training remains a significant objective for the new region while, at the same time, the number of school leavers without qualifications is still above the national average. While the rate of unemployment is below the national average from the level V, the lack of training is a major handicap in the career and for the integration into the workplace. Improving the level of training, the rise of abilities for employees, the lifelong learning for job seekers, or even strengthening the fight for literacy and preventing from dropping out of school before the first qualification remain major issues. The main objective of the MOBinov 16 project is to foster the mobility of targeted beneficiaries in order to secure their training route and to favour their long-term professional integration. About thirty partner organisations (secondary schools for vocational training, apprentices training centres, training organisms) are going to federate within the consortium and experience joint projects in a sector-based logic.A steering committee, in accordance with a coordinating team, will supervise the implementation of the project. Each organism, which is member of the consortium, will conduct its mobility project along with the support of the steering committee. The link between the other consortia of the territory (consortium of Local Missions for complementary beneficiaries – NEET –, academic consortia of Amiens and Lille) will be assured under the auspices of the Regional Committee for Mobility (COREMOB) and will ensure that the targeted people are complementary and the territory well covered. Impacts expected on the beneficiaries of mobility projects carried out during MOBinov 16:- Improving the propensity for mobility and the openness to the world and to Europe,- Improving professional skills- Improving employability - Improving the rate of people returning to school or deciding to pursue studies.Impacts expected on education staff:- Improving teaching skills- Improving the knowledge of European mechanisms- Strengthening the motivation for setting up mobility projects.Impacts expected on participating organisations (educational institutions/training bodies)- Developing local partnership,- Developing European and international openness,- Developing attractiveness (young people chose to study in these institutions/training bodies) and recognition,- Improving the skills of administrative teams in terms of project follow-up and management.The project MOBinov 16 meets the challenges of Nord Pas de Calais – Picardy’s territory (fostering professional mobility, returning to school and having access to level V diploma at least, pursuing studies in higher education, equal access to vocational training, raising the level of training. The project MOBinov 16 will contribute to rekindle interest from educational institutions and training bodies for European and international mobility. It will enable to disseminate the good practices already tested and produce other European projects.

The EURO+STEPHENSON Project involves 15 apprentices who are currently taking on BAC Professionnel (Vocational A-levels), BTS (Higher National Diploma) in Commerce, Tourism or Hospitality or MCAR (BTEC level 3 – Front Office Operations). They are expected to pass their exam in June 2016. They still need to consolidate their language and professional skills to take on further studies in better conditions. They will then satisfy the pre-requisites of HND and Bachelor’s degree. This includes organizational, language and analytical skills, as well as hard skills). This will also enable them to sign a work contract.During this ten month long project – including a six month work placement either in the UK, Spain or Germany  – apprentices will be given a vocational training status. During the following year they will have the opportunity to enroll in a superior course (from Vocational A-levels to either BTEC level 3 – Front Office Operations or Higher National Diploma; or from Higher National Diploma to Bachelor’s degree). They will be tutored for two months before they leave and two other months after their return home. Before the six month training period, a two month long preparation will be held with cross-cultural, social, cultural and language courses on an e-learning platform, and an initial assessment will be undertaken before departure. An administrative follow-up guide is also on the agenda.Following the apprentices’ return, a second period of preparation will be held for the apprentices. They are expected to fill out the MOBILITY EUROPASS, write out a professional report and give an oral presentation in two languages. A language assessment will then be scheduled.Placements aim at reinforcing language, professional and personal skills to give apprentices more self-confidence. They also make them aware of training and work market internationalization. Placements will indeed value skills that they have gained during their course and will allow them to open themselves to another culture, with improved language skills. This will therefore have an impact on their career path and widen their cultural and language knowledge of another European country through the acquisition of new professional skills.A six month long mobility is an additional asset for apprentices, giving them the opportunity to gain real hands on experience. A placement in a European company will bring added value to the beneficiaries’ background and show up on their resume, whether it be to take on further studies or to be hired. These placements will certainly have a positive impact on their career path through personal development, autonomy, self-confidence and cross-cultural adaptability to different work situations in their future professional life.In regards to CFA Stephenson, international mobility will have a positive impact on training quality, teaching practices, employability, local, regional and international influence (partnerships, collaboration on teaching techniques, ECVET criteria, incoming and outgoing mobilities, hosting of foreign apprentices and students), etc.Assessments and certifications of language and professional skills through the EUROPASS and the validation of a work report on a dual training programme will contribute to the next level of qualification of apprentices who previously went through a difficult context.A first period of tutoring before departure was designed to get participants prepared to the following activities: - cross-cultural communication- language preparation (OLS platform and CFA tutoring)- administrative tasksjob hunting and identification of potential accommodationA second period of tutoring on return will be dedicated to the following: - filling out of the EUROPASS MOBILITY- preparation and finalisation of a report (40 pages, 1/3 of which in the language of the hosting country), together with a related oral presentationADVANTAGES: - better employability on the European/worldwide work market- development of international projects and training sessions- implementation of ECVET- quality and innovation in teaching procedures.
Pogłębienie umiejętności zawodowych przez praktykę w Niemczech i Hiszpanii

The project entitled Deepening professional skills through practice in Germany and Spain, was based on a diagnosis of the needs of schools, pupils, staff and school environment CKZiU No. 1 in Warsaw in the school year 2015 / 16. Conception of school development assumes its constant development and improvement, which resulted in the creation of the European Strategy for the Development of Schools assuming an improvement in the areas : I-organization and management, II teaching and didactic , III competences of the staff. The project has three main objectives for the pupils and staff.1.Helping  young people in entering the EU market through counseling European and international work placements in Germany2.Supporting vocational training of school by participating in job shadowing staff in enterprises in Spain.3.Rising the prestige of school through the promotion of the project results in the local, regional, national and EU levelsThe project has been defined beam specific objectives for students, teacheres, school and its local community. The objectives translate into action-objectives of the project are included in the schedule and arranged in time. The tasks are transformed  into results and products of the project directly affecting the educational processes taking place in schools and improving the quality of school work. Products and results are disseminated in accordance with the strategyThe project includes international cooperation with a partner from Leipzig -realizacja internships for students and partners from the UK -realizacja Job shadowing for senior Salamanca in Spain. The project implementation period is 01.11.2016-31.10.2018.The internships in Leipzig involved a total of 70 students, including 35 from the technical construction and 35 with technical landscaping, 6 teachers caregivers. Implementation of the internship takes place in two stages, Stage I in July-August 2017 it includes 17 TB and 18 learn learn Lanscape A, 3 teachers guardians, the second a step of July-August 2018 includes 18 TB and 17 learn learn LA, 3 teachers caregivers. The duration of each of the internships is 30 days substance.Implementation of the Job Shadowing takes place in February 2017, five days substantive practical training staff in companies of renewable energy systems and energy efficiency and includes 4 teachers.The project uses the methodology of the educational project, its preparation and execution is teamwork staff CKZi U 1 and 2 foreign partners. Director CKZiU No. 1 established a project management team consisting of teachers and staff, supervises the team. The project prepared by a team of four teachers for its implementation is also responsible management team, composed of staff composed of project coordinator -kierownik practical education responsible for project management in accordance with the principles of the Erasmus + (financial agreement, reporting, dissemination of results, language support OLS rules for the application logo) and the implementation of the project budget and 4 members of the team responsible for carrying out specific tasks merit of the project and allocated to-date activities detailed in these tasks. The team includes teachers of vocational subjects and foreign languages teacher. Team Coordinator works with the accounts in the DBFO in Wola Disctrict.The project implements 24 tasks identified and described in the project schedule From 8.Description of the expected results of the project predicts an increase in knowledge, skills and competences of pupils and professional competence of teachers. An internship abroad as the first work gives participants and mentors teachers the opportunity to learn the realities of the labor market in the European Union. In addition, vocational education more attractive, triggers the overall mobility of young people with the motivation to learn the trade. Students will have the opportunity to gain additional expertise that will give them future employment opportunities or to register your own business.The project implementation will also foreign partners through authentication and strengthen contacts, creating a canon of good practices in joint cooperation and the creation of a network of institutions and companies cooperating with the implementation of subsequent projects.    The impact on indirect recipients will be visible with in the form of strengthening the image of CKZiU No. 1 as an institution that cares about the comprehensive development of students and teachers, open to the needs of pupils, their parents, the local community and national levels.

This project builds on a previous eight-year experience with mobility program at our school, through which students and staff get priceless professional and personal experience by completion of training program at the workplaces of our foreign partners.In this project, we plan to realize 47 mobilities, out of which 41 are designed for students  and 6 for teachers. The project comes out of significant needs of school, which are met by its implementation.The offer of educational programmes at our school has nearly doubled over the past few years and the number of students has increased to the current 880. To meet the educational needs of our students, we extended the number of cooperating organizations in this project up to the current 9 and we have fully covered all the educational programmes taught at our school with mobilities. Apart from several school educational programmes under Applied Chemistry there are some other programmes such as Fire Protection, Security and Legal Studies, Cosmetic Services and apprenticeship Hairdresser. We plan mobilities into six European countries (Germany, Cyprus, Great Britain, Spain, Italy, Slovakia 4x). Our project partners are vocational schools, technical colleges and businesses. With four of our partners we realize reciprocal mobilities.The receiving organizations for students in chemical branches are vocational schools (SBG Dresden, IIS Scalcerle Padova, SOS Chemical Bratislava), two technical colleges (University of Plymouth and the University of Nicosia) and a Spanish pharmaceutical company BIOT Microgen, mediated by Europroyectos LdV Granada.Students in the branch of Fire Protection will participate in an internship at The Secondary School of Construction in Žilina, which disposes of excellent technical background in the fire fighting equipment and works closely with the Secondary School of Fire Protection, which will also partake in our students training.Students in the field of Security and Legal Studies pass their practice at the Faculty of Safety Engineering University of Žilina, namely the Department of Safety Engineering and the Department of Emergency Engineering.For students of Cosmetic Services and Hairdresser we secured professional experience in beauty and hairdressing salons at Secondary Vocational School (Beauty and Care School).Simultaneously with the increase in number of mobilities, we also strive to raise up the quality. In all mobilities of this project, we will apply the principles of ECVET. Some units of learning outcomes have been created in previous projects and some new are just being created.Within this project we also plan mobilities of pedagogical staff - VET teachers as we believe that professional development of teachers is a prerequisite for quality assurance in education. Besides professional and pedagogical skills of teachers we also want to strengthen their language skills. In this project we want to focus on vocational teachers in the field of Security and Legal Studies who will complete work-programme at the Faculty of Safety Engineering, and vocational teachers in Applied Chemistry who will complete training programme at IIS Scalcerle in Padua.On the side of students we see the impact of the project in the acquisition of new knowledge and skills, strengthening linguistic communication and lexical skills, improving self-confidence and also motivation for further education. Thanks to this experience students gain an overview of the requirements imposed on their profession, learn about possibilities of study abroad and employment on the European labor market.  Through this experience the profile of graduates has been improved, which brings benefit to strategic partners of our school (employers, tertiary education).On the side of school, we see an apparent increase in the attractiveness of school resulting in an increased interest of studying science. Through mobilities the school receives valuable feedback about the quality of education. The school benefits from the exchange of experience and the transfer of good practice in the practice of school. Within this project we above all want to test the units of learning outcomes and start using them for national mobilities afterwards as well.The project will be disseminated through the school website, the educational portal of the Pardubice region authority, local and regional press. The project will be presented during the Open Days, at fairs of schools, at workshops with employers. After completion of the project activities, a final conference will be held at the school where students involved in the project will present  mobilities realized in the project period.
Mobilitati in Europa in vederea formarii profesionale

The project “European Mobilities concerning vocational training”, -which Economic College “PartenieCosma” Oradea acceses- has at the base of it the awareness of the idea of lifelong learning, training and more than that, the idea of the necessity of deepening theoretical knowledge through practical instruction. On the other hand, the project team acknowledges the importance of developing the European dimension of education by accessing this kind of projects whose main beneficiaries are the students of our school. Thus, this project becomes another tool in the hands of our school teachers to support students so that they can find other ways of responding to the challenges of contemporary world. Moreover, the idea of the project was brought to life in the context of the lack of proper space for vocational training. The  building that is going to house such a space is still under construction. In this context, by the means of the project “European Mobilities concerning vocational training” we propose to offer our students a budget of extra time for vocational training in countries from Europe, countries that have a long history in tourism and gastronomy. In this way students are going to acquire new skills and abilities to their professional profile in line with the demands of European labour market. The project is taking place throughout the course of two school years: 2016/2017, 2017/2018. The project is addressed to a number of 35 students of Xth form of our school, level of qualification 3, Tourism and Food specialization. The students are going to be male and female teenagers of 16-17 years old, coming both from the town of Oradea and from the countryside: 40% of our students are from the villages of Bihor county, but also Sălaj and Satu-Mare. These students are going to benefit from three weeks of vocational trining at economic agents in Europe Union countries, following this timeline:  Flux no 1: France 29th of May – 18th of June 2017  Flux no 2: England 5th of June – 27th of June 2017  Flux no 3: Spain 28th of August – 19th of September 2017  Flux no 4: Italy 2nd of July – 24th of July 2018  Flux no 5: Portugal 20th of August – 11th of September 2018 The seven students of each flux are going to be accompanied by one teacher. The general objective of the project is improving the professional competences of our Xth form students (16-17 years old), 3rd level of qualification Tourism and Food specialization. The specific objects of the project are:• Upgrading their knowledge related to Public Food/Alimentation• Improvement of students skills in line with the new requests and good European practices• Students awareness of the demands of European Union• Acquiring skills/abilities/competences that exceed the national curriculum• Understanding the culture of the host country and especially its gastronomical culture• Consolidation of self confidence, of working in teams• Improvement of communication in a foreign language• Development of the consciousness of self educationAll these objectives will be achieved through such activities like:• Instructing, getting familiar with the new environement – the kitchen, all equipment that is going to be used, the content of the menu, processing raw material, organoleptic examination of mass catering, measuring raw material, obtaining meals with low/high degree of difficulty, operations for the conservation of raw materials, knowledge of the amount of nutrients and energy of preparations/food, cooking dishes according to specific technological processes, seasoning, plating different types of dishes as aesthetic as possible, presentation of serving systems, traditional recipies, setting up a menu for different kinds of events.As far as the implementation methodology is concerned, the project team will make best use of the time and human resources.At the same time, the project team will conduct responsibly each phase of the project, beginning with the selection of participants up to writing the final report – as it has been mentioned in the application form.As far as the results are concerned, they are obvious both on the students that take part in the project and on the teachers (members of the project team, accompanying teacher, speciality teachers) and on the curriculum as well. As a conclusion, by undertaking these vocational traineeships as part of this project , our students are going to benefit a lot both on a professional level but also on a personal level as well – they will fefine their social abilities, improve their communication skills in a foreign language and achieve a strong interest in self development.On a long term, our institution is going to consider accessing other projects in Erasmus + Programme: Mobility Projects or Strategic Partnerships.
Praktyki zagraniczne kluczem do przyszłego sukcesu zawodowego ucznia

Project summary:Project ‘Professional Training Abroad as Essential for Future Professional Success of Secondary School Students’The beneficiaries of the project are students of secondary school of hotel administration and catering and nutrition attending Zespół Szkół Zawodowych - ZSG (Technical and Vocational Secondary School Complex) - in Wrocław. The project addresses dual 3-week professional training for the students.A group of 16 students is going to go to the United Kingdom for professional training and internship in June 2017. The youths are going to work at various positions in hotels (kitchen, restaurant, bar, reception desk, housekeeping) and also undergo practical training at Tellus college.Students’ mobility project shall support students in their personal and professional development, increase the quality of vocational training, allow obtaining practical experience and new skills essential in the continually developing area of catering and hotel services. The students are going to learn about British cuisine, and work with regional products which are little known in Poland. The project will significantly raise their language skills in English – the language which is inevitable for efficient interpersonal communication in modern world. Professional training abroad should enable students to learn about the culture, tradition and history of the United Kingdom, especially in their free time. They will be able to become more self-sufficient and independent; their self-esteem and their multicultural and European consciousness concerning values will increase. Vocational education in Poland is currently being rebuilt after years of neglect, so enabling students to have professional training abroad should enhance the position of ZSG and encourage more candidates to choose their career in service professions.After returning from the training students’ satisfaction will increase their motivation to learn and work, which should affect the whole school community and promote professional development of its other members by exchanging experience.The project is compatible with the Development Strategy of Lower Silesia Voivodship 2020 where tourism is one of the main pillars of the balanced development of the region rich in nature, landscape and cultural qualities. Catering and tourism business is developing dynamically and is constantly in need of new human resources with high social competences and professional skills. Lower Silesia voivodship is one of the most frequently visited by tourists region of Poland, both domestic and foreign, so it can be assumed that well-qualified graduates of secondary school of hotel administration, tourism and catering will find their place in the labour market in Poland and abroad.Advantages of the project:- reliable, competent partner with long-standing experience Tellus (Group) Ltd – Work Experience- verified training workplaces,  meeting the criteria and expectations- proper preparation of participants-to-be for taking part in training abroad (language and communicativeness preparation are of primary importance)- professional pedagogic and merit-oriented counselling
Mobilité et découverte des pratiques professionnelles

We are a secondary school located in Saint Ouen (93400). It proposes general, technological and professional trainings. We propose a 3-years professional training wich prepares a vocational high school diploma specialized in management and administration with the possibility to join the european section in the second and third level (we have three levels for the vocational diploma : first, second and third levels). The european section proposes two more hours of english and english communication. In this european section, a preparation in language and culture are proposed to our students. We study professional subjects in english ; we play oral roles ; we study the history of Europe, we research documentary, we organize activities outside. We also propose a complementary training (1 year) with specialization in "commercial assistant job" that our students can prepare after vocational high diploma. It was created one year ago with local companies. Our participants are from our european section (second level) and the complementary training. We do not propose our project to students from the third level because they have exams. Our participants often come from unprivileged background. They start the training courses with an handicap, it is not like pupils coming from general classes. They do not have an european culture and opening. The families can not pay intensive courses of language or journeys for their children. This project concerns 15 students studying in our european section and complementary training. This project is a professional training with an internship in companies proposed by our partner Tellus Group, during 4 weeks. It is a training courses organisation which proposes a professional training "Communication in the Workplace" and internships in companies. Telllus Group offers the certification Apted "Responsible work practice". The objectives of our project are : work experience, improving the english level, enrichment of our professional training for our students, numerous french and european certifications, getting more chances to follow studies or to integrate the labor market, more things in the CV. First of all, the impact is local : valuation of our professional training with the european section and the complementary training "commercial assistant job". Then, the impact is regional and national : better results, attractiveness of our school and of our professional section in Seine-Saint-Denis, partnership with a european organisation Tellus Group. We hope to launch this project to offer the most completed professional training to our participants in order to offer them getting enough skills and work experience to integrate the labor market. This project will allow our students to open their mind to a european culture, to improve their english level. Some of the participants will be able to realize other mobilities, to study abroad, to continue their studies (like BTS Manager assistant: 2-years diploma) and to validate new skills.

“Take your chance – apprenticeship with “Budowlanka” Rybnik” is a project prepared by a Complex of Building Construction Schools in Rybnik and three partner institutions from Braga, Lisbon, and Plymouth. The dates of the project are: from 01.06.2016 to 31.05.2018. The project is dedicated to 24 people from building construction students, 8 geodesy students, and 12 IT students. The project is divided into 3 stages:1. Preparation for the training: classes in pedagogy and psychology, culture, languages, health and safety regulations.2. Training: training programs for students mentioned above will take place in partner institutions and companies. 3. After training: summarizing the actions performed in earlier stages and reached aims.The main aim of the project is the participation of students from the Complex of Building Construction Schools in Rybnik in the training. The training will take place: 01.05 - 26.05.2017 and 30.04. – 25.05.2018 – building construction students; 04.09.-29.09.2017 IT students; 04.09 - 15.09. 2017 geodesy students; 2-29.05.2017 building construction students. Altogether 44 students will participate in the project. The participation in the project will allow our students develop their practical knowledge in new professional environment. This promotes their personal development. It will be easier for our students to enter the labour market. Participating in the training will enable our students to observe institutions and working conditions in Portugal and Great Britain. Students will be able to develop their language competence: English for those going to Braga and Plymouth, German for students going to Lisbon. General aims:1. Incresing the number of mobility within the Erasmus+ Programme up to 44. It includes:2017: 8 geodesy students, 12 IT students, 8 building construction students2018: 16 building construction students.Students will participate in the training in Braga, Lisbon and Plymouth in the following companies: 1- Cru Design, Ormia, Inforlink, SDI Lab,  Balanças Marques Firewall IT Infonetmedia LTD, Insight4Life, Casais, DBR, DST, Cliamares, Ribeiro, Spinnaker Waste Management.2. Developing the plan for dissemination of results by informing teachers, parents, other students, local authorities responsible for education in Rybnik about the project. The information will be presented during meetings, conferences, and open days which will take place during and after the project conducted by the Complex of Building Construction Schools in Rybnik. 3. Students knowledge in geodesy, building construction, IT will increase.Detailed aims:- there will be an increase in students’ practical skills (44 training participants)- as a result of language preparation and training participation there will be an increase in language competences (for 28 students- English’ for 16 students – German) both in general foreign language as well as language for specific purposes (professional)- 44 students will increase their soft skills: interpersonal communication, key competences: solving problems, communication in a foreign language.- there will be an increase in language, intercultural, and managerial competences among teachers who will accompany students during their training.Measurable results:44 students participated in the mobility project during 6 trainings in companies and institutions. They developed their knowledge and practical skills that are useful at work, language competences, and knowledge about countries where the training will take place. - 44 certificates were issued, they confirm students’ participation in the preparation stage,- 44 Europass Mobility and Europass CV were issued- 2 recommendations per group for the most active students during the preparation stage were issued- evaluation tools were developed; they will be used in the next project- rules of communication and dissemination of information were developed, e.g. project resultsThe project will be based on the methodology of reaching aims according to a developed schedule, monitoring the aims, and evaluation. It will also be based on procedures used for reacting in difficult situations, predicting them and reacting prior to their occurrence, based on our 5 years experience in previous projects.The project will have a direct impact on participants. During the training they will be able to develop their practical skills and compare practice with theory. The training will also have an influence on students’ language, social, and intercultural competences. The project will have an influence on partner institutions participating in the project, e.g. quality of teaching vocational subjects, foreign languages will increase. Staff development will take place, their abilities in writing and managing projects in an international context. Using analysis and the dissemination plan prepared for the project, we will promote it and information will be presented to the local community, politicians, and employers.
Mobilność uczniów i nauczycieli Zespołu Szkół Nr 3 w Wyszkowie fundamentem sukcesu zawodowego.

This project is going to be realized in a form of three – week foreign technical training, in companies dealing with IT, production, trading and service branches. The realization of this practice is going to take place two years. The participants of this project will be 66 students from Zespol Szkol No 3 in Wyszkow who educate in IT and economical areas. The offer will be directed to the students of the 2nd and 3rd grade (17-19 year-old).  The participants of this project will be 24 teachers from the vocational education and training (VET) sector.The main aim of this project is to improve practical skills of 66 students from technical classes (IT and economical specializations) and their 24 teachers  from Zespol Szkol No 3 in Wyszkow so as to make  their later professional and personal development easier.Detailed aims (hard):• Gaining additional qualifications, the expansion of 66 students’ knowledge in IT and economical professions.• Getting to know the requirements which are put on students/ employees in a partner’s country by 66 students.• The improvement of 66 students’ and teachers' English language skillsDetailed aims (soft):• the development of social and public skills (endurance, precision, dutifulness,  cooperation in groups)• an increase in motivation towards learning, higher professional and personal aspirations• the alignment of educational chances, especially for students coming from villages or with special educational needs• enabling students to gain extra skills and knowledge  which will make further education easier and/or the choice of a professional path• the improvement of  the quality of provided educational services at school• an increase in key competence• a growth in students’ self-esteem• a better preparation  of school graduates in labor market• the establishment of cooperation: between labor market institutions and school, in terms of  two-directional information flow and the accuracy of  offered educational services• transnational cooperation ( the introduction of innovatory system solutions in technical training, an increase in vocational students’ mobility, an increase in the number of graduates who are open towards other cultures and posses language skills  at an extended level)The sources of verification: - attendment list- training register (every day)- evaluation forms (two during the project)- final reports- diagnostic vocational tests (two during the project)Needs:• students’ needs (the usage of theoretical knowlege in practice, vocational mobility, expanding language skills inc. technical language, the willingness to check onself in a stressful situation, becoming independent, making contacts with future employers)• teachers’ needs (the usage of practical knowlege, vocational mobility, expanding language skills)• school needs (the improvement of educational quality, a growth in educational competitivness, gaining prestige, recruitment improvement, giving the assurence of a good professional start to students)• Polish and foreign employers’ needs (raising demand for IT specialists with an international experience)• District, province and country needs (promotion, hiring skilled workers, the development of IT branch).
Mobilność zawodowa uczniów Zespołu Szkół RCKU w Wolborzu drogą do sukcesu na rynku pracy

This project is necessary for the development of professional skills of young people at  ZS Wolbórz in the context of future employment in the local market and European market.The main objective of the project is to improve the attractiveness and quality of vocational education at Wolbórz ZS youth by organizing internships and internships abroad in line with the directions of vocational training and labor market needs. This will be achieved by allowing 51 students  of  ZS Wolbórz, enrolled in the competition : logistics technicians , technician hotelier , technician of car mechanics to hold the monthly practices / professional internships in enterprises in the UK. The intended effects of the project will be :-getting additional qualifications ( in ares Apted ) , skills and experience confirmed by appropriate documents (certificates, the Europass Mobility )-improving educational offer for the above-mentioned  profiles at ZS Wolbórz . -Increase awareness of the need to learn throughout life-Reduce risk of social exclusion due to lack of work after graduation- Equal educational opportunities for young people from rural areas-getting of key competencies in foreign languages, including industrial vocabulary- Greater motivation of students to learn-Increase the number of well-educated professionals on the local labor market-increasing  awareness among young people about the necessity of a  lifelong learning - growth education of young people from rural areas ( equal opportunities )-interesting other students to invest in their own skills and knowledge and finding new ways to develop their skills and experience-Increase the prestige of the school as an educational establishment with modern types of teachingThe main objective and the intended effects resulting from perceived in this direction needs of the local community , employers and also signaled by the students themselves .The main and most important activity in the project will be a combination of theoretical training and learning in the workplace in a Apted qualification, which combine theoretical knowledge with practical activities of a union in a particular workplace.Conducted in the third quarter of 2015  diagnoses of competencies both key and professional of ZS Wolbórz’s students, pointed out some  important conclusions for school work in the context of vocational training :-In Vocational , there is a necessity of continuous changes that keep pace for booming labor market.-there is a lack of  effective system solutions that would offset the gaps between education and market requirements-Lack Of effective financial instruments for schools to attract the qualified personnel of technical-engineering as well as old fashioned  equipment and facilities are not in favor of improving the level of educationOpportunities  for school to improve vocational training are:-Step by step modification implemented in school curricula includes training in key competences,-Conducting Systematic diagnosis of the level of knowledge and skills of students, providing continuous monitoring for learning outcomes in competencies both key and professional,-Starting up activities to motivate students for further education, pointing out that there is a relation between mastering  the key competences and better opportunities for employment,-Developing at pupils’ minds  widely understood entrepreneurship by teaching them creative thinking, how to plan  their careers, develop interpersonal skills and effective self-presentation,-Analyzing local and nationwide job market aiming at adjusting school’s educational offer-Improving the involvement of employers in raising the professional skills of students through their interest in cooperating with the school, promoting the best students, enabling apprenticeships, including abroad apprenticeship, participating in projects that improve skills and develop competences.  Due to the rapidly changing labor market, declining indicators of demographic trends and increasing globalization, all activities aimed at vocational education and training of key competencies take on a special significance. This are the main features that  will determine the future of the school.

The main aim of the Practices Consortium coordinated by Fundació BCN Formació Professional is to improve the competitiveness and employability of recent graduates of initial vocational training of the vocational schools of Barcelona across a period of practices in different European countries. The project also aims to generate a positive impact increasing and diversifying the professional experience of Initial VET graduates. Al same time the project aims to foster the European identity of the youngster to improve the professional mobility. Also, the project pretends to enforce the skills and knowledge of the Chemistry and Audiovisuals. The present consortium focuses his activity in mobility for graduates in individual vocational training but wants to maximize the participation of more schools and VET students in the next future. Both, Fundación BCN Formación Profesional wants to continuous being the reference institution of Barcelona in relation with the coordination and execution of European education programs. With the project development, the consortium pretends that a total among of 20 graduates in initial vocational training acquire more professional experience related with the finished studies and, at same time, that this background helps them increasing their employability and strengthening they entry into the labor market. The project will allow that the youngsters develop 2 months of practices in different companies. At same time, the projects pretends that Barcelona has VET professionals with more and more diverse knowledge around their professional field across Job Shadowing stages in reference countries of their professional field.

The project “Equality in practice and work” responds to the needs of our graduates to develop their professional skills in accordance to the demands of European context, providing their chances on the labor market to be equal to graduates of other educational institutions with similar profile. This is especially important as our school is located in a rural area, such non-formal learning student experiences are more limited than in urban areas, especially in big cities.The proposed objectives are: to develop the professional skills of students in the target group; to get a feedback in terms of quality of education in our school, in perspective of European market requirements; to improve the skills of the management team and the teaching staff in organization, by conducting and evaluating learning activities, both at professional level and at communication/relational level; increasing pupils motivation for choosing tourism profile; creating better prerequisites for professional insertion at the regional, national and at the European labor market.1. Mihail Kogalniceanu High School in Snagov, Romania, a state institution, with levels of primary, secondary and gimazial classes, which include technology profile classes with services specialization (tourism technician) - will involve in the project a team of 5 people, four teachers and an accountant, and the target group of pupils will include 34 students from the technological, tourism services classes, in grades 10-12.2. ANAPTYXIAKO KENTRO THESSALIAS in Trikala, Greece, is a non-profit center/provider for continuing professional education and training (VET) and a development center, and will be a host organization.3. IBD Partnership in Portsmouth, UK, plan and manage training for students, entrepreneurs and employees and the disabled and disadvantaged, will be a second host institution.4. Social Entrepreneurship and Innovative European Studies Institute in Klaipeda, Lithuania, is a consulting and training institution dedicated to innovative teaching methods, creating strategies, and developing sustainable entrepreneurship, will be the third host institution.Description of activities: I. Prior project activities: arranging the schedule of activities and responsibilities of participants, signing, organizing selection of students, preparing information materials, organization of mobility, training the participants. II. October 2016 - first mobility activity in Greece. Traineeship of mobility will be structured in four sub-activities: identifying skills, knowledge and competencies existing among the participants; preparation and training the students to participate in practical work in relevant companies profile; effective participation in different work positions; assessment of skills acquired during practice. During the mobility activity there will be permanent monitoring and support activities. III. Preparation activities for the second stage of mobility and activities to disseminate the results achieved in the first mobility stage. IV. March 2017 will be the second stage of mobility in the UK. Internships will have the same structure as those of Greece; yet improvements that can be accepted on the basis of previous experience. V. Preparation activities for the third stage of mobility and activities to disseminate the results obtained in the first two mobility stages. VI. July 2017 will be held the third mobility activity in Lithuania with the same structure as those conducted in previous mobilities stages. VII. Dissemination of mobility and integration of results in the current work and the impact assessment.The methodology of using gained experience: - Improving the procedure for conducting internships through aligning them with European standards and include exchange of best practices; - Increase the number of practice partnerships at national and European level by using communication skills and collaboration with diverse cultures; - Using the experience in writing and implementing projects under the Erasmus Programme+ in increasing the number of quality projects; - The students ability to use mobility certificates in educational portfolios, employment resumes and  partnership agreements in companies which runs professional practice; efficient professional assessment criteria in students; applying these criteria in evaluating the quality of school education.Impact of the project “Equality in practice and work”: Equal opportunities of employment for graduates of travel classes on the European labor market. The quality of services provided by students in practice will increase. For the school it will increase the chance of new partnerships and the confidence in developing parterneships at European level. The prestige of the school as competence trainer in the professional field also will increase.
Praktyczne umiejętności w reklamie kluczem do sukcesu na europejskim rynku pracy

Project SummaryThe Complex of Schools of Economy and Commerce is an institution of vocational education. In 2012, a new field of study was introduced: the Advertising Organisation Technician. The teachers are still in the process of acquiring new vocational skills (undergoing in-service training). We wish to add a European dimension to our institution. That is why our school is seeking to implement a project entitled "Practical Skills in Advertising as a Key to Success in the European Labour Market" (within the framework of the Erasmus+ programme KA1). It will be implemented without the quality charter for vocational education and training. The projects concerns the latest trends in advertising. There will be 30 students taking part in the mobilities. The project will be implemented in the period from 1st Sep. 2016 to 30th Aug. 2017 in cooperation with the Tellus Education Group Training Centre in Plymouth, UK. The partner organisation is a vocational training provider with over ten years' experience in implementing effective programmes of vocational training based on Europe-wide cooperation. The following objectives have been set for the project:project participants acquiring vocational experience in an international environment, developing the participants' practical skills and social competence and mobility in order to increase their potential attractiveness in the labour market, reinforcing foreign language skills, broadening the knowledge of other cultures and religions,improving the teachers' competence, work quality and teaching methods and their undestanding of educational systems and strategies in other countries.The achieved results of the project (a teaching curriculum and lesson plans) will be published in the Creative Commons open educational licenses and will be permanently introduced into the everyday operation of our institution.
Staż zagraniczny to dobry początek europejskiej kariery zawodowej

The aim of the project is to achieve knowledge and vocational competence development by the students of O. Lange Technical School during  an internship, which will be a good start in their career. That is why both teaching staff and students will participate in the work experience abroad. Students will get new experience, new practical and languistic skills in the multicultural environment. In the traineeship the beneficiaries will be students taught to be the Hotelary technician, Tourism technician and Economics technician, the teaching vocational staff and the headmaster will have job -shadowing. Teachers will get to know new teaching methods at practical lessons, workshops and in companies/ institutions, and they will also learn innovative methods of school management considering strategies of  the region and country development. Students will have the internship in different countries in the European dimension but improving the same  vocational abilities.  O. Lange Technical School cooperates with three foreign partners: Euromind Projects from Spain will carry out the traineeship in Sevilla - two groups, 16 students each + two group leaders ( 01.07.2017-22.07.2017 and 04.06.2018 - 25.06.2018),  Casa de Educacao from Portugal will organize the internship in Lisbon one group of 16 students + 2  group leaders (22.08.2016 - 09.09.2016) and job shadowing for a five-vocational - teacher group in the period of 21.08.2017 - 25.08.2017. The third partner is Tellus Educational Group from the United Kingdom which will organize the traineeship in Plymouth for two groups, 20 students +2 group leaders each.Apart from gaining work experience in the profession beneficiaries will develope linguistic skills on the praparatory coursein their country, mostly English and additionally groups going to Spain will have a Spanish course and participants going to Portugal a Portuguese course. The hosting organizations will continue the language courses during the IVT in the evenings.A really crucial goal is to learn new cultures, tradions, intercultural sophistication. We would like our students to learn tolerance and equality of all nations, religions and races. Students need a contact with a multicultural society so they will take part in the cultural programmme and trips. Each group will have at least one daily trip and some around the city and area in the evenings and at the weekends. Participants wil have dissemination sessions , they will prepare a guide book about the country of the internship. It will include information about : tradions, cultural differences, interesting places, accommodation, cuisine, transport and useful suggestions. In this way they will create nice materials which will be used in the further education at school during vocational classes. The teaching staff will prepare a raport from job-shadowing, deliver evaluation results and try to implement them at school depending on time and financial conditions.  Beneficiaries will be accommodeted in the hostel with full-board in Lisbon and Sevilla, but with host families with full-board in Plymouth, all participants will get a monthly ticket for the local transport. The teaching staff will stay in a hotel with full board. Gained abilities and performed tasks will be evaluated by the mentor in the place of the traineeship with the ECVET assessment sheet. Then ,  project coordinators from sending and hosting organizations will assess the trainee's engagement in the IVT. The notes will help in further work at school. Participants will share the abilities with other students at school, they will teach them. They will show their new skills preparing and serving food and sharing their knowledge about new cultures during multimedia presentations at school events. All participants will get certificates and Europass Mobility documents.
Staże zawodowe uczniów ZSTZ Radzymin w krajach Unii Europejskiej

+The Project „ Placements of students from Technical Vocational School in Radzymin in the European Union countries” anticipates trips of 3 groups of year three students.Group A – the students who study to be catering and nutrition technicians (15 people) and waiters (5 people). 20 people altogether. In group A there are students of 2 professions because the programme provided for this placement includes the same issues. They will go for placements at restaurants, hotels and cafés in Italy.Group B – the students who study to be computer specialists (16 people). This group will go for placements at computer companies in the UK.Group C – the students who study to be landscape architecture technicians (10 people). Group C will go for placements at horticultural companies in Ireland.(The companies addresses for all groups are in the attachment to this form).The total number of participants is 46. 2 attendants will go with group A and B. 1 attendant – with group C.Methodology used during the project includes: demonstrations, lectures, analyses, presentations, observations.The project responds to the educational needs of the country connected with increasing the level of efficiency of vocational training, acquiring new qualifications and work experience to adapt to the requirements of the labour market in Poland and Europe. It also helps to develop the knowledge of foreign languages, especially work related language.The project responds to the regional needs. Firstly, Warsaw and its surroundings are the places popular among tourists. After the organization of sporting and cultural events of European and world interest, the number of foreign tourists in Warsaw has increased. This contributed to the development of catering sector in Masovia. The demand for qualified, experienced, foreign language speaking catering and customer service employees is increasing. The placement of catering students and waiters fits perfectly here. (Group A). Secondly, information technologies are constantly developing. The needs for computer services, creating websites or databases are still growing. The demand for such services is still high. (Group B). Thirdly, there is the need to use the space around houses and housing estates in Masovia resulting from the constantly growing number of houses, housing estates and other buildings, especially in Wołomin county, where Radzymin is located. The placement of landscape architecture students  in Ireland responds to these needs. (Group C).Aims:-gaining by the participants of the project profesional skills supported by the Europass certificate, this results in wider opportunity for them to find a job in the local as well as European labour market.-using and dveloping English and Italian language skills-creating opportunity to travel abroad for underprivileged students: those who come from rural areas and whose families are at risk of unemployment, the project may help them gain more self-confidence as well as essential profesional skills.-sensitizing the participants to cultural diversity of Europe and increasing tolerance for other cultures.-increasing atractiveness of vocational education in our school.-development of IT competence especially group BExpected Results:-46 students with professional skills and experience gained abroad and confirmed by Europass certificate.-Participants will be entitled to add information about their new experience gained abroad in their CV.-46 students with higher professional language skills: 26 English, 20 Italian language. Familiarisation with labour market in Italy, England and Ireland as well as functioning of  firms, companies and restaurants in the areas of gardening, IT, gastronomy and catering.-Growth of self-esteem, improvement of communication and organizational skills, greater opennes of the participants on  cultural diversity of Europe.-Increase in number of candidates applying for our school as a result of increasing atractiveness of the vocational education.-Exchange of  skills and experience between our school and organizations and companies which will host our apprentices.After completing the project we expect them to find job in the professions they were trained for. We believe thus that it will prevent them  from joining the group of unemployed. Another hope we have is that they will use English language fluently at their work and they will not be afraid to look for a job abroad.   Another essential profit  is a distinct increase in number of candidates applying for our school as well as tightening and development of cooperation with our partners  in connection with another upcoming projects.Influence of the project:The project will have a meaningful effect on school society who will have opportunity to watch the presentation and talk to the participants of the internship abroad. It will also affect the town of Radzymin, Wolomin district, parents of the participants, employers, junior high school students.
Ponadnarodowy wymiar kształcenia w ZS Nr 7 kluczem do profesjonalizmu zawodowego

The Project „The Transnational dimension of education In School Complex No 7 as a key to vocational professionalism” entails the accomplishment of 3 actions in school years 2016/2017 and 2017/2018 of which 48 students and 8 teachers of School Complex No 7 in Koszalin will become beneficiaries.In action A1 the Project envisages the completion of 1-week training stay for vocational training teachers from School Complex no 7, including the representatives of the managing staff , in the center of Tellus Education Group in Rome, Italy,  within the mobility “Sharing Good practice”. The treaning will concern the education system in Italy with the special inclusion of vocational training education. Action A2  in the Project will be about the completion of 2-week traineeship for 24 students from School Complex no 7 in the form of work placement in plants of Rome in Italy. The target group will include:- one group of 8 students from technical school of landscape architecture- one group of 8 students from technical school of devices and systems of renewable power industry- one group of 8 students from technical school of digital graphic processesAction A3  in the project will be about the completion of 2-week traineeship for 24 students from School Complex no 7 in the form of vocational training in the training centre of the Plant of Promoting Vocational Training of Association of Building Construction Industry of Berlin and Brandenburg in Frankfurt/Oder in Germany. The target group will include:- one group of 8 students from technical school of building construction  - one group of 8 students from technical school of geodesy- one group of 8 students from vocational school specialising in finishing works in buildings.The objectives of the project are:1. Raising practical skills of the students within building construction works such as bricklaying, drywall processing, small architecture in gardens, designing and developing gardens, decorative paving , managing geodesy data and techniques of geodesy satellite measurements as well as devices of renewable power industry and multimedia techniques and digital printing.2. Creating a dynamic team of teachers in School Complex no 7, characterised by engagement and professionalism.3. Raising the attractiveness, quality and effectiveness of vocational training in School Complex no 7   through internationalizing the educational process and enriching teaching syllabuses with innovative elements.4. Making possible for the participants to receive the certificate Europass-Mobility as well as other certificates and in this way adding to the improvement of the level of clarity and recognition of qualifications within the European Union.5. Preparing and training graduates who will be competitive on the local, domestic and international job market, equipped in necessary vocational and social skills.6. Raising language skills in the students and teachers within the scope of foreign languages.7. Developing  the habit of “lifelong learning “ in the project participants  - students and teachers.8. Raising intercultural competences in the participants.9. Gaining new professional experiences by the teaching staff and the raise in their competences connected with particular training profiles, including the ability to manage a school in case of the school managing staff.10. Better comprehension of practices, strategies and systems in the field of training and education systems in various countries of the European Union.11. The popularization of vocational training at the local, domestic and European level, enhancing its  status.The expected results of the project are as follows: enhancing the international potential of the institutions involved in the project, transfer of innovation from the Italian and German vocational training market, gaining and raising key competencies by the participants from School Complex No 7 within such trades as technician of building construction, technician of geodesy, technician of landscape architecture, technician of devices and systems of renewable power industry, technician of digital graphic processes and technologist of finishing works in buildings as well as developing in the participants the attitude of openness towards taking up jobs and in-service training courses not only in their home country but also abroad.
Praktyka zawodowa w Anglii,  Hiszpanii i Grecjii szansą lepszego startu zawodowego dla uczniów Zespołu Szkół nr 2 w Sanoku

The project is a continuation and is complementary to the assumptions of the mobility project being currently done in the Erasmus+ programme, and just completed  mobility project in Leonardo da Vinci programme. The project participants will be 48 students from  technical   school of ZS No. 2 in Sanok, studying to become  telecommunications technican, mechanic technician, automotive technician, environmental protection technician and a car mechanic and 6 teachers of vocational education. Students will take an apprenticeship in workplaces and companies corresponding to their field of study in The UK, Spain and Greece  There will be three groups of students going abroad.  in September 2017 16 students- mechanic technicians and automotive technicians- will go on a 4-week- training to the UK and 16 pupils- telecommunications technicians and environmental protection technicians will leave for 4-week vocational training in companies in Spain. In March 2018, another group of 16 students will go on a 2-week  apprenticeship to Greece. The programs have been developed in close connection with the guidelines of apprenticeship programs based on the curriculum of particular professions, but are to be implemented on the basis of modern facilities and equipment, and focus on learning new technologies and to develop skills particularly desired by the local labor market. Within the project 6 ZS2 vocational teachers will participate in the training  as supervisers. The project is a response to a problem which occurred in our school: poor recruitment to school, poor school performance, and consequently poor performance in professional examinations and Matura examinations. As a result, fewer students continue their education after secondary school, and not even all of them take the exams. After examining the problem we tried  to solve it on many levels, but in-depth analysis in the form of interviews and surveys showed that the primary cause of failure is lack of motivation for learning, lack of faith in students' own abilities and lack of prospects for the future. An additional problem is a nationwide trend, which is  the popularity of general education over vocational training among junior high school students. To change this situation, we have developed a project whose main goal is to increase students' motivation to develop knowledge and improve skills, gain new skills, improve language skills- mostly English , increase the mobility of participants, increase their chances on European and national labor market, increase self-esteem, increse intercultural competences, improve the quality and attractiveness of vocational education in the school and in the region, prevent early school leaving and reduce failure in education.  the teachers will  develop their skills in the diagnosis of pupils' needs and learn more attractive teaching meathods. The cooperation will contribute to the exchange of best practices, gaining experience through practical activities and ability to cooperate at the international level.  The most important results of the project will include obtaining Europass Mobility certificate , obtaining ECVET points, acquiring new skills, improving language skills and filling in the European Language Passport, increasing the mobility of participants, increasing students' chances on European and national labor market, increasing self-esteem and motivation to learn, which will help to reduce the number of early school leavers, learn intercultural competences among students and teachers, improve the quality and attractiveness of vocational education in the school and in the region, as well as the preparation to the strategic partnership in the future.
Mobilność szansą na rozwój zawodowy i osobisty

The promotor of the project is Bytów ZSE-U school.The realization is planned for 2017-2018.Our intermediate partners are the Centre of Vocational Training in Schmalkalden,Germany and Tellus Group in Plymouth,England.The receiving organizations will be the leading enterprises in which 50 students will have a 4-week internship in May 2017 and in May 2018.The third-grade students will be having work placements in specialised enterprises in Thuringia in Germany and in exclusive hotels and tourist centres in Hampshire County in England.Moreover, 16 of our graduates will have a 3-month internship from June to August 2017 and 2018.The graduates will have their apprenticeship in the same places as the third-grades.In addition, our intermediate partner is Vitalis Betreuungsgesellschaft für Modellprojekte mbH -Saxony organising a week job shadowing placement for 8 vocational teachers in May 2017 and in May 2018:the one for hotel and catering department teachers-in S.Eger CKZ enterprise, the second for economy and logistics teachers in CSP „ZAGWmbH” in Leipzig.  This project meets the needs for modern vocational training,aimed at preparing students effectively for their future life and work through dual and  modularity educational system.The direct results are the needs of the school students and the local job market which is suffering from high unemployment(17,6%).Young people, including women,especially those who come from socially and materially neglected rural beckgrounds,have limited opportunities for development,further education and realisation of interesting business plans.Their participation in this project will be an important stage in their real-life process of personal and professional development as it will permanently integrate them with domestic and European job market and will raise their self-esteem as well as a sense of professionalism.The objectives of this project are:1.Improvement of school quality and its dimension through international cooperation and integration 2. Counteracting the unemployment among young people,especially women,as well as social exclusion among graduates from vocational schools3.Promotion of employees' mobility on a European job market 4.Enhancement of students' and graduates' competences,both personal and social ones through teaching resourcefulness and creativity,mobility and universal personal and cultural development5.Gaining practical experience and professional knowledge by the students according to the highest standards of business know-how in providing services in trade,catering, tourism, hotel industry in countries of western Europe6.Improvement of quality and position of professional training through developing real competences of students7.Adjusting professional qualifications of the trainees to the needs of job market8.Stimulation of connection between professional training and employment9.Implementing innovative educational solutions to upgrade students' professional qualifications10.Training and improving students' practical language skills which leads the young people to become multilingual.The school and its partners have appropriate staff resources as well as vast experience gained through doing numerous exchange projects, what gives a full guarantee to fulfill the above objectives and predicted results,i .e. 66 work placements, 16 job shadowing placements, certificates and Europass documents confirming formal qualifications.The domestic qualification will be unified with the European ones.Rational actions at the stage of planning,realisation and evaluation of the project give a quarantee that all Erasmus+ partners will contribute in expected results. Taking part in the project will lead to increase participants' key competences and practical skills.There will be implementation of good examples from countries with the best governance and efficiency to local businesses.The participants will gain skills of using knowledge in new situations,integrating technology with training and self-development,what is an optimal way of creative actions in professional and social life of young people. Thanks to gained language skills,the internship will empower the position of beneficiaries on a real job market.Participating in another edition of work placements abroad will bring long-term effects by consolidating the position of the school as a successful school,which takes chalenges because it takes care of the level of education and professional preparation of its students and tachers alike.The scope of cooperation between the vocational school and foreign enterprises will increase,which will influence the development of the school.Vocational education will gain new quality and will become trendy among middle school students.The project will be an impulse to economic development.It is  important for local eemployers to take part in elaboration of the programme of the work experience and now they are looking forward to the effects of the project.
European Vocational Training - IES  A Pinguela - 2016-18

CONTEXT AND OBJECTIVESInstituto de Enseñanza Secundaria A Pinguela (I.E.S. A Pinguela) (http://www.iesapinguela.es) is a public College located in Monforte de Lemos, a town on the  north-west of Spain (Galicia), that offers secondary, bachillerato (16-18) and VET (high and medium level). It is located in a rural area which is under-industrialised and we are committed to give to all our  students the opportunity to experience mobility in Europe to improve their competences and employability.This project is aimed to VET students and teachers, having  the following objectives:1. For students, to validate On the Job training module (FCT) with a placement on a company abroad2. To improve competence on the host country language3. For teachers, to get updated on latest market products and techniques to be incorporated to their teaching4. For IES A Pinguela to reinforce a network of european partners, to enrich mobility offers to students and teachers5. For host partners to benefit form participants experience and know-how.ACTIVITIESIES A Pinguela offers 4 VET courses  PEINADO Y COSMÉTICA CAPILAR (2 year+FCT), ESTÉTICA Y BELLEZA (2 year+FCT), GESTIÓN ADMINISTRATIVA (2year+FCT) and SISTEMAS MICROINFORMÁTICOS Y REDES (3 year+FCT)Student mobilities will last  for the duration of the whole FCT (10 weeks) to better meet objectives 1 and2.Apr-Jun 2017: 2 students from GESTIÓN and 2 students from ESTETICA in companies in Italy. 1 student from GESTION in a company in France. 2 students from PEINADO in companies in Portugal.Apr-Jun 2018:  1 student from GESTION  and 2 students from PEINADO in companies in Italy and 1 student from GESTION in a company in France and 1 student from ESTETICA in a company in Italy.Oct-dec 2016 and oct-dec 2017: 2 students from SISTEMAS MICROINFORMÁTICOS in companies in the UKTeacher mobilities will be:June 2016: one teacher of Beauty will do a one week period of  job-shadowing  in a company in the UK June 2017: one teacher of Beauty will do one week of  job-shadowing  in a company in the UK and one teacher of Business and administration will do a job-shadowing in a company in Italy.METHODOLOGYA mobility commission will be formed by VET tutors, the project coordinator , the head of school and a teacher responsible for the linguistic and cultural training; to assure that all professional families  are involved. It will carry on the following  tasks:  select participants, define training agreements, monitor work placements, evaluate and certify work-placements. This  commission is responsible for running the project together with partners:IIS Biagio Pascal and IIS  E. Montale Nuovo IPC support the selection of companies and participants, facilitate  communication between IES A Pinguela  and host  companies  and cooperate in organizing the trip. Host companies  from IT, Administration  and Hair & Beauty sectors : agree on the training program, designate a tutor in  the company; collaborate in the evaluation of the participants and with the dissemination of the project. Participants organise their trips supported by IES A Pinguela, take  their linguistic, cultural and practical preparation both at IES A Pinguela and via OLS , take responsabilities for the on the job training module and  integrate on the social life of the destination city. RESULTS AND IMPACT- To improve professional, linguistic and personal competences for the participants- To validate  the on the job training module having  adquired  necesary learning outcomes- To increase employment opportunities for participants.- To make participants European citizens- To improve teaching methodology in VETLONG TERM BENEFITS- To consolidate mobility offer for VET students and teachers- To built up a network of Colleges and companies across Europe.- To get involved in partnership project s with schools and companies.
Europejski technik na bytowskim rynku pracy

During this period  six fields will be achieved by participants. The project, in four fields, will be attended by 36 third grade students in the profession techniques vehicles and IT technician.Students will participate in four-week vocational trainings in enterprises supervised by qualified staff in Plymouth in the UK. All participants will be prepared in the language, cultural and  pedagogical fields before leaving Poland. One tutor will support one group of students (a total of four tutors).Two fields will be directed to graduates of  IT school - a total of 8 people. Their four-month internships will take place in British companies involved in information technology. A partner institution which implements the project is Tellus College.The main objective of the project is to equip the student with practical skills and professional qualifications that correspond to the needs of the local and European labor market. The attractiveness of the school will increase in the local community.The result of the project for the participants will be the increase of opportunities to be employed not only in the region or Poland, but also in the partner’s country or other EU countries.
