The attractiveness of the school will increase in the local community.The result of the project for the participants will be the increase of opportunities to be employed not only in the region or Poland, but also in the partner’s country or other EU countries. The implementation of the project is important because of the high unemployment in the region in which beneficiaries live. The gaining skills, which are educated in school are still attractive and sought on the European market.
Dziś pracując, zyskuję przyszłość - staże zagraniczne uczniów ZSP Nr 2 w Rudzie Śląskiej

" I gain my future by working today" - foreign training for students of ZSP no.2 in Ruda Śląska project is addressed to the students of second and third grades of the Technical Secondary School of the Hotel Industry, Gastronomy, Tourism Industry and Economics.From September 2016 to May 2018 four mobilities are planned - two to Rome, one to Lisbon and one to Barcelona. The project is for 72 students, divided into 4 groups of 18 students each. The training will be carried out in restaurants, hotels, tourist and service companies. The content and aims of the project are in accordance with the educational curricula and the programmes valid for the above mentioned professions as well as with the school mission, which aims in preparing its graduates to be ready to take on tasks within new determinants of job market. Moreover, the importance of creating a hihg personal culture individuals, who are involved in local environment's affairs but are also aware and open for other communities and culture are not neglected. The major goal of this project is to meet individual needs of each participant in the area of their practical professional skills, which will significantly increase participants' opportunities of employment on open European job market. The skills will be confirmed by Europass Mobility document and ECVET system certificate. Involvement in this project will guarantee the participants development of their language and personal skills, will enable them to understand other countries and their culture, which  results in growth of European citizenship and identity spirit. Companies that cooperate within this project with ZSP no.2 in Ruda Śląska are British company Tellus Group and portuguese company E.P.D. which are skilled training centers with significant experience in preparing and monitoring of EU's projects. These companies have their branch offices in some European cites like Rome ( Tellus ) and Barcelona ( E.P.D. ). Within this project, the sending organization will fulfill following tasks:- choosing partner companies ( verified during previous projects )- determination of project aims in accordance with students' needs and their abilities- preparing application- determing recruitment criteria and selecting participants- language, cultural and didactic preparing of the participants- signing training agreements with the participants- signing appropriate documents connected with implementation of ECVET system- organization of the travel, providing insurance and professional care for the participants in the country of placement- monitoring of proper performance of foreign partner companies- rational budget calculation, current expenses supervision and providing financial documents- evaluation of the project and issuing Europass Mobility certificates- preparing final reportThe tasks of foreign partner companies;- participation in preparing the project- signing the statement concerning the training programme and other documents connected with ECVET system implementation- arranging the placements in accordance with students' skills and expectations- organizing accomodation and food for students and accompanying teachers, organizing the transfer from and to the airport ( Barcelona and Lisbon ) and public transport tickets- monitoring of training realization- organizing of free time activities and cultural program- evaluation of the project and preparing final report- issuing the certificates confirming the training and certificates for the employersRealization of " I gain my future by working today - foreign training for students of ZSP no.2 in Ruda Śląska" project will let to achieve individual results for each of the participants. In consequence, it will rise their mobility and attractiveness on the job market with high rate of unemployment among young people. It is believed that observation of good trainings and experience gained by the participants of this project will affect and improve vocational and general teaching process in ZSP no.2 in Ruda Śląska. It will also certainly attract future students and the school will be perceived as worth investing for educational and local authorities.
TOWARDS EXCELLENCE IN VOCATIONAL EDUCATION AND TRAINING

The project "TEVET" will enable 60 students of ZSE to have internships in countries such as England (Plymouth), Germany (Leipzig) and Italy (Palermo).  The students will travel to the UK, Germany  (Tellus Group), Italy (SEND) in order to gain experience and undergo vocational training. The profiles of study of the selected participants include: Logistics Technician, Spedition Technician Economist Technician.The purpose of the project is providing some young people living in the area of high unemployment (the rate is up to 25.1 per cent) with the possibility to learn their professions in a practical way and at a high European standard. The project also aims to improve professional competences of trainees/interns, gaining by them practical experience, new skills and qualifications which will be recognized thanks to the use of such European tools as  AptEd, Europass CV, Europass Mobility and ECVET.The principles of recruiting mobility members will be transparent, objective and they will be announced in the beneficiary`s school. The recruitment will be comprised of a few phases and will take into consideration: a student`s interest in learning vocational subjects, his or her language competences, creativity, potential but also a financial and family status. The selected persons will obtain a lot of support from the sending organization before leaving in the form of additional classes in vocational subjects, a language course emphasizing speaking skills and  professional psychological and pedagogical training covering all the aspects of mobilities.In March 2017 a ten-person group of students from ZSE will go to Germany in order to gain the practical skills needed for the profession of Logistician Technician and Speditor Technician. The work in such companies as DHL, Ebay and Amazon will ensure that the Polish youth will obtain professional qualifications at the highest level.In April 2017 a ten-person group of students under the supervision of their teacher will go to Italy where they will have internships in transportation and spedition companies, and in May 2017 a ten-person group of young people of the Economist Technician profile of study will go to England so that they will gain practical skills required for running an accounting firm. The project has been planned for two years, so in the next year another groups of students will have internships will have internships in the same countries and more or less at the same time.The TEVET project is a good example of tightening cooperation between the sectors of education, services and manufacturing, which will result in the strengthening of the synergy effect between education and the working environment. The participants will learn about innovative training methods and vocational practice and they will be granted European certificates. In this project the following tools will be used: ECVET, EQAVET and EUROPASS MOBILITY. TEVET complies with EUROPEAN QUALITY CHARTER for MOBILITY (also VET Mobility Charter). The beneficiaries are mainly students of ZSE who come from rural disadvantaged areas and who do not have experience of staying in a foreign country. The funding will enable these students to develop professionally, linguistically and culturally, which will lead to their social inclusion and will increase their chances in the labour market. Other expected effects of TEVET  include: improving vocational foreign language whose meaning is gradually increasing due to internationalization of economy, boosting employment opportunities, stimulating entrepreneurship of young people, their initiatives as well as fostering the idea of continuing education or lifelong learning.The selected training and job centres are institutions promoting intercultural values, tolerance and respect for other ethnic groups. Furthermore, the European dimension of education and training will facilitate personal development of youth of poor, disadvantaged backgrounds.  The project will have an impact on the development of ZSE in Radom as a partner of the local enterprises, which will provide many young people living locally with education at a high European level. Vocational teachers will mainly accompany the students and they will be able to bring good practices onto the domestic ground. Thanks to their close observations they will implement the procedures of recognition of both formal and non-formal qualifications as well as the European tools for assessment of qualifications and skills. Foreign good practices will be brought to Poland and employed in ZSE. Cooperation with foreign firms will be set up, which will boost innovation in Poland in the future. TEVET complies with the Europe 2020 strategy focused on making the EU a “smart, sustainable and inclusive” economy through increasing employment competitiveness, economic growth and integration of the labour market thanks to increased mobility of students, and to the sectoral and horizontal assumptions of ERASMUS+.
Europejska jakość kształcenia zawodowego w Zespole Szkół Technicznych                    i Ogólnokształcących w Jarosławiu

The applicant of the project is Zespol Szkol Technicznych i Ogolnoksztalcacych in Jaroslaw. The partners of the project are Tellus (Group) Ltd, WBS Training and BbS Aschersleben-Staßfurt “WEMA”. The participants of the project will be the group of 84 students, educating in such professions as electronics technician, telecommunications technician and IT technician as well as 12 teachers. The duration of the project is two years and in this time two groups of 16 students and 2 teachers will go to Plymouth or Portsmouth (Great Britain), two groups of 16 students and 2 teachers will leave for Germany (Dresden), four groups of 5 students and 1 teacher will go to Germany (Aschersleben). The participants of the project will be divided into groups in view of the quality of the realising project and organisational possibilities of the partners. The placements’ programmes  will be realised as work placements in partners’ institutions in Plymouth, Portsmouth and Dresden. n Aschersleben, students will take part in work placements in companies in accordance with an agreed schedule.  The duration of the project is estimated for two years, whereas the duration of individual placements is two weeks. The main goal of the project is the improvement of quality and innovation in Zespol Szkol Technicznych I Ogolnoksztalcacych in Jaroslaw through achieving vocational skills, language and cultural competence by the group of 84 students and 10 teachers in school years 2016/2017 and 2017/2018. The project’s realisation enable to achieve the following specific aims: becoming acquainted with: English and German working standards, technological and quality standards, typical workstation equipment to carry out research in the particular country, providing services and production by the use of modern diagnostic devices, work tools and procedures which are obligatory when doing particular vocational duties, and also becoming acquainted with binding work and safety regulations in a particular country as well as the standards of safe work. Additionally, students will compare Polish standards, technology and equipment ruling in an electronic and telecommunications branch with their equivalents in the partners’ countries. The participants of the project will take part in work placements in enterprises  of electronic and telecommunications branch in professional workshops, at the same time experiencing real conditions of employment on the European labour market. The assumption of the project is gaining new practical knowledge and experience by its participants, which directly will increase the attractiveness of prospective graduates of the school on the labour market. The improvement of language competence geared particularly to vocational vocabulary and its practical use will contribute to a better preparation of students to exams in vocational qualifications. Thanks to versatility, great equipment, competent training staff, the receiving organisations enable  full realisation of the project and achievement of projects’ aims. Moreover, all institutions provide accommodation and full board for the participants of the project and realisation of cultural programmes. Students will take part in a variety of practical activities which help them to deepen their knowledge and share it, widen experiences, exchange information and achieve vocational competence in the field of electronics and telecommunications. Also, the purpose of the project is facilitating the students’ personal development, making interpersonal contacts, cooperating in a team, encouraging students to make an effort, solving typical problems constructively, enhancing students’ self-esteem, motivating students to learn foreign languages, strengthening and using specialist language, discovering new cultures and sightseeing various corners of the world. Expecting results of the completed work placement will be first and foremost  preparation to carry out such tasks as installation and conservation electronic devices, usage and repair of electronic devices as well as the construction of a rover and Wi-Fi antenna. The content of vocational training results from the core curriculum of such professions as telecommunications technician, electronics technician and IT technician. Students will participate in a cultural programme, as well.
Praktyki zagraniczne szansą na rozwój kompetencji zawodowych.

The project will be implemented by the National Association for Entrepreneurship Encouragement (NAEE) from Konskie (the body applying) in the partnership with the  Centre of Professional Training (CPT) from Szydlowiec (Poland) and Tellus z Plymouth (UK). Before the implementation of the project NAEE will sign an agreement about cooperation with CPT and a contract with Tellus concerning implementation of the project where all the parties will get their responsibilities. The project is about organizing apprenticeship in Plymouth (GB) for 10 pupils in the initial phase of their proffesional training as a carpenter who are being trained in CPT and who go to public vocational  school in Szydlowiec and public special vocational school at CPT. The possibility of the participants to take part in apprenticeship will give new skills and practical knowledge in the field of technology using in British carpenter industry. The aim of the project is to increase competences of young people which are necessary to set own business, to educate the attitude of being enterprising, assertive, creative and open to new activities. To do it correctly the participants will be instructed with the topic of setting own business according to standards and needs of European Union. The topic connected with setting micro and small business and the dynamics of their development in Poland supported by practical giving the sources of funding the business (POKL, PUP) will be an important element of this project.The apprenticeship will take 2 weeks and will take place in British carpenter workshops. The expected departure term is July 2017.The trip will be connected with the knowledge of everyday life people living there. The young trainee will be able to feel the membership to the EU and the lack of barriers between countries. This project provides preparation activities: English course, pedagogical and cultural preparation (in the country of departure as well). All participants are at the beginning of their professional education stage, aged between 16-19. The most of the participants have never been abroad, they have got a low level of language preparation. This causes their fear from movement and their low self-esteem. This project is compatible with the needs. It encourages activity to “cross borders” ( more mobility), it rises the level of own skills and stimulates to learn English. The sense of lower value and fear of the unknown in cultural and moral aspect will get lower if all participants take part in preparation classes ( the knowledge of the country, extra classes, customs, culture). Trainees will have an opportunity to learn how to manage different situations, where it is needed to break language barriers. They will have much bigger chances to find a good job at Polish or foreign employers. This is an effective fight against the unemployment which is very high in szydłowiecki district. This project meets the needs of the participants and the labor market as well.iU. The project will last for 13 months. The results of the project:Rising professional skills among the participants through obtaining new knowledge and experience (proved by Europass Mobility)Rising language skills and competences, especially within the professional vocabulary (certificates)Rising competity of the participants in the labour marketInspiring at least 80% of participants to work in EU countries .Increasing of self-esteem with 80% of participants.Increasing of the level of the enterprisewith 70% of participantsCreating intercultural competences such as being open, tolerance, acceptationRising quality of training, improved rates of passing the proffesional final examRising the significance and prestige of the NAEE on the national and international marketIncrising skills and knowledge of NAEE staff in the field of implementation of international projectsThe dissiminating activities will concentrate on maximum durance and recognition of the results of the project as well as the widest possible applying of them. The wide promotion of the project and its results will lead to the rising interest of different institutions from the district and its neighbours to the idea of foreign apprenticeship. The project will be an excellent promotion of international cooperation and cooperation between local educational and training establishments. It will also become a promotion of the institutions implementing the project and the project's results.

The applicant of the ‘European experience – an investment in the future’ project is the Vocational School Complex in Giżycko. The partner institutions are: TELLUS EDUCATION GROUP (UK) and ESMOVIA (Spain). The participants of the project are 16 students of the school who are trained in the following professions: hotel industry technician, nutrition and food service technician and cook. The project is also addressed to 12 teachers of the Vocational School Complex who are either teachers of vocational subjects for gastronomy and hotel industry, teachers of business studies, vocational traineeship organizers or members of management staff. The main objective of the project is to strengthen professional competences of the staff teaching in hotel and catering industry and to support the students in gaining knowledge, skills and competences which will facilitate their personal development and raise their employment possibilities. The students will have the opportunity to gain valuable experience and to raise their professional competences and attractiveness to potential employers. The project will enable the students to increase their learning motivation and the teachers to raise their job satisfaction, awareness of the correlation between education and job market, and to learn about educational system in Spain. It will also raise English language skills, including vocational English, of all the participants. The project assumes 2 mobilities of eight-person groups of students with one attendant each. The first one – to Plymouth in Great Britain (may 2017) and the second one – to Valencia in Spain (October 2017). A group of 12 teachers is also going to go to Valencia (February 2017) for a job shadowing training – an observation of Spanish school work and traineeships in work places such as hotels and restaurants. The students are going to undergo 2 weeks traineeship in 3-4 stars hotels and restaurants, which host visitors all year round offering a high standard of service, at the positions corresponding with their target professions.  The participants will develop their professional skills in the areas of food and beverages preparation technology, serving hotel guests or consumers and preparing residential units for guests. The traineeship curriculum will be fitted to each vocational group respecting individual needs of the participants. To prepare the students properly for the traineeship, they are going to be provided with cultural and linguistic preparation before and during the mobilities. The workers of the partner institutions will monitor the course of traineeship, evaluate the outcomes and issue certificates confirming performed training which will include a list of acquired skills. The Vocational School Complex will apply for issuing the Europass Mobility Certificates in consultation with the partner institutions. As a part of the project, the students will create regional culinary guidebooks, which will be used during regular classes at school.During the stay, the teachers will learn about teaching methods, the schools organizational structure and the educational system in Spain, the rules and ways of testing students, the organization of traineeships and the range of cooperation with work places.  As a summary, there will be the Erasmus Day organized in the Vocational School Complex. During the event, the information about English and Spanish cuisine, culture and customs, and the possibilities of organizing and participating in foreign mobilities will be shared. The project will influence the professional and personal development of the participants. They will gain experience in team work. By learning rules and necessary skills the students will increase their chances of finding employment. They will look more actively for a job and become more mobile. The acquired EU funds will positively influence the support of teachers’ professional development and international cooperation development.Good practices will be incorporated at the Vocational School Complex. The school will gain opportunity to adjust syllabus, including traineeship program, to expectations of the job market. The project will influence the development of teachers’ substantive and pedagogical qualifications, who will transfer the positive experience from the project to the school practice, including lesson plans and open access lessons. The other teachers and the students who will not participate in the project will benefit from it. Participants will raise understanding and respect to diversity of the EU citizens and develop awareness of belonging to the European community.The experience gained will allow to include the foreign traineeship into the school offer, which will raise the attractiveness of education in our school. The experience and acquired skills of the employees will be used to plan the school work. The project will allow to implement European standards into vocational training in the Vocational School Complex.

Eurojoven Castilla y Leon is carried out by Instituto de la Juventud de Castilla y Leon joined in a consortium to 18 VET centres of the region. 60 young recent graduates in fields such as administrative management, commerce, imaging laboratory, welding and boiler, and electromechanical vehicle body, bakery and pastry, carpentry, laboratory, nursing assistants, characterization, decorative personal image, restaurant services, electrical, telecommunications, consumer electronics and construction, experience a stay of training related to their educational background in companies / entities in Poland, UK, Ireland and Czech Republic. For 3 months learn professional, English and social skills and entrepreneurship.Aims to achieve:- Increased knowledge of the profiles that companies demand in other countries and applying the curriculum- Strengthening cooperation between partners at national and international levels for the realization of future projects- Increased language skills, especially English- Recognition and measurement of VET in other countriesFor participants expected results are:- Increase by 50% the employability of 60 youth of Castilla and Leon.- Increase of 50% of their personal, social, linguistic and professional.Through the project is intended to achieve the following related to the European dimension results:- Increased attractiveness of mobility and lifelong learning for both young people in general and for the project partners.- Use tools and visibility within the European framework and the Europass.- Approach and collaboration among young people, public bodies, schools and businesses in Europe.Long-term impacts:- Participants may apply tools for learning planning your day and your professional future.- For the Center, the internationalization strategy through mobility programs, is definitely achieving modernization that reverse in the center, which makes it attractive and unique in the eyes of prospective students and companies.- Interest in new schools to establish partnerships with social partners outside education, and employment-related and labor policies.- Inclusion of mobility programs in political strategies related to regional youth.- Opening of new contacts and potential partnerships, sharing of ideas and initiatives between different actors of the project. Ability to plan in time of innovation and training projects in other actions of Erasmus + or others.
FCT Europa: Técnicos Deportivos de Baloncesto y Mantenimiento Electromecánico

This mobility project will be developed by the IES Fermín Bouza Brey, of Vilagarcia de Arousa (Galicia), a secondary school that offers:ESO, Vocational Education (short cycles, Higher education and Vocational Basic), Secondary and Sport Education in Basketball Sport Technician. Born from the need of increasing internationalization of companies and their staff need to incorporate availability ofinternational mobility, commitment to improving the skills of management and organization of the center and its faculty, improving the skills of students facing a employability more and better career prospects, increased language skills, etc.The principal aims of mobilities will be:- Increasing skills and general abilities related to market work and contribute for a cohesionated society which builds bridges between the labour market and the education world.- Developing training, more recent innovation and internationalization at all levels- Promote the need for a European conscience, encouraging reformers principles at national level to modernize the education and training system, giving an example of good practice and recognizing EU tools.- Increasing international dimension of education and training through cooperation between institutions and partners - To encourage the teaching and learning of languages and promoting an intercultural awareness and spread the linguistic diversity of the EU.The project shows 14 mobilities: 8 for students and 6 for teachers. The profile of students, by which is meant the activity, are students of first courses of FP (IMA) and vocational training course of Basketball Sport Technician and the teaching staff would be who are involved at that level. These students are prepared to exercise as coaches in professional sport clubs and technician in electromechanical maintenance technicians in companies. Teachers will be chosen from basketball sports education in order to improve and update their curriculum in a changing work such as basketball coach. Activities are focused in these areas:- Areas of coaching with former teams of professional sport clubs of basketball- Areas of learning of basketball from technical, tactic and physic views.- Areas of management and professional organization of a sports club basketball- Areas of execution of maintenance and repair of machinery and industrial equipment.- A production areas in automated processes as responsible of lines, integrating the production and maintenance functions.- A production areas making machinery manufacturing assembly, installation and technical assistance plan.The mobilities of students will last for 2 months for V.T.Electromechanical Maintenance and 1 month for V.T. Basketball Sport Technician in order to complete the module of Job Training (FCT) defined in the curriculum of the training cycles.The mobilities of teachers will be for job shadowing in a company of the sport sector for a week  in order to identify different teaching methodologies and knowing how to organize a sport club.The methodology used to run the project will be working closely with partners countries and with the intermediary company Tellus Group. They will supply accommodating, language training, provide a suitable company profile for students to practice, and safety training health, cultural visits, etc. The communication between the partners will be fluent, including the intermediary partner, the sending institution and the company chosen, using CIT tools that will maintain high cohesion between the objectives and the development of mobility.As a project which contains mobility of students and staff of educational institutions we are going to try to get:- Contribute to the training of young people as qualified, open and experienced professionals abroad.- Promoting language learning and culture of the countries of the European Union and promote integration between differentcultures.- Encourage the update and recycling of teachers involved in teaching of the cycle. This training will also cover personal cultural,linguistic and educational areas.The benefits of participating in a European program of this nature is mainly focused on:- The different vocational training cycles increase their advertising, which will mean that more students are interested in making them- Higher rate of employment for students- To improve cooperation between companies and institutions- To expand the European conscience of our education center developing new european programs (Erasmus+Sport, Mobility charter of VT, etc) and open the doors for students/staff from other countries in a close future

“Apprenticeship abroad as the key to a professional career” is a project aimed at giving the participants an opportunity to achieve success in their professional development and raising the level of teaching in our school. Taking part in the apprenticeship provides a chance to acquire knowledge, skills and professional qualifications, enhance the perspectives for better employment in both domestic and European job markets, and to boost the personal development of the students and the teachers. A crucial aim is to increase the intercultural awareness and understanding of different cultures and countries by the project participants and to strengthen the feeling of citizenship and European identity.The direct participants are a group of 52 students from profiles: ICT, electronics, geodesy and technology of renewable energy sources who will take part in the project as a part of their compulsory professional practice, 8 teachers whose role will be to supervise the trainees and 6 vocational teachers, who will undergo specialist professional training. The indirect participants are the whole school and the local community.20 ICT students will go for two-week training in Great Britain. The apprenticeship will take place in Plymouth in the centre of the vocational education Tellus Group. The students will do tasks connected with designing and creating local computer networks as well as managing the data communication networks.16 students from the geodesy profile will do a two-week apprenticeship in Spain. The host organisation will be EuroMind. The students will carry out their practice under the supervision of a surveyor from the company Iniciativas el Condado. As part of the apprenticeship the students will perform measurements in the field and then they will do the calculations in AutoCAD programme.  The students will learn the specifics of work in a geodesic company as well as in the technical office of the town council. 16 students from the profiles electronics and technology of renewable energy sources, will complete a one-month apprenticeship in Portugal in companies dealing with the monitoring and servicing of systems and devices of electronics and renewable energy.The recruitment will be based on clear rules. The students will be provided with international transport, insurance, accommodation, board and full mentoring from both the teachers of ZSEiO, who will be looking after the students during the apprenticeship and from the employers of the host organisations.Before leaving the young apprentices will get organisational support, which will make their stay abroad easier. They will boost their vocabulary and expressions in English needed for work and everyday communication. They will also get basic information about the culture, traditions, customs and the economy of the country they are going to. They will be familiarised with the rules of the apprenticeship, the programme and regulations of their training, rights and obligations, safety rules during their journey and stay as well as cultural differences. English will be the basic language of communication. The students going to Portugal will take part in a Portuguese course, which will help them communicate in Spain.The apprenticeship will allow the opportunity to compare the European industry solutions with the ones used in Poland and to verify the theoretical knowledge in a practical aspect. While taking part in the project, the students will develop their language competence, improve their communication skills and specific vocabulary. Staying with families and in hostels, often with people from other countries, the students will learn the understanding of different cultures, openness and tolerance.Each participant will receive the Europass Mobility document, which describes the vocational and additional benefits the student acquired and a Certificate of completion.Our school can see the need for educating its staff, therefore 6 teachers will go to Spain for specialist professional training. It will be organised by euroMind, a company with huge experience in professional training that cooperates with numerous vocational schools. The teachers will familiarise themselves with the educational system in Spain, especially with its vocational part, they will get to know the ECVET system tools, and visit vocational training facilities.Teachers will exchange their experience with their Spanish counterparts about the curriculums they use, teaching materials, e-tools, Moodle platform, the organisation of the apprenticeship and the employment opportunities for the school graduates in local and European job markets. This will be a chance to enhance the teachers’ professional competences and improve their ability to use the English language in practice. The whole local community will benefit from the project.It will open the door for a professional career for the participants and it will contribute to better and more effective teaching in our school.
Europejskie Praktyki Zawodowe – doświadczenie na dziś i jutro

The project “European vocational apprenticeship –the experience for today and for tomorrow “ attempts to meet the expectations on the European Job Market. PZNr 10 SME im M. Kopernika  faces another challenge to realize new tasks aiming at the improvement of the quality of teaching, taking into consideration the growing need of the students, their parents as well as the employers. The school’s development lets its graduates fit into the job market easily or to continue their education at universities. The project “European vocational apprenticeship – the experience for today and for tomorrow “ develops the experience worked out throughout the previous four years of the school’s foreign vocational apprenticeships. Both Polish and European partners have been included into the process of its preparation as well as its implementation. The Regional Employers Association  “PODBESKIDZIE”, the representatives of job center in Oświęcim as well as one of the largest employing company in the area  - GRUPA KĘTY S.A. also contributed to the project preparation. Due to the fact that we have just started the cooperation with a new partner – TellUs Education Group, the project opens new possibilities of learning the English attitude to a job, to the personal competence relating to a particular line of business as well as practical learning and improving a foreign language emphasizing vocational vocabulary.   33 technical college students will take part in the project. 9 mechanics, 16 hotel management technicians,  8 culinary technicians. They will develop and improve their occupational competence during the two year planned area of activity. (09.2016-08.2018) The students will participate in the 4-week apprenticeship in foreign companies while learning new methods and techniques of their occupations as well as learning specific activities and tasks necessary for their future jobs. They will acquire new experiences and qualifications, know the newest technologies and find out about the specific way of managing foreign business enterprises. Above all, they will master their English skills including vocational vocabulary and they will also become even better motivated about their educational progress. The trip abroad will be preceded by pedagogical, cultural, language and risk prevention preparation. The partner organization TellUs Education Group in Plymouth (England) will take the role of an organizer during the stay in the host country. This will be a great opportunity to get to know the richness of culture and heritage of the partner country – England. Cross-cultural competence will be developed such as tolerance, acceptance, openness. The attitude towards cultural differences will be improved. Stereotypes will be overcome. The project will support the people of low living standard, low income, difficult family situation, coming from small towns or villages and those with health problems. It will try to reinforce the students motivation to study and to self-improvement.  The increase of self-belief in students’ own abilities will result in higher personal and career aspirations. The participants will learn how to overcome stress and assimilate in the new environment.The actions connected with the students’ mobility will be based on the ECVET principles as well as equally well known and recognized system called AptEd. Whereas the skills acquired by students will be confirmed by Europass Mobility. The school will provide the certificates confirming the level of language skills in terms of vocational vocabulary. The foreign employers will grade the students abilities and skills acquired during their apprenticeship in the Evaluation Card. Current evaluation and risk management will influence the high quality of the project. The results will be publicized in the school local area and the school’s foreign partners. The quality and attractiveness of teaching will be increased due to the experience the teachers acquire during the exchange. The project partners will reinforce their position on the local and European market. They will improve the techniques they use. The employers will gain qualified and highly motivated employees. Not only will the project’s actions influence all the engaged participants but the whole society will benefit as well due to social death prevention. The project will support the people of low living standard, low income, difficult family situation, coming from small towns or villages and those with health problems. It will attempt to intensify the students motivation to self- improvement and towards their educational process. The increase of self-belief in students’ own abilities will result in higher personal and career aspirations. The participants will learn how to overcome stress and assimilate in the new environment.

The changes on the job market, the expectations from today’s employees of practical skills, good knowledge of technology and excellent vocational training supported by good foreign language level make school do its best in order to meet these requirements and prepare school graduates to enter the world of  work with confidence and self-assurance.Learning in the classroom does not allow students to acquire skills good enough to fulfill expectations of future employers. As a result, the school wants to help its students undertake the training abroad in order to raise the quality, attractiveness and effectiveness of vocational training and enable teachers to improve both their qualifications and teaching skills. That is why we would like to provide our teachers with Job Shadowing  and our students and graduates  with vocational traineeship in the UK, Spain and Germany. In 2017, two teachers will go to Germany. Vitalis GMBH will be the organization providing 5 day Job Shadowing with the program covering the topics of German vocational counseling system. Teachers will have the opportunity to observe the work of foreign institution providing advisory services and participate in classes in one of German schools.The apprenticeship for undergraduate/graduate students will take place in 5 groups in the years 2016-2018. Training institutions for 70 students are Tellus Group Ltd-Tellus College (UK), Vitalis GMBH (Germany) and EuroMind Projects (Spain).English and German partners declared to organize 4 week traineeship in Plymouth and Leipzig best facilities for 3 groups of students (44 students). As for the UK, the students are supposed to take part in dual training which includes vocational apprenticeship in companies and AptEd  course. The vocational traineeship will be organized in groups of 2 or 3 persons.Spanish partner declared to organize 2 week apprenticeship for 2 groups of students (26 students) in the fields of land surveying and building construction in Seville and Ubeda. Each group will have its own manager (the person working in the given place) and training will be monitored by manager of Tellus Group Ltd., Vitalis Gmbh and EuroMind Projects and a teacher - traineeship guardian of the Building Schools Complex (ZSB). At the time of doing the traineeship, students will master English or German language and culture of the host country thanks to language courses (UK, Spain), cultural activities, sightseeing tours or host families in the UK.Students will take part in intense English, Spanish or German language courses a few months before their departure to the UK, Spain or Germany. They will also participate in workshops about stress, conflict solutions, vocational counseling and safety regulations in the workplace, the ability of creating portfolio. The main aim of the project is to enable students of construction industry, land surveying, logistics, catering and hotel industry to gain and improve vocational skills in attractive workplace conditions as well as to give them the opportunity to increase their chances on the job market. Moreover, students will be able to get to know needs of the European employers and European job market. Other aims include raising students’ vocational mobility, providing the opportunity to verify the knowledge and skills gained in school, practicing language skills. At the same time, the school itself will gain experience in handling international projects.Thanks to the project, all 70 participants will get new qualifications  and  vocational skills inthe UK, Spain and Germany confirmed by certificate and the Europass Mobility in Polish, English, Spanish and German languages, ECVET,  they will be able to improve their English language (English language course certificates), will benefit from educational activities, learn how to deal with stressful situations, create their own EUROPASS CV and electronic Portfolio. All these things will significantly help students look for better job opportunities in the future. The main aim of the project for teachers will be the possibility of gaining the knowledge about the organization of vocational counseling system in Germany, getting to know the new work methods of German advisors and comparing them with the Polish system. Exchanging and sharing the experience, establishing contacts with German institutions of vocational guidance are very important. Teachers will also improve their linguistic, social and cultural skills.The Building Schools Complex in Konin (ZSB Konin) will present project results on school website, exhibitions, seminaries and will include vocational internship in the school curriculum. The project itself will contribute to the promotion of school and its students’ achievements (future graduates) in local environment
Increasing Entrepreneurship skills of Hospitality and Catering in VET

As the Hospitality and Catering department of Akçakoca Vocational and Technical Highschool this project aims  to increase our students' professional competences in VET in the fields of Hospitality and Catering.With this project we also would like to increase their language skills in order to be highly demanded workers among the tourism sector in Kocaeli.With our project we will be able to develop,compare and seize the initial vocational training at our school  with the initial vocational training in European Association countries.  According to Erasmus+ program and our national goals;our project will encourage European cooperation, Europeanity, quality and reformity concepts to be understood and adopted by our beneficiaries. This Project is prepared especially to increase  entrepreneurship skills among our students.We will prepare the infrastructure of international professional certification, and support professional education.Mobilities to a different country will provide not only self confidence but also experiencing awareness of cultural differences.25  students from our 10th and 11th grade are going to do their Vet training by international mobilities. .There will be 2 mobilities to UK and 1 to Italy between February and August 2017.Tellus Group companies will serve as the host instituition.Our instituition aims  to graduate our students with superior skills to meet the needs of the increasing tourism investment in our province.Our activities in the project preparation phase involves the preparation of communication and the draft program with the host institution.After our project is approved our activities will consist of setting up a  project team , the selection of beneficiaries, skills training internship mobility, dissemination and evaluation .
LUIS DE LUCENA ABRE FRONTERAS A LA FP

Our project: “LUIS DE LUCENA ABRE FRONTERAS A LA FP”, aims to provide the selected students from intermediate Vocational Training at IES Luis de Lucena in Guadalajara, the opportunity to complete their training in a country of the European Union.
Through these practices students will complete their Vocational Studies implementing the technical knowledge and skills acquired and thus achieve certification in the module "On the Job Training" as well as get an internationally valid Europass certificate.
Cultural and language training will also be improved. They also increase their autonomy, initiative and responsibility and will be a good example for other students. All this will contribute to improve the  learning competences forever and  and the ability to excel.
The programme will involve six students belonging to intermediate Vocational Studies of  "Telecommunications Installations", "Electrical and Automatic installations"  and "Beauty & Wellness”. Destination countries are the United Kingdom and Italy.
The first phase of the project is to select candidates students, using objective tests and personal interviews, so that we can find the right company to their profile. The selected students will carry out a linguistic and cultural preparation about the destination country as well as an specific training in the technical skills required for the position in the destination company.
The stay will last 82 days, from late March to mid-June 2017. We have the support of two partners: the company Tellus College (UK) and the Associazione Culturale Enea (Italy). They will help us to search and select the companies as needed, according to the profile of our students, and also with the management of the accommodation.
Finally, our center will be responsible for arranging, travel, insurance and all necessary documentation.
Communications between the different parts will be made by mail, phone or instant messaging systems.
The company tutor will inform us, on a weekly basis, about the students progress. Besides,  all students and tutors will keep a weekly record about the project activities carried out, in order to establish quality criteria to help us to complete the project's final report.
By the end of the training, the students will gain an internationally recognized certification and also the Europass mobility certificate, favoring work mobility and employability. The destination company will also issue a work certificate.
ESTANCIAS INTERNACIONALES PARA ALUMNADO Y PROFESORADO SEFED EN CFGM

Inform Foundation manages since 1987 the SEFED Programme (Simulation for Business Educational Purposes - The Practice Firm concept) which offers training to around 7.000 students delivered by 800 teachers in vocational training institutions and training for the unemployed in Spain. All these students are being trained in professional and social skills in the business and managing of companies field.

This professional and practical training aimed at finding jobs is well know and acknowledged by the Ministry of Labour issuing a professional certificate with level 1, 2, 3 or by the corresponding Ministry of Education issuing a medium level of vocational training in the administration or comercial field.

Inform has always considered working experiences abroad as part of and an added value to the training delivered in the SEFED Programme. Thus, Erasmus + K1 Programme allows us to support our students and teachers in training activities to achieve and use knowledge, skills and qualifications for their personal development, ocupability and participation in the European labour market. 

The participants of this project are:

- Unemployed students or VET students (mainly young people and women over 25 years old) who are being trained in the SEFED Programme and who would like to improve not only their knowledge and skills in the business field, undertaking working experience stays in Ireland or Great Britain, but their language skills as well. Thus, the project is about to undertake 52 working stays in Irish, Italian, Lithuanian or UK companies and undertake business and management tasks during 5, 8 or 12 weeks as a maximum as participants cannot have longer stays because of personal reasons and the need they have to look for jobs.

- Teachers and professional staff working for the SEFED Programme: the project allows us to offer a unique opportunity for teachers and professional staff working for the SEFED Programme to be able to share and improve their knwoledge and experiences in a different country and in different organizations, including the transfer of skills and/or methods and innovative ways of doing things in the training field. The transfer of know-how is meant to improve the quality and access to continuous training, to update and adapt the european educational and training systems. When improving knowledge, attitudes and individual skills from all professional staff involved in the SEFED Programme, we will improve in the development of the european labour market and social economy.
The project is based on professional stays in 4 countries, 2 of them already have practice firm networks and are members of Europen-Pen International, from which Inform Foundation is a founding member. Specifically, the professional/pedagogical team will undertake training stays for 5 days in different training organizations which have practice firms in Lithuania and Austria in which teachers and professional staff will share experiences and best practices regarding the practice firm concept, the organization and management of practice firms as active learning tools.
There will also be some stays in Ireland in which there will be a combination of know-how transfer, innovative learning ways of doing things and application of IT in training. There will also be visits to Irish companies so as to undertake job-shadowing.
The main goal of the stays in Netherlands is to know how they apply the Dual VET system. These knowledge and good practices will help spanish teachers and education professionals to improve the applications of dual VET system in Spain.
The participants will be teachers in language skills, foreign trade skills and counselors and training professional staff. There will also be professional staff from Inform Foundation with the aim to set up links with the Central Offices for Practice Firms from the 2 members of Europen-Pen International (Lithuania and Austria) and the Netherland stays as well.

The project is meant to improve the quality of the SEFED Programme, the ocupability and competitivity of students and professional staff in training participating in the project.

To prove the success there has been some success indicators set up as the level of labour ocupability of students, the improvement degree of language skills, or the increase of foreign trade orders.

Centre d'Estudis Sant Francesc aims at better internationalizing its students. Currently CESF is offering Intermediate Vocational Programmes for Commerce (Retail), Carers, Auxiliary Nursing Assistants and Computer Technicians. Also, for those students who could not finish the compulsory secondary education a course in the field of Computing is offered. For the unemployed, there are also two courses to get a Professional Qualification in the fields of Teacher Training and Community Mediation, respectively. Short-degree cycles are also taught in different areas such as business, computers or community services (Early Childhood Education and Social Integration).



What the school needs is the following: 1) students need more foreign language skills (especially English) and some type of added value (internships abroad) in order to increase their employability, and 2) we need better prepared teachers who approach business to classrooms, especially internationally speaking. This staff should also be better prepared at foreign languages to provide more content in English and make students have more contact with the language in the classes, epecially in the field of VET and the courses described above.

Activities:

A1) for students, 8 flows to UK and Ireland and Malta, respectively, in different periods (March/April and June) are proposed for traineeships in companies. It is strongly recommended for students in the Health and Social Services and Carers to do their traineeship in Ireland. In total 40 students will be travelling to do their internships abroad in groups of 5.


A2) for teachers, also threeflows are proposed  to Italy. Two renown companies with a very comprehensive variety of services will serve as examples for teachers in the area of Health and Social Services, respectively.


To carry out the project, we wilk talk to students who are likely to take part in it to make them aware of the importance of these traineeship periods. As for the training activity for teachers, the idea that it is a unique opportunity will be emphasized. The selection process is meant to be very objective and, once selected, participants will be monitored by the sending institution as well as by the intermediary and the receiving organization. At the end of the project, students' results  will be analyzed from the point of view of employability and language learning. As for the staff, the implementation of new concepts and methods in their classes will be evaluated.

CESF is aiming at increasing the number of well-prepared students in the VET sector who can afterwards enrol in any course in the field of Higher Vocational Training, and actually enhance their employability. As for teachers, they will be encouraged to use in their lessons new knowledge and methods acquired in their job shadowing experiences.

"La mobilité européenne, un outil de formation pour tous"

Reunion Island, a French overseas department located in Indian Ocean, off the island Madagascar, presents a very specific situation with alarming statistics concerning unemployment. The geographic isolation of the island imposes a certain degree of mobility to the young unemployed people from Reunion.Our organization, Mission Locale Sud, aimes at opening the range of opportunities for this target group. Most of the young people are under skilled which means that we must be innovative in providing alternative training solutions, through non-formal education, based on experience and hands-on learning. But here on the island, because of our geographical location mobility is not easy to organize.The aims of the project are :- To establish our structure as an actor of European and international mobility projects, but also for local projects, with the search for new partnerships.- Set up a qualified team to serve these international projects, on a linguistic and organizational level- Continue to provide the public with original projects that are professional and personal springboards.The project called "European mobility, training for everyone", offers to 8 members of the Mission Locale's staff  an internship in a European organization (Spanish, Italian, Irish or British). The training will be for a period of 2 weeks, to train "multipliers" of the European mobility project, within our team and beyond the local network. The themes targeted in the training program are varied : European citizenship, mobility, work placements in companies and professional integration.The expected results, in addition to the benefit to the participants, will be to consolidate the work experience gained through the use the European mobility project as an insertion tool which in turn will allow our structure to continue the development of our privileged position in the field of mobility and inclusion and to thus stimulate new projects.
Higher education student and staff mobility project

Higher education student and staff mobility project
