The trainees will build on their language and human competencies and acquire new professional action competence. Thus, the trainees will not lose the connection at the school. With the new media (moodle) the school will offer modules to the trainees. These need to be developed and uploaded again, so that the vocational teachers can check the success of learning. In this way we also during the internship a learning purpose. In addition, the trainees will continue their record books, as indeed their only place of learning has changed. The activity will therefore be similar to here at German institutions.
In the long term, we hope not only in a few occupations should get such an exchange, but also in other areas. The vocational skills, mobility and flexibility of the new generation of skilled workers will be further promoted. A long-term goal may be that the BBS II Göttingen as "European School" is.

The Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Baden-Wurttemberg, Germany (German abbreviation: BWIHK), in an umbrella organization of the 12 Chambers of Commerce and Industry in Baden-Wuerttemberg (German Federal Land) and represents the voice of Baden-Wuerttemberg’s industry, trade and service sector whilst being committed to the overall interests of the economy. Therefore the BWIHK works together with different actors which are situated not only on the local (IHKs) and regional (IHKs) but also on the national (DIHK) and international (AHK) level.
One of the main concerns of the BWIHK is to promote the internationalization of vocational training in Baden-Wuerttemberg. In the context of previous Leonardo da Vinci-mobility projects the BWHK has already sent moren than 300 trainees abroad during their training. Since 2008 Go.for.europe has supported more than 2000 trainees in doing an internship in different countries of Europe. Also in the upcoming years BWIHK aims to offer for again 120 trainees grants to gain work experience in Great Britain and Spain.
The main target group of this project form trainees who are in the second year of their apprenticeship. The big advantage is that these young people have already achieved an adequate basic knowledge in their profession whilst at the same time not being in exams revision yet. BWIHK’s intended four-week internships are planned to take place in the following periods: autumn 2017/2018 and spring 2018/2019. BWIHK intends to work again with the same partner organizations like in the last years due to the good cooperation established. BWIHK’s UK partner is called Tellus Group and is located in Plymouth. In Spain BWIHK’s cooperation applies to Service Internship Consulting, based in Málaga. The responsible project managers at BWIHK are Ms. Verena Koenig, based at Lake Constance, and Ms. Julia Beck, based in Stuttgart.
The above-mentioned partner organizations will take care of the apprentices during their stay abroad. An airport shuttle on the apprentices’ arrival will be ensured from the airport to their host families or respectively to their apartments. The apprentices will attend a language course during the first week of their stay. The following three weeks they will do an internship in a company and field which meets the requirements/line of work of to their apprenticeship/profession. They will work 5 days a week, 8 hours a day. At the weekends the partner organization offers a cultural programme but they will also have time for their own.
During the whole time of their programme participation the apprentices have to write a report portfolio and keep records about their stay abroad, including photos and notes. After their stay abroad the project will be evaluated through different instruments. Therefore a follow-up seminar will take place which is organized by the project managers of the BWIHK. The evaluation will be done by interviewing the participants about their experience and their level of satisfaction with regard to their stay abroad. That will be done partially by a standardized questionary in order to show possible disturbances or unexpected developments and to allow the evaluator to react in case of need. The closing evaluation will be done by analyzing the reports of the participants and the group discussions.                                                                                
For the future one of the most aims of the BWIHK is sending still more apprentices to Europe. Furthermore the BWIHK aims to convince training companies of the importance and additional value of this great offer so that quite more apprentices can participate in this project in the upcoming years.

The project is organised by the two project partners Wilhelm Gienger KG in Kornwestheim, Germany and the Tellus Group based in Plymouth, UK. The company Wilhelm Gienger KG is a family-run, medium-sized company with over 90 years experience in the sector as a wholesaler in building services. As a training provider the project partner Tellus Group is an active partner of programmes such as Erasmus+ and has many years of experience in arranging internships. 
Planned are two postings of trainees in autumn of 2017 and of 2018 respectively for three weeks. There are eight trainees posted at a time, who are carefully selected in advance by their internal and academic achievements as well as their motivation letters. 
Background of the project are the positive experiences with the Go.for.europe project and Erasmus+ programme in 2014 up to 2016 in which overall 14 trainees were posted abroad.
Thereby a very large value for the company has been recognized, resulting in the following objectives for the current project. Through the internships, the trainees should expand their social and intercultural skills as well as their professional and language
competences. These include increasing the language skills, mobility, flexibility, openness plus independence and obtaining self-assurance in dealing with business partners. Furthermore, the project is accompanied by the increase in attractiveness of the dual education system and of Wilhelm Gienger KG as a training company and business company. This image enhancement should have a positive impact on employees, potential applicants, and other external people such as our customers. With the support of our junior staff on their way to qualified professionals, we will get high performing employees that secure the long-term success of the company.
The project will be offered to full-aged trainees in the second and third year of apprenticeships, who already provide basic knowledge. An optimal preparation is ensured by a detailed information transfer over the course of the project and preparation seminars.
The trainees are posted for three weeks at a time. The accommodation is provided by host families who are carefully selected by the Tellus Group. On the first day the students take part at a welcome meeting which informs about the next steps and the internship companies. After an one-week intensive language course, the trainees will complete two-week internships.
The travel arrangements and insurances are arranged by the company Wilhelm Gienger KG. The Tellus Group is organising the accommodations, internships as well as the programme and are in charge of the group. There is steady contact with the Tellus Group and the trainees also have the opportunity to communicate to us at any time during their stay.
The evaluation of the project will be effected by means of participant reports, feedback from our project partner, personal interviews with trainees and presentations of the project results.

Vocational trainees shall get international experience to improve their linguistic, cultural and professional knowledges and skills.
All participants are working in enterprises, which cooperate with others in foreign countries - for example as part of an international group or as customer or as supplier. The training companies are all customer- and sales-oriented and practice a CRM. For the most training companies is also very important the quality control and qualitiy work because they are in an international competitive.

Project objectives and expected results:
- greater occupational competence
- improved foreign language proficiency 
- foreign markets to get to know and recognize differences from the domestic market 
- to identify and understand differences in the type of customer contact and customer loyalty

Our school's students for industrial business managment assistant work for companies which have many subsidiaries and partners in different countries all around the world due to a more and more complex and globalized world. Our school wants to train them for these modern challenges and help them in the field of mobility, flexibility and cultural knowledge. This is why we organize this project. During their stay abroad, the students will get to know the culture, language and business practice of the host country and expand their competences in those areas. This project will furthermore prepare them for their language certificates and help them improve their language skills. Our school wants to strengthen this project over the next few years so it can become a core pillar of the training at our school.
All of these aims will be dealt with during our visits to Plymouth between September 2017 and May 2018. Since all of our trainees will be in their second or third year of training, they will have all the important experience to be helpful members at their work places and their host families and will allow them to work and live independently in the foreign country.
The project coordinator at the Erwin-Teufel-Schule is Mr Sebastian Freund. Our partner in Plymouth is the TellUs Group who were introduced to us by Go.for.europe from the IHK Hochrhein-Bodensee in Constance. In Plymouth, representatives from TellUS will be our main contact. During our two visits, 30 students (15 per visit) will have the opportunity to take part in the programme.

Departure and arrival:
The students will leave from Stuttgart International Airport and fly to London Heathrow on their own. TellUS will pick them up at the airport and bring them to their host families by bus.

Accommodation and social environment:
In Plymouth, TellUS will give further information about the companies they'll work for and further details about the schedule during the next days and week. All students will live with host families (half-board).

Acclimatisation:
On the first day there will be a meeting with representatives from TellUS. The students will meet their TellUS-contacts in person and learn about all the important information they need (contacts. schedule, phone numbers, bus tickets, maps of the city) so that they are all set for their stay in the UK.
Then they will have a language test to check their language level. According to the test results, they will be split up into groups and start their language course. They will have an intensive language course focusing on business English. During course week, they will get to know many customs and specifics about the UK.

Work placement:
First they will get to know their companies and get to know all the work related processes at first. When they know about the most important things, they will start to work in the areas they work in in Germany as well, e.g. administration, offers and enquiries or accountance.

Work day:
The students will work up to 37,5 hours per week, depending on their companies. No one will work more than 37,5 hours a week.

Culture:
During the weekend, the ETS and TellUS will put together a variety of cultural activities and sightseeing.
Go Abroad and Complete Your Skills IV

The Europe-Agency of the District Government of Soest is offering 70 vocational students of the districts vocational schools a four week internship abroad within the project "Go Abroad and Complete Your Skills IV". Main focuses of the project are  competences in foreign languages (Englisch/Spanisch) and the internship in a foreign company. 
Partner of the District Government of Soest are CLIC internationale house in Seville and the Tellus Group in Plymouth, UK which are responsible for organizing housing, internships and overseeing the students during their internship period. 

The use of foreign languages is vital especially in the educational fields of business management and administration. That is why, the vocational training in business and administration has an emphasis on language training in two different foreign languages, one of them beeing Englisch. To promote  learning of foreign languages, an internship in an Englisch company is considered to be very helpful and motivating. After the internship, the new aquired competences are validated by a third party with a certificate, which can be used to help with future work applications.

Because of the work placement in a foreign company in a foreign country, social an language competences are improved, especially because of the new cultural insights. Thus, intercultural learning will also be a great part of the internship experience.
EXPERIENCE Training, Working and Learning in Europe

"EXPERIENCE Training, Working and Learning in Europe" is a mobility project for VET students and staff int he sector of health and social care. With the help of this project we want to enhance the personal, professional and intercultural competences of students and staff of WBS SCHULEN. 

Our objectives are firstly to convey holistic European values; in a globalised world it is more important than ever to participate on an international level. Secondly we want to prevent cultural bias; and the best way to start raising a global awareness is to get in contact with other cultures. We want to unite this goal with an educational goal which brings the European Union closer together by exchaning national ideas, education systems and mentalities. Thirdly, our objective is to support personal and professional growth of our students and staff. They need to learn to act and think on a global level, have empathy and understanding for other people and different cultures, grow their tolerance and improve their language skills. Due to their growth, our educational organisation is able to improve and grow as well, because our fourth goal is to improve the mothods and quality of teaching and learning at our schools. 

EXPERIENCE will be carried out in close contact between the European partners. Every organisational step of the mobility project has been planned precisely and every participating organisation knows exactly what their task is in every stage of the organisation, implementation and evaluation to complete this mobility programme in high quality. 

We encourage our students and staff to use this possibility during their holidays, project weeks or after the students' final exams. We plan on sending 40 employees of our organisation to a workshop or training and 80 of our students to a training or work placement abroad. By providing 10 of our single parent students with the opportunity to take their children with them on their EXPERIENCE we want to counteract the disadvantages in work life of people with families and thereby reduce inequalities of the labour market.

We want to be a part of the European education development and contribute to a holistic education. The EXPERIENCE our participants will gain will contribute to their skills and can be integrated in the system of our schools. Improvement and development of our schools means improvement of education. And this is a key to a better Euopean society, growing in knowledge, competences and feeling of togetherness.
Über den Tellerrand 4 - Auslandspraktika für Schüler und Schülerinnen der Bereiche Hauswirtschaft und Ernährung sowie Gesundheit und Soziales

Project background and number and profile of participants
The Hermann-Gmeiner-Berufskolleg intends to dispatch a total of 26 students from the areas domestic science and nutrition as well as health, education and social sciences to work placements in Spain, Ireland and England. Students will be given two options concerning the duration of these stays abroad: they can either spend 6 weeks abroad using the obligatory four-week-work placement of the respective training scheme and adding two weeks of the Easter holidays or they spend four months abroad after the completion of their training. A part of our students have little self-confidence as well as difficulties in theoretical learning and in self-assessing their skills and competences realistically. Furthermore, their communicative competency in English is often not very advanced and encounters with people from different cultural backgrounds are restricted to a private or school environment. However, this is a stark contrast to the expectations employers have of their employees like the ability to perform job-related tasks independently and the mental and physical readiness to adapt to changes. It goes for all students that as future employees they are going to have more and more job-related contacts with people from a different cultural background – especially so in our Dutch-German border region. Thus our students’ learning needs are developing a realistic job prospect which matches their skills, refining their personality, improving their foreign language and intercultural competences and realistically assessing the chances of temporarily learning and working abroad as a future prospect. In addition to that some of our teachers would like to learn from schools or educational institutions or do further education abroad because they wish to develop themselves further and improve the content and methods they apply in lessons and training-scheme-related tasks outside teaching.

Project aims and expected results and effects
The project aims are derived from the learning needs described above: increase the participants' employability and scholastic aptitude by improving their job-related, personal, foreign language and intercultural competences as well as their mobility. We expect our students to return from their work placements abroad with enhanced self-confidence and open-mindedness towards life in different countries and in dealing with other cultures and foreign languages and also with a clearer idea concerning their future career. Ideally the work placement abroad results in a successful application for a job or an apprenticeship. For the educational staff and our school we expect an extension of knowledge and intercultural competence and connected to that enhanced teaching quality with respect to content and methods. Our project team will very likely intensify their knowledge concerning international cooperation and increase their organisational skills. We also hope to attract more students to our school by offering work placements abroad and to provide our region with young people who are employable and open for new developments. Apart from these future and hard-to-measure results we expect tangible results in the form of a documentation in German and English or Spanish consisting of texts, pictures, films or sound recordings or presentations about the work experience or further education abroad.

Activities and methods
Our student beneficiaries will complete internships abroad in the social institutions like creches, senior citizens institutions or youth institutions or in hotels, restaurants or canteen kitchens. Our partners in Spain, England and Ireland organize work placements, accommodation and where applicable language courses and they also act as mentors and supervisors and provide some parts of the  documentation. Apart from travel arrangements and settling invoices issued by our partners we as sending organisation carry out all tasks connected to insurance, contracts , documents, administration and budgeting on behalf of the beneficiaries. Finances are co-administrated by our school board authority, the Kreis Wesel. We are constantly in touch by email and if need be by phone with everyone involved in the project in order to arrange contents and organisation flexibly according to the beneficiaries' needs.
Participating teachers suggest an appropriate further education activity, professional conference or similar school-related activities to the head-mistress and organize their stay abroad by themselves. Participation in a psychology teacher conference in Iceland and a visit to inclusive schools or institutions are currently in planning. The project team only arranges financial support for the participating teachers.
LEILA 2017 - Language & Experience in Industry, Logistics & Administration

The project "Language & Experience in Industry, Logistics & Administration" (LEILA 2017) enables 60 students in initial vocational training as well as four teachers to implement traineeships in companies and vocational organisations abroad.

Sending and coordinating organisation in this project is the "Herwig-Blankertz-Schule Hofgeismar/ Wolfhagen". Our school has got several years' experience in preparing, managing and evaluating European-funded mobility projects. By taking part in European projects, we would like to highlight the international aspects in vocational training.

Main host organisations are Škoda in Mlada Boleslav, Czech Republic and Tellus Ltd. in Plymouth and Portsmouth, United Kingdom. Two new cooperations offer placements in Sweden as well as in Slovakia. The traineeships take place in industrial mechanics, logistics, business administration and carpentry; they last between two and three weeks.

The project aims at an additional qualification of the participants: They improve their foreign language skills and their hard skills in their special area of vocational training. At the same time, their willingness for professional mobility in the future rises significantly and they enhance the chances to find employment after they have finished their vocational qualification.

All in all, we would like to help our students to know what it is like to live and work in Europe.

At Georg-Simon-Ohm-Berufskolleg (vocational school)students get trained to become IT specialists and IT systems electronics specialist. Moreover, within the dual system students also attend the  AV-department, to become media operator / picture and sound or event –technicians as part of their education. These training courses complete their 3-year training with an examination before the Chamber of Industry and Commerce.
The IT-department  IT (vocational school for IT specialists and IT system electronics), 10 pupils in the first semester and 10 pupils in the second semester of the second year of training are given the opportunity to deepen their knowledge of  their industry in a European country for one month. In addition, 10 pupils from the AV department are sent to the UK for the very first time.
Students get the opportunity to carry out this internship in companies and educational institutions of the EU to broaden their horizan but also to open up the European dimension to them regarding Europe as potential workplace. Professional experience abroad is particularly important in the IT and media sector for qualified specialists. This project also intends to improve the use of English as a "technical language" in the IT - and also within the media environment. Most of the facilities, which take on apprentices are selected by the sending agencies, whose suitability has already been demonstrated in past projects. In addition, one can say that all the institutions being involved in this project, already have several years of experience with our trainees. It is therefore fairly easy to define most of the learning arrangements for the stays of our trainees. The applicant institution knows most of the responsible persons personally and there is mutual trust.
Students of the AV-department will do their internships in Plymouth and London to the following dates:
2.07.- 29.07.2017 (London), 10.07.- 29.07.2017 (Plymouth), 18.06.2017- 30.07.2018 (London) and 18.06.2017 - 15.07.2017. 
The activities have started by informing possible participants in the summer of 2016 and have carried on until the beginning of 2017. After their application, preliminary contracts are concluded. For the students the process of applying has started in 2016 and will  continue in 2017 for the year 2018. (The target period for the AV-internships in 2018 are also the months of June and July, depending on the offer of the partner institutions.) From January 2017 the linguistic and cultural preparations will begin. The participants then apply to the partner institutions. As soon as a commitment is made, the participant contract is concluded and the first part of the grant is passed. Learning arrangements between the project partner, the partner institution and the participants will be  coordinated. At the same time the participants organize trips and accommodation with the support of the partner institution. The implementation of the business practice is continuously evaluated by the partner institutions and the project executing agency.
The intention is to deepen the knowledge acquired in the area of IT,  media design/ egineering and event technology by the students abroad as well as to gather practical experiences in this field of work. It is also intended to apply action-oriented self-controlled learning methods within this project.
The participants have the following targets set:
- to expand their professional competence
- to acquire intercultural competence
- to broaden personal competences, especially in the area of self-organisation
- to improve their language competency in English
- to acquire basic language skills in the language of the country

Project participants:
Association 3K-Aktiv e.V. (D), IBD Partnership (UK), LOTP Lightonthepath Glasgow (UK), MTP Mobilitas Training Projects (ES), ZEAL Ltd. and PARAGON Europe Ltd. (MT), Eurocultura (IT) and the Dudley College at Birmingham (UK).
3K-Aktiv e.V. manages and supports the administrative and organizational handling of the project. It sensitizes companies and training companies to the implementation of mobility for trainees and supports them in the preparation, implementation and follow-up of foreign stays. Furthermore, we will also carry out and implement the evaluation and public relations work together  with our partners abroad, . The tasks of our foreign partners are essentially in the acquisition and provision of suitable companies, appropriate internships and accommodation facilities abroad.
Participants:
62 trainees from the fields of bakery, hotel / catering and travel, tourism and leisure and other commercial professions.
4 internal VET Trainers
Requirements and needs:
In particular, workers and trainees from the fields of hotel / catering and travel, tourism and leisure need increasingly foreign
language skills, intercultural skills and a particularly high degree of adaptability for their daily interaction with guests. This applies
equally to commercial staff in international companies. Both from the perspective of the companies that are active in international
markets, as well as for the professional perspective of the trainees, the need arises to acquire these skills.
Objectives:
Learners should use and deepen their professional knowledge during the stay abroad. Furthermore, they should increase their social
and international expertise. In a pre-agreed contract between the partners the working areas will be set; Eg. participants are used in
hotel trades in the "reception" and in commercial occupations in the "Shopping / Sales Export". After training, the learners become
more flexible by their increased mobility readiness, so that their career prospects will improve. In addition, participants will learn
more about the current and historical culture of the country.
Results:
An essential part is to demand and support and to raise awareness of a growing Europe. Significant results are improved language
skills of the participants, as well as the better cultural understanding of all involved with each other. Degradation of language and
cultural barriers in terms of the European idea will create higher common potentials in personal development or in the context of
business cooperation. Each participant will complete a 2-4 week stay  abroad and thereby improve personal and professional skills. These include the elimination of language barriers through improved language skills, a greater cultural understanding, an in-depth knowledge as well as an increase in personal self-consciousness. Overall, thereby the personal job situation for the trainee improves.
Additional results:
All participants will receive the Europass-Mobility; Reports of the participating students; Project report;
Publication of project results through information flyers, website "EuropAktiv" and events of 3K-AKTIV e.V.

Project management: 01/06/2017 to 31/05/2019

We, the Johann-Friedrich-von-Cotta-Schule in Stuttgart, Germany, are applying for Erasmus+ support of our exchange programme. This programme enables a number of our students to spend four weeks in England in order to attend a language course and to complete an intership in a company. Our students take part in the dual education system which combines on-the-job training in their chosen field in a company (usually three to four days a week) with taking classes at a vocational school where they receive a more theoretical background (one or two days a week). At the end of the second year of their three-year apprenticeship they get the opportunity to join our programme. The students are usually between 19 to 24 years of age. 

All of the students we send abroad are working in publishing companies, adverising agenies or in the marketing departments of their company. Typically they are working in small  to medium-sized companies which are not in the position to offer the students a work placement abroad. However, the students' field of employment is characterized by an increasing internationalization. We aim at preparing the students for the job market and at increasing their emloyability. This includes offering the chance to spend one part of their training abroad. We want to give them the opportunity to expand their knowledge, inrease their understanding of a different culture by spending time in a company as well as by interacting with their host families. Furthermore we want them to be able to make use of the language skills they have acquired in school. We believe that the students will not only personally benefit from going abroad but they will also gain employability skills through their internship in England. The students will certainly experience what is means to live in the European Union.

Having completed the programme the students will obtain the Europass Mobility as well as a language course certificate. These certify the intership, language skills and the additonal professional skills they have acquired during their stay abroad. All this is to improve the students' chances both on the national and international job market.

BBA Oldenburg, an initial vocational school for Occupational Therapy in Germany, is aiming to offer its students and lecturers inspiration through international experience and exchange in order to provide an up-to-date and high-quality training. Our school is interested in the further development of the profile of Occupational Therapy and implements current international findings and visions into the training.

The participants make important contacts cross border and participate in European networks.
They deal with different conditions people in other cultural and societal contexts live in. They recognize diversity as an important content point of a globalized world and modern, client-centred and context-based Occupational Therapy.
The participants develop important professional, personal and informal skills. They are in exchange with European professional colleagues and deal cross border with current professional and social issues. The participants recognize lifelong learning and mobility as a part of the professional life in the EU. They develop an appreciative, critical and open attitude and feel as EU citizens. The familiarity of European themes is increasing among the participants and in their personal environment.

To achieve these objectives, 11 participants will participate in mobility in other European countries within two years. Nine students in the first year of education complete a four-week work placement in a social or health care institution; two teachers of the BBA participate in the annual meeting of the "European Network of Occupational Therapy in Higher Education" (ENOTHE) in Croatia.

The experiences of the participants in the project are evaluated. The gained insights and competences are included in the following training and further placements.
European Mobility Network und TTASTE- Teachers and Trainers are sent to Europe

During the project, the "Berufsbildungswerk Neckargemünd" (BBWN) sends a total of 23 trainees abroad for internships or practical stays. They all have very specific special educational needs. At the BBW, young people are trained outside of a company, i.e. the practical part takes place in well-equipped training companies or on shop floors.  In these international internship programs, trainees gain valuable experiences at cooperation companies.
One of the most important objectives is the strengthening and acquisition of self-reliance and self-confidence. After finishing their training program, our trainees have to face the first job market and compete with people without handicaps. Showing mobility and intercultural competence and having gained experience abroad increases our trainees’ chances dramatically and helps compensating for disadvantages resulting from their handicaps. At the moment we are offering internships in Spain, England, Ireland, Estonia, France, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic, and Italy. The International Coordinator at our vocational school plans and organizes the entire internship. Typically, the trainees are accompanied by a teacher/trainer during the first days of their internship. Erasmus+ Mobility and the BBWN fund the program and bear all expenses, such as travel expenses, board and lodging and insurance.

Apart from the trainees, four trainers and teachers of the BBWN will visit our partners (VETPRO). These are facilities that offer vocational training for young people with special educational needs. Our goal is to learn from our partners, gain insights and deepen our collaboration, e.g. within Peer Review Projects or ECVET.  We are striving for a regular exchange of colleagues within VETPRO projects in order to promote the internationalization of our facility.
Nell-Breuning Schule Rottweil: Chancen nutzen - Kompetenzen erwerben

With the project “Nell-Breuning School Rottweil: Good prospects - acquire skills”, the school offers full-time students, trainees and teachers the possibility to stay for four weeks in Great Britain. The parties involved are the Nell-Breuning school Rottweil sending full-time students, trainees and teachers and Tellus Group, LAF and Twin Group as receiving organisations.

With the support of the Erasmus project the Nell-Breuning school aims for greater internationalisation as well as for an increase of quality in many sectors of school life. Therefore we offer the following activities:

Sending the apprentices for four weeks:
The apprentices are at the end of the first and/or second year within their three-year or two-year training course. The training focuses, on the one hand, on conveying specialist knowledge in the areas of business administration and economy, and the acquisition and/or consolidation of English as a business language on the other. The project aims at helping apprentices to improve their foreign language skills as well as their intercultural and professional competence, benefitting the companies with their labour.
Since the internationalisation of small and medium-sized enterprises will increase in the near future, the demands on employees will also increase.  A high command of English is in demand.

Two-week stay for students at a vocational college focusing on health care. The students leave the vocational college with the German higher education entrance qualifications. They can also attend the course to become an officially recognised assistant in healthcare.

A good command of English and intercultural skills are in high demand for a future working life. The aim is the use and immersion of the professional skills that were acquired at school as well as to get to know the working routine and the business operations in an English company. Furthermore is to mention that the pupils experience the English culture and the British way of life. In this context, the pupils can develop their oral and written skills.

Five oder nine-day stay for teachers:
The students' stay abroad and the lessons at Nell-Breuning need to be linked in a better way. Therefore some colleagues are sent who teach at the vocational college for healthcare as well as at vocational school.
New ideas and impulses are expected through the interaction with European colleagues. Approaches in teaching English as a foreign language and company visits help to develop new skills and gain experience. As a result the teachers are more motivated and the quality of the lessons increases. All in all there is a growth of the quality development at Nell-Breuning school.
  
We pursue the following objectives, in particular:
Promoting the internationalisation of vocational training in Baden-Wurttemberg
Making the stay abroad an integral part of the training
Increasing the attractiveness of teaching sending teachers abroad.
Increasing the attractiveness of the dual training system as well as the vocational college.
Promoting professional, intercultural, social and language skills (mobility, flexibility, independence, self-confidence, etc.)
Expanding the establishment of long-term contacts with foreign companies and suppliers.
EuropAktiv - KiEA Kompetenzerwerb im europäischen Ausland

Project management: 01/06/2017 to 31/05/2019

The present pool project "individual scholarships let's go! and lift" is a nationwide initiative to promote practical trainings abroad for apprentices of skilled trades as well as technical trainees in industry and trade who are taking part in a vocational education and training under the dual system. Its objectives are fixed against the background of a previously relatively low mobility of young people in the dual training system which currently stands at about 4 percent. Additionally, conventional measures of mobility for apprentices are usually carried out in groups and are too inflexible for interested individuals or do not match due to their technical, spatial or temporal orientation. However, this project provides promotion of individual practical trainings abroad, irrespective of time, country of destination and the occupation requiring formal training. But the project determines clearly the funding period which in each case is scheduled to last three weeks. This schedule is based on the experience that this period usually already allows young people to a positive experience mobility with sustainable effect and that on the other hand longer periods of absence of the apprentices is in most cases hardly accepted among their training companies. Moreover, the realisation of practical trainings abroad shall now also be possible for those youngster, who just finished their apprenticeship. The 3-week-training abroad has to be completed within the first 12 months after their successful final examination. The experience showed that some of the apprentices do not have the opportunity to do an intership during their vocational education under dual system due to timely and operational reasons. 

This project shall enable the mobility consultation services of the Chambers of Skilled Trades and the Chambers of Industry and Commerce to provide a funding offer to apprentices who are interested in individual scholarships. The mobility consultation services of the Chambers are acting as "regional support partners”. Concerning the hosting institutions the notifier turns to partners abroad that have been established in the course of individual scholarships for apprentices of the skilled trades awarded since 2007 in the pool project line “let’s go!”.

The procurement procedures start with the written application of the young person. This application already ensures the prompt provision of information to the training company and the vocational school by obtaining the respective letter of reference from them. The applicant’s formal and personal suitability for an individual training abroad will be tested in a selection and awareness section conducted by the notifier or the regional support partners (mobility coaches of the Chambers). In case of a positive evaluation the preparation of the internship abroad will be planned. As soon as a suitable hosting institution/company is found and a learning agreement regarding the stay has been reached, the applicant will be informed of the authorisation of the funding. During the internship abroad different measures of the sending and hosting institutions will ensure the support for the young person and the documentation will start. After returning home the documentation will be finished and the final evidences will be provided. A certificate will be issued attesting the stay and the individual scholarship is finalised.

The project "individual scholarships to let's go!" is expected to have the following results: The quantitative participation in individual scholarships of apprentices of the skilled trades and of technical trainees in industry and trade will increase. The individual internship abroad promotes the intercultural and language competences and supports the personal and professional development of the participating apprentices and trainees. The positive impact of the acquired competences will become clear in the domestic apprenticeship. At the same time it is expected that the restraining threshold of the participants for future long-term work in other European countries will be lower.
Regarding the quantitative need: The nationwide concept of the project is geared towards the whole group of apprentices of skilled trades and of technical trainees in industry and trade as well as towards young people recently aquired their certificat of vocational education in the mentioned two occupational groups. In view of the above, the notifier and its partner institutions see the need for the 100 scholarships applied for in this project in the two-year period starting 1st June 2017 till 31st May 2019.

The project "ARTITUDE", will last 24 months and is addressed to 100 students attending the III and IV grade at the I. I. S.S. "Pantini – Pudente in Vasto (CH), the  I.I.S. "Mattei” located in Vasto (CH), and the national Convitto “G.B.Vico” (Liceo Artistico e Classico) in Chieti.  The project meets the need to further qualify the human resources involved in the mobility. This will be achieved through a 1-month internship in host organisations  for students in the  field of management /enhancement/promotion of artistic and cultural heritage (museums, agencies of cultural promotion, cultural associations).  This is a developing sector in Europe and,  in spite of the crisis, it can offer new and qualified employment opportunities.
In fact, thanks to the work placements -in European cities (London, Plymouth, Cork, Amiens, Valencia and Derry) where artistic and cultural heritage are widely enhanced and where the sector is an important employment source-  it is intended to offer an “on the job" learning opportunity   in foreign companies and institutions , in order to integrate students’ school education by ensuring  improvement of their professional and entrepreneurial skills especially in relation to:  1)technical and professional abilities in the specific fields of cultural offer management, enhancement/promotion of artistic/cultural products/services, 2) abilities to find the way through an increasingly open market and  evaluate the opportunities arising from such growing openness; 3) abilities to meet the demanding requirements from users of cultural services/ products; 4) abilities to innovate, diversify and increase performances  of public and private organisations that manage the cultural offer. In order to have a successful project a partnership has been created. It involves regional and transnational organisations committed to the training and professional development of young human resources and to the quality improvement of cultural supply. In fact the partnership includes:institutions, employer associations, companies and non-profit partners that will work together to promote a quality cooperation and the enhancement of knowledges/skills of young people. In the preparation of the project, the European Quality Charter for mobility has been taken into account for the following issues: selection procedure, learning plans, individualisation, linguistic aspects, logistic support, certification of learning  outcomes.
It is foreseen that beneficiary students, on their return from the mobility, together with the national partners participating in the Consortium, prepare a Plan for management and improvement of one or more cultural/artistic  goods in the Abruzzo Region to be promoted at European level.  Beneficiaries will be concretely involved in the enhancement of a specific artistic/cultural proposal in order to harness the new gained competences so that companies  in the reference sector could consider proposals from the human resources of the schools  involved in the mobility. Thanks to ARTITUDE project, the Consortium aims also to lay the foundations for long term collaboration with the local and transnational partnership and to consolidate, in the long run, the connection between schools and business at European level.
Catering and Hospitality from Education to Future job

The objectives of the project C.H.E.F. were identified on the basis of specific analyses: 
1) Analysis of consumers demand: its evolution and characteristics
Nowadays, European consumers are much more sensitive to the quality of food they eat and attach greater value to food preparation and to the professionalism of hosts and waiting staff. They particularly appreciate information about the origin of offered product. 
2) Analysis of the job market in the touristic, wine and food and hospitality sectors
Unlike other professional sectors, which in the last five years have experienced the aftermaths of the difficult economic cycle, this sector is enjoying a growing trend. However, positions in the sector are not always filled by graduates of Hotel Management VET Schools – who graduate with the ambition of growing professionally – and are often filled by workers with disparate professional backgrounds. To the detriment of the quality of service, the sector as a whole takes up workers with different training backgrounds.
3) Analysis on the needs of the education system. 
Students and Trainees’ dropout rate remains too high. The professions of the sector are, in fact, very demanding and training in Italy – while schools constantly fight against school drop out  – is well focused on keeping it world renowned quality high. 
The combined analysis of the market, job and education system shows that consumers are increasingly sophisticated preferences. As a consequence, companies are looking for qualified workers, and schools have the responsibility to prepare professionals able to cope with market demands.
For these reasons, the Project aims to achieve four macro-objectives:
– Guarantee that all the participants acquire professional competencies on the job fully meeting the demands of Italian and foreign labour market
– Do more to prevent school and training drop out
– Enhance the distinctive characters of the Italian training to improve international placement
– Contribute to disseminating in Europe training practices with highest impact on hiring
The National Mobility Consortium is composed of 31 partner organisations, six of which are the institutes for hotel and catering services (Vet Schools), sending partners from Italy’s Lazio region. The project, coordinated by Italy, involves three other European countries that will host the mobility: Malta, Spain, UK. There are four hosting partners abroad: one in Malta, one in United Kingdom (Plymouth) and two in Spain (Madrid and Valencia). Thirty-five European partner organisations take part in the C.H.E.F. project. 
The project is sponsored by the Lazio Regional Education Office of the Italian Ministry of Education, Universities and Research. There also are other organisations which support the project to guarantee its dissemination within each partner country and, more organically, at a European level, too (European Association of Hotel and Tourism Schools; Asociación de Empresarios del Turismo de la Comunidad Valenciana; European Historic Thermal Towns Association; Federació Intercomarcal d’Hostaleria i Restauració; Heritage Malta; Solidus Italia; Rete di Imprese Turistiche ETL Terre di Tuscia; Rete DEURE).
The first cohort of the project will include 180 newly graduates, selected from the six participating Institutes for Hotel and Catering Services. The mobility period of three months abroad provide VET traineeships in companies of the sector (hotel and restaurants), especially selected to guarantee that on-the-job training activities fulfil the objectives identified in single units of learning outcomes. 
The goal of the professional training is to guarantee that new graduates acquire professional competencies in their three main programs (food and wine, waiting and selling services, touristic reception) and facilitate the successful transition from VET education to work.
PRoject for Internships in Management of Export

The project PR.I.M.E. is promoted by a National Mobility Consortium composed of 16 partner organisations: 
– five VET Schools from the Province of Barletta-Andria-Trani take part in the project as sending partners. The VET School I.I.S.S. Colasanto is both sending partner and applicant organisation, as well as the lead body of the National Mobility Consortium
– eleven intermediary organisations, among which: five companies (Lula Consulting, Future Centre, Megamark, Terme di Margherita di Savoia, Zingrillo), three local authorities (the Province of Barletta-Andria-Trani – which, a part from itself, also represents Andria and Barletta Job-Centers in the project – the Municipality of Andria and the Municipality of Trani), three umbrella organisations representing small and medium enterprises (Sistema Impresa BAT Foggia, CNA BAT, Confartigianato Barletta)
The hosting partners are Malta Vocational Centre in Malta and Tellus Group in United Kingdom (Plymouth). The transnational partnership is thus composed of a total amount of eighteen partner organisations from three countries (Italy, Malta and UK).
The beneficiaries of the professional path promoted by the project are one hundred recent graduates, selected in the five sending VET Schools. The project entails a three month mobility abroad. The project aims to reach two objectives: 
– promoting employment of newly graduates through a professional path, which may turn into a profession for life, that supplements the Learning Outcomes reached during the five years of VET School with updated competencies left out of school education (yet in continuity with it) and meeting the specific professional needs of the companies operating in export management  
– meeting the potential growth of the labour market and feeding it by making available qualified human resources
The accounting officer with export competencies – which represents the professional objective of the project – is responsible for preparing the balance sheets and ensuring accounting of economic and financial transactions, for drawing up the annual financial statements of the companies and dealing with negotiations and managing financial transactions.
The peculiar needs of the actual development of the Province of Barletta-Andria-Trani – structured in a solid handicraft and semi-industrial sector, which, in the last few years, has highly developed – require a combination of skills typically found in multiple professional profiles. In fact, every company of the Province needs basic accounting but the same companies are now developing towards foreign demand and require other skills as well. There is a new need of professional figures who can speak the language of foreign accounting and whose skills go beyond those of traditional accounting. Such professional figures could support from the inside companies who want to reach or expand in foreign markets. 
Due to the definite employment purpose of the project, the chosen sending partners are VET Schools whose education is consistent with the identified professional figure. To optimize the intersection between supply and demand of labour market, the professional training has been developed on the basis of: 
– the analysis of the labour market of the Province of Barletta-Andria-Trani and of its perspectives of opening-up to the Maltese and British markets
– the meeting of supply (professional qualifications needed by the sending VET Schools) and demand (professional roles necessary for national and foreign partner organisations)
– the analysis of the Regional Directory of Professional Qualifications
The transnational partnership aims at achieving three macro-objectives:
– equipping all participants with preparatory training before the mobility, that will allow them to fully absorb the skills they will acquire during the three months of VET learners traineeships in companies abroad
– facilitating the access to the European labour market for new graduates through experience, professional skills and competencies acquired during the long-term traineeships in foreign companies, which will provide an opportunity to build direct relationships with local employers
– guaranteeing the continuity of the PR.I.M.E. project making sure it has long lasting and sustainable benefits even after its completion, through: 1) a Dissemination Plan of the project’s outcomes that takes advantage of the opportunities offered by the broad national and international networks and its promotional channels; 2) the organization of a job event in which new graduates of the sending Schools can meet national and international companies, umbrella organizations representing small and medium enterprises, Job-Centers and local authorities.
Dual MOB - Dual Training through Mobility

Two of the main problems faced by VET systems in Europe are Early School Leaving (ESL) and the number of students failing to achieve key competences at the end of compulsory education.
VET system has played a main role in fighting these challenges over the years, however in order to continue to tackle early school leaving and equipping students with relevant skills required by the labour market, it is important to foster WBL practices.
Moving from these challenges and considering that the Italian Ministry of Labour and Social Policy launched the Dual System in Italy, the members of the consortium have decided to increase the opportunities for learning mobility during VET pathways that use WBL methodologies.

The goal of the project is to promote, within VET courses that adopt WBL methodologies,  learning mobility period abroad. Indeed, WBL and transnational mobility experiences are important to (re)motivate VET learners (preventing early school leaving) and to provide them with the competences required by the companies. 

Therefore the DUAL MOB project will give students the chance to develop technical competences and soft skills 
through WBL mobility experiences abroad. These experiences will be carried out during VET qualification path and with the final aim of assessing and validating the learning outcomes acquired during the mobility so as to facilitate future inclusion of the young participants in the labor market or to continue their studies.
The project will involve 300 students (1/3 suffering from economic/social/cultural disadvantage) enrolled in VET courses in one of the 150 VET Centres run by the Consortium Members in 18 Italian Regions. 

The project has a wide sectorial and geographical coverage. The sectors in which the students will have the chance to take their internship are the following:
- Agribusiness (Backery and Pastry; Agriculture)
- Arts and Crafts (Fashion, Wood)
- Mechanic and Construction (Mechanics, Masonry, Electric, Electronic, Thermo-hydraulic)
- Graphics
- Administrative, Selling
- Tourism and Catering
- Personal Service (Beauty and Hairdressing)

Furthermore, the partnership will involve 16 partners from 6 different countries (ES, IE, UK, FR, DE, FI). Such a wide partnership will result in fruitful experience for the students, suitable to any professional path. 

The DUAL MOB project promotes 2 different types of Transnational Mobility: 1) 3-4 weeks internships in a company abroad, carried out by students attending an Initial VET course; 2) 3-4 weeks in a VET centre abroad, with periods spent in company or other context, carried out by students attending an Initial VET course. 

The Learning Outcomes will be valorized and recognized through the ECVET system. In fact, the Consortium Members will take advantage of the experience and the ECVET tools developed during the GORES project. 
The project will have an impact on the development of professional and transversal skills of VET students and staff involved (accompanying persons), as well as on the offer of VET  training provision which will be possible thanks to the improvement in the use of the WBL approach and by strengthening the mutual trust among project partners.

This project will also lay the groundwork for enrichment in terms of organizational and teaching methods that the sending organisations may exploit during the pilot project related to the Dual System in Italy.

#FutureReady
Nøtterøy Upper Secondary School has since 2007 held various projects in internationalisation for students in both vocational and general studies. The school acknowledges that in order to solve our shared European challenges, we need to start with bringing change to our local communities. Our focus as a school is on our students to be “preparing for the future, and learning for life”. We take our social assignment seriously and see that internationalisation is an important tool to achieve goals in the county regional plan for the entire course of schooling. There are demands for a holistic schooling with emphasis on quality and relevant training, including establishing arenas for interaction and learning.
Our school has a long-term commitment to strengthening students' understanding of, and expertise in, how to live in a multicultural society built on democratic values and human rights. The importance of internationalisation is well understood by the school management, as well as in the county administration, and our head of department takes an active part throughout the process.
In the Department of Health- and childcare, Krakow was chosen for our student mobilities in order to meet community needs for expertise in migration pedagogy. In Vestfold county the inward labour migration from Poland is significant, and students will meet Poles in their future careers in the Health- and childcare sector.
There is an average of 140 students attending Health- and childcare programmes every year. Student mobility is offered students at year 2 at the Childcare and youth worker programme, the Health worker programme, and to students belonging to our special Health- and childcare programme, where the students become qualified for higher education in addition to receiving vocational training.
The students will be in practice for two weeks either in the privately owned nursery Bright Child, or at Ognisko, public day centres for mentally retarded adults.
At work, the students will take part in the normal day to day activities, but also be expected to initiate and lead planned activities on their own. Students will participate in reflection groups each afternoon and blog about their experiences throughout their stay, as well as complete an interdisciplinary project assignment. While in the host country each student will be sharing a small flat with another student, and together they will be responsible for grocery shopping and cooking, keeping the flat tidy and clean, laundry, being on time for work as well as keeping other appointments.
There will be two teachers present during the entire practice period, and they will be in close contact with the nursery and day centres, in addition to having professional guidance sessions with the students. The teachers will provide support for students both individually and in groups, and make sure they get to sample some of the local culture.
The aim of the international practice is to ready the students for linguistic and cultural challenges in a multicultural society, through first-hand experience of what it is like to work and live in a foreign country. Their reflections underway provide learning for life, and ensure quality of training.
We believe that this will make our pupils and teachers more tolerant regarding other cultures and respect for other norms and values. An experience that can be shared with collegues and other pupils at our school. Increased multicultural understanding will have a positive effect on the  environment at our school. Another competence aim that will be covered is increased knowledge of languages. They will also develop communication- and cooperation skills and increase their social competence. Our school also focus on the cooperation between our two vocational lines of studies and emphasize relevant goals in these two lines of studies.
On the one hand, a long time goal for sending student mobilites to Krakow, is to encourage professional and personal growth, as well as resilience, independence, responsibility and tolerance for each student. On the other hand, we would like students to gain valuable multicultural expertise preparing them for their future careers.

As a school we see internationalisation projects as a way to increase student motivation and thereby up the number of students completing secondary school. IWe wish to promote our as a school offering Healthcare, Childhood and Youth Development as lines of studies. In the longer term we also wish to recruit well qualified and motivated applicants that are suited to work in an open and multicultural Europe.

Finally, the local community expect schools to provide up to date and relevant training for our young people, including multicultural understanding and competence, important to their future careers.

The project is focused on the initial professional training of the third-grade students of the secondary health medical school majoring in nursing and the second and third-grade students of the medical college– branches Diploma general nurse, Diploma pharmaceutical assistant,  Diploma dental technologist and Diploma nutrition therapist. Within the project, two or three-week specialized practical trainings in Great Britain, Spain, Ireland and Slovakia  will be implemented. 43 students from our school will participate during the project period.
The main goal of the project is to extend and innovate professional training at our school through such experience abroad. By
putting the project into practise, students should be able to compare health care system in Great Britain, Spain,  Ireland and Slovakia with the Czech one.
No less substantial aim is the support of foreign language qualification, possibility to check the ability to communicate in a foreign
language and broadening the vocabulary in the field of professional medical English and Spanish. Thanks to the multicultural enviroment, students will also gain knowledge in the sphere of cultural and mental differences of foreign citizens and the development of their personal qualities (like independence, responsibility, tolerance) will also be supported.
Professional experience is the part of educational programmes of the above mentioned branches. ECVET is implemented at this project.  Professional educational stays abroad are to be planned for the very same period when the other students will take part in such working experience in the Czech Republic. After successful finishing of the practical training, students will be given a Europass Mobility and the training will be acknowledged as part of the compulsory practical training.
The output of the project will be a specialist courses for students from the other grades focused on the comparison of experiences
gained in the work places in foreign coutries and in the Czech Republic, or, more precisely, oddities and differences in health care. The mobility participants will present their conclusions and outputs from the project in form of presentations accompanied by photodocumentation. Results of and knowledge gained during the educational stay will also be presented in our school’s magazine, website and in the local press.
Vertiefung der Fremdsprachenkenntnisse und Sammeln von Berufserfahrungen im Rahmen eines Praktikums

Students of BHAK Korneuburg (Secondary College for Business Administration in Korneuburg) receive a sound business education and acquire the ability to communicate, present and negotiate in two foreign languages in business contexts and everyday situations. English and Italian or French are the foreign languages taught at this school. To complement their intensive vocational training students have to complete a compulsory work placement during their school holidays. 
At BHAK Korneuburg the TOP LEAGUE programme has been created to provide additional professional training and incentives for the personal development of top-performing students.
We would like 17 students of the TOP LEAGUE programme to participate in this ERASMUS+ project within the next 2 years.
The objectives of the ERASMUS+ project are to improve students’ knowledge of foreign languages and their intercultural skills. Participation in this project should enhance professional mobility, flexibility and the ability to manage life in a foreign country and business environment. 
The participants are to complete a four-week work placement in relevant foreign companies or organisations in Great Britain, Ireland, France or Italy. 
While the personal development of our students is our top priority, participation in this ERASMUS+ project is also bound to have a positive effect on school development and will enable and promote cooperation with international companies and international school partnerships, which constitute a main goal for BHAK Korneuburg.

Secondary Nursing School and Tertiary Vocational Nursing School in Liberec has prepared a two-year project of international learning mobilities for its students. The mobilities will be realised in United Kingdom and Germany and organised by organising agencies Tellus College a WAD Bildungsakademie GmbH. Both agencies have rich available contacts to nursing facilities and social care facilities and they will negotiate training places for our participants.
There will be 6 two-week learning mobilities realised within the project, 4 in United Kingdom, 2 in Germany. Altogether there will be 56 students and 6 accompanying persons participating in these stays. Learning mobilities will require active usage of foreign language and independence when practising everyday nursing tasks. Participants will have opportunity to gain insight into ways of caring and rules for nursing abroad.
We will implement the project in line with ECVET and we expect its contribution to realisation of our school goals in the field of enhancing the quality of our teaching.
With regard to increasing demands on professional competencies and mainly on language skills we expect not only extension of students´ practical professional skills but also improvement in their language abilities and cultural awareness due to their participation in the project. Such an international experience enhances their employability in our cross-border region where foreign clients are hospitalised quite often.
"ALPEN TRIFFT MEER" - Vertiefung der Fremdsprachenkompetenz und Verbesserung der Beschäftigungsfähigkeit der SchülerInnen der Tourismusschule Salzkammergut Bad Ischl

The project "The Alps meet the sea" consists of a one-month stay in different European countries where the students of the Tourism College Bad Ischl do a practical work placement in various sectors of the tourism industry in the partner companies. The main aim of the project is to improve on the one side their foreign language skills and the employability in the European market on the other. Moreover, the students should also get an insight into the different working methods as well as gastronomic particularities of the European countries. Networking on a personal and professional level should improve the mobility of the young people in order to increase their chances in the European labour market.
Students are well prepared (two foreign languages - common and job-related) and they also receive professional training for the hotel and catering trade. During their stay the partner companies and the mentors of internship will look after the young people. Finally, this project should strengthen the European sense of community.

The project  " Logistic without borders" is based on a strategic target of our school which is to reinforce and support the tech-professional preparation,creativity and trade activities of students. The orientation of the school and the set of subjects to be taught (directional management of transport and logistic activities) predicts that our graduates will be engaged with international commercial transactions. Logistics and transport require international cooperation and  in some substantial ratio are based on it. This project brings to our school another step for intl.cooperation and friendship (we launched it by previous project of worktraining in Hungary) which we would like to extend toward other countries in a way as to allow our students to see and understand intl.comparisons. As a partner for coaction we have chosen a company Tellus College, which works on the UK market and they will help develop our students work opportunities and experience within respective suitable domains within the programme „Work based learning“.
2 groups of 3rd and 4th grade students studying „Transport and logistics“  plus „Logistic  and  financial services“ would participate in the program. We would like to show the students new possibilities which their profession offers within the EU. We shall motivate them and further their education while raising  their qualification. The selection of students will be arranged by our teachers (able to assess their specific knowledge and competencies, incl.language and personal premises). The project will form a healthy competition in the school, inspire an interest among the students in their specialized branches and also help their specific/personal character progress. Work-training abroad will also develop a competitiveness of our students on job market within the CR and other EU countries. 
The project shall implement units of learning ECVET. Worktrainings will be orientated on work in dept.of logistics (activities connected with manual and informational flow of reserves either in written/electronic communication or execution of operations linked with purchase and sale and the use of modern PC  techniques). The result of the work training, in relation to a learning plan, is going to advance specific proficiencies and competencies. Our students will acquire all of them during their work in a foreign company.  Achieved proficiencies of our students will be acknowledged/accounted for within the subject Special training, after their return back to the CR.  The ECVET units were created for this project in cooperation with the foreign partner Tellus in such way to use them afterwards on the national level–within work trainings in local companies. By applying ECVET the foreign partner will perceive the professional profile of a student equally to other students from the EU. During the preparation of this we have planned: the project schedule, organization, project management, accountability of involved partners, implementation of ECVET units, monitoring, evaluation & dissemination of the project.
The task of the school management is to advertise the project and increase the knowledge of possibilities of cooperation in Europe.
Activities for the dissemination and exploitation of results are planned from the beginning, as a part of the project and after its end to include activities aimed at ensuring the visibility, accessibility & applicability. The results of the project (work experience, gained and confirmed skills and competencies of JVU, European cooperation) will be spread by all participants. Students will disseminate the results and experience informally among their classmates, teachers, parents and friends in person, through social networks.
The school will present a summary of this project and its experience to the professional public at the meeting of Association of Professional Schools ICT, postal, banking and logistics, a group for transport, logistics and mail as well as social partners. Another important point is sharing the experience with the implementation of European tools through professional training. This  work experience abroad will be motivating for new students and make our program more attractive for students. By acceptance of ECVET, both the foreign partner and the school or other training organizations would have access to a professional qualification profile and would be ready to participate in all activities associated with Erasmus +.
The main aim of the project is to develop job competencies and partnerships between vocational secondary education and the labor market in the EU, increasing the qualifications of our students with the use of units of learning outcomes ECVET and harmonization with the European Qualifications Framework (level 4) and last but not least student´s personal developments. Choosing the experienced foreign partner and its experience with tools in mobility, shall guarantee fulfillment of our goals.
"Explore, Experience and Learn by Working Abroad “

The project was implemented under long-term needs of the school and  defined during several preparatory project meetings where school management discussed everything with the project manager and teachers of economy and engineering branches.  The most important points were agreed and made into project objectives on which we will focus.   
   Creating this project was based on need to deal with problems created by decreased number of our students caused by population decline. At the same time we want to react to demanding requirements of the labour market where high demand for our graduates speaks clearly in our favour. With this project we want to improve linguistic and practical knowledge of our pupils who will be able to develop professionally, therefore able to find work more easily. Moreover we want to react to their high demand for activities abroad. Unlike grammar schools and business academies our students are usually from socially lower classes and some of them have never been abroad. Our school is also attended  by Immigrants from Ukraine, Romania and Asia.

We approached to the project comprehensively and it will address the issue of improving the quality of education.
Our involvement in this project within ERASMUS+ is regarded as an important element for improvement of teaching as such. The main objective of the project is to increase students’ employability in short supply professions on the labour market not only in regional areas of the CR but also in the international European space. The current motivation of students for further study is also very important for their future profession as well as for development of their foreign language skills. The contribution to quality of education is also expected since students of engineering branch will work with technologies that our school does not provide and gain knowledge of fulfilling tasks given in English language. Studens of economy branch will improve their skills in working with
special economic PC programs, activities connected with setting up a company and its ensuring,  creating and using a bank account.
The expected benefit is also in the shift of teachers‘ thinking in European context together with introduction of ECVET. 
Other benefits for students themselves:
- Obtaining the document Europass Mobility (for better employability at labour market)
- Including of gained results (credits) of education within principles of ECVET without having to be re-examinated
- Increase of readiness for A- levels 
- Improvement of professional shaping up and improving of employability orientation in their branches
- Familiarity with the culture and social environment of GB, its differences and particularities via their staying in host families and participation in afternoon activities prepared by TELLUS
We are planning to send 24 students (12 of engineering branch, 12 of entrepreneurs assistant branch) of second and third year.  All planned activities are based on the same principle, they have the same objective and they will meet the same needs of the participants. They differ only in their professional focus of education branches.  They have a possibility to find their inner motivation to study foreign languages and be employable in other countries in the future.
After approval of the project a general contract (Memorandum of understanding) will be worked out and will be valid for the whole period of project time.
The general contract will be signed by all three subjects (a student, sending and welcoming organisation) before sending students to a specific mobility so called Learning Agreement.
The organizations will proceed together when fulfilling necessary steps for gaining documents for students within Europass – Mobility.
For the assessment of learning outcomes in ECVET, activity units of learning outcomes will be developed for each activity unit where acquired results of learning will be assessed and recorded by welcoming school. 
The skills and knowledge gained from well-prepared internships will be of a great significance in its contribution to the improvement of teaching students. The use of European instruments or certificates in turn increases the quality of work, not only teachers involved but also educational organizations, too. These are, of course, also the goals of this project.

Due to their mobilities, all participants will develop and improve their language and communicative competences, experience new, innovative teaching methods and broaden their horizons in terms of multicultural relations, education towards European unity and the process of globalization.
International mobilities are irreplaceable  in respect of acquiring practical experience. Participation in this project will definitely help us to improve the quality of teaching and motivation of both students and teachers.
