Achieving European professional competences through practical training in Eu companies by assuring immediate  educ.  success and rising the level of graduating with good results in the exams in order to offer perspectives for a career and professional insertion; 2. Orientation of the graduates to new jobs of current labour market through knowing how to work in Eu companies and identifying needs in terms of professional skills required by employers; 3. Developing skills to use new IT technologies in the workplace, language skills-English, cultural and social skills making them fit for the EU labor market.
 The project has 2 Actions:  1. Practical training stage in companies for students and 2.”Job shadowing" - the observation and exchange of teaching experiences for teachers. With 4 streams as follows: GT1 =6 teachers VET specialists in the fields covered by the project, GT2 = 14students –Tourism GT3 =8students -Textile industry., GT4 =8 students - Banqueting org. Total : 6 teachers and 21 students.
 Activities-A1-Signing contracts with training institutions and companies; A2-selection for those interested for GT; A3 Preparation students -20 cls. pedagogical training , 30cls of English , 10 cls.- cultural training ;Teachers: ped. training= 0cls., English training =10 cls., cult. training=10 cls. A4- Mobilities for IP training for students in companies- working with 6 hours / day for companies and VET institutions, workshops, working sessions with young hosts from  training institutions , cultural visits and programes in host families . A-Mobility- teachers -Job-shadowing, observation, exchange of experiences and good didactical experiences” - visits in VET institutions, assisting  VET classes, workshops, seminars, caravan questions / answers, focus group ,etc.  A5-Monitoring—permanent made by 1 monitor of the beneficiary, 1 Monitor of the host institution, one of the IP company collaborating for the good  going of the activities and  preventing any  risks.A6-Active Evaluation and validation by: ECVET Certificates, APT, Europass. A7-Dissemination: permanent by various means and methods to ensure a positive feedback, permanent and long term benefic for the educ., institution, community.
Results forStudents:  Ensuring school success immediately with good results at exams and on the long term -increasing socio-professional insertion of graduates by: -achieving new VET professional skills, language skills in English in IT Technologies, cultural and social skills. 
Results forTeachers: - Training European teachers- capable of ensuring European and international gateway of the education in the region. - Achieving:  competences, new didactical abilities in VET- UE, language, digital and cultural abilities
Impact forStudents:  will acquire professional competences relevant for their job wanted in specializations required by the current labor market ; for Teachers: achieving Eu competences in education and profess. VET, training in modern methods and strategies

Young professionals in a vocational school are in a context of identity research influenced by new technologies, the practice of social networks, their family and social environment. They often choose their training by default, sometimes after having experienced a chaotic schooling.It is an audience with few financial and cultural opportunities.

Thus, the project main objectives are to give them the possibility to get some positive experience outside the traditional educational framework. 

They will develop new skills (such as autonomy, foreign languages, cultural awareness), new notions (sharing, living together, having some job experience) and knowledge about different cultural, social  and business environment. These target skills are part of their training but  we hope that this foreign experience will add benefit to their Professional diploma as they must do their training period in tertiary companies - Commerce, Sales Management and Administration - according to their Btec diploma option as specified in the French professional curriculum.

Moreover,  living in a foreign country will encourage foreign language learning as students will have to communicate, express themselves and be understood. This one-month training period abroad will allow them to overcome their fears about foreign language learning and be fully involved in their work experience. Being involved in a « real life » consistent project, students will develop"here and now" skills and will be more motivated by academic  learning outcomes as they will change focus and give sense to their learning. by doing so they will widen their skill scope - knowledge and attitudes - for a « somewhere else, later » experience.

We believe that these first cultural experiences abroad will encourage further exchanges across borders, whether in a professional environment (jobs, internships, training courses) or at  university (Erasmus work placement in Higher Education).

These objectives are defined and implemented by our European Department, based on our prior experience with European projects. Everything has been carefully planned and scheduled for students’ mobilities :from our partners(companies,accommodation) who have agreed to collaborate  to the organizational aspects of the mobility (transportation, logistics and general organization). At least one reference teacher will be with them to help and supervise visits,  training period assessments, health monitoring, and moral support as most learners are under age. Thus, the student-teacher relationship is changed, allowing a new relationship between the X and Z generations so as to close the gap and provide better understanding between these two generations. 

 Two cities were chosen for the mobilities for several reasons : Bristol (direct flight from Toulouse, Airbus subsidiary, city size ...) and Valencia (its economic and cultural wealth, a city as big as Toulouse, less famous and less known than Madrid  or Barcelona in our region). These mobilities will be divided into two specific periods with 6 students in each city (28 days in June 2017 and January 2019).

Our school is located in the South of France and teachers are mostly Generation X, but they are still in a dynamic educational approach of their job : always  curious and willing to  discover new pedagogical tools in order to be able to make knowledge accessible to students and motivate them. Anxious to be as close as possible  to the  school European identity, 8 colleagues have obtained certification - DNL- to teach their subject in a foreign language. These certifications allow a broader offer in terms of curriculum in our high school. Consequently, these 14- day mobilities will  allow  them to practice and improve their skills, including foreign language ones. Each teacher is responsible for his/her own mobility organization with regards to his /her personal and professional goals and wishes. They must define their objectives and target needs beforehand. A  good practice committee  has also been created so that teachers will  be able to share their mobility outcomes and experience with the educational community and encourage new colleagues to go abroad. When they return, teachers must produce tools, documents, detailed reports on their mobility objectives and outcomes so as to share their results. Dissemination is a key step to strengthen and consolidate the European identity and citizenship in our school, a core target of our school educational project. 

This aspect has been enriched over the years thanks to teachers and students’ mobilities.
In the long term, these mobilities represent a real vector of social integration for our students, help break down stereotypes and strengthen our sense of European belonging for all. We want to defend the values ​​and missions of Europe in a spirit of freedom and tolerance.
Europe et emploi : un enjeu pour l'avenir

The school group les Deux Rives is situated in Landerneau in Brittany. It is a private school working in association with the state. It consists of a comprehensive school, a general and technological high school as well as a vocational high school and post baccalaureate centre with initial and sandwich courses.
Our objective is to enable students and teachers fromour vocational school to go on palcements in companies in Spain, Italy, UK and Portugal.

The aim of the school group is for students doing a vocational baccalaureate to get an opportunity to do a thirty two days training period in companies in Spain, Portugal,Italy and UK.
These training periods are adapted to the students' profiles. Thanks to them, students increase their chance to get a job as a technician and become more autonomous.
Students are aged 17-20 years old and are from the following fields :
- Vocational baccalaureate in trade for future sales assistants.
- Vocational baccalaureate in electricity to become electricians
- Vocational baccalaureate in painting to become house-painters and decorators 
- Vocational baccalaureate in maintenance.
- Vocational baccalaureate in masonry and structural work.
- Vocational baccalaureate in joinery.

Students are selected via a meeting and interview process. The final decision is up to the school-board.
Before the training period, preliminary activities are made during individual personalized time:
- A language course in OLS (Online Linguistic Support), for Portugueses students traditional courses.
- A language course in the target language.
- A language course for vocational lexical needs.
- An informative and cultural course.
- Detailed logistical information about the journey.

We are going to adopt an ECVET approach for a better recognition of the experiences of learning of our students.

Before this period, we have assist to information meetings to understand the approach before using it. With our partners, we are going to define in terms of experience of learning, the objectives of the mobility, to discuss the evaluation of these experiences, their validation and their gratitude.
An agreement will be signed between the shops, companies and the high school.
During the mobility practice, students must be prepared to activities of training that respect the objectives of learning and will estimate them on documents Europass mobility and the assessment grid certificative.
On the way back, we shall validate the experiences obtained by the student and we shall recognize the credits, language skills and knowledge of the culture of the country obtained abroad.
This note goes in account into the notation of the diploma under the name of optional subject of mobility.

The management of the project is confided to the coordinator of the European projects of the high school chelped by the executive committee and the teams of professors.

We are waiting for the support and for the professionalism of our Spanish, Italian, English and Portuguese partners who help us in their respective country in search of companies and of accommodation as well as in the tutelage of our students during their stay.


The targeted results for each student after the training period are as follow: 
- Getting European certificates.
- A better chance to get a job.
- An enhancement of professional, cultural, personal and language skills.
- An enhancement of involved teachers' training.
Long term results are:
- Getting more and more students interested in future European projects.
- Getting more and more partner-companies involved in the Erasmus + program to welcome more foreign trainees.
- A better publicity for our vocational high school.
- A better cooperation between our high school and the world of work.
- A better cohesion between participating foreign high schools and the development of new projects (a three-month exchange for year-eleven students with our Spanish partners).
In a nutshell, this project has a local, regional and international impact on a professional, educational, social, cultural and language-learning level.

Nowadays, Education must answer  the needs of a fragile and booming economy.
It allows young people to confront the fact that other skills are needed in the professional arena.
Internship are a guarantee for a processional integration and are part of the training of the candidates for a vocational diploma.
Work experience, being in genuine professional situations, strengthens the students’ knowledge and reinforces their projects.
The experiences gained during the internship, will be transferred to other professional situations of the same kind .
Our particular objectives would be, that our young pupils consult with the business managers who had succeeded in their professional career, which would in turn increase their desire to study and solidify their own project.
Competitiveness can be created around this type of project.
Work experience is immersion. Being in another environment is a major asset for these young people because, it will allow them to use the knowledge and the skills learnt at High School. It will also reinforce their motivations to go on with their studies ,and will create new perspectives for their professional life .
Furthermore , mentioning work experience on their CV ,is a positive element and a point in their favour. 
The jobs our young people are destined to do are changing, hence the great importance of such a project.
This internship , in the framework of Erasmus is meant for 75 pupils(boys and girls), most of them are under 18 years old , going to a vocational school, and majoring in different fields . 
In order to facilitate their social and professional integration, they will be accompanied by teachers and an assistant teacher for the pupil with special needs. 

This experiment aims to allow these young people to
- forget their inhibitions and feel at ease as far as speaking a  foreign language is concerned
-improve their skills in a language aspiring to the B2 level in accordance with the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages
-Have a better knowledge of the specific vocabulary of the specialized fields 
-Increase motivation for the jobs linked to the school subjects they have  been studying.
- Create incentives to discover and travel around the world, to Europe in particular .
-Get sufficient autonomy to plan and view the future with confidence and to go on studying in Martinique and elsewhere.
-Enable each student to fulfill their potential so that they may become connected citizens in the up to date world and to be ready to conquer it.
-The success of this project will make it possible for this initiative to be promulgated within our academy .

A previous collaborative work within the schools helped developing a shared mobility preparation plan in order to maximize quality and outcomes, for all beneficiaries; all will be prepared before their mobility and their experience, assessment will come in a portfolio: Europass CV, Europass mobility and Europro for the students; European section students will add the oral exam and the mobility unit to validate their curriculum and experience.

A pilot and referent in each school of the Cluster manage logistics and organisation for this project; all have a strong knowledge and experience of mobility project insuring the good working of the project and comply with the bill of specifications/
yearly calendar, procedures guide for each group of mobility, evaluation and certification tools, project follow -up, dissemination plan allow an efficient management, information flow among all stakeholders;
host partners in the different countries have and will cooperate in this project

Praktyki w Anglii, Niemczech i Portugalii szansą lepszego startu zawodowego.

The project is a continuation and is complementary to the assumptions of the mobility project being currently done in the Erasmus+ programme, and just completed  mobility project in Leonardo da Vinci programme. The project participants will be 68 students from  technical   school of ZS No. 2 in Sanok, studying to become  telecommunications technican, mechanic technician, automotive technician, environmental protection technician and a car mechanic and 9 teachers of vocational education. The students will take an apprenticeship in workplaces and companies corresponding to their field of study in The UK,  Portugal and Germany. We want  all  all the professions to participate in the project  but without specifying the limit of the students from the given class- it will be verified during the recruitment process. Students of the Vocaional School will be given priority during recruitment for 2-week d AutoCad course, we assume that they will be about 50% of the group.
There are scheduled four groups of students' going abroa d. In order not to disorganize the work of school,  the students will take part in the mobility in September / October 2018 -when the apprenticeships for all third-grade technical school is planned.Those eligible to participate in the project will participate in  the mobility, while other students will practice in the country.   In September 2018 -12 students- mechanic technicians and automotive technicians- will go on a 4-week- training to the UK and 16 pupils- telecommunications technicians and environmental protection technicians will leave for 4-week vocational training in companies in Portugal.  
  For the same reason, an internship in Dresden has been planned in two editions during the winter holidays in 2018 and 2019.  The programs have been developed in close connection with the guidelines of apprenticeship programs based on the curriculum of particular professions, but are to be implemented on the basis of modern facilities and equipment, and focus on learning new technologies and to develop skills particularly desired by the local labor market. During each round of the internship students will be accompanied by vocational teachers (depending on the group size): one (United Kingdom) or two (other mobility) .
There also will be nvolved 2 vocational teachers in job-shadowing in our partner school in Weilheim.
Before leaving for training students and teachers receive support in the form of the inguistic, cultural and pedagogical preparation 
-530 hours in the project.
 The project is a response to a problem which occurred in our school: poor recruitment to school, poor school performance, and consequently poor performance in professionaland Matura examinations. As a result, fewer students continue their education after secondary school, and not even all of them take the exams. After examining the problem we tried  to solve it on many levels, but in-depth analysis in the form of interviews and surveys showed that the primary cause of failure is lack of motivation for learning, lack of faith in students' own abilities and lack of prospects for the future. An additional problem is a nationwide trend, which is  the popularity of general education over vocational training among junior high school students.  Last we noticed the severity of attitudes expressing lack of tolerance for other cultures and religions (in connection with plans to accept immigrants in our city). 
To change this situation, we have developed a project which main goal is to increase students' motivation to develop knowledge and improve skills, gain new skills, improve language skills- mostly English , increase the mobility of participants, increase their chances on European and national labor market, increase self-esteem, increse intercultural competences, improve the quality and attractiveness of vocational education in the school and in the region, prevent early school leaving and reduce failure in education.  the teachers will  develop their skills in the diagnosis of pupils' needs and learn more attractive teaching meathods. The cooperation will contribute to the exchange of best practices, gaining experience through practical activities and ability to cooperate at the international level.  
The most important results of the project will include obtaining Europass Mobility certificate , obtaining ECVET points, acquiring new skills, improving language skills and filling in the European Language Passport, increasing the mobility of participants, increasing students' chances on European and national labor market, increasing self-esteem and motivation to learn, which will help to reduce the number of early school leavers, learn intercultural competences among students and teachers, improve the quality and attractiveness of vocational education in the school and in the region, as well as the preparation to the strategic partnership in the future.

The two year EURO+STEPHENSON Project involves 20 apprentices who are currently taking on BAC Professionnel (Vocational A-levels), BTS (Higher National Diploma) in Commerce, Tourism or Hospitality or MCAR (BTEC level 3 – Front Office Operations). They are expected to pass their exam in June 2017 or in June 2018. They still need to consolidate their language and professional skills to take on further studies in better conditions. They will then satisfy the pre-requisites of HND and Bachelor’s degree. This includes organizational, language and analytical skills, as well as hard skills). This will also enable them to sign a work contract.

During this ten month long project – including a six month work placement either in the UK, Spain or Germany  – apprentices will be given a vocational training status. During the following year they will have the opportunity to enroll in a superior course (from Vocational A-levels to either BTEC level 3 – Front Office Operations or Higher National Diploma; or from Higher National Diploma to Bachelor’s degree). They will be tutored for two months before they leave and two other months after their return home. Before the six month training period, a two month long preparation will be held with cross-cultural, social, cultural and language courses on an e-learning platform, and an initial assessment will be undertaken before departure. An administrative follow-up guide is also on the agenda.
Following the apprentices’ return, a second period of preparation will be held for the apprentices. They are expected to fill out the MOBILITY EUROPASS, write out a professional report and give an oral presentation in two languages. A language assessment will then be scheduled.

Placements aim at reinforcing language, professional and personal skills to give apprentices more self-confidence. They also make them aware of training and work market internationalization. 

Placements will indeed value skills that they have gained during their course and will allow them to open themselves to another culture, with improved language skills. This will therefore have an impact on their career path and widen their cultural and language knowledge of another European country through the acquisition of new professional skills.

A six month long mobility is an additional asset for apprentices, giving them the opportunity to gain real hands on experience. A placement in a European company will bring added value to the beneficiaries’ background and show up on their resume, whether it be to take on further studies or to be hired. These placements will certainly have a positive impact on their career path through personal development, autonomy, self-confidence and cross-cultural adaptability to different work situations in their future professional life.

In regards to CFA Stephenson, international mobility will have a positive impact on training quality, teaching practices, employability, local, regional and international influence (partnerships, collaboration on teaching techniques, ECVET criteria, incoming and outgoing mobilities, hosting of foreign apprentices and students), etc.

Assessments and certifications of language and professional skills through the EUROPASS and the validation of a work report on a dual training programme will contribute to the next level of qualification of apprentices who previously went through a difficult context.

A first period of tutoring before departure was designed to get participants prepared to the following activities: 
- cross-cultural communication
- language preparation (OLS platform and CFA tutoring)
- administrative tasks
job hunting and identification of potential accommodation

A second period of tutoring on return will be dedicated to the following: 
- filling out of the EUROPASS MOBILITY
- preparation and finalisation of a report (40 pages, 1/3 of which in the language of the hosting country), together with a related oral presentation
ADVANTAGES: 
- better employability on the European/worldwide work market
- development of international projects and training sessions
- implementation of ECVET
- quality and innovation in teaching procedures.
Practicieni de succes, angajați de top!

The project "Successful Practitioners, Top Employees" addresses the needs of "Alexandru Domsa" Technical School as they were identified by the management team in the SWOT analysis and stated in the School’s Action Plan. Improving insertion in the labor market, developing specific work skills for students according to their qualification, developing effective management skills, improving teaching skills of VET teachers, creating an open attitude among students and teachers towards European values are issues that can be resolved by reaching the objectives of this project. The general objective aims quality improvement by improving skills for 10 VET staff (teachers and managers), by application of theory into practice, through the development of management skills of the staff involved in the strategic development of the organization, and increase competences for 42 pupils during the activities which will be carried out in mobilities within European organizations. There are also specific objectives: to develop specialized competences as well as specific work place abilities and skills; to increase the insertion rate on the labour market by offering better trained graduates and thus generating higher satisfaction from businesses; to improve VET teacher’s  skills in order to address their individual needs and stimulate their creativity; to improve the quality of management; to develop language social, civic skills and digital competences; to raise cultural awareness and boost cultural expression of participants.
The following training activities are planned: 
A1Mobilities for VET students: 1flow to IPODOMI (14 students), 2 flows at Tellus Education Group (28 students); the participating students will develop specialized skills certified by Europass Mobility and Certificates of Professional Competence.
A2 Mobility for teachers (10 teachers), one flow at Tellus Education Group; 4 VET teachers will acquire teaching skills to stimulate students' creativity, 6 members of the management team will develop practical skills for efficient and modern management.
The participating students and teachers will be selected according to procedures established by the project team. Clear responsibilities will be given to each member of the project team through an internal decision. The team will ensure the management of the project, covering all sections:  preparation and deployment of mobilities (logistics, cultural, linguistic, risk assessment), communication with partners and direct beneficiaries to ensure quality internships, foreseen impact and expected benefits ; monitoring, control, evaluation covering all aspects of project implementation (carrying out selection tests, deployment of the training program, goals and  achievement indicators as planned, delivery of results / certificates); dissemination will target high visibility of  the project activities and mobilities; transfer of best practice will be achieved not only in the workplace but also in the attitude of every participant in community life. Project management will be the done according to plans, in the key points of the project (special consideration on flows), and using specific instruments as planned. The budget will be managed by the project team; exceptional costs were provided for to 8 students with fewer opportunities. 
The project will help increase the visibility and prestige of our school in the community because it offers the opportunity of developing practical skills required by the labor market and projects a clearer and safer educational path. It also develops international cooperation in vocational training as well as it increases the number of partnerships with education and training organizations in Europe. This way our school opens the path of European partnership in VET education, the students will benefit from the mobilities in terms of professional training and cultural experience. The staff will have the opportunity to exchange best practices on content strategies and training methods, management skills.  The improvement of management strategies for internationalization has become an indicator of organizational capacity, for quality improvement of education and training. By adapting the training programms to the needs of the labour market and the enhancement of the quality of training the project will have an important impact on several levels. 
The improvement of the recognition and validation processes for acquired skills as well as a more modern, more dynamic, and more professional employee  will  contribute with important added value to the school and community. The development of the participants' skills in marketing education is also an important issue with long term benefits.
Dezvoltare instituţională prin integrarea de modele europene

The purpose of the project ”Institutional development by integrating European models” is:
- Developing the professional abilities of 45 participants (35 minors specialized in Tourism and Catering and 10 teachers – Technologial field) over a period of 2 years time, according to up- to -date norms and regulations, in order to:
o adapt the teaching system to the changes that occurred in the national and international socio-economic climat (teachers)
o adapt and get an easier insertion on the labour market (students)
The objectives of the project are:
1. The development of linguistic and professional abilities of the 35 participating students in order to ensure them a better insertion on the labour market
2. The development of professional abilities of 10 teachers in order to adapt the teaching methods centered on students to the needs of the labour market
3. Institutional development by integrating European models
4. Strenghtening international partnerships in order to develop profesional training/ internship at European standards for students and teachers

The training needs are:
- updating the teaching practices, especially specific evaluation and teaching methods on practical training by direct observation of other teaching systems (the implementation of which could be extremely helpful in their teaching endevour)
-(for students) developing professional abilities in accordance with their specialization by direct experience and workpractice; thus, the problem identified at school level was the insufficient material basis of the field Tourism and Catering (due to legal procedures and birocracy); a direct effect of this situation was the fact that students may accomplish their internship at economic agents that fail to provide a training workplace directly linked to the student specialization

The impact is boud to be a positive one as the beneficiary of 
• teacher’s training will be:
 -themselves as they are going to  experience a boost in their their selfesteem and they are going to be able to design lessons directly linked to the needs of the students, that are going to help students acquire the necessary abilities in accordance with their specialization
-all the students of the school due to the adaptation of curricula and workmethods in class (the impact is going to be felt on more than 900 people)
- the other teachers of the school that are going to take part in the workshops and dissemination activities (more than 200 people) 
- the institution, whose prestige will increase by the fact that more students are going to choose to apply in order to study at this college

• the students’ training will be
-themselves as they are going to integrate in a specific workenvironment and they are going to appply the abilities acquired during the internship
- students’ peers, as a follow up of the discussion on the conditions, thematic and experience gained during the internship as well as on the practical lesson they’ve witnessed (more then 20 students/class)
- the local community and the employers (more than 15) as they are going to be able to rely on better skilled workforce
- the institution as its’s going to be able to provide the society with workfoce trained at European standards

The duration of the project is 2 years, three flows in the first year (june, july, august, 2018) and two flows in the second year (june, july 2019).

Diputación de Pontevedra has established active employment and entrepreneurship as cornerstone policies for the achievement of its development overall strategy, through the dissemination of programmes for labour insertion. Even so, there is young people with no motivation for employment, victims of years full of negative employment situations, and therefore, with difficulty for access to labour market, low-skilled in a second language, ICT competences and priorities around basic issues such as education, housing, employment and health. Furthermore, we find companies demanding prepared young people, as a consequence of the competitiveness misbalance within the European common market that cannot satisfy companies' needs, feeding the EU skills gap.

In order to overcome such skills gap of the province, with a strong rural character, the Diputación has formed a Consortium, with 33 schools of FP in Pontevedra, which will offer 102 young graduates in a cycle of VET of Middle Degree of One of these centres, the possibility of carrying out work practices, for 6 months, in a European company. Participants must return from their mobility within 12 months after obtaining their degree. The international practices will not be part of the FCT but will add value to the practices previously carried out in companies in the province.

The participants will also carry out a formative linguistic activity through the online tool "OLS", made available for the Programme, for the following languages: English, Italian and Dutch. In the case of participants traveling to Finland, they will take an intensive course of Finnish, in a destination of 2 weeks duration.

The project also includes mobility of 20 teachers who have shown their interest in observing practices in an EU country. Staff mobility will last 5 days for teachers traveling to Ireland, Italy, Germany and Malta, and 10 days for teachers going to Finland. The practices will consist of visiting training centres similar to the integrated centres of vocational training in Galicia, in order to learn new didactic methods used in the country of destination.

The 33 entities that are part of the Consortium are:

- IES Pedro Floriani
- CEIFP A Xunqueira
- Center of Agroforestal Education and Experimentation of Lourizán
- Divino Maestro Training Center in Vigo
- Association EFA A Cancela
- IES A Guía
- IES Frei Martín Sarmiento
- IES Chan Do Monte
- IES Chapela
- IES Laxeiro
- IES Marco de Camballón
- IES Pintor Colmeiro
- IES Ramón Cabanillas
- IES Ramón Mª Aller Ulloa
- IES Ricardo Mella
- IES Salvaterra de Miño
- IES Tomiño
- IES Vilalonga (Sanxenxo)
- Galician Institute of Education in Aquaculture (IGAFA)
- IES Luis Seoane
- IES Montecelo
- CPR San Miguel
- IES Politécnico de Vigo
- IES A Xunqueira I
- IES Plurilingüe Terra de Turonio
- Instituto Politécnico Marítimo Pesqueiro do Atlántico in Vigo
- Colegio Vigo
- IES Johan Carballeira
- IES Rodeira
- CPR DANIEL CASTELAO
- CIFR A Granxa
- IES Ribeira de Louro
- CAPD Atlántico

The countries of destination and distribution of scholarships will be organized as follows: United Kingdom (23), Ireland (18), Italy (18), Malta (8), Portugal (8), Finland (4) and Netherlands (13). With regard to teachers, scholarships will be distributed as follows: Finland (5), Malta (5), Germany (5), Italy (5) and Ireland (5). 5 supervisors of Diputación de Pontevedra will complemente the mobility scheme of the project.

Therefore, PRACTICUM DEPO 2017 has set out the following specific targets in order to achieve the overall goal:

- Facilitate the acquisition of professional experience at international levels.
- Increase innovative knowledge and entrepreneurship in the participants.
- Encourage the practice and improvement of a second language and the obtaining of technical vocabulary of the professional sector of the participants.
- Facilitate the transition from the educational system to the labour market of the participants.
- Promote synergies between the educational and labour worlds
- Develop skills and knowledge that improve their skills and abilities in front of any job, project or situation.
- Implement the concept of European citizenship and become aware of the importance of international mobility to create free and respectful generations with other cultures or societies

It is expected that with PRACTICUM DEPO 2017, young people and teachers will consolidate new technical knowledge in key competences of their specialty, gain greater autonomy and a series of transversal competences that will benefit them in their future work and personal. And, last but not least, to add that PRACTICUM DEPO 2017 will generate more qualified, integral and, therefore, confident of its possibilities, favouring the insertion of labour and contribute to the promotion and sustainability of the Erasmus + programme.
MOOVE - mobilité, orientation, ouverture, valorisation et expérience

Because of globalisation, it is more and more pivotal for youths in vocational training to enjoy work training abroad: it often significantly affects their future employability. Through this project Culture et Liberté along with its partners organisations of the national mobility consortium aims to answer this crucial need and to add European mobility to said training in order to ensure a blended learning experience.
The project’s audience includes two different types of trainees: apprentices aiming at a Bac Pro in the sector of Electrical Engineering, building and printing industry  for whom we are setting up a professional internship abroad lasting 14 days (excluding travel days); teaching and training staff who wish to increase their skills within the context of partnering professional schools abroad for 5 days (excluding travel days) in order to get acquainted with their field of expertise in a foreign context . 
To complete our project, we rely on our experience in the field of French-German exchanges aimed at youths either in vocational training or integrating the work-force; on our expertise with the former Leonardo da Vinci programme, and on the tools developed with various partners within the framework of a project aiming at transferring innovation, the results of which are summed up in a database named INTAKT. This database, which enables the transfer of information between the project’s partners, is also a tool which both helps to define the purposes of the training and to self-evaluate the participants.

Regarding the impact and the expected results, we aim at:
a) For trainees in vocational training, to increase their day-to-day self-reliance and their awareness of the importance of a good command of foreign languages, and to improve their commitment to successfully complete their professional training.
b) For teaching and training staff, to improve their understanding of new forms of learning, practices, methods, organisation and management techniques since these will affect their teaching experience.

The potential long-term benefits involve an intellectual and professional opening on the part of participants on an intercultural and European level. Culture et Liberté hopes thus to position itself as a relevant actor in the coordination and setting up of European mobility programmes aimed at youths in professional training in Paris and its region.

The main aim of the Practices Consortium coordinated by Fundació BCN Formació Professional is to improve the competitiveness and employability of recent graduates of initial vocational training of the vocational schools of Barcelona across a period of practices in different European countries. The project also aims to generate a positive impact increasing and diversifying the professional experience of Initial VET graduates. Al same time the project aims to foster the European identity of the youngster to improve the professional mobility. Also, the project pretends to enforce the skills and knowledge of the thachers that are developing dual system. 

The present consortium focuses his activity in mobility for graduates in individual vocational training but wants to maximize the participation of more schools and VET students in the next future. Both, Fundación BCN Formación Profesional wants to continuous being the reference institution of Barcelona in relation with the coordination and execution of European education programs. 

With the project development, the consortium pretends that a total among of 20 graduates in initial vocational training acquire more professional experience related with the finished studies and, at same time, that this background helps them increasing their employability and strengthening they entry into the labor market. The project will allow that the youngsters develop 2 months of practices in different companies. At same time, the projects pretends that Barcelona has VET professionals with more and more diverse knowledge around their professional field across Job Shadowing stages in reference countries of their professional field.

“From apprenticeship to professionalism” is the title of the project whose aim is to enable students to succeed in the professional field and, at the same time, significantly increase the level of teaching in our school. Participation in the project will create a real chance for the students to gain knowledge, skills and professional qualifications, which will increase their employment prospects in both national and European job markets and will enhance their personal development. The project will increase students’ intercultural awareness, understanding of other cultures and countries and it will enhance the feeling of citizenship and European identity.
 
The main participants of the project will be 80 students from 5 classes who, in the school year 2017/2018, will have their obligatory apprenticeship. Other beneficiaries will be the whole school and the local community.
 
32 students from the ICT class will go for two weeks of work training in Great Britain. Their apprenticeship will take place in Plymouth at the Centre of Vocational Training Tellus Education Group. The apprentices will carry out tasks connected with designing and making local computer networks and managing ICT networks. Additionally, they will learn the basics of robotics and design Internet sites.
 
In cooperation with the organisation euroMind, two-week apprenticeships in Spain will be organised for the students of the other professions taught in our school. A group of 16 students of Surveying will have their apprenticeship under the supervision of a surveyor from the company Iniciativas el Condado. As part of their professional training, the students will carry out measurements in the field, perform calculations using the AutoCAD program and create maps. They will learn the specifics of work in a Survey company and in a technical office of the town hall in Sevilla.
 
A group of 16 students of electronics will gain their professional experience in Sevilla constructing drones, and a group of 16 students-technicians of renewable energy systems will work on the installation of a solar house. Additionally, the electronics students will visit a company producing drones, while the other group will visit the largest solar power plant in Europe. Participation in the project will enable our students to gain a lot of new competences, which are impossible to get at school. It will give them the chance to compare European industry solutions with ones used in Poland and verify their theoretical knowledge in a practical aspect. They will develop their language competences, improve their communication skills and their knowledge of professional vocabulary. Living with host families or in hostels, often with course participants from different countries, will help the students gain a better understanding of other cultures, openness and tolerance. The experiences of the apprentices and the teachers supervising them will have a positive influence on the whole school. The materials created by them (presentations, training diaries, an Internet site, maps, fanpage) will be used in the process of education and will influence the curriculum. Evaluation and assessment of the students’ achievements gained during the apprenticeship will be done using the system ECVET.
Each of the participants will receive a Europass Mobility document.
 
The recruitment of the participants will be done according to fair and clear rules. The students will be provided with international transport, insurance, accommodation, full board, and the mentoring of teachers from ZSEiO and the employees of the host organisations. Before starting their apprenticeship, the students will receive organisational support that will make their stay abroad easier. During English classes they will boost their professional vocabulary. They will receive basic information about the culture, traditions, customs and the economy of the country they are going to. They will be familiarised with the rules of the apprenticeship, the programme and the regulations of the training, their rights and duties, health and safety rules during the journey and for the stay abroad as well as with the cultural differences. The basic language of communication will be English.
 
At the end of the project a conference will be organised with the representatives of the local authorities of education, local companies and employers. The students – the participants of the international training, will present the project results, which will be followed by a discussion giving the employers an opportunity to express their opinions about the project and the needs of the local and national job markets.
 
The project will bring many benefits for the students, teachers, the whole school and the local community. For the participants, it will open doors to a professional career and, for the school, it will provide the opportunity for better and more effective teaching.

Centre d'Estudis Sant Francesc aims at better internationalizing its students. Currently CESF is offering Intermediate Vocational Programmes for Commerce (Retail), Carers, Auxiliary Nursing Assistants and Computer Technicians. Also, for those students who could not finish the compulsory secondary education a course in the field of Computing is offered. 


What the school needs is the following: 1) students need more foreign language skills (especially English) and some type of added value (internships abroad) in order to increase their employability, 2) students need to learn to live in a globalized world, 3) students' employability needs boosting by adding a traineeship abroad to their CV and therefore making students more interesting candidates for candidates and better Higher VET students if they choose this type of studies in the future, 4) emphasising work-based learning in order to create programmes which could be adapted further to both national and international business needs.

Activities:

A1) for students, 2 flows to UK, and 2 to Italy and Ireland, respectively, in different periods (March/April and June) are proposed for traineeships in companies. It is strongly recommended for students in the Health and Social Services and Carers to do their traineeship in Ireland and Italy. In total 16 students will be travelling to do their internships abroad in groups of 4


To carry out the project, we wilk talk to students who are likely to take part in it to make them aware of the importance of these traineeship periods. The selection process is meant to be very objective and, once selected, participants will be monitored by the sending institution as well as by the intermediary and the receiving organization. At the end of the project, students' results  will be analyzed from the point of view of employability and language learning. 

CESF is aiming at increasing the number of well-prepared students in the VET sector who can afterwards enrol in any course in the field of Higher Vocational Training, and actually enhance their employability.

ESTANCIAS INTERNACIONALES PARA ALUMNADO Y PROFESORADO SEFED

Inform Foundation manages since 1987 the SEFED Programme (Simulation for Business Educational Purposes - The Practice Firm concept) which offers training to around 7.000 students delivered by 800 teachers in vocational training institutions and training for the unemployed in Spain. All these students are being trained in professional and social skills in the business and managing of companies field.

This professional and practical training aimed at finding jobs is well know and acknowledged by the Ministry of Labour issuing a professional certificate with level 1 or 2 by the corresponding Ministry of Education issuing a medium level of vocational training in the administration or comercial field.

Inform has always considered working experiences abroad as part of and an added value to the training delivered in the SEFED Programme. Thus, Erasmus + K1 Programme allows us to support our students and teachers in training activities to achieve and use knowledge, skills and qualifications for their personal development, ocupability and participation in the European labour market. 

The participants of this project are:

- Unemployed students or VET students (mainly young people and women over 25 years old) who are being trained in the SEFED Programme and who would like to improve not only their knowledge and skills in the business field, undertaking working experience stays in Ireland or Great Britain, but their language skills as well. Thus, the project is about to undertake 100 working stays in Irish, Italian, Lithuanian or UK companies and undertake business and management tasks during 4, 5, 8 or 12 weeks as a maximum as participants cannot have longer stays because of personal reasons and the need they have to look for jobs. We include accompanying teachers to help and support students in the firts days of their mobility, so most of them are under 18 and/or they have not any labour experience.

- Teachers and professional staff working for the SEFED Programme: the project allows us to offer a unique opportunity for 40 teachers and professional staff working for the SEFED Programme to be able to share and improve their knwoledge and experiences in a different country and in different organizations, including the transfer of skills and/or methods and innovative ways of doing things in the training field. The transfer of know-how is meant to improve the quality and access to continuous training, to update and adapt the european educational and training systems. When improving knowledge, attitudes and individual skills from all professional staff involved in the SEFED Programme, we will improve in the development of the european labour market and social economy.
The project is based on professional stays in 6 countries, 4 of them already have practice firm networks and are members of Europen-Pen International, from which Inform Foundation is a founding member. Specifically, the professional/pedagogical team will undertake training stays for 5 days in different training organizations which have practice firms in Belgium, Finland, France and Lithuania in which teachers and professional staff will share experiences and best practices regarding the practice firm concept, the organization and management of practice firms as active learning tools.
There will also be some stays in Ireland and UK in which there will be a combination of know-how transfer, innovative learning ways of doing things and application of IT in training. There will also be visits to Irish and English companies so as to undertake job-shadowing.
The participants will be teachers in language skills, foreign trade skills and counselors and training professional staff. There will also be professional staff from Inform Foundation with the aim to set up links with the Central Offices for Practice Firms from the 2 members of Europen-Pen International (Belgium, Finland, France and Lithuania).

The project is meant to improve the quality of the SEFED Programme, the ocupability and competitivity of students and professional staff in training participating in the project.

To prove the success there has been some success indicators set up as the level of labour ocupability of students, the improvement degree of language skills, or the increase of foreign trade orders.

Eurojoven Castilla y Leon is a project born of the need to join forces on the part of the public body competent in matters of youth in the region and the educational centers of different provinces. Both agents want to offer an answer to increase the employability of their young people as well as to improve the level of English. 60 young people with VET diplomas in different professional fields carry out a 90-day mobility to a company in another country: United Kingdom, Ireland, Czech Republic or Poland. In the company he/she follow a itinerary of learning with the support of the companies and the contact from the consortium. 22 VET educational centers in all provinces of Castilla y Leon are part of the national consortium promoted by Instituto de la Juventud de Castilla y Leon. The beneficiaries are young people between the ages of 18 and 25 who have recently graduated in a VET. Their level of English is between A2 and B1. It is a matter of facilitating this step between their educational pathway and professional life, acquiring with this experience a greater autonomy, security, learning techniques, English, values of tolerance, respect, identity and cultural diversity. The project pursues objectives such as the following:
- To facilitate the young people of Castilla y Leon an experience outside their comfort zone to develop their comepetences, abilities and attitudes related to autonomy.
- To create a learning space in a safe working environment related to the training field in which the participant is entitled. To promote knowledge of methods and work styles in other countries.
- To enhancement the employability of 60 young people in Castilla y Leon, adding to the CV of the young people and the participants a remarkable work experience, as well as the establishment of contacts within the companies in which they practice.
- To guide the graduates in the region in the design of a training and work plan that allows them to meet their expectations according to their competencies.
- To promote the use of the Europass CV and the system of recognition of credits and qualifications not only through studies, also experiences such as certification of Europass mobility.
- To provide a response to people with difficulties in continuing their studies in insertion in the labor market for fewer opportunities (for this application 16 people with this profile have been submitted).
- To offer a learning beyond the contemplated in the classroom, in the line of the educational plans of the formative cycle.
- To increase the attractiveness of the centers of the region as well as their institutions, their recognition in the effort to respond to the demands of young people.
- To improve the level of foreign languages, mainly English, beneficiaries and the national institutions partners of the project.
- To learn more about the European labor market, which is constantly changing.
- To put into practice the flexibility and adaptability of public centers and organizations in their decision-making and implementation. To facilitate collaborative work and remove administrative barriers.
- To strengthen the cooperation between different organizations with the same user profile: the young person recently graduated in VET in Castilla y Leon and thus respond with more quality and use of resources to their needs.
- To improve the image of the educational system and the measures in place in Spain on youth issues.
- To bring institutions closer to young people and vice versa.
The results of the project focus on the profile of youth and project partners at local, regional and national level, as the improvement of situations that concern all levels related to youth: youth unemployment. At local level, with the return of the majority of the participants and their placement in companies where knowledge and acquired skills are turned over, a medium-term increase in quality of work is noted. Unemployment levels fell in the region and, therefore, at national level.

Eurojoven Castilla y Leon is a project born of the need to join forces on the part of the public body competent in matters of youth in the region and the educational centers of different provinces. Both agents want to offer an answer to increase the employability of their young people as well as to improve the level of English. 60 young people with VET diplomas in different professional fields carry out a 90-day mobility to a company in another country: United Kingdom, Ireland, Czech Republic or Poland. In the company he/she follow a itinerary of learning with the support of the companies and the contact from the consortium. 22 VET educational centers in all provinces of Castilla y Leon are part of the national consortium promoted by Instituto de la Juventud de Castilla y Leon. The beneficiaries are young people between the ages of 18 and 25 who have recently graduated in a VET. Their level of English is between A2 and B1. It is a matter of facilitating this step between their educational pathway and professional life, acquiring with this experience a greater autonomy, security, learning techniques, English, values of tolerance, respect, identity and cultural diversity. This project primarily involves the disadvantageous yet successful graduated or graduated to be who are coming from poor backgrounds, broken families and who don’t have oppurtunity to see the implementations in European countries. The mobile programming are widely began to be used in Turkey and our project aims to show the students the point Europe has reached in using and integrating these mobile programming and automation systems. It also aims both to enable them with an education required by the sector and to provide them by the work experience through a vocational training in the host country. By rapidly changing and developing technology necessity of controlling the systems regardless to time and place is rapidly increasing. 
Every each day this leads to a need in developing more mobile software and gap of a staff member is also increasing day by day. In order to fulfill the gap it is aimed not only to provide the newly graduated with skills and knowledge required by the sector but also to raise them as qualified midman preferable by the business world. Moreover it is aimed to provide these young people with working experience and highly improved skills  and it is also aimed to catch up with mobility updating.  Turkey's share today from the global mobile applications is under %1. In 2017 It is estimated that global mobile application market will reach to 100 billion dollars. The each %1 share We will gain from the market will provide us with 1 billion dollars. Apart of that the BT expenditures  are expected to reach15 billion dollars in 2017. At this point developing the national programming infrastructure and using the national software in various implementations will lead to a great amount of acquisitions.  
Our project will contribute to raise the skilled labour in mobile programming and this will lead to a contribution on  education which will increase employment. The experience acquired by this project will be used in setting the understanding of quality of education in European dimension.  These trainings will encourage the young to produce new ideas and realize these ideas. And these will contribute to improve their skills in taking  responsibility, entrepreneurship and producing. Our project not only encourages the young to be able to built new partnership and communication networks but also encourages them to make researches and making new projects. Thanks to this it encourages to build a dynamic entrepreneurship.
Our project will involve 24 Golcuk MTAL ICT-Electric and Electronic graduates or graduated tobe who applies the selection criteria.
• With this project having  disseminated international ICT certification We aim to raise the skilled labour that our country and sector demands. Consequently We also aim to contribute to education which will increase the employment in our region. 
• To make a contribution in raising manpower in global standarts 
• To contribute in meeting BT expenditures with national sources
• To make a contribution in developing our national programming infrastructure
• We aim to apply the need of the sector to the education 
This project is prepared with the consciousness that ICT will lead our country to a rich and modern country.
Animasyonun Teknoloji ile Eğitime Sihirli Dokunuşu

Every country continues its existence thanks to the citizens living in it. The quality of these citizens directly determines the quality of the country. Besides, education is the most important way for people to display virtuous and knowledgeable attitude. The more importance the society gives in education and the better it’s been applied, the higher the educational level of the citizens who are living in that country will be.

By the development of technology day by day, it is a fact that it has been part of all over our lives recently.Technological developments are important innovations that facilitate and accelerate life.The place and importance of changing and developing technology in education system according to needs is also accepted. As a result of these needs, interactive whiteboards were installed, tablets were distributed to teachers and students within the scope of the Ministry of National Education’s FATIH Project. The Directorate General of Innovation and Education Technologies also established a platform called Education Information Network (EBA).

With the "Young Entrepreneurs of the Future of Mobile Software" which we have implemented in our school in 2015, our teachers and students have been majored in the field of mobile software. Due to this project and after receiving "Animation with Action Script 3.0 Training” which our students of Information Technology department will study abroad, we aim to prepare mobile-compatible interactive educational materials that can be used in EBA platform and students' tablets and cell phones.At the end of the project, the materials prepared by our teachers and students will be uploaded to the EBA platform and offered to students for free with approval from the Ministry of National Education. With this project, students will have more professional skills, increase their foreign language level and enhance entrepreneurial skills.At the end of this project, students are aimed to have the fund of knowledge and experience that Software companies need in mobile programming. This project supports the FATIH Project goals.

“The Magic Touch of Animation on Education By Using Technology” Project has the aim of transferring the vocational education system and different study methods in European Union member countries to our beneficiaries.One of our main objectives is to contribute to the achievement of the Ministry of National Education's FATIH project. Compliance with the Erasmus + programtargets,promoting European cooperation, Europeanism and developing quality awareness areprioritytargets.Effective development of foreign language (English), assessment of job opportunitiesin foreign countries, on the job training the learning methods realized with the help of  Information Communication Technologies(ICT)are other aims of this project.

The project will consist of 28 11th and 12th grade students residing in Sultanbeyli, İzmit and Zuhal Dörtçelik Şenipek of Information Technologies departments of Vocational and Technical Anatolian High Schools in İstanbul, Kocaeli and Bursa 
The international mobility of the project will take place between April and July, 2018in four different countries for 20 days each. ENGLAND mobility will be take place in Tellus, an institution operating in Plymouth. ITALY mobility will be take place in Tellus Italy, an institution operating in Torino. SPAIN mobilities will be hosted by the Oneco and Europroyectos  institutions. The host institution in GERMANY is Iuventas.
