c) educational staff working in classes of education for refugees and migrants

All 45 students will be in their second year of training at the time of the mobility and realize a 3-weeks work placement in a company abroad in the field of metalwork and mechanical engineering, chemistry or security services. (FIN, UK, NO, TR, NL).
The teacher is team leader for classes of education for refugees and migrants. She will teach in the target language Dutch at a VET school in Rotterdam and get an insight into the transfer of the target group from vocational training into the labour market and into referring concepts of the involved institutions.

The main sustainable objectives of this project are 

A. for the institution Berufskolleg West and its network

• consolidation of its internationalization strategy thereby enhancing its competitiveness as a vocational college in the region
• encouraging the learning and working within a European network of companies and educational institutions and those in the labour market in order to strengthen the region as a business location and enhancing its competitiveness 
• effecting quality objectives in vocational training by implementing mobilities and its outcomes into curricula, school organization, quality management and in-company training
• quality development of work placements abroad with regard to the quality commitment in learning agreements and ECVET transparency instruments.

B. for educational staff
• development educational personnel’s competencies with regard to their teaching objectives and functions within the vocational college
• enhancing project management skills for team leading functions

C. for apprentices and students 
• sustainable development of social and personal skills or our students including flexibility, communications skills, team spirit and tolerance through vocational work experience within a different cultural context
• sustainable development of students’ technical skills by taking into consideration both the level of training and individual requirements and hereby increasing their opportunities on the labour market
• development the students’ language skills, primarily the knowledge of English as lingua franca.

The main sustainable objectives of this project are to continue previous work and to encourage the learning and working within a European context and by collaborating with companies and educational institutions within the region, i.e. consolidation of the internationalisation strategy of the Berufskolleg West and collaboration with training companies and the Chamber of Commerce and their complete integration into the implementation of mobilities also with regard to the quality commitment in learning agreements and ECVET transparency instruments.

The process will be performed in accordance with the new ‘quality frame and guidelines for vocational colleges for the implementation of learning mobilities and practical training abroad’, published by the Ministery of Education in North Rhine-Westphalia (MSW).
The objective of the Berufskolleg West is the certification of vocational colleges in accordance with the Circular of the MSW for ‘International co-operation in European Vocational Training’ from 03.04.2017 – 311–1.25.05. Both documents can be downloaded from www.berufsbildung.nrw.de/cms/bildungsganguebergreifende-themen/idb/.
 
In the long run WPA V contributes to the institutions’ reputation and impact within the region plus the students’ competitiveness on the European labour market.
Europa hautnah - Auslandsaufenthalt für Auszubildende der Stadtverwaltung Ravensburg

The educational concept created by the city of Ravensburg "Future 2020 - training at the city council " provides that trainees can provide some of their practical training abroad to undergo further training abroad. The aim is to promote their own mobility and in addition to the recovery of its own professionals to promote the personal development of trainees . Hence, in addition to the improvement of international action skills and foreign language skills are intensified. Also the independence and personal flexibility should be encouraged.

Knowledge of foreign languages need now not only our budding event managers and merchants for tourism and leisure, but in particular the public administration clerks and skilled employees for office communication.

The exchange promotes international relations and broadens the view of our trainees . Ultimately, this increases the overall quality of education. Likewise, acquire the budding professionals intercultural skills , which are in the increasing number of citizens with a migration background an important qualification .

The four-week posting to Plymouth (England ) is to be with 6 apprentices who complete dual vocational training and are in the second year of training , conducted in July/August 2018 and 2019. 

After a one-week intensive language course a three-week practical placement is on the programme. Accommodation is in host families and it is offered a cultural programme. In the host country , the stay is implemented by our partner organization Tellus Group Ltd. They have years of experience with the implementation of mobility experiences and we work together very well since 2011.

The course of the Tellus Group refreshes the existing English skills and deepens it . Participants can also receive voice and internship certificates that represent an advantage for further personal and professional life.

If projects in the United Kingdom can not be approved anymore we will look for a full-service-partner in Ireland to undertake the mobility.

By staying with host families and the daily contact with colleagues in the placement operation, the theme of our project is automatically lived " Europe first hand ." The trainees will be assigned to each separate host families to allow no "hiding" behind other trainees. Mostly, the students share their room with an intern from another country , so that in a very tangible intercultural consideration can and must be practiced. About teaching and work in the placement companies , the participants come together with students from other countries . This promotes our goal to encourage our students to overcome barriers and overcome prejudices .

We as promoters promise us an increasing attractiveness as a training company in the increasingly competitive market for suitable trainees. The city of Ravensburg takes as a public employer a pioneering position , thus gaining additional training company as attractive. We also recruit the majority of our administrative staff from our trainees. Empirical evidence from the private sector and from already -made experience from assignments in the years 2011-2015 show that trainees work after a stay abroad more independently, more flexible and are more motivated . Trainees see life of another country from a different perspective by getting there insight into the working world. In addition, the trainee has the opportunity to acquire country-specific skills as well as to meet operational processes and techniques they use in the city of Ravensburg and able to contribute . Accordingly, the acquired knowledge, experience and skills can be used directly for the city administration and its service quality to good .

Justification of the project
- Internationalisation is a central component of our organizational culture and therefore embedded in our Understanding of Quality, i.e. SQV.
- We maintain numerous international partnerships in the course of our internationalisation strategy.
- Our training organizations operate worldwide and expect us to prepare the trainees to work in an international environment and gain international experiences.
- Digitalisation has global reach and therefore teachers, administration secretaries and school management need new qualifications and competences. 

Aim of the project
Berufsschule Lichtenfels (vocational college) wants its students to succeed in the job market of the future. An essential part is the improvement of English language skills, especially in their field of work. Additionally, advancing digitalisation requires latest knowledge in the field of IT and new media.
Working in British companies offers the students to get an insight into the way organisations operate and the challenges they face. They can apply their language skills in at work and in everyday situations. They can develop a sensibility for cultural differences, increase their self-esteem and discover new challenges.
Up to now, we have been offering our students a 3-weeks exchange programme with our Czech partner school. The project duration is too long for our students and their training companies. We did not find enough participants. We want to increase the amount of participants with this Erasmus-Plus project significantly.

Number and profile of the participants
Out target group are 20 apprentices of age in the field of ‘Industrial Management Assistant’ and ‘Management Assistant for Tourism and Leisure’ in their second year of apprenticeship. We want to offer them a 2-week mobility in Great Britain.

Specification of the activities and realisation
The apprentices do a 2-week work placement in a British company in the same sector to develop their professional, medial, cultural and linguistic competences. At their first day at Tellus College they are getting an introduction into labour law and security regulations. They are getting information about their company and the characteristics of the host country. 

Results and long-term benefit
The participants improve their English language skills significantly. They expand their vocabulary in professional and everyday situations. They can communicate in an English-speaking environment and take part in social life. The work in the internship companies helps to develop their expertise and media competence. Their stay in Great Britain offers the possibility to develop their intercultural competence and discover the differences between German and British lifestyle and world of work. Their personal development benefits from a rising autonomy that leads to problem-solving competences and motivation. The participation in this project will provide excellent opportunities on the job market.
Mit Auslandserfahrung punkten - man lernt mehr als man denkt

The project ‚Get ahead with un internship abroad—you learn more than you think’ builds on the previous projects carried out by the Nürnberger Fremdprachenschule, a college which trains students to qualify as state certified multilingual office assistants. The objective of all our projects is to enable our students to gain practical experience working in companies in Europe, as the training offered by our college is purely academic and has no practical component.
The specific aim of this project is to make it possible for our students to gain an insight into how international companies operate and thus improve their chances on the European/international job market. By improving their work-relevant language skills, especially their oral proficiency, and their intercultural competence, participants in the scheme can devolop both at a personal and a professional level, sharpen their individual profile and embark on their working life with a high degree of competence and self-confidence. In addition, the objective of the project is to raise their awareness of European issues.
Twenty-two students and one teacher will take part in the project. The students are all young adults aged 18 and above. For most, the training course at our college is the first training they do after leaving school.
Completing an internship in an international company, be it in tourism, administration, trade and industry or imports/exports, enables the participants to put what they have learnt at our college into practice and helps them to see how versatile the profession which they have trained for is. They can work in trade and industry, gain experience in dealing with customers, learn to work in a team, translate documents and much more. The school works closely together with agencies in each country. Learning targets are set out and the students are supervised by mentors: they have to complete a learning diary and have regular meetings with the mentors.
This project aims to sharpen the students’ understanding that taking part in a European internship not only improves their language proficiency but also enhances other skills. The students are expected to document what they have learnt and become aware that in addition to business skills, the internship gives them an insight into other aspects of life abroad which they may not be aware of at first sight. They are encouraged to reflect on aspects such as cultural differences, traditions, eating culture, body 
At the end of the project, the participants will have a clearer view of their professional future and as a result find it easier to find employment. In addition, they should become more willing to travel and develop more tolerance and openness towards other cultures.
The participants are expected to pass on their experiences to other young people in our school, at education fairs and other information events and thus act as multiplicators, motivating them to take part in similar mobility projects. A further, long-term effect that is not to be underestimated is the improvement of teaching, as the experiences the participants have had are evaluated by the teachers and are integrated into their lessons. In this way, the quality of our training is always under scrutiny and is continually being optimised. The mobility of teachers who visit companies and the agencies we work with to observe the working practices there also contributes towards improving the teaching quality at our school. The teachers gain an insight into working methods and are then able to pass on these insights to their colleagues in the school, who can make additions to their lessons to cover language points and aspects of working life that had previously been lacking.

With regard to the restructuring of  the educational program, The Ernst-Litfass-School wants to focus more on a European dimension. In the center of attention will be project-based learning formats with students with different educational biographies. This is a challenge that a lot of other schools are facing especially in the field of creative professions. The high appeal of this vocational field is often matched with vague ideas about the the true character of the tasks involved. In this case  an interdisciplinary approach could be helpful to find the right choice of profession according to the students'  vocation. Teachers who are concerned with the curricular development will deal with approaches from other countries and  adapt their competences through methods like job shadowing, best practice and critical peers. We expect an active participation in the development of current and future curricula, also beyond school e.g. in the advisory bodies of social partners. A high benefit will be the perception of the Ernst-Litfass-School as a progressive media school at European level.

Our school's students for industrial business managment assistant work for companies which have many subsidiaries and partners in different countries all around the world due to a more and more complex and globalized world. Our school wants to train them for these modern challenges and help them in the field of mobility, flexibility and cultural knowledge. This is why we organize this project. During their stay abroad, the students will get to know the culture, language and business practice of the host country and expand their competences in those areas. This project will furthermore prepare them for their language certificates and help them improve their language skills. Our school wants to strengthen this project over the next few years so it can become a core pillar of the training at our school.
All of these aims will be dealt with during our visits to Portsmouth in 2019 and 2020. Since all of our trainees will be in their second of training, they will have all the important experience to be helpful members at their work places and their host families and will allow them to work and live independently in the foreign country.
The project coordinator at the Erwin-Teufel-Schule is Mr Sebastian Freund. Our partner in Portsmouth is the TellUs Group who were introduced to us by Go.for.europe from the IHK Hochrhein-Bodensee in Constance. In Portsmouth, representatives from TellUS will be our main contact. During our two visits, 30 students (15 per visit) will have the opportunity to take part in the programme.

Departure and arrival:
The students will leave from Stuttgart or Zurich International Airport and fly to London Heathrow on their own. TellUS will pick them up at the airport and bring them to their host families by bus.

Accommodation and social environment:
In Portsmouth, TellUS will give further information about the companies they'll work for and further details about the schedule during the next days and week. All students will live with host families (half-board).

Acclimatisation:
On the first day there will be a meeting with representatives from TellUS. The students will meet their TellUS-contacts in person and learn about all the important information they need (contacts. schedule, phone numbers, bus tickets, maps of the city) so that they are all set for their stay in the UK.
Then they will have a language test to check their language level. According to the test results, they will be split up into groups and start their language course. They will have an intensive language course focusing on business English. During course week, they will get to know many customs and specifics about the UK.

Work placement:
First they will get to know their companies and get to know all the work related processes at first. When they know about the most important things, they will start to work in the areas they work in in Germany as well, e.g. administration, offers and enquiries or accountance.

Work day:
The students will work up to 37,5 hours per week, depending on their companies. No one will work more than 37,5 hours a week.

Culture:
During the weekend, the ETS and TellUS will put together a variety of cultural activities and sightseeing. Also, Mr Freund will lead a field trip to London to show all participants this beautiful city.

The project "Explore Europe 2018- 2019" enables young people during or immediately after the end of their training to do an internship. Possible destinations are in Ireland, Malta, the United Kingdom, France, Spain and Austria.

All participants will gain a greater understanding of the European labor market, learn new skills, be more implicated in their further education and will be more self-confident. At the same time, we expect participants to be good German ambassadors: to be open, friendly and eager learners and to be able to talk about the German education system in their respective fields.

For all organizational matters, we cooperate with local partner organisations, with whom we have been working for many years. They organise the internship placements and accommodation, offer cultural tours and events and are there to help in case problems occur. The learning goals for the internship and the precise tasks the interns are expected to perform are discussed in advance and written down in a memorandum of learning. After the internship the participants are awarded a mobility pass.

We place a special emphasis on preparing the participants for their stay abroad to facilitate the learning process and intercultural experiences. The preparation takes place during a mandatory seminar. In addition, we offer a seminar after the stay abroad to reflect on the experiences, deepen intercultural aspects and contribute to the participants´ understanding of the European Union and their own role within civil society.
European Mobility Network und TTASTE- Teachers and Trainers are sent to Europe

During the mobility project, the Berufsbildungswerk Neckargemünd (BBWN) is sending a total of  21 trainees abroad. All of them have very specific special needs. At the BBWN, young people are being trained outside of a company, i.e. the practical part takes place in well-equipped training companies or on shop floors.  Through the Erasmus+ mobility program trainees are gaining valuable experiences at cooperation companies.

One of the most important objectives is the strengthening and acquisition of self-reliance and self-confidence. After finishing their training programs, our trainees have to face the first job market and compete with people without handicaps. Demonstrating mobility and intercultural competence and having gained experience abroad increases our trainees’ chances to a great extent and helps compensating for disadvantages resulting from their handicaps. At the moment, we are offering internships in Spain, England, Ireland, Estonia, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic, and Italy. The International Coordinator at our vocational school plans and organizes the entire internship. Typically, the trainees are accompanied by a teacher/trainer during the first days of their internships. Erasmus+ Mobility and the BBWN fund the program and bear all expenses, such as travel expenses, board and lodging, and insurance.

Apart from the trainees, a total of eight trainers and teachers of the BBWN will visit our partners. These are facilities that offer vocational training for young people with special needs. Our goal is to learn from our partners, gain insights and deepen our collaboration.  We are striving for a regular exchange of colleagues within the mobility projects in order to promote the internationalization of our facility.
Nachhaltiges Lernen: nur was für Streber oder doch eine gute Idee?

Sustainability is one of the most important demands and goals of our time. But what exactly is sustainability? How does it influence our everyday lives? Does it even exist for the individual in its own personal life?

Sustainability is definitely a matter in business processes, not only in relation to environmental matters: How can a company manage to retain its employees? How can it actively involve its employees in its development process? How can it strengthen their strengths and help them overcome their weaknesses?

Those questions are closely linked to the demand for lifelong learning, a special variety of sustainability. How can I learn sustainably so that I can use my knowledge longer than only for the next test? Which competences do I need in my (business) life? On the other hand: how can I  recognize if I lack important competences for achieving my aims in due time? How can early school leaving or school failures be minimized or even permanently prevented in public education, school and training systems?

All this implies a European dimension that should not be ignored. How do learners and teachers  as well as companies in different countries act? How can a country, how can Europe act sustainably to provide skilled workers?

This project therefore focuses on the aspect of sustainable learning. Students of dual education for job training will investigate during their job shadowing how their peers learn, how they work in different countries, how the employees are involved into the decision-making process. Full-time course students, while they visit colleges and/or companies, will investigate on how to acquire skills and competences which can be used for their (business) life. The results of all this will be used to develop new learning and teaching concepts. 

The educational experts will develop ideas for a suitable monitoring in cooperation with colleges and companies to enable an adequate school and vocational education while at the same time taking on-time countermeasures against (impending) school failure or non-achievement of set learning objectives to prevent early school leaving.
Mobilität in der beruflichen Aus- und Weiterbildung

It is a well-know fact that the world of work is becoming more and more international. This is particularly relevant for Germany as an exporting and immigration nation. A consequence is that skilled workers, willing to make their career, are expected to be ready to work abroad and work together with other foreign workers , for instance in branches of their companies, with business partners or in foreign companies. The field of electronics is no exception; many of the German medium-sized or large companies are global players and have business relations with international clients and they have got more and more foreign skilled workers.

This is the setting of the project of Werner-von-Siemens-Schule, a vocational school in Cologne, Germany. In the next two years we want to give about 50 apprentices of our school the opportunity to do an internship fulltime in an electronics company in a foreign country. All participants will be apprentices in the field of electronics, either fulltime at school or in cooperation with a company (Duales System). During their internship in a Spanish, Italian, French, Finnish or Hungarian firm, they will have learn to face and to handle professional situations in a foreign language environment. These experiences will help them later on to judge their professional and linguistic skills better and to approach similar situations more effectively in their future professional life. In the long run, they might even consider working abroad frequently or permanently to promote their career.

From experience, most of the participants have only rarely been abroad so far and the fewest of them have already been in the country of destination. Quite a few of them have a migration background. Therefore, the exchange will also be a cultural experience for them, as they will get to know new attitudes and ways of living. Thus, they might even get a new outlook on life in Germany. In order to support this development, our partners will organize (inter-)cultural activities, such as common outings or meetings.

Meanwhile our educational staff will get a higher level of profession by visiting our schoolish and business partners in Europe. They will increase their didactical and (technical) language skills and their knowledge about technical aspects, which are typical in the visited nations. Therefore they have to visit and work in electronics companies, make some jobshaddowing in our associated Schools and are visiting special (technical) language courses.

Vocational trainees shall get international experience to improve their linguistic, cultural and professional knowledges and skills.
All participants are working in enterprises, which cooperate with others in foreign countries - for example as part of an international group or as customer or as supplier. The training companies are all customer- and sales-oriented and practice a CRM. For the most training companies is also very important the quality control and qualitiy work because they are in an international competitive.

Project objectives and expected results:
- greater occupational competence
- improved foreign language proficiency 
- foreign markets to get to know and recognize differences from the domestic market 
- to identify and understand differences in the type of customer contact and customer loyalty

BBA Oldenburg, an initial vocational school for Occupational Therapy in Germany, is aiming to offer its students and lecturers inspiration through international experience and exchange in order to provide an up-to-date and high-quality training. Our school is interested in the further development of the profile of Occupational Therapy and implements current international findings and visions into the training.

The participants make important contacts cross border and participate in European networks.
They deal with different conditions people in other cultural and societal contexts live in. They recognize diversity as an important content point of a globalized world and modern, client-centred and context-based Occupational Therapy.
The participants develop important professional, personal and informal skills. They are in exchange with European professional colleagues and deal cross border with current professional and social issues. The participants recognize lifelong learning and mobility as a part of the professional life in the EU. They develop an appreciative, critical and open attitude and feel as EU citizens. The familiarity of European themes is increasing among the participants and in their personal environment.

To achieve these objectives, 13 participants will participate in mobility in other European countries within two years. Nine students in the first year of education complete a four-week work placement in a social or health care institution; four teachers of the BBA participate in the annual meeting of the "European Network of Occupational Therapy in Higher Education" (ENOTHE).

The experiences of the participants in the project are evaluated. The gained insights and competences are included in the following training and further placements.
Berufliche Schulen Oberndorf-Sulz: Internationalisierung der Beruflichen Bildung-Chancen nutzen

With the present project „ Berufliche Schulen Oberndorf-Sulz: Internationalisation of the vocational training -good prospects” all participants are enabled to engage with globalisation and its benefits working abroad for a certain time. 
Participants are students and staff members of Berufliche Schulen Oberndorf-Sulz (BOS) as sending organisation and ist partner organisations Tellus Group, Twin Group and LAF as receiving organisations in the UK.
BOS wants to establish the increased internationalisation, which can be seen in today,’s world of work at vocational school and expects a massive increase in teaching quality.

The following activities have been planned: 

Four-week placement of apprentices:

The apprentices are at the end of their first, second or third year of their training. Thanks to the project, they do not only improve their language skills, but also their intercultural, theoretical and practical knowledge about their job. 
Internationalisation does not only affect big companies, but also smaller and midsize companies. Thus, the focus on international relations and businesses is a crucial part of vocational education at school. 

Two week placement of students of business college:

Communication in foreign languages and intercultural competences are indispensable in today’s world of work. Whether students want to focus on an educational training, a career at a university or a college, they will be expected to have good foreign language skills. At many universities and college classes are taught in English and a semester abroad is almost getting a must. In order to be well-equipped for the future career, spending time abroad is a really good experience and will help the business college students immensely.

As a summary, BOS aims at the following points:

- Improvement of the internationalisation of BOS 
- Facilitate placements abroad also for smaller and midsize companies
- Investment in the education of well-trained professionals
- Improvement of the professional, intercultural, social and language skills of the participants 
- Development of long-term cooperation with foreign educational institutes and companies
- Enhancement of the professional perspectives of students 
- Improvement of the schools public image and attractiveness 
- Better teaching quality and improved school development
- Innovative impulses for the school management 
- Living the European thought in a sustainable way

Project title: EUROPAKTIV V

Project participants:
Association 3K-Aktiv e.V. (D), IBD Partnership (UK), LOTP Lightonthepath Glasgow (UK), MTP Mobilitas Training Projects (ES), ZEAL
Ltd. and IZI Ltd. (MT), Eurocultura (IT), ADC College London (UK) and Dublin (IR) and the Dudley College at Birmingham (UK).

3K-Aktiv e.V. manages and supports the administrative and organizational handling of the project. It sensitizes companies and
training companies to the implementation of mobility for trainees and supports them in the preparation, implementation and
follow-up of foreign stays. Furthermore, we will also carry out and implement the evaluation and public relations work together
with our partners abroad, . The tasks of our foreign partners are essentially in the acquisition and provision of suitable companies,
appropriate internships and accommodation facilities abroad.

Participants:
94 trainees from the fields of bakery, hotel / catering, education, health- and homecare, travel, tourism and leisure and other commercial professions.
6 internal VET Trainers

Requirements and needs:
In particular, workers and trainees from the fields of hotel / catering and travel, tourism and leisure need increasingly foreign
language skills, intercultural skills and a particularly high degree of adaptability for their daily interaction with guests. This applies
equally to commercial staff in international companies. Both from the perspective of the companies that are active in international
markets, as well as for the professional perspective of the trainees, the need arises to acquire these skills.

Objectives:
Learners should use and deepen their professional knowledge during the stay abroad. Furthermore, they should increase their social
and international expertise. In a pre-agreed contract between the partners the working areas will be set; Eg. participants are used in
hotel trades in the "reception" and in commercial occupations in the "Shopping / Sales Export". After training, the learners become
more flexible by their increased mobility readiness, so that their career prospects will improve. In addition, participants will learn
more about the current and historical culture of the country.

Results:
An essential part is to demand and support and to raise awareness of a growing Europe. Significant results are improved language
skills of the participants, as well as the better cultural understanding of all involved with each other. Degradation of language and
cultural barriers in terms of the European idea will create higher common potentials in personal development or in the context of
business cooperation. Each participant will complete a 2-4 week stay abroad and thereby improve personal and professional skills.
These include the elimination of language barriers through improved language skills, a greater cultural understanding, an in-depth
knowledge as well as an increase in personal self-consciousness. Overall, thereby the personal job situation for the trainee improves.

Additional results:
All participants will receive the Europass-Mobility; Reports of the participating students; Project report;
Publication of project results through information flyers, website "EuropAktiv" and events of 3K-AKTIV e.V.

Project management: 01/10/2018 to 30/09/2020
Lernen und arbeiten in England IV

For its students, the Gewerbliche Schule Ehingen wants to create the opportunity of an internationally accepted practical training abroad. Similar to a former Leonardo-project, the school intends to offer three-week work placements in England in industry and trades and crafts (mechatronics technicians, car mechanics, industrial mechanics, industrial electronics technicians, plastics processing technicians, professional drivers, floorers and parquet layers). 
Details for the next two years: 2 flows to England and maybe Ireland with 15 participants each. All participants are at the end of their second or at the beginning of their third year of vocational training.
Parents or companies rarely encourage the students to go abroad. However, it is evident, that they make valuable experiences which benefit them in their career and intercultural awareness. They learn about industrial production, maintenance and repair and customer service or customer orders in comparison with their home country. Apart from that they enlarge their professional vocabulary and learn to integrate into the workflow of a foreign company in a short period of time. This placement is accepted as part of their German apprenticeship and provides them with advantages for future job applications (certificates).
The work placement has been positively evaluated by the previous project participants. Their training companies increasingly appreciate and support this possibility. Our present strategy has proven successful which is why we intend to establish this programme over a longer term.

The present pool project "individual scholarships let's go! and lift" is a nationwide initiative to promote practical trainings abroad for apprentices of skilled trades as well as technical trainees in industry and trade who are taking part in a vocational education and training under the dual system. Its objectives are fixed against the background of a previously relatively low mobility of young people in the dual training system. Additionally, conventional measures of mobility for apprentices are usually carried out in groups and are too inflexible for interested individuals or do not match due to their technical, spatial or temporal orientation. However, this project provides promotion of individual practical trainings abroad, irrespective of time, country of destination and the occupation requiring formal training. But the project determines clearly the funding period which in each case is scheduled to last three weeks. This schedule is based on the experience that this period usually already allows young people to a positive experience mobility with sustainable effect and that on the other hand longer periods of absence of the apprentices is in most cases hardly accepted among their training companies. Moreover, the realisation of practical trainings abroad shall now also be possible for those youngster, who just finished their apprenticeship. The 2 till 4 week training abroad has to be completed within the first 12 months after their successful final examination. The experience showed that some of the apprentices do not have the opportunity to do an intership during their vocational education under dual system due to timely and operational reasons. 2 weeks are a possibility for trainees which can not stay away for long (Business reasons), the 3 weeks are the most popular option and the 4 weeks are a possibility for apprentice with with a company that can support this (exemption of the apprentice) or graduate. 
The Average will be three weeks and need-oriented will be the possibilty to choose less (zwo weeks) or more (four weeks). 

This project shall enable the mobility consultation services of the Chambers of Skilled Trades and the Chambers of Industry and Commerce to provide a funding offer to apprentices who are interested in individual scholarships. The mobility consultation services of the Chambers are acting as "regional support partners”. Concerning the hosting institutions the notifier turns to partners abroad that have been established in the course of individual scholarships for apprentices of the skilled trades awarded since 2007 in the pool project line “let’s go!”.
The procurement procedures start with the written application of the young people. This application already ensures the prompt provision of information to the training company and the vocational school by obtaining the respective letter of reference from them. The applicant’s formal and personal suitability for an individual training abroad will be tested in a selection and awareness section conducted by the notifier or the regional support partners (mobility coaches of the Chambers). In case of a positive evaluation the preparation of the internship abroad will be planned. As soon as a suitable hosting institution/company is found and a learning agreement regarding the stay has been reached, the applicant will be informed of the authorisation of the funding. During the internship abroad different measures of the sending and hosting institutions will ensure the support for the young person and the documentation will start. After returning home the documentation will be finished and the final evidences will be provided. A certificate will be issued attesting the stay and the individual scholarship is finalised.

Following results are expected by the project "individual scholarships to let's go!":
The quantitative participation in individual scholarships of apprentices of the skilled trades and of technical trainees in industry and trade will increase. The individual internship abroad promotes the intercultural and language competences and supports the personal and professional development of the participating apprentices and trainees. The positive impact of the acquired competences will become clear in the domestic apprenticeship. At the same time it is expected that the restraining threshold of the participants for future long-term work in other European countries will be lower.
Regarding the quantitative need: The nationwide concept of the project is geared towards the whole group of apprentices of skilled trades and of technical trainees in industry and trade as well as towards young people recently aquired their certificat of vocational education in the mentioned two occupational groups. In view of the above, the notifier and its partner institutions see the need for the 100 scholarships applied for in this project in the two-year period starting 1st June 2018 till 31st May 2020.

The mobility project "kindergarten in europe" consists of a 2 or 3-week trip abroad in different European countries (England, Malta, Ireland) where the students of the BAFEP Judenburg complete a practical work placement in kindergarten. 
The main aim of the project is to improve  foreign language skills, increasing the feeling of EU citizenship and the employability of our students in the european market. 
Moreover, the students should also get an insight into the different working methods and cultural nuances of these European countries. 
The school also hopes to lift its international profile and to be able to offer students work opportunities that would otherwise not often be possible given their Socioeconomic status. We also hope to motivate other students, staff and organisations to involve themselves in ERASMUS+ projects the future  through the success of this project and network with strategic partners who can help us meeting our schools educational development needs, deepen our Know-How and Knowledge and improve and enhance our curriculum.
Our students will be well prepared through course work in the subjects Englisch and pedagogics.

Let´s practise in Europe mobility project is based on the European Development Plan of Hotel academy.  The aim is to connect theory and practical experience, enhance special competences and complete practical training abroad, improve language skills and get cultural and social competences in European country.

Project is aimed for students and teachers. 
Students (aged 17 to 19)specialized on the Seafood gastronomy programme will learn practical skills working with raw seafood ingredients and preparing seafood dishes as well as its styling. They will be able to experience the process of preparing and cooking seafood in real environment which is not possible in their home country. Students of Marketing mangement will be able to work in graphic programme Adobe. They´ll complete different marketing tasks, creating media outcomes according to real life situations.   

The teachers will accomplish practical programmes according to their specialization in hotel environment. They will take part in some practical tasks or do job shadowing. The aim is to get new knowledge as well as practical insight into process of  teaching special subjects and practical training at homeschool.    

The project will enable participant´s personal and professional development and it will increase their work placement chances after finishing their education. European mobility experiences are highly motivating to better achievements at school and in real life too. The professional status of the Hotel academy can be updated and as positive marketing spread in public. The teachers´ improved competences will be implemented into school educational documents and practically into teaching processes. New international contacts  can be great starting point for future cooperation.
Consortium Inter-académique de Mobilité en Europe dans l'enseignement Professionnel 2018-2020

80% - Rate of families in the Hauts-de-France Region eligible to social assistance
27.7% - Regional unemployment rate for 15-24 year-olds, 3.5 points higher than the national rate
17% - Regional early-school-leaving rate in vocational high school, 40% of young people moving to vocational high school after
lower secondary school.

These statistics clearly introduce the social, educational and employment challenges faced by our "academies" (educational authorities) in Amiens and Lille, and the necessity to set up ambitious projects to help reduce these proportions.

Our academic projects claim a strong focus on European and international openness. Learning mobility, a means of openness,
personal and professional enrichment, development of ambition and motivation, is at the heart of this priority. CIME_pro 18 project is an emblematic action of this policy.

Inter-academic consortium of European Mobility in vocational education and training, CIME_pro 18 engages 34 vocational high
schools around the GIP FORINVAL in a project deployed on the territory of the "academic region" for a larger impact.

Thanks to the PIMEN projects on Lille side, MOPIC / MOPAAM on Amiens side, CALME_sco, CIME_pro, CALME_sup, inter-academic projects, our teams have gradually developed a solid experience in the construction, management, implementation and dissemination of learning mobility projects. This project reflects a common, lasting and growing policy of the Academic Delegations to European and International Relations and Cooperation (DAREIC), working closely together for the entire regional educational community.

The CIME_pro 18 project:
- complements the offer of mobility projects on our territory: MOBinov, PIMEN5, CIME_pro 17, projects for vocational education and training, CALME_sco, MOPAAM16_perso, MOPAAM18 for school staff, CALME_sup for higher education students.
- fosters the common will of our academic teams to work together thanks to mobility projects implemented at the inter-academic
level (Lille - Amiens): CALME_sco 1 (2015-2017), CALME_sup 2 and 3 (2017-2020), CIME_pro 17 et 18 (2017-2020).
- pursues the networking of our institutions providing vocational training at the local level (with local economic partners), at the
inter-academic level (between institutions of our two academies), at European level (with foreign host partners).

CIME_pro 18 gives the opportunity to 323 young people from 34 of our vocational high schools to carry out a period of vocational training abroad, mainly young people from disadvantaged socio-professional categories, with little or no appetite for mobility, and for whom, professional and personal future is largely obscured by social problems.

A steering committee, composed of representatives from each member institution and the inter-academic coordination team
(DAREICs - GIP), will be the decision-making body of the project and will meet on a quarterly basis.

The dissemination activities will be numerous and will concern all the people involved, especially during the inter-academic days of
learning mobility that will be organized on our territory (May & October).

The impact of the project will be significant:

On the school career of beneficiairy students:
- development of their interest forf mobility, transnational professional mobility becoming a reality for many of them
- increased professional, entrepreneurial, interpersonal, intercultural, linguistic and social skills
- reinforcement of their autonomy, ambition and motivation (increased rate of access to higher education)

On the accompanying staff members or teachers who will carry out a training period abroad, and/or on members of the project
teams within the beneficiary institutions
- enriching career paths and developing their professional, intercultural and linguistic skills
- professionalization of educational teams in project management
On the concerned structures:
- contribution to achieve the objectives of school projects in terms of European and international openness
- amplification of the local and inter-academic (regional) influence of the sending schools
- qualitative and quantitative improvement in the school guidance of lower-secondary-school students to these high schools.
- enrichment and sustainability of partnerships at European level (host partners abroad) and at the local level (reception of foreign
students for institutions that implement reciprocal exchanges)

Within our inter-academic territory (Hauts-de-France region)
- Networking of schools and enhanced cooperation between our two "academies" (educational authorities)
- Harmonization and pooling of practices

CIME_pro 18 is an essential and ambitious project for a territory with major challenges.
LA FORMATION DE FORMATEURS PAR UNE MOBILITE EN EUROPE
Medkulturne in strokovne kompetence z roko v roki

The Consortium of Schools of Economics of Eastern Slovenia (Celje School of Economics, Grammar School Celje – Center, Murska Sobota School of Economics, Secondary School of Economics Maribor, Secondary School Slovenj Gradec and Muta, Novo mesto School of Economics) has formed partnership with partners in the United Kingdom, Spain, Ireland, Portugal and Malta for the purpose of collaborating in the mobility project for our secondary school students from five of our regions that is taking place from June 2018 until June 2019. We are aiming at organising work placements for 147 of our secondary vocational and technical school students as well as those of grammar school of economics for a period of 2 or 3 weeks respectively depending on their programme. The duration of their work placements has been adjusted to their curricula. All partners are aiming at enabling our participants to get an excellent mobility experience, we want to help them upgrade their speaking abilities in English or teach them the basics of the Spanish/Portuguese language. We are going to work hard to broaden their horizons to such an extent so that foreign languages will no longer be a problem but a challenge, we would like them to understand the notion of multicultural existence and be able to live among and with different kinds of people, help them adapt to intergenerational environment, we want to encourage the use of their professional skills in foreign work environment and gain new professional skills (mostly the development of entrepreneurial and digital competences), including generic competences which are becoming increasingly sought after by employers. It is necessary they become aware of the importance of lifelong learning and training as Europe offers excellent opportunities for international cooperation, networking and exchange of expertise. Student mobility experience has so far – according to our long-term experience – immensely contributed to their strengthened self-confidence, improved self-worth as well as their linguistic, intercultural and digital competences. In majority we are developing entrepreneurial skills and competences but as we also carry out other educational programmes within our respective schools, the students of the latter have also been involved in the project. 
The project is of utmost importance for all partner schools of the Consortium as mobility activities raise our international profile and attract a greater number of students who want to enrol in our schools. At the same time it provides invaluable new experiences for all of us, including accompanying persons. Nowadays internationalization is a must therefore we are strengthening our collaboration with foreign partners with this project and consequently we keep improving our mobility practice by learning also from their rich experience. Mobility is an added value to our educational programmes and it diversifies everyday activities in all our partner schools be it for students or teachers, especially with the use of eTwinning and School Education Gateway that will enable the upgrade of digital and intercultural competences of both teachers and students.
Creëren van Volwaardige Leeromgevingen -  Uitwisseling voor en door Ervaren Trainers

The CRE-ATE project fits within the wider vision of Syntra West vzw that aims to offer high quality training for all learners by strengthening teachers in their role as trainer and coach. In view of the changed expectations and increasing diversity in the groups of learners, as well as the demand for specific support from the teacher in order to respond to this change appropriately, a shift to a rich and constructive learning environment required. To enhance the employability of the learners and to prepare them for their future careers in a real work environment, courses tailored to their possibilities and learning needs are the solution. In this way we want to enhance the motivation and learning ability of each individual student.

In the CRE-ATE project, 6 teachers and employees are offered the opportunity to learn from colleagues abroad, via 6 mobilities to Spain, Hungary, the Netherlands, Portugal and the United Kingdom. They will get inspired by job shadowings and exchanges with teachers and trainers who face similar challenges and tendencies. By experiencing themselves how other European training partners apply concrete tools and methodologies, we want to offer our trainers resources which they can use in their own teaching practice.

The topics that will be discussed are:

- Creating a rich and stimulating learning environment: providing individual feedback, coaching and advice outside the classroom setting (e.g. by using a learning platform, giving specific practical assignments and applying different ways to motivate the learners)
- The integration of 21st century skills (e.g. intrapreneurship, critical thinking, communication skills, entrepreneurial learning and sense of responsibility) into the courses: creating awareness of these skills and supporting the learners in practicing those skills in each lesson 
- ICT-supported teaching: the added value of ICT and the use of concrete tools, programmes and methodologies in order to differentiate in view of different learning abilities, learning styles and interests.

After each mobility activity, peer moments will be organized to transfer the acquired knowledge and insights to the entire organization. The new methodologies are also incorporated into practical staff trainings, linked to broad range of didactic skills in order to give all future trainers the confidence to apply the newly gained insights. At the end of the project, a final event will take place to have the participants testify about their European experience in view of a wide knowledge sharing and creating new learning dynamics in the entire organization.
Z delovnimi izkušnjami v tujini do boljših zaposlitvenih možnosti
Pradědeček jel do světa na zkušenou, já na mobilitu

The project "My Great-grandfather Worked Abroad for Experience, Me for Mobility" is a set of activities that are linked to a successful project of mobility in Slovakia two years ago. It was created as our respond to the demand of students for the journey with experience in another country and also as the efforts of colleagues to increase motivation of students to learn foreign languages and to expand their professional competences. Our goal is to give students the opportunity to verify and expand their knowledge and skills in new environment and thus to be able to take advantage of the experience for their future work. In May 2019, 12 students of the 3rd year of study of Care and Pre-school and After-school Pedagogy will leave for their first foreign practice. One group with an accompanying person goes to Germany and the other similar in the same term to England. In the second phase of mobility program, 4 graduate students will go for a three-month internship to Jena (Germany) and Plymouth (England) as a part of ErasmusPro at the beginning of June 2019.
They will work in pairs to be able to help each other. We strive to increase the interest in long-term mobility, and their example shall become a model for future internships of graduates or other adult students who would meet the school's respected criteria for foreign practice/internship.

Technical teachers learn to use the new European ECVET assessment tools and create units of learning outcomes tailor-made for each student. We want them to understand the evaluation of their expertise and experience a sense of appreciation when applying new skills from their mobility in practice and later in employment. We will support students by issuing the Europass and presenting results of the ECVET European Assessment Tool to see how their new experience and skills are valued on the labour market. These two documents will strongly increase their chance in future employment.
As a new partner, we appreciate the interest of the SBBS in German Jena, which has very good results in international work and mobility programmes in many European countries. Their system of work and practice will be inspiring for us as we have planned placements and teacher shadowing at this school. We want to learn more about the school as a partner and to negotiate the conditions for our future cooperation. That is why we have planned a visit to this school at the beginning of the project in September 2018.
With regard to the language we are studying, we also focus on England, where Tellus agency, with whom we have worked in the past, will ensure good professional leadership and implementation of work practices in South England, Plymouth.

Our society is rapidly changing and young people react to changes according to their interests and possibilities. They prefer communication on social networks rather than face-to-face communication. The opportunity to create a mobility project, in which each student has to communicate with project co-creators, and gradually fulfil tasks to complete the required training to allow a practice abroad, we see as a great contribution for improving social skills and communication. During practice, students are increasingly meeting people of other nationalities with other cultural habits, and for this reason, mobility is a strong incentive to create positive international attitudes among students and to create correct responses to the perception of a different culture. We perceive the mobility program also as a major shift in the personal development of the project team members. When designing and implementing the project, they expand their own competencies in project design and management while respecting, identifying and helping to realize the long-term goals of the European School Development Plan. They can transfer their newly acquired experience to other teachers. The project has great importance for the development and support of the European dimension of the school.
Realizace zahraničních odborných praxí pro studenty vyšších odborných škol zdravotnických na Vysočině

The project „International vocational internships for students of nursing schools of higher education in the Vysočina region“ will be implemented within the timeframe from June 2018 to August 2019 through the partnership of three Czech schools in the Vysočina region (Havlíčkův Brod, Žďár nad Sázavou, Třebíč) and in cooperation with international partner in vocational education field - Tellus Group (UK). The project follows on previous successful cooperation in international internships dated back to 2012-2014. Its content is designed for 22 students from 2nd and 3rd grades in the study program Certified Nurse. The participants will carry out a month-long internship in high quality senior care institutions located in Playmouth, Britain. By participating in this project, the participants will also find inspiration in new educational and healthcare system in Great Britain. 
The project will have positive impacts on students and partner schools: 1) Students will gain significant international vocational working experience in nursing, which they will use after graduation during job search both in the Czech Republic and abroad. Students will also develop their language skills in English, not only during preparation classes, but also through practical use of English at the workplaces. They will be more self-reliant, they will gain intercultural and international insight. They will be inspired by nursing systems in foreign countries. Students will be then more motivated for their future studies. They will also aquire an important reference for their CV and they will receive a European confirmation of such experience (ECVET, EUROPASS Mobility). The participants will also express motivation to younger students.
2) Our schools will strengthen the cooperation with international partners. The internships will innovate and refresh our education as the participation will be provided as an extra benefit for the best students. The partnership will also strengthen further cooperation in future projects. Graduates with international working experience will serve as very good reference for presentation of our school and it will lead to higher demand for graduates by potential employers and higher number of pupils interested in studying in our schools. In general, our students will be more motivated by the possibility to qualify for participation in international internships. The participating schools will gain experience with defining units of learning outcomes, ECVET implementation and using of EUROPASS Mobility certificates.

The lycée H.Senez in Hénin-Beaumont is a vocational high school specializing in customer services and industry sectors, it is also an apprentice centre. It caters students from the last years of secondary education (middle school), to the BTS and Licence Pro (HND and Bachelor’s degrees), providing training for industrial and service sectors.  
In spite of the unfavourable socio-economic situation of the region (the former coal-mining of Nord Pas-de Calais) in which it is located, it has lots of human, geographical potentials and assets. 
The international mobility experiences have so far set all the participants in a more confident and dynamic approach by improving the project with better expertise and more people committed. 
As it is convinced that is important to have a common strategy and to comply with the list of specifications, the educational team consisting of people from various departments and a coordinator, has made a major contribution to define the framework of the project: how, when and what type of planned activities should be developed or carried out within a 30 hour’ special preparation and follow-up process (for the academic year).   
New partnerships have been established with an Italian, a Belgian, a German vocational school also joining a new private hosting organisation in Ireland and England.  
Our role is to cooperate with these partners in order to meet the needs for mobility of:
a.Learners aged between 17 and 19, in the fields of catering and hospitality (4 students); motor vehicule (4 students); sales and retail (4 students); e-administration and office work (8 students); customer service (8 students).
b. 7 staff members: to give and receive trainings (1 in a library in Belfast; 4 in a learning centre in Ireland; 2 in a vocational school in Germany; 1 in a charity shop in Edinburgh) 
1.The project aims at the participating school by:
-creating and /or sustaining partnerships between our vocational school and European partners (companies and/or training centres) in order to build European citizenship
- building and developing the opportunity for our school and its members to: 
  a.bring an international and European dimension into education and training
  b.engage with the institution and activities in order to keep up with sustainable improvement (quality assurance dimension) 
2.The project aims at the learners by:
-making the professional experience an opportunity and gateway to school success,
-developing employability and access to higher education,
-overcoming language barrier or developing language skills
-learning transferable skills and competencies,
-developing autonomy, entrepreneurship, and will for success
When experiencing mobility abroad, the participant steps out of comfort zones and changes his/her own habits. Opening to the world, to others and to difference is definitely an opportunity to a citizenship and ‘living together’ experiencing via exchanging, mentoring, helping each other and reciprocity.   
3.The project aims at the staff by:
-mastering organization skills, language and cultural communication skills
-improving team spirit , cross-curricular and cross-school work
-organizing exchanges on know-how and skills between students / between teachers
- gathering and adjusting the curricula in order to meet the needs of the project, so, implementing lesson plans (welcoming/informing/dealing with orders, booking a train ticket…) 
-gaining educational and teaching competencies: teaching English as a second language or professional English 
- improving the assessment and evaluation procedures during the training period  
We will make sure we:
- encourage, promote and make mobility accessible during scholarship and future life by disseminating the reports and the benefits gained from experiences through school events in every partner school, meetings; narratives, certificates … 
- collect, share, disseminate  and highlight the results of the mobility experienced by the staff involved and all the participants within and outside the school as well.
- create tools in order to help measure the impacts of the mobility on participants
Mobilité et découverte des pratiques professionnelles pour des élèves de filière professionnelle

We are a polyvalent high school located in Seine Saint Denis. We offer many programs such as general, technical and vocational training courses. We have a three-year vocational training course whose specialty is “Management and administration”. The participants to this mobility project are 8 students from 2nd year of our vocational high school enrolled in the “European section”. These 8 students come from underprivileged areas. We would like to offer them a vocational training including an internship in a company thanks to our partner “Tellus”, located in Plymouth (UK). This vocational training would lead them to obtain a European certificate (ECVET). The training course is called “Responsible practices in companies” (hygiene and security) and has the following goals:

-       Identify one’s responsibility in terms of hygiene and security (follow the instructions, first-aid kits, basic regulations).
-       Identify a positive attitude in a workplace and understand its importance. The participants will stay in host families.

At the end of this project, we expect them to improve their English, be more open-minded (thanks to culture and European citizenship), obtain many European tools (the Europass mobility certificate, the ECVET certificate, a Europass curriculum vitae…). We also expect them to benefit from this enriching vocational training thanks to personal fulfillment (new encounters, the discovery of a new country and its culture).

With this mobility project, we would like to showcase our “European section” and our “Management and administration” training courses in order to attract more candidates. Moreover, we would like to open our high school towards Europe by proposing abroad mobility projects, European certificates. Hopefully, in the long term, we would like to become a high school offering vocational training courses, the ECVET certificate or even launch a partnership with another European high school.

In this project, we build on our previous ten-year´s continuous experience with the mobility programme in VET sector, thanks to which students and VET teachers can gain priceless both professional and personal experience by completing a training program at workplaces of our foreign partners. Foreign internships have since become an integral part of the school's educational offer. The number of study fields taught at school has almost doubled over the past few years and the number of students has increased to the current 1021. In addition to the traditional field of study Applied Chemistry being taught in a few specialisations, some new study branches such as Fire Protection, Security and Legal Studies and study fields Hairdresser and Hair Cosmetics have been introduced. 
In order to meet the educational needs of our students and allow them to participate in a foreign mobility within their study focus, we have extended the net of collaborating organisations up to the current twelve partners and we have fully covered all of the educational programmes taught at our school. By increasing number of mobilities and extending the international cooperation, we meet the basic objectives of the European Strategic Development Plan. We plan internships into 8 European countries (Great Britain, Germany, Cyprus, Italy, Spain, Slovakia, Lithuania and Macedonia). Our partners in the project are 6 secondary vocational schools, 4 universities and one educational centre. In case of four partners we will implement reciprocal mobilities. The total number of students in foreign mobilities is 68, out of which 30 students are in study field of Applied Chemistry, 14 in study field of Fire Protection, 14 in Security and Legal Studies and 10 in the hairdressing fields. The project is newly implementing long-term mobility ErasmusPro, when two chemistry students will participate in a three-month´s mobility in England, where the receiving organization will be the University of Plymouth (specifically the School of Geography, Earth & Environmental Sciences), and two other students in a professional vocational school SBG in Dresden.
Our collaborating partners for chemistry are secondary vocational schools: SBG Dresden, SOŠ Chemická in Bratislava, IIS Pietro Scalcerle in Padua, two universities - University of Plymouth and University of Nicosia and the Spanish training center. CNFPO in Cartagena.
Receiving organizations for students in the field of Fire Protection are School of Fire Protection in Žilina and Fire School in Vilnius, in Lithuania.
The receiving organizations for students in Security and Legal Studies are the Faculty of Security Engineering at University of Žilina, Goce Delcev University in Macedonia and SOŠ Chemická in Bratislava.
Students in Hairdresser and Hair Cosmetics study fields will be trained at SOŠ in Spišská Nová Ves, some at Secondary Vocational School in Vilnius, in Lithuania.
Along with the increasing number of mobilities, we are also striving to enhance the quality of our projects. In all of the project mobilities, we are going to apply ECVET principles and test the learning outcomes through an agreed procedure of evaluation.
As part of the project, we also plan the mobility of staff - teachers of vocational subjects, as we realize that professional growth of teachers is a prerequisite for ensuring quality in education. In addition to the professional and pedagogical competencies of teachers, we also want to strengthen their language competencies. In this year's project, we want to focus on professional teachers in the study fields of Security and Legal Studies, Fire Protection and Hairdressing.
On the side of students we see the impact of the project in acquiring new professional knowledge and skills, enhancing English language communication skills and lexical skills, strengthening self-confidence and motivation for further education. Thanks to this experience, students gain an insight into the requirements of their profession, learn about opportunities to study abroad or work in the European labour market. Through this experience, the profile of graduates is being improved, from which the strategic partners of the school (employers, tertiary education) benefit. The long-term mobility of ErasmusPro, which we want to integrate into future projects, is supposed to have the greatest impact on students' language competencies and expertise.
Impact on the school side is seen in an increase in school attractiveness and an increased interest of pupils to study sciences. Through mobility, the school gets valuable feedback on the quality of the education provided. The benefit is also in the exchange of experience and the transfer of good practice examples into school. The project will be disseminated through school website, the Pardubice Region's web, local press, further at Open Days, promotion fairs, workshops with employers and the final project conference via participants´ presentations.
"Competente profesionale la standarde europene – siguranta integrarii si adaptarii pe piata europeana a muncii!"

The project "Professional skills at European standards - the security of integration and adjustement to the European labour market" takes place between the 1st of September 2018 and 29th of February 2020 by the National Consortium formed by the Technological High School "Dinu Bratianu" in Stefanesti, Arges county as coordinator and Technological High School in Costesti, Arges county and Technological High School "Nicolae Plesoianu" in Ramnicu Valcea, Valcea county as partners. The consortium is formed as the result of the good collaboration in other projects and educational programmes of these high schools. In addition, they noticed common problems that could be solved together.
 The project is written for the benefit of 63 students in 10th grade professional school and of 9 teachers from Technology domain (VET teachers) who will do their practice and their job shadowing activity in VET formation centres and their partners. There are 21 students and 3 teachers from each school. 
 The purpose of this project is to develop professional skills at a European level in the study area of the participants through communication and relating, through the development of the critical thinking and of the moral, civic, social and cultural skills.
 The specific objectives of this project are:
 1 – to develop the practical skills of maintaining, repairing and diagnosing internal combustion engines during the stage of 6 weeks for 61 students;
 2 - improving modern methods and practices of approaching technical disciplines for 9 teachers, within 5 days;
 3 – to develop transnational partenerships and European cooperation meant to ensure the mobility of young people and to determine institutional development of schools;
 4 – to develop six partnerships with economical agents of the same profile at the local or regional level, in order to use the results of teaching got by the beneficiaries of the stage during the project implementation;
 5 – to get a healthy opinion about life and work, to develop critical judgement, to learn how to make decisions and how to assume responsibilities during the project .
 We have chosen three forming centres from three different countries, in order to give variety and also the possibility to compare different work environments and different strategies of the educational process. 
 The organizations of receiving are: Tellus College, Plymouth - UK, ESCOLA PROFISSIONAL DO MONTIJO - Associação para a Formação Profissional e Desenvolvimento do Montijo - Portugal and IPODOMI -  Greece.
 We have chosen these organizations of receiving because they are well known centres as concerning the quality of teaching given to the participants at the mobility and they have partners specialized in the mechanic part of engines, as well as VET schools and so they are appropriate for our participants, who have theoretical information, but not practical experience.
 During the stage, the students will get through 90 classes of the CDL module “The maintenance and repairing of internal combustion engines”, and teachers will work for 5 days.
 The project develops the specialized professional skills of the participants and it also creates the conditions for personal developing through the achievement of language, social, civic, intercultural skills, which will allow them to adjust to the conditions of active life.
 The practical stage improves the professional abilities of students and creates the conditions to their European integration, because it keeps up with technology and automatic production and services. The project aims a quick integration on the labour market of the graduates and a large mobility at a European level.
 In addition, the project represents for teachers a new professional experience, so that the developed skills improve the developing strategy of the schools in the consortium. The developed skills will be certified in the documents provided: the Europass Mobility document, the ECVET certificate and the participation certificate– for students, the forming certificate and the Europass Mobility document – for teachers.
ESTANCIAS INTERNACIONALES PARA ALUMNADO DEL PROGRAMA SEFED

Fundación Inform (www.inform.es) is an organization dedicated to the management, coordination and implementation of different educational programs and projects applied to VET training in Spain. It has as members of its Board the municipalities of 17 municipalities in Catalonia: Sant Pere de Ribes, Vilafranca del Penedès, Molins de Rei, El Prat de Llobregat, Santa Coloma de Gramenet, Manlleu, the Mancomunitat de Municipis de la Vall del Tenes, Lleida , Tortosa, Reus, Rubí, El Vendrell, Barcelona, Tarragona, Sabadell, Valls and Girona and the Escola Pia de Catalunya and establishes collaboration agreements with each of the VET training centers where the SEFED Program is applied (Simulation of Companies with Educational Aims) throughout Catalonia and Spain.
Our vision is to find and apply pedagogical tools to adapt the training of people to the needs of the labor market, to contribute to a qualitative improvement of the society in which we develop.
Our mission is to create, consolidate and transfer training products that facilitate the labor insertion and the continuous improvement of different groups, preferably using the methodology of business simulation.
Our values are the capacity for innovation, transnationality, transparency, quality and networking.
Since 1987 Fundación Inform manages and applies the SEFED Program in VET training for administration staff for SMEs in VET medium-level, in VET higher-level and in professional VET certificates related to the Administrative and Commercial VET family.
The transnationality of the SEFED Program has always been a key point in Inform's strategic plans and for this reason we have participated in European programs since 1987 (including 13 Leonardo Mobility projects) to try to internationalize the training received by our students and adapt it to the labour market.
