Since 1994, Inform is a founding member of the international network Europen-Pen International (http://www.penworldwide.org/), which brings together all the educational organizations in the world that manage simulation projects like ours. The Europen Network has 40 countries and 8,000 simulated companies in VET schools, universities, secondary schools, etc .; and we work together in various projects to advance towards common models of learning, the improvement of the professional skills of students and teachers and the development of the European labor market.

We have two types of students participating in this project.
- On the one hand, the SEFED students level 2 professional certificate ADGD0308 Administrative management activities. They are unemployed people, mostly women over 25/30 years old, with low education and mostly a lot of work experience that with the crisis have been left out of the labor market. We want to comment that the condition of being women is not a requirement of the VET project that we offer, but a reality of the current labor market.
- On the other hand students or recent graduates in VET education  and being trained by the SEFED methodology in their VET schools. They are young people from 16 to 18 years old.

The national consortium of this project consists of 56 entities that are VET schools and organizations in which the SEFED methodology is taught in part of the curriculum of VET middle level, from the VET Administrative and Commercial family, 13 of these 56 are organizations that belong to the board of Fundación Inform and in which the VET project  ADGD0308 is delivered. All these VET centers need to improve the linguistic, social and professional / technical skills of their students. We need skills and competencies of high quality and excellence so that our students can compete in the labor market. Participation and common work in European projects in a consortium coordinated by the Foundation is part of our vision and mission as an organization. We believe that transnationality must be a way of being, of working and of understanding things. And with this premise we have been working since 1987 when we started our journey in training. Transnationality is an essential point in the Foundation's strategic plan since its inception. This mission and vision is also constantly transferred to all our students and professionals who participate in the training we offer.
Inovare si dezvoltare pentru o educatie profesionala de calitate

The idea of this project was born out of the needs that we identified in the Mihai Bravu Technical College:  the insertion of the graduates on the labour market; increasing professional competences and key competences so that they are able to work in their field of training; social inclusion, in the case of students coming from disadvantaged communities and the need to increase the attractiveness of our educational offer.
Through this project, 42 tenth grade students from the Mechanics; Electric; Constructions, installations and public works fields of training and 12 VET teachers will benefit from training at Tellus College and Tellus College Spain. Students from disadvantaged communities will have priority at the selection.
The aim of the project is to develop the vocational technical competences and key competences of the students and to increase the efficiency of the vocational training of our institution (the educational offer - by including dual education - and the learning techniques used) in order to integrate into a continuously developing labour market.
Specific objectives:
1.Developing the professional competences in the Mechanical; Electric; Construction, Installations and Public Works fields  of the 42 students by conducting three-week (90-hour) work experience programs at Tellus Education Group by the end of the two-year project (2020), with a minimum of 40% of the participants being: ethnic minorities; students from poor single-parent families; with parents living abroad or students at high risk of school dropout.
2.Development with 1 point on a behavioural observation grid (with levels 1 to 5) of the following key competences: a) social competences of collaboration and teamwork in workshops; b) entrepreneurial competences and critical thinking, by taking the initiative to solve problems; by the 42 students participating in the three-week (90-hour) internships by 2020
3.Setting up at least 2 transnational partnerships and at least 2 national partnerships with employers from the technical field in order to have 10% of the 2021 graduates employed in their respective qualifications 
4. Increasing the quality and attractiveness of the vocational training of the institution through the effective implementation of dual education (minimum 1 class / year of project) and by using the specialized learning techniques observed by the 12 VET teachers participating in the 2 Staff Training Abroad mobilities at Tellus Group by 2020 .
In the first flow, 6 VET teachers will spend 5 days taking part in Staff Training Abroad in Plymouth, UK in order to observe the implementation of dual professional education. In the 2nd flow, 14 students from the Mechanics field (Mechanical technician for maintenance and repairs; Technician processing on CNC machines)will take part in a work experience program in Plymouth for 3 weeks. In the 2nd year of the project, 6 VET teachers will be participating in the 3rd flow in Staff Training Abroad in Salamanca, Spain, for 5 days, where they will have a hands-on observation period of the utilisation of the new AutoCAD graphical interface and of the CNC simulators. In the 4th flow, 14 students in Construction, Installations and Public Works (Technician in construction and public works)will participate in Technical based learning in Plymouth, UK for 3 weeks. In the last flow, 14 students from the Electric field (Technician in electrical installation) will undergo Technical based learning in Salamanca, Tellus Spain for 3 weeks.
These activities will help students develop competences in line with the "Responsible work practice" accredited with 1 ECVET. The student learning outcomes are in line with their field of training and correlated with the key competences in the Local Development Curriculum and set out in the MoU.
The methodology of implementation will include planning actions (with the Gantt chart), timing of activities, budget management, task distribution, training of participants, organising mobilities, monitoring, disseminating and exploiting results and project evaluation.
The learning outcomes for VET staff are the development of dual-learning implementation skills and of the knowledge about specialized educational techniques and the software used during Technical-based learning.
The impact of the project on the students will be by the development of professional competences, increasing their chances of integration on the labour market (using Europass and ECVET), by increasing their self-confidence and motivation regarding their field. The impact on the teachers will be by increasing the skills of implementing dual learning and their ability to bring change into the institution and the community. There will be an increase in the visibility of the high school and in its European dimension, boosting the competitiveness of the educational offer through the implementation of dual classes, while the institution becomes appealing for national and transnational working partnerships.
European Vocational Training - IES A Pinguela - 2018-20

CONTEXT  AND OBJECTIVES

Instituto de Enseñanza Secundaria A Pinguela (1.E.S. A Pinguela) (http://www.iesapinguela.es) is a public College located in Monforte de Lemas, a town on the north-west of Spain (Galicia), that offers secondary, bachillerato (16-18 yo) and VET (high and medium level). lt is located in a rural area which is under-industrialised  and we are committed to give to all our  students the opportunity to experience mobility in Europe to improve their competences and employability.
This project is aimed to VET students and teachers, having the following objectives:

1. For students , to validate On the Job training module (FCT) with a placement on a company abroad
2. To improve competence on the host country language
3. For teachers, to get updated on latest market products and techniques to be incorporated to their teaching
4. For IES A Pinguela to reinforce a network of european partners, to enrich mobility offers to students and teachers
S. For host partners to benefit form participants experience and know-how.

ACTIVITIES

IES A Pinguela offers 4 VET courses PEINADO Y COSMÉTICA CAPILAR (2 year+FCT), ESTÉTICA Y BELLEZA (2 year+FCT), GESTIÓN ADMINISTRATIVA (2year+FCT) and SISTEMAS MICROINFORMÁTICOS Y REDES (2 year+FCT)
Student mobilities will last for the duration of the whole FCT (10 weeks) to better meet objectives 1 and 2.

Oct-dec 2018: 1 student from SISTEMAS MICROINFORMÁTICOS in a company in the UK .
Apr-Jun 2019: 1 student from SISTEMAS MICROINFORMÁTICOS in a company in the UK , 2 students from GESTIÓN in companies in italy, 1 student from GESTIÓN in a company in France, 3 students from PEINADO in companies in Portugal, 1 student from ESTETICA in a company in Portugal.
Apr-Jun 2020: 1 student from SISTEMAS MICROINFORMÁTICOS in a company in the UK , 1 student from GESTION in a company in Italy, 2 students from PEINADO in companies in Portugal and 1 student from ESTETICA in a company in Portugal.
Teacher  mobilities  will be:
June 2018: one teacher of Beauty will do a one week period of job-shadowing  in a company in  Italy
June 2019: one teacher of Beauty will do one week of job-shadowing in a company in Italy and one teacher of Business and administration will do a job-shadowing  in a company in ltaly.

METHODOLOGY

A mobility commission will be formed by VET tutors, the project coordinator and the head of school; to assure that all professional families are involved . lt will carry on the following tasks: select participants , define training agreements , monitor work placements, evaluate and certify work-placements. This commission is responsible for running the project together with partners:

IIS Biagio Pascal supports the selection of companies and participants, facilitates communication between IES A Pinguela and host companies and cooperates in organizing the trip.
Host companies from IT, Administration and Hair & Beauty sectors: agree on the training program, designate a tutor in the company; collaborate in the evaluation of the participants and with the dissemination of the project.
Participants organise their trips supported by IES A Pinguela , take their linguistic, cultural and practical preparation both at IES A Pinguela and vía OLS , take responsabilities for the On the job training module and integrate on the social life of the destination city.

RESULTS AND IMPACT

- To improve professional, linguistic and personal competences far the participants
- To validate the on the job training module having  adquired  necesary learning outcomes
- To increase employment opportunities far participants
- To make participants European citizens
- To improve teaching methodology in VET

LONG TERM BENEFITS

- To consolidate mobility offer far VET students and teachers
- To built up a network of Colleges and companies across Europe.
- To get involved in partnership projects with schools and companies.

Eurojoven Castilla y Leon is an Erasmus + mobility project for recent graduates of Vocational Training at the Castilla y Leon educational centers. It has been carried out annually since 2014.
The project arises from the need to respond to the high unemployment rate among young people in Castilla y León. To this end, the Instituto de la Juventud de Castilla y Leon and 26 vocational education centers combine forces, synergies and work teams in order to increase the linguistic and professional skills of people between 18 and 30 who have just finished their studies of VET in commercial activities, hairdressing, electromechanics and bodywork of vehicles, bakery, pastry and confectionery, administrative management, conduction of sports physical activities in the natural environment, auxiliary nursing care, social health care for people in situations of dependency, cuisine and gastronomy, catering services, wood and furniture, micro-computer systems and networks. A total of 60 participants who practice for 89 days in companies from another country: Italy, Poland, United Kingdom or Ireland. This aims to achieve the following results: an increase in the competences of the participants in linguistic terms and professional techniques, cooperation between the different institutions that care for the benefit of young people such as the Youth Institute of Castilla y León, belonging to the Regional Ministry of Family and Equality of Opportunities of the Junta de Castilla y León, and vocational training centers of the region, to increase knowledge of the labor market by these institutions and better respond to the needs of employability of youth.
This project is developed at European level with the intention of growing by all the partners involved towards new possibilities of learning and employment, as well as the enrichment between educational systems and youth policies within the European Union. The impact of this project lies in:
Obtained by the participants of a Europass mobility certificate that accredits the skills acquired during their mobility experience in another country. The different project partners will see their capacity to work with entities of different nature and different countries strengthened. There will be an approach between the shipping partners and the companies that will facilitate a greater knowledge of the labor and educational reality of the participants. This will encourage a reflection on the educational focus of the institutions. The success of the project will influence the decision-making and public opinion of our region, betting on similar mobility programs financed by the own resources of public organisms. The intercultural aspect will influence the local community where the participants have lived, increasing the attractiveness of mobility programs and arousing interest in other cultures. A greater openness to new approaches and possible methodologies that the participant will contribute to the company where he practices. The participants will be more likely to have access to a job within their training sector. The consortium and the partners will launch a new mobility project to respond to the needs of new participants. They will include improvements according to the evaluation of the project that concerns us. Improvement and creation of tools to manage mobility projects by all partners. Participants will be able to apply learning planning tools to their day-to-day and professional future. As for the Center, the strategy of internationalization through the Mobility Programs, means to definitively achieve the Modernization that will revert in the Center, which makes it attractive and peculiar in the eyes of future students and companies. Interest in new educational centers to establish collaborations with social agents outside the educational sphere, and more related to employment and labor policies. Inclusion of mobility programs in political strategies related to youth at the regional level. Opening of new contacts and possible collaborations, sharing of ideas and initiatives among the different agents of the project. Possibility of planning in time ErasmusPro mobility projects or other European programs.

The consortium and the partners will launch a new mobility project to respond to the needs of new participants. They will include improvements according to the evaluation of the project that concerns us. Improvement and creation of tools to manage mobility projects by all partners. Participants will be able to apply learning planning tools to their day-to-day and professional future. As for the Center, the strategy of internationalization through the Mobility Programs, means to definitively achieve the Modernization that will revert in the Center, which makes it attractive and peculiar in the eyes of future students and companies. Interest in new educational centers to establish collaborations with social agents outside the educational sphere, and more related to employment and labor policies. Inclusion of mobility programs in political strategies related to youth at the regional level. Opening of new contacts and possible collaborations, sharing of ideas and initiatives among the different agents of the project. Possibility of planning in time ErasmusPro mobility projects or other European programs.

Eurojoven Castilla y Leon is an Erasmus + mobility project for recent graduates of Vocational Training at the Castilla y Leon educational centers. It has been carried out annually since 2014.
The project arises from the need to respond to the high unemployment rate among young people in Castilla y León. To this end, the Instituto de la Juventud de Castilla y Leon and 26 vocational education centers combine forces, synergies and work teams in order to increase the linguistic and professional skills of people between 18 and 30 who have just finished their studies of VET in commercial activities, hairdressing, electromechanics and bodywork of vehicles, bakery, pastry and confectionery, administrative management, conduction of sports physical activities in the natural environment, auxiliary nursing care, social health care for people in situations of dependency, cuisine and gastronomy, catering services, wood and furniture, micro-computer systems and networks. A total of 60 participants who practice for 89 days in companies from another country: Italy, Poland, United Kingdom or Ireland. This aims to achieve the following results: an increase in the competences of the participants in linguistic terms and professional techniques, cooperation between the different institutions that care for the benefit of young people such as the Youth Institute of Castilla y León, belonging to the Regional Ministry of Family and Equality of Opportunities of the Junta de Castilla y León, and vocational training centers of the region, to increase knowledge of the labor market by these institutions and better respond to the needs of employability of youth.
This project is developed at European level with the intention of growing by all the partners involved towards new possibilities of learning and employment, as well as the enrichment between educational systems and youth policies within the European Union. The impact of this project lies in:
Obtained by the participants of a Europass mobility certificate that accredits the skills acquired during their mobility experience in another country. The different project partners will see their capacity to work with entities of different nature and different countries strengthened. There will be an approach between the shipping partners and the companies that will facilitate a greater knowledge of the labor and educational reality of the participants. This will encourage a reflection on the educational focus of the institutions. The success of the project will influence the decision-making and public opinion of our region, betting on similar mobility programs financed by the own resources of public organisms. The intercultural aspect will influence the local community where the participants have lived, increasing the attractiveness of mobility programs and arousing interest in other cultures. A greater openness to new approaches and possible methodologies that the participant will contribute to the company where he practices. The participants will be more likely to have access to a job within their training sector. The consortium and the partners will launch a new mobility project to respond to the needs of new participants. They will include improvements according to the evaluation of the project that concerns us. Improvement and creation of tools to manage mobility projects by all partners. Participants will be able to apply learning planning tools to their day-to-day and professional future. As for the Center, the strategy of internationalization through the Mobility Programs, means to definitively achieve the Modernization that will revert in the Center, which makes it attractive and peculiar in the eyes of future students and companies. Interest in new educational centers to establish collaborations with social agents outside the educational sphere, and more related to employment and labor policies. Inclusion of mobility programs in political strategies related to youth at the regional level. Opening of new contacts and possible collaborations, sharing of ideas and initiatives among the different agents of the project. Possibility of planning in time ErasmusPro mobility projects or other European programs.

Diputación of Pontevedra is a public institution clearly committed to the sustainable development of the province. That is why some projects are focused on addressing the different problems faced by the area: waste management, unemployment, tourism, urban and rural development, sewer mains, etc.

In this sense, this proposal intends to contribute to mitigate the unemployment figures, that remain high, despite the gradual decrease in the unemployment rate since 2012. In addition, there are young people with no motivation for employment, low-skilled in a second language, and with little ICT competences at a professional level, and therefore, with difficulty for access to labour market. Furthermore, we find companies in the province demanding prepared young people, as a consequence of the competitiveness misbalance within the European common market that cannot satisfy companies' needs, feeding the EU skills gap.

In order to overcome such skills gap of the province, with a strong rural character, the Diputación has formed a Consortium, with 37 VET schools in Pontevedra and Employment Workshop and authorized courses with Certificate of Competences, which will offer 105 young VET graduates in one of these centres, the possibility of carrying out work practices, for 6 months (ErasmusPro), in a European company. Participants must return from their mobility within 12 months after obtaining their degree. The international practices will not be part of the Workplace Training Programmes (FCT) but will add value to the training previously carried out in companies in the province.
The participants will also carry out a formative linguistic activity through the online tool "OLS". In the case of participants travelling to Iceland and Norway, they will take an intensive course of language, in a destination of 2 weeks duration.

The countries of destination are: United Kingdom, Ireland, Italy, Portugal, Malta, Germany, Romania, Cyprus, Bulgaria, Poland, Slovakia, Crete, Sweden, Slovenia, Finland, Netherlands, Norway, Denmark, Iceland and France. The mobilities will be completed with preparatory visits of 4 supervisors from the Diputación to Sweden, Crete, Romania and Italy.

The project also includes mobility of 15 teachers and staff of the Diputación who have shown their interest in observing practices in: Portugal, Poland, Slovakia, Italy, Crete, Romania, Sweden, France and Netherlands. The practices will consist of visiting training centres similar to the integrated centres of vocational training in Galicia, in order to learn new didactic methods used in the country of destination.

Therefore, PRACTICUM DEPO 2018 has set out the following specific targets in order to achieve the overall goal:
- Facilitate the acquisition of professional experience at international levels.
- Increase innovative knowledge and entrepreneurship in the participants.
- Encourage the practice and improvement of a second language and obtaining technical vocabulary of the professional sector of the participants.
- Facilitate the transition from the educational system to the labour market of the participants.
- Promote synergies between the educational and labour worlds
- Develop skills and knowledge that improve their skills and abilities in front of any job, project or situation.
- Implement the concept of European citizenship and become aware of the importance of international mobility to create free and respectful generations with other cultures or societies

It is expected that with PRACTICUM DEPO 2018 will generate more qualified, integral and, therefore, confident young people, favouring the labour integration and contribute to the promotion and sustainability of the Erasmus + programme.
W przyszłość z europejskim doświadczeniem zawodowym.

“Into the future with European professional experience” is the title of the project whose main objective is to create an opportunity for the students to achieve success in the professional development and at the same time to raise the quality of teaching in our school. It will provide its participants with a real chance to gain knowledge, skills and professional qualifications often unique in the region. It will boost the perspectives of finding employment on both domestic and European market and strengthen the participants’ personal development. The project will raise the students’ intercultural awareness, understanding of different countries and cultures and it will enhance the feeling of citizenship and European identity. 
The direct participants of the project will be 72 students of our technical high school who in the school year 2018/2019 will be doing their regular, obligatory vocational training. The indirect participants will be the whole school and the local community.
32 students will have their apprenticeship in Spain and they will deal with drones. The students of electronics will learn how to design and construct the unmanned flying machines and the geodesy students will use the drones to measure the area. It is a new technique used in geodesy and it is called photogrammetry. The students will have their apprenticeship in Seville in two different companies, both of which set trends in their area on a European scale.
In Plymouth, Great Britain, in the centre of vocational education - Tellus Education Group, a group of 18 ICT students will have their training. The apprentices will be doing tasks connected with designing and constructing local computer networks and with managing ICT networks. Additionally, they will learn about the basics of robotics and designing Internet websites.
The students from the class that joins two professions: ICT and technology of renewable energy sources, will have their training in companies in Portugal where renewable energy is commonly used. They will gain their experience in repairing and servicing the devices used in this area.
The project will create an opportunity for all the participants to gain valuable, often unique in the region, professional experience. The students will compare European industry solutions with the ones used in Poland and they will verify their theoretical knowledge in practical aspect. They will boost their language competence, communication skills and the knowledge of professional vocabulary. Living with host families or in hostels, often with course participants from different countries, will teach them to be open to different cultures and attitudes. The experience of the trainees and the supervising teachers will have a positive influence on the whole school. The materials created during the training will be used in the process of education and in the syllabus. 
Each participant will receive the Europass Mobility document, which will confirm the professional, language and social skills gained by the apprentices. 

The recruitment of  the trainees will be based on clear rules. The participants will be provided with international transport, insurance, accommodation, meals and full mentoring from their own high school teachers of English, the teachers of adequate vocational subjects and the host organisation employees.
Before the start of the apprenticeship the students will have classes preparing them for a successful apprenticeship. There will be English language courses, classes with a native speaker and psychological workshops. Additionally, the students going to Spain and Portugal will learn the basics of the language of the host country both in Poland and during their stay there. They will also be given some information about the culture, traditions, customs and economy of the country they are going to visit. The rules of the recruitment, programme, regulations of the apprenticeship, the students’ rights and duties, safety regulations during the journey and stay abroad as well as cultural differences will be discussed before the training.
The students will disseminate the project results on Facebook accounts created especially for this purpose, the school website, through films and presentations, picture displays, meetings and interviews in the local media.  
At the end of the project there will be a conference summarising the project with the participation of the representatives of local authorities, vocational schools, local entrepreneurs, as well as students and parents.

Not only the students and the teachers will benefit from the project but also the whole school and local community. Its participants with their new European, professional experience will boldly and successfully walk into the future.

The consortium between the City Council and the Vocational Training Schools of Granada aims to create synergies at a local and international level which improve the vocational education received by young people and facilitate their access to the labour market.
This project derives from the global need to become part of the process of internationalisation and modernisation of education. The sending organisations include IES Cartuja, CE Ave Maria San Cristobal, IES Politécnico Hermenegildo Lanz, IES Francisco Ayala, IES Aynadamar, IES Zaidin Vergeles, CDP Atlántida and IES Virgen de las Nieves. This VET schools have experience in the management of European projects. With this new initiative, we intend to join efforts to contribute to the improvement of educational quality and to increase job opportunities.
To achieve this, we propose activities for students, who will do internships in companies, and activities for teaching staff, who will carry out a job-shadowing activity in VET schools. Regarding the students, the project includes 58 mobilities: 54 students of Initial Vocational Training (FPGM) will do their internship in companies for 87 days, hosting countries include the Netherlands, Italy, Germany, Ireland, United Kingdom and France; 4 students of Basic Vocational Training (FPB) will do their internships in Italy for 3 weeks. For Initial Vocational Training students, the project includes 13 accompanying teachers during the first week of stay. For Basic Vocational Training students, there are 2 accompanying teachers during the 3 weeks to reinforce the monitoring.
The internships will be recognised by the official module of Company Placements (FCT), which is common to all students. However, this experience will entail an added value for the participants at a personal and professional level. In addition to acquiring knowledge and skills in their field of speciality, they can benefit from a linguistic and cultural immersion, expanding their linguistic and personal skills. This will foster their autonomy and they will acquire a more versatile profile, which will facilitate their access to the labour market. It will also encourage motivation to continue with their education.
As for the teaching staff, the project includes 9 mobilities for a week in Finland, the Netherlands and the United Kingdom. Teachers can learn about other educational systems and observe the work carried out by other professionals. Thus, they can enrich their professional and methodological knowledge. They can learn about different resources, ICT, training programmes, etc. All this will have a very positive impact on the quality of the education provided, adapted to the needs of today's society.
For the proper management of the project, communication channels will be established between all the parties involved throughout the entire project. There will be a continuous contact between the City Council, school mobility coordinators, teaching tutors, participants, host and intermediary organisations and company tutors.
The City Council will be part of the Association of European Cities XARXA FP. This supposes an improvement in the quality of vocational education in Granada, promoting the mobility of students and teachers. In addition, we have the cooperation of different companies, including intermediary and host organisations with great experience in European projects, which will allow us to achieve the expected results.
Regarding the selection process, it will be carried out in a fair and transparent manner, publishing the established selection criteria. Then, we will organise practical issues (travel, accommodation, insurance, etc.) and quality issues (training programmes, agreements between different parties, etc.). Pedagogical, linguistic and cultural preparation will also be provided before the mobility.
Monitoring will take place during mobility period. Participants will have a teaching tutor and a company tutor, and communications will be established among all the parties to ensure compliance with the training programme and the adaptation and satisfaction of participants.
At the end of the mobilities, participants will obtain a certificate and the Europass Mobility document.
Each member will hold a meeting with the participants for the final evaluation of the project. All results will be shared between the coordinator and the members of the consortium to maximise the results. The results will be disseminated through different means: meetings, press and local TV, web pages, European platform, social networks ...
In conclusion, we intend to promote the internationalisation of education through innovative training programmes for students and lifelong training of teachers. In addition, we establish a European cooperation network for future projects, creating a greater sense of European citizenship and promoting Unity in Diversity.

Foreign vocational trainings for students are not only an attractive way of education but also an invaluable experience which is in demand among today’s employers expecting from their  employees attitude of enterprise, practical skills, good command of foreign languages, interest in new technologies and trends, activity, mobility and desire of lifetime learning.
 All this makes the Building School Complex in Konin (ZSBiKZ) take a number of actions to best prepare its students to find their own place on a difficult ever-changing job market. As a result, the school makes every possible effort to meet the requirements of the employers and tries to educate its graduates in order to make them ready to enter the job market as workers with both a rich portfolio and working experience gained from English, German and Spanish employers. 
Therefore, ZSBiKZ wants the students of all professions taught at Secondary Technical School and Basic Vocational School and their graduates to complete their apprenticeship in the UK, Spain and Germany. 
The apprenticeship for undergraduate/graduate students will take place in 5 groups in the years 2019-2020. Training institutions for 74 students are Tellus Group Ltd-Tellus College (UK), Vitalis GMBH (Germany) and EuroMind Projects (Spain).

English and German partners declared to organize 3 week traineeship in Plymouth and Leipzig best facilities for 3 groups of students (38 students). Spanish partner declared to organize 2 week apprenticeship for 2 groups of students (36 students). The first group of 16 students will be trained in the field of building construction in Ubeda ( building construction company based on BioConstruction program) and the second group of 20 students will be trained in Sevilla (there is a group of 10 students trained in land surveying field). Vocational training program, its time, place and realization are relevant to educational curriculum, apprenticeship (BioConstruction, Land Surveying) and base on interview analyzing students’ needs and preferences. 

Each group will have its own manager (the person working in the given place) and training will be monitored by the manager of Tellus Group Ltd., Vitalis Gmbh and EuroMind Projects and a teacher - traineeship guardian of the Building Schools Complex (ZSBiKZ).  

The project Erasmus+ gives students/graduates the opportunity to acquire additional skills and competences, gain professional experience (often impossible to obtain in Poland) confirmed by appropriate certificates. It inreases students’ chances on both local and European job market.
At the time of doing the traineeship, students will improve their professional skills, master English, German or Spanish language thanks to language course (Spain) and vocational training in a foreign language environment. The participants of the project will have the possibility to discover and enjoy the beauty and culture of the host country thanks to cultural activities, sightseeing tours or host families in the UK. 
Students will take part in intense English, Spanish or German language courses a few months before their departure to the UK, Spain or Germany. They will also participate in workshops about stress, conflict solutions, vocational counseling and safety regulations in the workplace, the ability of creating portfolio. 

The main aim of the project is to enable students of construction industry, land surveying, logistics, catering, hotel industry and landscape architecture to gain and improve vocational skills in attractive workplace conditions as well as to give them the opportunity to increase their chances on the job market. Moreover, students will be able to get to know needs of the European employers and European job market. Other aims include raising students’ vocational mobility, providing the opportunity to verify the knowledge and skills gained in school, practicing language skills. At the same time, the school itself will gain experience in handling international projects.

Thanks to the project, all 74 students will get new qualifications  and  vocational skills in
the UK, Spain and Germany confirmed by certificate and the Europass Mobility in Polish, English, Spanish and German languages, ECVET,  they will be able to improve their English and German language, learn how to deal with stressful situations, create their own EUROPASS CV and electronic Portfolio. All these things will significantly help students look for better job opportunities in the future.

The school itself will also benefit from the implementation of the project as it influences the quality of work. 

The Building Schools Complex in Konin (ZSBiKZ Konin) will present project results on school website, exhibitions, seminaries and will include vocational internship in the school curriculum. The project itself will contribute to the promotion of school and its students’ achievements (future graduates) in local environment.
Nowoczesne narzędzia IT, w tym gry i grywalizacja wspomagające nauczanie dorosłych jako źródło konkurencyjności Fundacji MIERO

The project "Modern IT tools supporting adult education, including games and gamification as a source of competitiveness of the MIERO Foundation" is aimed at educators, trainers, and volunteers of the MIERO FOUNDATION employed on the basis of a contract of employment, civil contract or voluntary agreement. The participants of the project are people who have the motivation to lead classes in games and gamification in the future and use other modern IT tools in the process of adult education, in particular in the areas of entrepreneurship and decision-making.
Statistical data show that in Europe, the industry that generates the most new professions, we can include IT industries and all industries cooperating with digitization [Source: Foresight Publication of Personnel of Modern Economy, PARP, 2009]. This digitization and new IT tools are more and more connected with education. In the future, it is therefore inevitable linking education with new technology.
"Game" can become a tool supporting the education process. Research show that the greatest pleasure comes from the process of participating in the game / game through the uncertainty of the results that eventually take place in it (W. Holmes et al., Neuroeducational research in the design and use of games-based teaching, vol. 1, Portugal 2013 , p. 236). Implementation of elements of gamification into the learning process using games fostered increasing the attractiveness of the learning process, and thus increasing the motivation and commitment of the students in educational activities (Z. Bieńkowska, Game that is hard to resist - can science be addictive?).
On the basis of the above knowledge, the European development plan of the MIERO Foundation has the following project objectives:
- implementation of new teaching tools in the form of games and gamification, in particular in the field of entrepreneurship education and decision-making.
- implementation of new IT teaching tools, including mapping, cloud,
- raising the competence of MIERO Foundation educators and volunteers, in particular in the use of games and gamification and new IT tools in adult education,
- introduction of new programs in the area of modern IT tools in adult education as well as games and gamification in teaching entrepreneurship and decision-making,
- giving the European dimension to the organization.
These goals will be achieved through the following activities:
- Participation of 5 employees in the training in the UK in the field of games and gamification.
 - Participation of 3 employees in the training in Portugal in the field of modern IT tools used in adult education.
The introduction of new training areas in the MIERO Foundation, including implying games and gamification in teaching entrepreneurship and decision-making and new IT tools supporting the teaching processes of already functioning trainings will be the result. 
The impact of the project will be local, national and international.
The methods used in the project are a method of critical analysis of materials received during the trainings, the survey method (during the evaluation questionnaire), SWOT analysis method - analysis of strengths and weaknesses, threats and opportunities to undertake work on the project (used to reduce project risk).
Long-term benefits result primarily from new skills and digital qualifications of participants, which in turn will affect the Foundation's growing competitive position, according to "Human Capital is the Foundation's Capital".
