Fourteen years of experience of the Goldenberg Europakolleg (GEK) – both a college of further education and a vocational school- offer an established project background and a perfect basis for ERASMUS+. 
Both of the school’s locations are situated in major economically important areas near Cologne. Our cooperation with many successful, internationally active companies (in the fields of agricultural machinery, chemistry, metalworking industry) demands a vocational training which prepares trainees, and the teaching staff as well for the challenges of a growing European job market. 
The GEK is a European School which highly values on their European oriented education. We offer a variety of language courses (English, Dutch, French, Spanish) and consider it to be important that our students have the opportunity to use these languages in real-life professional situations, which take place during a three week internship work placement abroad.
Here, our project background and our project objectives are closely linked. The VET mobilities of trainees as well as trainers lead to an increased cross-cultural understanding of a common Europe.
The experiences of our students abroad lead to a higher self-confidence and encourage them to seek for job possibilities beyond their country borders. Another project objective is that “Europe” is part of the school’s curriculum. Lessons in various subjects deal with topics that are relevant for a European way of thinking. This is supported by the school’s „student-project-week“, which offers a variety of projects focusing on Europe.   
With the start of ERASMUS+, the GEK is able to offer almost 100 mobility participants the chance to travel and work abroad in 2018/19. This follows the plans of our district council in Cologne to raise the number of vocational mobilities to 10%.  These participants are f. e. technicians for illumination advertisements, electricians for automation engineering, chemical lab assistants, metal workers and technical assistants in the field of design.
So far we have organized VETPRO-projects for trainers and teachers which took them to our partners abroad for one week. They worked under the title “Teaching the European Way”. Our IVT-projects under the title “Different Places-Different Faces” enabled our students to work for three weeks in Finland, Rumania, Malta, Great Britain and on the island of La Palma.
All those activities are coming together with ERASMUS+ and the GEK is offering future participants to work under the title “IVT quality+”. Therefore our teachers already had the possibility to take part in trainings for one/up to three weeks abroad.
In addition to our mobility under KA1, we also succesfully applied for a KA2 mobility. 
But the GEK does not only send students abroad, we also welcome our partner school’s students from Finland here in the Rhineland area. The teachers and trainers of the GEK organize accommodation and internships with our cooperating companies in the field of electrical engineering, chemistry and design. These internships usually last from four to six weeks.
Our project implementation has been consistently improved and is now divided into 3 main stages: 1. The application phase: In this stage students qualify by participating in cross-cultural preparation lessons. Here they also create a europass CV in English and pass a mobility interview, to show their motivation to work abroad. The participants take part in the OLS-test before travelling abroad. This stage ends in an intercultural evening which prepares all the participants for their upcoming departure day.
2. The actual stay abroad: During this time, the students are monitored, both by the local partners as well as the responsible teachers and trainers of the GEK. The participants document their linguistic, social, personal and professional impressions and experiences in a travel diary called “Travelog”. It is an important instrument of the third stage of the mobility project. 3. The evaluation of the experience abroad: With the help of the Travelog their gained competence are documented and can be comprehended. Later on these competences are evaluated in our competence overview, which are used to fill out the europass Mobility certificate. Conclusively the partcipants take part in another OLS-test after their return.
The project results, their benefits as well as their impact are closely related. The Europass Mobility is one example. It is used for future applications by our trainees after the end of their vocational training, as well as by our teaching staff for better career chances. This document increases their career prospects on the national and European job market. 
Our collaboration with regional companies that employ apprentices of our foreign project partners, often results in the decrease of language barriers and more cultural acceptance. By implementing our European mobilities we spread the idea of Europe within the GEK and also on a regional level.
PLUS-Mechatronics Ultimate Skills in Europe & SMART Specialisations

The project proposal PLUS-MUSE&SMART falls within the programming framework outlined in the Erasmus+ VET Mobility Charter obtained in 2016. The proposed project is in line with the Internationalization Strategy described in the Charter application, it further develops the experience made in 2017 and fully responds to the most recent labour market needs.  
The project is addressed to 100 participant, having obtained a VET school diploma for no longer than one year and residing in the province of Trentino in Italy. 
Project participants will have gained technical and professional skills during the school curriculum and have a profile that fits with a professional development in the SMART SPECIALIZATIONS fields. In the Province of Trento such fields have been identified with Agrifood, Quality of Life, Energy and Environment, Mechatronics. These sectors require good command of the following technologies: advanced manufacturing systems, biotechnologies, micro-nano technologies, ICT, advanced materials. The project is aimed at exploiting the learning opportunities offered by on-the-job training, in the form of a long-term workexperience. 
With a view to improve the whole local system approach towards on the job training, a mobility to the benefit of 8 members of staff involved in mobility and in dual training will be organised 
As regards the learners, the project will be not only aimed at reinforcing non-formal learning thanks to the opportunity to play an active role in a work context but also at improving their competencies and qualifications for better quality and faster job opportunities. The mobility learning outcomes will be tailored to the single participant and specialization sector in order to obtain a final certification of competence in the relevant sector. The potential companies where the workexperience will take place have already been pre-selected, in order to identify quality environments where the learning outcomes can reasonably be met. Along with the professional competencies, the mobilities will also be expected to improve participants’ linguistic and social competencies.  
Mobilities will take place in Germany, the UK, Ireland, Bulgaria and Spain, for 8 groups of 10/14 participants, with a duration of 12 weeks. 
The contents and the learning outcomes of the internships will be discussed with the companies and the participants. Participation to the PLUS-MUSE&SMART project will be based on a public open call for selections, with an application to be submitted by interested candidates.
Before the internship abroad, a preliminary linguistic, cultural and pedagogical preparation stage of 2 weeks will be carried out in Trento, to be financed with regional resources. The learners will also benefit from using the European OLS platform. The experience abroad will also include a 3-day initial induction and preparation to the workplacment. At the end of the experience abroad, 2 days of programme follow up will be organized in Trento. 
Upon return to Italy, a second workexperience of 8 weeks in Trentino will be available for the most technologically advanced sectors. This final stage will be entirely financed with regional resources. 
The project identifies specific quality tools which will be applied and combined in the tutoring, monitoring, and certification stage, both by the Sending and by Receiving organizations. 
As regards the 8 staff, a mobility of 4 days will be activated in collaboration with a German Partner Organization having the necessary requested experience. The programme will deepen cutting-edge tools, practices, methodologies and procedures, and will combine a theoretical component with practical observation one. The programme will be aimed at improving the competencies of the staff in managing and coordinating VET mobilities, and in enhancing the value of transnational mobility as a training tool.  
The whole PLUS-MUSE&SMART project will be accompanied by promotion, monitoring, evaluation and dissemination actions, to take place at the start, during and at the end of the project.
OIKOS - Opportunities and International Keys for Occupational Skills

Liceo Azuni's internationalization strategy is focused on the continuous development of key competences for lifelong learning (2006/962/CE) and for an active citizenship (Decree 22/08/2007 att. 2). Its framework is an educational approach based on meaningful learning and centred on the promotion of the human being. 
This project, which is in the second stage of a four-year plan, consists of a mobility flow of 40 students towards the United Kingdom, France and Germany who will be coordinated by 4 teachers and 4 members of our staff. 
The middle and long-term strategy aims at a gradual increase of the mobility: from the third year, this will be implemented by expanding the destinations located in the Mediterranean area and/or in the Northern, Central and Eastern European countries and, due to the expected increase of know-how and operational strategies, we will increase the number of students (up to 50) involved in the mobility project. The time spent abroad will enable beneficiaries to carry out an internship in companies or institutions selected with the support of transnational partners (A1 activity of the present form). The privileged sectors will be consistent with the educational targets of our school: cultural heritage and tourism, public and private institutions operating in the field of communications (primarily for students enrolled in the classical humanities course of our school); art and entertainment, with particular regard to music and dance, will be the fields of interest of some other students (especially those who are enrolled in Liceo Azuni's music and dance related courses).   
These activities will allow the implementation of disciplinary theoretical acquisitions and the development of the ability to transfer the so-called soft skills in the workplace. It is expected that the placements will produce effective results in terms of a conscious study and/or work guidance and, thanks to the Europass and the ECVET certification provided within the project, enhance employability. The habit to intercultural dialogue and the familiarity with foreign languages, as natural outcomes of the mobility experiences, will allow young citizens living in a place strongly determined by insularity, to open themselves to local, regional and national opportunities, which of course relate to the European context of the knowledge society and to the global market.
These targets are consistent with those identified by the European International Agenda 2020, which is an essential point of reference for our school's educational plan. The latter already promotes the learning of two foreign languages through a series of activities: exchange projects with European schools and linguistic internships abroad (Germany, France, Denmark); collaboration with the local branch of the Alliance Française and with the authorized Cambridge and IELTS test centres in the organization of courses for the achievement of international linguistic certifications. This is complementary to the CLIL methodology, which we intend to strengthen and extend to a second foreign language through the simultaneous mobility of staff members (A2 activity of this form). The latter will be able to optimize the effectiveness of the mobility project and make a direct impact on all members of the school and, by virtue of the formal and informal dissemination of activities among colleagues, improve the ability to change learning/teaching methods. Indeed, the strengthening of linguistic skills, CLIL teaching methods and the use of ITC, objectives shared with the partner organizations, will immediately lead to the enrichment of professional resources of the school, which will be also improved by the exchange of good practices acquired through future experiences of job shadowing. 
We also intend to aim at new curricula that will cover from the starting year the learning of two foreign languages and that will allow the strengthening of student-centred teaching methods that optimize the resources offered by new technologies. 
In view of the fact that a high percentage of students engaged in internship experiences abroad is represented by minors, the presence of teachers as tutors is required (one out of ten students for the entire duration of the mobility). Their ongoing professional support on-site guarantees the smooth running of the experience and its enrichment. Tutors’ function will especially be a continuous, informal monitoring of the placements, in order to evaluate their effectiveness in terms of professional value through meetings with beneficiaries and briefing within the hosting realities. Tutors will also have the task of ensuring adequate living conditions for the young participants.

Öresundsgymnasiet, earlier Allvar Gullstrand Landskrona has vocational/general education. Together with some vocational programmes/schools in the vicinity we constitute Technic College Western Scania.
We have offered our vocational students traineeship periods abroad since 2006. Our two first Leonardo applications “Expanding Horizons” 2006:1002 and Exploring Horizons” 2008:529 encompassed only the tech programme at Allvar Gullstrand. The certified project “Experiencing Horizons 2010 – 2014 (LLP-LdV-MC-10/S/689) included more vocational programmes/schools . In the VET Learner Mobility 2014-KA102-000277, we involved Svalöfs Gymnasium and established a consortium, through which we established   a traineeship network for schools in Landskrona/Svalöv. In the Mobility Charter 2015-1-SE01-KA109-012379 Svalöv was not eligible due to lacking activity years. We have during these years enlarged the number of partners abroad. 
Öresundsgymnasiet suffered 2016-17 from organization unrest with redundancy and project downtime. The school ambassador for EU, educated 2011, has worked according to the  internationalization strategy , written 2015 and the new school leaders have associated. 
Some students suffer from ADHD/ADD/other psychological disorders, which demand an adult there at the beginning of the traineeship and due to this we apply for some accompanying people.
It is important for the students to see more of the outside world to create user friendly and competitive products and services and to attune their professional skills and experiences to European demands and values. We want to increase their innovation abilities, strengthen their vocational qualifications and their employability in Europe where competition no longer has geographical, cultural and linguistic borders. We want to give the students more self-confidence contributing to their personal development. Through the traineeship abroad we try to expand/extend the horizons for them to explore/ experience and give them an international perspective for their future. The professional world is international and by working at companies abroad during the last traineeship period with succeeding feedback, discussions, validations (ECVET, Europass) and dissemination at home the students develop their quality awareness, their creativity and their entrepreneurship at the same time as we fortify the European idea. Europe is their future labour market! We want to emphasize the importance of languages skills in Europe with extended contacts across the borders and for future employers. 
The experiences the students bring home affect the modeling of future education and traineesship periods at local level. Their international perspective is a welcome contribution for future employment in local companies or elsewhere enlarging the competitiveness of Swedish enterprise. 
Landskrona has a high youth unemployment percentage and also many immigrants of second/third generations. This project tries to offer a way to diminish youth unemployment and enhance the knowledge of EU and what EU may offer youths in Landskrona. It is important that we can keep the education quality on a high level, counteract the segregation between natives and immigrants, offer a future without unemployment and work against the school dropout rate.
Through the new offer Erasmus Pro we give our graduating students the possibility within one year after their upper school exam do a longer traineeship period abroad. 6 students believe that they will take advantage of this offer for between 4 and 9 months when they have finished school.
The possibilities for further education for the staff have long been few, which this project tries to remedy. We have a three-year Nordplusspråk project from autumn 2016 for vernacular teachers in the Nordic countries SE/DK/NO. We continue the benchmarking project COLLEAGUE, included in our internationalization strategy, focusing on pedagogical further training for our staff through job shadowing abroad. Teachers are expected to increase the education quality through feedback, validation (ECVET, Europass), dissemination among colleagues. Through job shadowing the staff has the possibility to see and experience other pedagogics at the same time as they develop their quality awareness, their creativity and get a consolidated feeling for the European idea by studies/experience of modern use of ICT, multicultural classrooms, school dropout rate, EU for youths/as future labour market and an international standard in vocational education. The teachers do need further education and during 2016 -2018 we were visited by 17 job shadowers from ES, HR, DE, IT, PT, FR, which also contributed to further education for our own teachers/schoolleaders.
In the charter application 2015 we anticipated approximately 60 learner and 15 staff mobilities for the years 2018 - 2020, which we follow. The new Erasmus Pro will, however, increase our predicated budget.
VIVRE ET TRAVAILLER EN EUROPE VII

In line with the quality commitment of the ERASMUS VET Charter awarded and as part of the international strategy integrated in the educational program of the 7 vocational schools of Provence Formation, the implementation of tangible actions, already effective in the 2017 project, will be continued with the 2018 project 
Relying on the achievements and on a proven quality management of mobility projects since 2007, the objectives, in line with the ERASMUS program, aim at developing young people and professionals’ mobility in order to integrate internationalisation in curriculum, professional development in the long term.
The main activities and developments expected are:

1/Learners
• Assure that the number of learners mobilities in European forms in Bac Pro Sales, Commerce, Administration keeps growing, making thus a mobility abroad the key-stone of this curriculum:
-47 students are pre selected, some in their 1 st year (1 ere), giving them the opportunity to experience another mobility in their last year (Terminale)
• Offer mobility experience to students in a larger range of vocational fields facilitating thus their socio-professional inclusion by using and developing new skills:
-Bac Pro Esthétique: 7
-Bac Pro ARCU (Customer Service): 7
-Bac Technologique STMG (Management): 8 for whom the experience will revolve around a project based training to build with practical tasks to accomplish

• Facilitate and develop mobilities in Health Care, Catering and Hospitality, Logistics and Transport, Administration who are not  in European section: 58 students
 All together, 127 mobilities are planned for length of 2 to 5 weeks, supervised by 13 accompanying teachers in UK, Malta, and Finland with well-known partners and companies.

No mobilities of CAP in this application, 2 flows of 12 students are planned in March and November 2018
To date, mobilities in UK are scheduled between October 2018 and February 2019; due to an unknown participation to the ERASMUS program regarding the Brexit, several vocational schools of the cluster have already contacted partners in Denmark and Norway in order to plan preparatory visits. Moreover, Tellus offers placements possibilities in Poland and Italy that we are going to work on.

After the final selection, all students and staff will be prepared before their mobility; beside the European section in which a specific training is given to students, each team prepares a program adapted to students needs. Thanks to the training that many teachers involved in internationalisation of their school have followed, these “mobility workshops” are the practical use of their new skills while they also experiment new teaching methods.

2/Staff

• Accompanying staff ‘s assignments are numerous and necessary to guarantee the good working of the project and the management of the different flows:
-Supervision of students under 18, control of accommodation, placements, local transports
-Adjustments if necessary
-Assessment of the students at the end of the placement, compilation of all the official documentation to acknowledge learning outcomes: EUROPASS mobility, evaluation grid linked to the diploma, UFM (unite facultative de mobilité)
-Report on the flows

• Modernising and reinforcing the quality of teaching are also aimed at:
-15 teachers are engaged in the project in order to carry out a job shadowing in companies or vocational training centre in UK in Health Care, Sales, Catering and Hospitality
- 1 head teacher is willing to do the same in Italy in Catering and Hospitality
These mobilities focus on the professionalization of mobility stakeholders as well as teachers involved in DNL certification (Content and Language Integrated Learning)
All staff will have official recognition of their training with the EUROPASS passport

• The collaborative platform will be working in march 2018; all those involved in international projects will be able to share good practice, experiences, lessons plans and post relevant information. An « international » web page in French and English will allow a better communication on these projects

The aim of the project "European experience creates new opportunities" is to support pupils and employees in using, developing and gaining their professional and language skills by participating in professional practice in one of the European countries.
The aim of learning mobility is to improve their expertise and take advantage of opportunities in the labor market.
The aim of employee mobility is their professional development.
The Mobility Project is designed for pupils and employees of the Secondary vocational school of Business and Services in Krupina, who will be trained to practice in a partner organization in Poland. We plan to send 12 pupils - 6 pupils from the car-mechanic division and 6 students from the machine and equipment mechanics division. The accompanying teachers would be 4 - two from the Business and Services Department and two from the Food Department.
Pupils will take part in three-week professional practice at the workplace of the training center of the receiving organization in Krakow.
Weekly training is available for employees.
The expected date for both activities is February-May 2019.

Our strategy of internationalization is focused on developing the educational process by innovating the offered educational programs, increasing the expertise of pupils and our teachers and developing international cooperation. Participants will gain new experience in professional education at international level. At each stage of the project, we apply the elements of the ECVET system. 
Pupils will participate in the receiving organization of professional practice, achieving learning outcomes described through knowledge, skills and competences. The participant who successfully completes the learning outcomes will be assessed in relevant subject. Recognition of acquired knowledge, skills and competences - learning outcomes - will be reflected in the qualification profile of the graduate - implementation in the training program, Report Supplement. Participants receive the Certificate and the Europass Mobility.
Pupils will acquire professional competencies - car-mechanic:
Detecting errors, estimate needed and important repairs, repairs and replacement of damaged parts, testing the vehicle to check the repair, mount and service accessories such as radios and alarms
- machine and equipment mechanics:
Setting out the materials to be cut or joined, following engineering instructions and drawings, inspecting and testing cuts and joins, using precision measuring instruments, operating the semi-automatic spot-welding equipment used in high volume production lines, maintaining CNC machines

They will develop their personality skills, increase their self-esteem, self-confidence, taking responsibility, improve self-assessment, cooperation and develop interpersonal relationships. They will recognize the receiving organization, the culture of the host country. 
They will learn to orient themselves in a foreign environment. They recognize their European citizenship and verify the application of the principle of equal opportunities for EU citizens in the labor market.
They will improve their English language skills in professional terminology - tools and aids used in diagnostics, repair and assembly of cars, machinery and equipment, as well as communication in everyday life - accommodation, travel, shopping, presentation of our school and our country Slovakia.

Gained international experience should positively influence the attitude of pupils towards lifelong learning, which is important for their application to the European labor market. They motivate pupils to participate in other international programs.

The aim of the teaching staff training is to transfer the acquired experience, new ideas, methods and approaches to teaching in our country - the innovation of the educational program.
Teachers will know the partner institution and they will be able to compare training in our country and in Poland. Their international mobility will help them to develop language competencies. We suppose the increase of teacher’s participation in other projects.
For the school, active approach is needed, as everyone is responsible for its international development.
The results of the project and the experience gained will be published on the website.

By implementing the project activities, we will create a partnership with the Tellus Education Group. During the preparatory phase of the project, we agreed with the partner organization on the working conditions and documents needed to implement the project, identify tasks, responsibilities and solve financial issues.

Since not all participants will be 18 years old, the presence of accompanying persons is necessary. Accompanying persons are also required to monitor the participants during their work and therefore to evaluate their work experience. Their role is to help pupils to communicate in a foreign language, to help ensure the smooth running of the mobility, to prepare photos.

Within the framework of Erasmus +, BIC Ljubljana is intensifying its cooperation with its long-standing partners, that are providing high-quality student placements and high-quality staff training. We regularly carry out all the planned mobilities, which we expand every year, as we want to find quality learning places for all the educational programs that we implement. We update the content of curricula based on experience from abroad. Cooperation with education organizations lead to several examples of good practices (eg transfer of chemical labeling practices) to the introduction of modern methods of teaching. With mobility, we raise the level of professional profile of staff and thus the quality of the education process. VET practical education abroad enables the integration of professional and soft competences - in practice and in daily organizational problems. We strive to maintain a constant connection with global trends in the profession and the labor market, and therefore we strongly encourage staff training and therefore we cooporate in Erasmus + program as well as with national programs (Raising Vocational Teacher Competencies).
In the past year, we met with ECVET expert and implemented improvements to follow ECVET principles more systematically. In recognizing student learning outcomes, we take into account and assess the acquired knowledge abroad. One of the novelties is the form, which gives us an assessment of the practical knowledge of every student at a foreign employer. All participants in mobility also receive Europass mobility.
The selection of students is carried out on the basis of published criteria and the counseling service can propose candidates according to special needs and social status.
We pay special attention to the preparation of students for mobility - we conduct a workshop on preparing CVs and take care of the transfer of international experiences among students. A part of the preparations is also a language course and a review of the geography / history of the host.
Teachers are involved in the preparation of documents and the organization of the path, and receive practical information from colleagues who have already been on training in a given host country.
In the past year, we attended a workshop at CMEPIUS entitled "Strengthening the employment potential of students" and implemented new methods in the framework of student mobility evaluation. After mobility, we meet with students and we embed an international experience with an emphasis on the acquired soft competencies. In this way, students share informal experiences with us, and on the basis of the information obtained we improve the next mobility and prepare students better for them.
With teachers returning from mobility, we discuss the quality of work placements and staff training places in order to improve them in the future. After the completion of the project, teachers are provided with instructions for obtaining points. They also submit a report to their pedagogical supervisor, to fulfill their training announced in the yearly work plan.
Students give their experiences to classmates and the general public (blog), and teachers to staff and employers. The result of knowledge learned abroad is a book pastry Kruharije & Cukrnije with recipes and methods, which have been taught abroad for many years. Teachers of the Veterinary Techniques (VT) program are regularly involved in the training and introduce the most recent practical tasks (PEPAS system) in professional matura courses of the VT program.
Every 2-3 years at BIC Ljubljana we organize an international professional conference where we connect our participants of education and professional public from Slovenia and abroad. We often associate the conference with Erasmus + invited lecturers from abroad.
With E + mobility we aim to improve the employability of students. The former student participated in the first mobility at the time she attended the BIC LJ as a confectioner. Later, she enrolled to vocational college BIC LJ and again successfully applied for the Erasmus + placement. She found her practice at a high-quality employer in Belgium - Del Rey confectionery, ranked among the 100 best confectioners in the world. At the end of the practice, she was offered an immediate regular employment, which she intends to accept immediately after graduation.
Generaly the sscope of mobility is expanding. In this project, we start with more long-term mobilities (14 - 60 days) and mobility without accompanying persons. For the first time in the application form we also add the possibility of practical training for adult participants in the VET  program and mobility after the completion of the high school programs.
We provide an accompanying person in some mobilities (short-term) because they relate practical work to the content of school work, and thus provide short-term mobility efficiency.

MAIN ACTIVITIES AND EVENTS DEVELOPMENT.
All activities needed to be accomplished for a quality mobility project are meant to achieve short- and long-term goals.We wish to increase the number of students and teachers to enjoy a quality mobility project abroad.
For this reason we made contact with a new partner organization from Malta, Easy Job Bridge, which we met at the Intern. Conference hosted by the School Centre NG, which has been cooperating with them for a long time.
We changed our partner organization in GB, because they did not help us reach our goals completely. We are therefore enhancing the number of students adding four more students and two teachers, which means 1% of the students in our school.
We are planning to improve the quality of our mobility projects for students and teachers and to increase the amount of school exchanges (mobilities).
The students involved in mobility project 2017 in London, visited two salons where two former students work. They both underlined that working abroad is very demanding. However, they constantly upgrade their career goals. The students also interviewed Trevor Sorbie, the owner of one of the two salons. His life experience deeply impressed the students and consequently their schoolmates too, because Trevor Sorbie is an internationally renowned hairstyling icon. He confirmed that we can overcome obstacles thanks to our good will, perseverance and commitment. 
We will maximize further possibilities to enable students and accompanying (acc.) teachers to share their newly acquired knowledge and experience by making, for example, a presentation at the employer's salon, through various promotions at the elementary schools, at the Chamber of Craft and Small Business , at TV Ljubljana.
In 2018 we wish to increase the cooperation with schools from Central Europe and ex-Yugoslavia countries. We are arranging preparatory meetings at the secondary school in Čakovec, Croatia, in Novi Sad and Ruma, Serbia, where teachers who were at our school in December 2017 from the secondary school in Pećinci, Serbia, will help us.
During our prep. meetings in 2017 in Parnu (EST.), Havirov (CZ), Lorient (FR) and teachers' visit to our school from Helsinki (FIN), Čakovec (CRO) and Pećinci (SRB) we presented our projects through our different school activities. We agreed with the coordinators on inviting on 9th May 2018 professional teachers from Lorient, Parnu, Čakavec and Havirov to our Hairstyling Fashion Show organized by our 3rd year students.
In 2018 we intend to continue with the Spanish language course after learning our first Spanish words in Spring 2018. If the teachers are interested, we will organize an English language course to enhance their knowledge.
As far as internationalization is concerned, we are organizing an English language course for employers owning a salon who are involved in mobility projects and help foreign students to carry out their vocational training placement. The course is held by our teacher Monica Caltran who is training skills in Erasmus+ projects at school. The main Erasmus+ coordinator is joining the education training 'Efficient and Effective Project Management for EU funded projects' in Barcelona from 30th July to 3rd August 2018.
EVENTS DEVELOPMENT IN ATTACHMENT 1.
NEED FOR ACCOMPANYING TEACHERS.
Our students are 16 or 17 years old. Only few of them have already flown. Therefore the acc. teachers play a vital role starting from their help at the airport.
The teachers are together with the students only for one week. After that the students are supposed to be independent. As a relatively small school a teacher can't be absent from work for a long time. Due to family obligations teachers can't afford to stay abroad for a month. According to our experience our organization system works well. Although the students find it difficult to cope when the teachers leave, they are positively surprised after a few days by their independence and ingenuity. The transition is thus easier and smoother, the parents feel more relieved.The acc. teachers are in most cases also tourist guides, because they do some sightseeing with the students. They help them to orientate themselves, to get familiar with the new school and professional environment. Teachers and students keep contact with each other through e-mails, skype or telephone calls.
If two teachers take part in the mobility project, they join a job-shadowing. The teachers play two roles in this case. We are sending two professional teachers to Great Britain, because Salon International and The Alternative Hair Show are of fundamental importance from a professional point of view and enable them to share their expertise with the colleagues.
In 2017 one employer, who is a mentor to our and foreign students, participated in the above mentioned fair and show. In the future we are going to organize other mobility projects involving employers and making sure they will get high quality training in their field.

Main activities

The selection procedure for mobility participants will be conducted according to a predetermined timetable. We want to make the process transparent, and open to all students. This can be achieved with clear selection criteria an competent commission We will start the selection process with a public call in March, and we will finish it by publishing the results  in the months of April or May.

The next step is to prepare a mobility program. We have already concluded agreements with host organizations with which we have agreed on responsibilities and tasks.
After completing the selection process, we will send data on students, mobility participants (CV, "Learning outcomes") to all host organizations. On the basis of these documents, we will jointly develop training programs in times of mobility. Teachers of professional subjects will also assess the suitability of the program.  We will start with the introduction of ECVET tools for the WBL program.
For the teachers, we will prepare the program in cooperation with them and the coordinator of the host organization. Self-initiative by the teacher is important.
On the basis of the mobility program, we will prepare contractual documentation, which will be the basis for the financial and content implementation of each mobility.

The organization of the travel and accommodation of students will be organized in agreement with the host organizations. In previous mobility projects, this part of the preparations was carried out without major problems. It is important that the procedures are completed at least one month before the beginning of mobility.

In the field of preparing the participants of mobility, there are many possibilities for improvement. So far, we have carried out longer preparations only in the case of students leaving for mobility within the scope of 20 days. In this case, we organized the preparations within one week. In the future, we will continue with this form of preparation. In other cases, shorter preparations were carried out. In the new project, we intend to organize longer preparations for other students. The terms will be selected so that students will not miss regular classes (weekends, after school lessons).

Monitoring of participants in the time of mobility is carried out in various ways. On the way to the host organization we always try to ensure the teacher's escort. The teacher as a companion is with the students only for the first few days. They teach students how to travel safely, check the quality of the accommodation and accompany pupils to the workplace.
Progress at the workplace is monitored by the mentor of the student. Indirectly, the coordinator of the sending and receiving organization is included in the monitoring. So far, teachers of professional subjects have not yet taken part in this process. We will start this in the new project. A teacher of professional subjects will already be involved in the preparation of the training program, and then in contact with the mentor in the company. The system of cooperation of teachers of professional subjects and mentors in companies will be developed gradually.

Evaluation of each mobility will be done in several areas. So far, we have not systematically dealt with the evaluation. The main method of evaluation was the interview with students who returned from mobility. In the document "Strategy of Internationalization", the areas of evaluation were defined. By preparing appropriate mechanisms and systematic work, we will be able to monitor and improve the overall mobility process.

Dissemination of activities will take place in the framework of all promotional activities of School Center Kranj: events, web site, social networks, Radio Kranj, Zlatopoljčan magazine ... We will spread the results both among employees and participants in education as well as in the local environment.

The scope of mobility flows

The two-year project we will involve 86 students and 12 teachers. There are also 12 accompanying teachers envisaged.
In the project, all student mobility will take two to four weeks. The aim of all mobility is to improve knowledge in the field of expertise, better linguistic competence, a sense of understanding of the European perspective and the acquisition of other key competences.
Teacher mobility will take place simultaneously with student mobility. In Macedonia, teachers will prepare education for the teachers of the school in the field of electrical engineering and mechatronics. In the United Kingdom, teacher mobility will be carried out in the form of "Job shadowing".
The task of accompanying teachers is to safely monitor students on the way to the host organization, help with the installation and viewing of the workplace of the pupil. In addition, teachers get to know the host organization, learn about the school system, see examples of good practices, gain new contacts, etc.

Project: Vocational Training through Mobility to Success!
ACTIONS FOR ACHIEVING INTERNATIONALIZATION STRATEGY GOALS OF VSEE:
The Technological progress worldwide is associated with automation, electronics and IT innovations, which changes the image of industry.  This leads to the necessity of permanent development of technical specialists, so they can adapt quickly to the industrial market changes. In the context of global changes the students and teachers of VSEE have to possess flexible and adaptive competences, important for developing themselves as competitive specialists with professions of the future. The school team shows interest in leading the high school to direction – school with high-level vocation training, meeting employers’ needs, not only in Bulgaria but also globally. This will increase the capacity of the region, country and worldwide with qualified specialists. 
Training students in professions and qualifications, with priority for the modern economy, VSEE emphasize on fighting early school dropping because of low qualification, illiteracy, language handicaps, social inequality, digital competence and digital citizenship.  
In the period 2015-2020 VSEE school team will accomplish the following actions:
-Institutional commitment for internationalization: network enlargement with business partners, vocational schools, colleges, signing agreements of partnership with them and European universities, aiming new cooperation; raising teachers’ qualification by gaining international experience, acquired during international mobility or accompanying person in students’ mobility; taking part in joint projects with foreign companies presented in Bulgaria; organization and conducting international conferences, seminars and round tables, which present new opportunities for cooperation and contacts in academic and business environment; developing new “Erasmus+” projects and participating in motilities.
-Internationalization of school programs and content:  they will be updated jointly with the international business and educational partners in the field of VET and foreign languages, aiming actuality and high adaptability for international employment.
-Students and teaching staff: stimulating three/one -week mobility – practical training in vocational schools, colleges and high-technology companies in the frame of “Erasmus+ “ - 40 students each year and minimum 7 VET teachers.
EXPECTED DEVELOPMENT: enlarged partner’s network for innovative and good practices exchange in VET field, social equality and active citizenship; students completed mobility will fill up the lack of vocational skills in the innovative sectors of European Economics, with untaken job vacancies in the field of technical science technologies; our VET school will enhance the traditional education with innovative  training and techniques, meeting the needs of global industry, will integrate international intercultural and global approaches in training. This will lead to transferring  and accumulating educational results, validating qualifications and competences and increasing transnational mobility; VSEE will become modern educational institution, meeting global markets needs with proved authority, focused on professionals, necessary in the society, business, science and education.
According to our planned strategy of internationalization and school needs of increasing vocational training of teachers and students in 2018/2019 school year  40 students in year 11 and 12 from all vocational qualifications and 7 VET teachers will participate in mobility.
Students’ mobility will be 3 weeks, 15 working days and teachers’ -1 week 6 working days. These nobilities are based on high number of students 944 and 72 teachers, most of whom speak English language.
Planned flows  are: 
- 12 students  -Vocational Technical School, Liberec , Check Republic, 2 accompanying teachers
- 14 students  -VET Centre  Tellus Ed Group, Portsmouth, UK, 2 accompanying people,
- 14 students  -VET Centre  Tellus ED Group, Portsmouth, UK, 2 accompanying people,
- 8 VET teachers -VET Centre WBStraining,  Dresden, Germany 
Working language for all participants will be English. The majority of the students-participants will be under 18. We are planning 6 accompanying people because the students will carry out their training on different work placements, in different parts of the cities. Accompanying teachers will be participants’ tutors and will help them with the logistics and adapting to foreign cultural and language environment. They will aid the successful accomplishment of the practical training, will communicate with VSEE team, will contribute to the integration of acquired competences and experience during the mobility in the strategic development of the vocational school. 
Profile: VET, IT or language teachers in VSEE.

The project “The Way to Europe II.“ (07/2018 - 06/2019) is an important part of the school's internationalization strategy. The main activities contain internships in a company for 28 students of the Secondary School of Gastronomy in Ostrava-Hrabůvka (according to the plan in VET Charter). In addition to short-term placements, we also include long-term placements for fresh graduates of all fields of education. We do not plan the internship of employees for this Call, the placements took place within Call 2016. In accordance with the Action Plan EIS we are able to realize other activities - summer internships of pupils outside E +, language courses for teachers, participation in international competitions, maintenance and development of the partner network, etc.  During the following period we assume to implement the EIS according to the application form and the action plan, which was compiled according to the real possibilities of the school.
The aims of the project are to improve the student`s professional abilities (eg.: international cuisine as well as on processing and service of fish, seafood and regional ingredients.); to familiarize the students with new forms of work organization. The aim is also to extend participants´ skills significant for orientation on the labour market. The participants will be led and motivated to an active approach, flexibility, cooperation with regular workforce in a foreign country. They will not only extend their practical skills, theoretical knowledge and innovative ways at meals preparing processes but also become familiar with the unique technological and organizational methods. The cooks and pastry cooks will gain detailed knowledge about modern trends in European gastronomy, the waiters/waitresses will face and try new trends at guest service and communication with customers. The students of the Travel and Tourism services and Management will receive the practical experience in gastronomy services organization and tourism services organization (when dealing with clients in popular tourist places or within activities connected with housekeeping and work organization in a hotel). The four short-term mobility for 24 participiants will be held in France, Spain, Great Britain and Ireland and will be attended by the 1st – 4th grade (15-22 years) apprentices and students of both, study and apprentice courses for Cook, Waiter/Waitress, Pastry Cook, Catering and Accommodation Services, Management in gastronomy and Travel and Tourism services. The participants will be chosen on the basis of a transparent and open competition.
Our students’ practical training provided by our school’s partners, will be carried out in restaurants and hotels or travel agencies. During the Call we are planning the cooperation with proven partners (a partner school, 2 hotels, 2 receiving organizations), rights and obligations with them will be clearly defined and insured through contracts. There will be also some underage participants among the interns, that’s why we are planning the participation of accompanying persons for all short-term traineeship. We have verified that the accompanying person is very important for groups of interns (she monitors adherence to the content of the traineeship and the estimated learning outcomes, eliminates possible risks and is also important for the social climate formation). 
For the three-month ErasmusPro long term mobility we have started a cooperation with a new partner in Ireland. The competences of the coordinator we had cooperated with during the LdV programme (PLM) are a kind of guarantee of the high-quality mobility. In spite of this fact, we are going to realize a planning visit before the traineeship. We are not planning a stay of accompanying person during the ErasmusPro traineeship. The work placement will also be a great motivation for studying foreign languages. While communicating in English the participants will use grounding in spoken language of the host country (Spanish, French). The participants will undergo special language, professional, psychological and cultural training before their departure abroad. After finishing the internship they will receive a certificate of taking part in the work placement as well as their work evaluation in terms of ECVET system and Europass-Mobility. 
Learning units have been worked out for every our branch of study. The school’s traditional welfare partner - Regional economy chamber of Moravian-Silesian region – will be involved in the project. The projects will be under continuous monitoring and evaluation and will be presented at official school events, on web sites, facebook as well as in the regional mass media. It is expected that the participants of the internship will share a sense of the gained experiences with almost all our students at the school workshop which will be prepared and organized by all mobility participants.
Reforçar a identidade europeia com a partilha de saberes, celebrando a diversidade e a riqueza cultural

We understand that our project is part of a line of continuity of what has been our work over the past years in European projects. Initially, as a Leonardo da Vinci program and more recently with the Erasmus + program. However, it is our conviction that we can and should improve our practice in order to benefit our young people (former trainees and graduates) and our teachers and trainers, promoting the development of skills and the sharing of knowledge.
If we take into account the current context of change in Europe, it is urgent that our young people, as well as professionals, all European citizens, be challenged and prepared for the opportunities that are offered to them in a broader European context. For this reason, our mobility experiences are a tool that encourages, through the sharing of experiences and good practices, the promotion of European citizenship and European cultural heritage, understanding the specificities of each of us.
Our experience in European projects allows us to invest in the training of all those involved in this project, focusing on the promotion of cultural diversity, social and inclusive cohesion and the social and economic development of all persons involved. These are intrinsic factors of this project operationalization. It is for this reason that we think it is crucial to maintain the European partners who work with us from the beginning of our experience, who have taught us a lot and with whom we share the best we can do in practical terms, but also in human terms. However, we felt that it was necessary to go further and try out new formative contexts and new cultural experiences for all involved. We have thus extended our network of partners in the European area, including new institutions as new partners from Italy, Austria, Finland and Spain.
We are convinced that we have achieved so far a level of excellence in our initial and continuing education processes, which translates into the differentiation of curricula according to the needs of local, national and international companies on one hand, but also, in what concerns the interaction between people and communities through the dissemination of their heritage, traditions and their technical and cultural know-how, thus promoting innovation, the sharing of good practices and the intercultural dialogue.
Our intention with this project is answering to the challenges of Europe, satisfying the new demands of the labor market, promoting equitable and inclusive opportunities for all citizens, but also raising their awareness of social, linguistic, and cultural heritage, strengthening ties between European countries. We believe that it is through sharing experiences that those involved in this project will be more inclined to understand the importance of European themes in inclusive, prospective and transversal terms.
We understand that we have been consistent in achieving our objectives over the years, pointing out our continued participation in European projects as a continuous strategy for the future. In this way, our graduates and staff will always be able to experience new professional, linguistic, social and cultural contexts in order to also experience a different way of living their European citizenship. It is for all those involved, and for our Institution, a differentiating and enriching element in a market that wants to be more and more challenging and demanding. However, we do not forget in our strategy of continuity and future, the social, cultural and inclusive dimension of our project, despite the apparent economic recovery of our country, young people are increasingly moving in the European territory looking for better professional and social conditions. This project provides all the beneficiaries an empowering tool of opportunities for a future life, especially for the most disadvantaged.
In short, we understand that we are prepared to develop this project in an increasingly assumed form of our European citizenship, contributing to the investment in continuous training through the sharing of good practices, skills and knowledge. Moreover, we add our purpose to express our pride in our European identity, allowing the sustainable development of our economy and the promotion of our cultural heritage as part of the European Heritage.

Project Stop Heat Loss: Windows is based on the needs and visions of Střední škola stavební Třebíč described in the European Internationalization Strategy 2017 -2020 (EIS). It is formed in accordance with the school education programmes and the Long-term Plan for Education and Development of the Educational System of the Vysočina Region 2016.
The first part of the project´s name refers to one of the project objectives and at the same time unifies our previous project activities in a logical whole. We understand the word in the title in a broader context. At first, as a sash set in a frame in the opening, an object of interest and exploration in activity 1. In this case, we look at the window in terms of heat losses vs. fresh air and ventilation. For activity 2 and 4, the window is metaphorically used as a means for expanding horizons, new views and for fresh air in the sense of new professional stimuli.
Project activities and their implementation:
Activities A1 and A4 fully correspond to the set objectives of future school development, European Development Plan (described in EIS). A2 activity (ErasmusPro) and related A3 have been added to encourage a new activity in Call 2018 within Erasmus+ Key Action 1 because they fulfil the school´s aims.
 
Activity A1 - Learners' mobility - Mobility in VET providers and/or companies abroad, 2 weeks
The content of the activity is directly linked to the previous two projects, in which we focused on energy savings in the operation of technical systems in buildings and energy saving by insulation of building envelopes.  The new project focuses on windows as a tool for effective natural ventilation in buildings and reducing energy intensity during the operation of the building. 
24 learners in total, VET students in Year 3 (36-47-M / 01 Construction and 36-45-M / 01 Technical Facilities and Energy Efficiency of Buildings) will implement a two-week mobility with partners in the UK (autumn 2018), Latvia (spring 2019), Germany (autumn 2019) and Lithuania (spring 2020). In the first part of the training they will determine the indoor air quality (IAQ), measure CO2 levels, measure heat transfer coefficient, use thermal cameras to assess thermal bridges. In the second part, the participants will install windows of different materials and styles. The participants will learn how to use windows for effective natural ventilation of the building. ECVET principles will be applied. In accordance with the Czech law, an accompanying person will be sent with the group of students as a mentor, to guide and monitor them.

Activity A2 - ErasmusPro - long term mobility of VET learners in VET providers and/or companies abroad, 4 months
14 school students, apprentices (33-56-H / 01 Joiner, 36-64-H / 01 Carpenter, 36-67-H / 01 Bricklayer, 36-52-H / 01 Plumber) will undertake professional internships in construction companies in Lower Bavaria organized by the partner school (1st half of the school year 2018/2019). While the host body will be a VET provider, the activity will have a clear work-based learning component in the form of a work placement in a company. Competencies and skills acquired, experience from a real working environment, international experience strengthen the employability of VET learners and facilitate their transition to the labour market.

Activity A3 - Advance Planning Visit – ErasmusPro, 3 days
Due to the distances, the number of companies (7 to 10 in advance) and participants, their different field specializations, it is planned to send 3 members of staff for short “Advance Planning Visits” (September 2018) to the hosting organisations to facilitate interinstitutional cooperation, to prepare the mobilities and ensure their high quality – to prepare Learning Agreements, Units of Learning Outcomes, assessment tasks, evaluation questionnaires.

Activity A4 - Staff mobility – Staff training - a job shadowing/observation period abroad in a company or any other VET provider.
12 participants in total (VET teachers / trainers /school management) will be supported in their professional development in a form of a job shadowing /observation 5-day-long period in VET organisations in the UK (autumn 2018), Latvia (spring 2019), Germany (autumn 2019), and Lithuania (Spring 2020). Theoretical and practical knowledge, skills and experience gained by the participants is supposed to be passed on to VET learners and examples of good practice incorporated into school educational plans, curricula.

The future development of the Secondary school of Josef Sousedík primarily comes from a European international strategy for 2016 – 2020. Continuous raising of the international prestige of the school through the mobility of Erasmus+ is strengthening its position and ranks it among the important secondary vocational schools in the Zlín region. The strategy is focused on three main priorities – the mobility of pupils and teaching staff, modernization of the educational programmes and teaching methods and development of the strategic partnership and international cooperation. 
Through the mobility 2018 of Erasmus +, 28 pupils from 5 various professions and 4 accompanying people are going to take part in professional foreign scholarship in German Chemnitz and English Plymouth. The pupils, participating in the project, will get a unique opportunity to obtain ECVET during the internship in the framework of individual activities, under the guidance of experienced German and English experts. Professional practice will be ensured in workplaces and in companies, which are modern equipped. The development of mobility activities for pupils of the school contributes to the deepening of their skills and experience needed to succeed in international competition and that no matter they choose to study of work in the Czech Republic or abroad.
1st stage (autumn 2018) – 5 trainees from the field of Car mechanic and 5 trainees from the field of  Agricultural machines mechanic are going to work in Germany. These pupils will complete a German driving school Fahrschule Thomas Hanske. The pupils will receive theoretical and practical training of drivers of fork lift trucks under the guidance of the instructor. Successful completion of the course will provide them an International driving licence – Operation of forklift trucks, according to CSN 26 88 05 of the Labour Code in paragraph 134b. In another part of the internship they  will work in the workshops, they will learn to adjust the aggregates by the operation of the diagnostic equipment, to check the technical conditions of vehicles and agricultural technique. They will learn to measure emission values. This group will be completed by 4 trainees from the field of Gastronomy who are going to work in Saxon restaurants, they will learn to prepare typical German dishes and desserts, they find new techological procedures, they will communicate with experts of those fields. Before leaving for Germany, all the students have completed language training through online language support OLS.
2nd stage (spring 2019) – 8 trainees  from the field of Joiner and 6 Electricians are going to leave for England. The Joiners will make products made from wood and materiál based on wood. They will get to know various combination of materials and its work, they will work on machines, learn to set the cutting conditions and obtain skills focused on preparation of materials, manipulation with it, handy and machinary work, finishing and assembly work. The electricians will make electrotechnical measurements, learn to evaluate values measured purposefull for checking, diagnosis and removing faults. They will show machinery into operation, understand adjustment and working setting.The school is going to contribute to the mobility through the endowment fund and will support each trainee the amount of 1,000 Czech crowns to cover a representative work clothing which will be provided with patches of the flags of the Czech Republic, the EU and the flags of the countries of our partners. 
As practice shows that the development competences of vocational teachers is still needed to increase, the school strategically included working travel of 6 professional teachers. 2 teachers from the field of Gastronomy and 2 teachers from  the field of Cars in German operation and 1 teacher of Joiners and 1 teacher of Electricians will pass  an individual professional short term attachment. These school employees – participiants of the short term attachment – will get familiar with educational processes in the EU countries, observe sample professional lessons and examples of good practice on secondary education. The acquired competence of the trained teachers will be used subsequently in the innovation of school educational programmes in professional subjects, which will also contribute to the modernization of content of education and methods of teaching vocational subjects. 
The school has newly included a long term attachment for graduates in ErasmusPro. Three-month practice for 4 graduates from the fields of Autotronics and Gastronomy will be realized in Germany in a garage with modern equipment and in a top Saxon premises Ratskeller in Chemnitz. These long term graduates will obtain professional experiences, which will be used in next work and will be mentioned in CV. The graduates will be joined to realization of particular types of activities and we are expecting that this benefit from the attachment will be bilateral.
Rozwój wiedzy i umiejętności zawodowych podczas szkolenia za granicą

The project reflects the strategy of internationalizing the Agricultural Complex of Schools in Namysłów and involves the 4-week foreign vocational training in 2019 for 90 students of the technical vocational school in 6 professions and also the staff training. Three groups of students are going to be trained in May 2018 and these are. 22 students in the profession of an IT specialist in the training centre in Plymouth in Great Britain. 16 students of the technical vocational school of the tourist service will be placed for training in hotels and travel agencies in Rimini, Italy. 18 students of hotel industry will undertake training in Malaga, Spain. In June 18 students of the technical vocational school of advertising will be placed in the training centre in Plymouth in Great Britain and in September 18 students of agribusiness will be trained in southern Hesse in agricultural farms. . The project includes also staff training. . In July 2019, 5 teachers of vocational subjects of nutrition technology and hospitality technology will take part in a two-week internship in hotels and restaurants of Valencia. At the same time, 3 teachers of vocational subjects of information technology will be undertaking a computer repair and assembly training. A teacher of vocational subjects in the technical vocational school of the landscape architecture will take part in the internship training in a company dealing with floriculture and landscape architecture. 
According to the internationalizing strategy, a new hosting organization has been acquired: IZI Limited operating as a Easy School of Languages in Valleta, Malta. Also the cooperation with current hosting organizations- Tellus College TELLUS EDUCATION GROUP in Plymouth, Sistema Tourismo in Rimini, Starkenburg Farmers Association in Darmstadt, Germany and Tribeka Training in Malaga – will be continued and maintained.
The main aims of the project are: the development of skills and professional knowledge of pupils and staff, increase communication skills in foreign languages and personal development: increased responsibility, self-reliance, self-confidence, tolerance towards other cultures, to cope with different conditions. The project is important for learning and professional development of students of technical, because it enriches them with new skills and expertise and increases their mobility in the labor market. It enables better prepare future graduates to work to strengthen the European dimension in vocational education and encourage students to gain experience in combining theory with practice, learning about foreign cultures and customs, as well as the development of language skills, especially with language training. The project largely contributes to the mobility and personal development of participants, as it allows to know the culture of other countries, to increase the ability to be among strangers, making new contacts, dealing with difficult situations, growth ambition and self-esteem.
 The main aim of the staff training is to transfer the experience gained abroad to their own work. Practice in related businesses taught sector will contribute to increasing the quality of teaching and extension teaching skills of teachers.
As a result of links between the worlds of work and education, the project improves the employability of future graduates in the European labor market. The project promotes transparency and ability of professional qualifications in Europe based on the European Credit Transfer System for Vocational Education and Training (ECVET).
Care of the students will perform ZSR teachers and representatives of partner organizations, as well as guardians in individual enterprises. Participation of teachers, as accompanying persons is necessary to provide students with a sense of security, assist in difficult situations or arising conflicts, promote linguistic and control high levels of student learning.
In addition to acquiring new knowledge and skills outcome of the project will increase the participants' skills in communicating in English and German as well as Italian and Spanish, tolerant attitude towards different cultures and the acquisition of independence and responsibility. Students will take pedagogical, cultural and linguistic course. The project participants will be provided with travel, insurance, accommodation and meals, tickets for transport and pocket money. After completing the practice, participants will receive certificates confirming the acquisition of new skills and the documents Europass Mobility.
The project contributes to the development of industries in which future graduates will find employment. Long term benefits are primarily the acquisition by the participants of the new experiences that can facilitate employment and transfer of known solutions to the Polish, and the development of a European strategy for the internationalization of the school.
